text: Bottle from Macon Beverage Outlet. Hazy yellow with white head and plenty of carbonation. Banana and citrus nose, and sweet tart malty taste that lingers. Soft palate from the carbonation. A little sweet but very sophisticated.

Bottle
Пробов на дегуста& Крепост& не чувству&
Fles. Licht van kleur, mooi witte kraag. Sprankelend en fruitig. Gevaarlijk als dit echt 7,7% is, want het drinkt lekker door. Geen normale Weizen, echt een andere, eigen smaak.

Jaune orangée trouble, notes blé, levure, agrume doux, orange, banane (que je naime pas), finale douce. Pas vraiment désagréable mais pas vraiment mon truc. Bouteille 50cl achetée chez Dix sept sur Vin, Noisy-le-Grand, France, bue le 03/05/2017.

On tap at Weihenstephaner, Hackescher Markt, Berlin. Pours cloudy yellow with a foamy, lasting, white head. The aroma contains wheat, yeast, overripe fruits, clove and spices. It tastes light to medium sweet and medium spicy bitter. Alcoholic finish, fizzy carbonation, creamy texture. I prefer the regular Hefeweißbier.
UPDATED: JUN 16, 2017 Mooie weizener - een bock - met onderscheidende kenmerken. Aroma van abrikoos en tarwe. Beide komen ook in de smaak terug. Een diepe zoetige doch frisse smaak.
Bottle from Geers. Hazy yellow colour, creamy white foam. Nose of banana, sweet malts. Taste is sweet malts, lots of banana, yeasty, rather sweet. Not bad.

Drank this at the Berlin Bar in Melbourne. Not normally a bock drinker or a wheat beer drinker, do a bock posing as a wheat beer was a brace choice. The intricacy of the palette is something that's often missing but in this case it's there in bounds. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Proefglas van 50cl-fles op het Streekbierenfestival te Koekelare. U: Troebel stroblond met een witte schuimkraag. G: Tarwe, gist, hooi en licht kruidig. S: Moutzoet met een lichte carbonatie. Klein beetje esters. M: Doordrinker met medium carbonatie.

Big off white, creamy and average long lasting head. Orange golden unclear beer. Aroma is quite intense and very pleasant. Floral notes with ripe banana, clove and yeast. Taste is well balanced and I have the impression I taste everything the same time. Its wheaty, yeasty, sweet, sour and slightly bitter while creamy in texture. Finish is medium to long and average intense. At the end a sour and slightly bitter refreshing impression is staying. Carbonation is average and easy to enjoy. I live this beer a lot and it might be the best Weizenbock on the market.

Vierte en color amarillo oro velado pero brillante. Espuma muy generosa y persistente.

En nariz es de complejidad media-alta con notas de plátano y manzana entre las afrutadas y clavo entre las especiadas. La sensación en nariz es dulce y algo alcohólica.

Entre los sabores básicos destaca el dulzor (como de vainilla) y algo de acidez, así como un amargor inicialmente bajo pero creciente.

Es de cuerpo medio y textura sedosa. Más cálida que refrescante y algo alcohólica.

Troebel blond bier met witte schuimkraag. Vollere geur dan de Hefeweissbier, gistkarakter, kruidig, iets fruitig. Smaak: licht zoet, gistachtig, kruidig. Redelijk volmondig, romig. Medium koolzuurprikkel.

500ml bottle into weizen glass. Pours hazy effervescent amber with obligatory towering white head. Nose is banana, cloves and cinnamon. A thousand tiny bubbles persist. Slick sweet mouthfeel. Finish is fruity with alcohol and malt. Interesting, like a souped-up hefe. Goes well with cake.
Bottle. Hazy amber pour with white had. Aroma is yeasty sweet and doughy. Taste is balanced and pleasant with a good punch. Medium carbonation.
Tap @ Kaisla. Hazy gray with pure white head. Strong banana with cream and hints of wheat. Sweet and smooth. A nice weizenbock
Bottle. Hazy golden color with almost creamy off-white head. Aroma has fruits, yeast, sweet elements. Taste is malty sweet with long aftertaste. Flavors of citrus, yeast, fruits, hay and banana.

0,5l bottle. Hazy golden-yellow colour with huge and long lasting creamy white head. Aroma: Banana, biscuit, sweet ementaler with citrus notes. Elegant. Taste: Sweet, full, thick and rich malty start with a delightful, softly tart mouthfeel. No bitter/hoppy caracter at that point. With some time on the other hand it shows a short but recognizable smokey/bacon tone. Very grainy and creamy, smooth texture. Medium body with medium/soft carbonation. Medium lasting a bit sweet/tarty/slightly bitter finish. Excellent, elegant and delicious beer.
A well balanced taste but a little too sweet in my opinion. Fruit, bananas, spices.

Krāsa blāvi zeltaina. Aromātā banāni un krustnagliņas. Garā sākotnēji jūtami banāni ar krustnagliņām, taču pēc saldenuma un alkohola uzbrukuma īs garas izjūtas vairs neatjaunojas. Nedaudz par saldu tomēr.
Great example of the style, well made.. nothing off about it. These Germans do it well, worth buying. Monks Kettle SF.

500ml bottle at deTolly. Pours hazy yellow colour, small white head stays. Aroma is fresh, wheaty, flowery, banana, citrussy. Banana, grass, malt, tangerine in taste. Creamy and soft texture, soursweet, medium + bodied, average carbo, well covered alco. Very nice and tasty.

50 cl. bottle @ Home.
Aroma: not very intense aromas of wheat, spices, sweet grains, banana, citrus. Some malts in the background.
Appearance: straw light golden color, medium hazyness, perfectly white foam with very high thickness. Excellent retention. Creamy foam made of small bubbles. No Brussels lacing.
Taste: medium sweetness, low bitterness, low sourness. Strong flavors of wheat with hints of banana, spices. Alcohols warming effect is quite noticeable. Some citrus acidic overtones.
Palate: medium body, silky texture, medium-high carbonation, long finish of medium sweetness with flavors of sweet grains, wheat, banana, spices with some sparkling acidic overtones.
Overall: very good appearance, not very intense aromas but a lot of intense flavors of wheat, sweet grains, hints of banana, spices. Very refreshing, thirst quenching and pleasant. Very good beer.

Cloudy, yellow with a huge, four finger high, white head that sinks down to a fluffy, creamy two finger head and leaves a lot of lacing on the glass! 

Nose: Banana, coriander, citrus, orange, apricot, peach and green apple. 
Taste: Lemon, orange, biscuit, banana, honey, caramel and sugar. 
Mouth: Full body. Medium carbonation. Smooth and almost creamy. Sweet and slight sour ending. 

Sweet, refreshing, full body, smooth... SO GREAT!

Probably the best beer in the world!
I get this whenever I have spare cash as I often homebrew. Not cheap in the Land Down under! A bit like the Leffe Blond in fullness of body and amazing flavours but Vitus is a wheat beer so its even better! This is one of those things Im sure well find in heaven! Hallelujah!!

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2017 This dark wheat beer smells and tastes like banana and citrus. It is also medium-bodied, which is great for people who prefer drinks with lower alcohol levels. It can be perfectly paired with red meat, cheese and also desserts.I would choose it every time.

From decervecitas. In Bavaria glass. Playing Darksiders 2. Reminds a hefe wih a lighter, more refreshing and alcoholic body. Although the taste is pretty good, the sweetness is a bit over the top. Very foamy.

Cloudy apricot gold with a rich, creamy white head. The nose is eminently balanced. Banana, clove, bubble gum deliciously spicy. Taking a sip, wow. Juicy, delicious, super drinkable. Again, I am impressed by the incredible balance. Pepper, clove, banana. Creamy, silky texture, and totally hidden alcohol. Very direct, somewhat lacking complexity but the perfect beer to drink in big gulps out of a gigantic stein.
Bottle @ de klomp. Hazy golden with a large lasting white head. Fresh, Spicy Aroma with cloves, banana, ham,wheat. Taste is dry and medium sweet with clove, banana, ham, yeast. Dry finish.
Bouteille achetée chez Intercaves. Bock très aromatique et fruitée. Une belle structure en bouche.

(Bottled) Thick foamy white head. Looks like freshly powdered snow. Body is a cloudy golden color. Light aroma of clove. Nice flavor of fresh yeast and some noble hop character. More like a wheat beer than a bock beer, which can be quite cloying. Clean palate.

Bottle @ Wika ølsmagning. Appearance: hazy yellow with good soapy white head and lacing. aroma/taste: grain, wheat, oranges, straw and banana hints.
Palette: medium malty and yeasty aroma, average carbonation, medium body, average to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a light to medium bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. Overall: pretty ok fruity weizen bock.

Poured from bottle. Aroma of lemon, fruitcake and raisin. Good lookin cloudy gold with lacing. Tasting citrus, bread, fruitcake, banana, clove, caramel, and a hint of sugar. Slightly dry but full flavored. Excellent.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Shared with wim at phils place. Clear blond colored beer with small white head and no carbonation. Herby fruited yeasty aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sweet fruited.

Weizen Bock dun blond paille (EBC aux alentours de 15), parée dun léger voile et surmontée dune mousse blanche dun centimètre dépaisseur provenant dune multitude de fines bulles très jolies en verre, cette Weihenstephaner Vitus se démarque malheureusement surtout par son côté douceâtre la rendant à la longue écurante et par son manque de complexité la rendant peu intéressante. Au nez, cest le blé, la coriandre et la banane relevés dune pointe citronnée qui se révèlent. Lattaque est plutôt bien réussie, suave, sur des arômes fruités et fleuris, mais bien équilibrée par une légère présence houblonnée. Dès la deuxième bouche, sur une présence très sucrée, les arômes se font plus lourds en bouche avec, à cet instant des notes de miel et dépices douces. La troisième bouche laisse quant à elle sexprimer lamertume sur la retenue tout de même avec un faible IBU de 17 et des arômes de céréales. Larrière bouche par chance est un peu plus fraîche sur des notes fleuries. Lalcool, malgré un titrage de 7,7 % Abv, ne se fait absolument pas sentir tant le niveau de sucre est élevé. Ce manque de présence de lalcool couplé à une amertume peu développée ne permet aucun essor des arômes et mène sur un final toujours sur la douceur, un brin épicé et des arômes de banane. Les quelques notes acidulées surprenantes, ne permettront même pas de faire oublier la bouche pâteuse en fin de dégustation. En conclusion, si vous êtes amateurs de boissons très sucrées et simples, cette Weihenstephaner Vitus vous plaira très certainement. Ceci nest pas mon cas....

Ar: Moderate banana, black pepper, and tart peach; some clean dough and deep herbal notes; the herbal quality is very slightly vegetal. Ap: Cloudy straw gold; very large white head, beautiful mousse, and great retention, leaving an airy foam with mostly super-fine bubbles. T: Full, bready burst up front, slightly sweet; lots of wheat body, yet crisp; some clean, warming alcohol; fairly pronounced banana with clove, bubblegum, and black pepper accents; medium-low bitterness, herbal in hop flavor; peach skin and lemon on the finish. P: Medium, lush wheat body; high carbonation with a medium-dry finish. O: Tasty weizenbock; on the paler side for the style; clean wheat flavor and mouthfeel, with some nice hefe yeast notes and a clean, warming alcohol.
A big strong German Wheat beer. You can taste the wheat and barley and the higher ABV. A little aftertaste of banana and some similar characteristics of a weizen style.

Draft. Murky, almost opaque, orange in colour. Unusually pale for a Weizenbock. Yeasty and Spicy; cloves and cinnamon. Fruity; orange citrus, peel and bananas. Malty; wheat and caramel. Gentle hops. Alcohol well disguised but warming. Mega-spicy/fruity wheat beer. Sweet/sour taste. Dry finish. Very nice. A sort of turbocharged hefeweizen. Liked this a lot. Super wheat beer! (2008)
Butelka 0,5l. Aromat bananowy, owocowy. W smaku słodkie, pełne, mocno bananowe.

14. 2. 2017, Ljubljana. Very good mouthfull with silky feel and medium carbonisation, rich in flavour and aroma. Proper Heffe taste and feel. An excellent choice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 Bottle. Hazy golden, very thick frothy white head. Taste: Yeast, medium sweet, malts, bananas. Fruity. Hints of cloves. Sweet mouthfeel. Same finish. Soft carbonation, medium to full body. Nice beer for once in a while.

Hazy bright golden under a thick pillowy white head. Thick yeasty wheaty apricot-fruit estery nose with a dash of peppery clovey banana. Brisk full wheaty flavor with a gentle clove and banana fruitiness underneath. Lovely complex wheaty and yeasty flavor that has a brisk pale malty Bock strength behind it.

Słomkowy kolor i obfita piana.w zapachu wędzona kiełbasa i goździki. Trochę jak nasze grodziskie. 
W smaku typowy pszeniczniak. Bardzo intensywny.
Golden leicht trüb im Glas, cremiger weißer Schaum, bananig hefig in der nase, schön runder Körper, süßlich Fruchtig, leicht alkoholisch im Abgang

Bottle from local Kaufland supermarket. Pours the most beautiful yellow colour I have seen in a beer. Pleasent medium head. Banana taste, yeast, sweet bread, spicy. Soft texture, medium lively carbonation, slight bitterness, light and wonderful after taste. I would have again if only someone would import it again...great beer.

50 cl, bottle conditioned, BB Aug 23rd 2017. Hazy, light golden, medium white head, medium carbonation, nice lacing. Aroma is banana, coriander and clove. Mouthfeel is well carbonated and refreshing, lasts for a long time. Taste is very fruity, its clove, banana, belgian yeast tutti-frutti, and then the coriander. Flavours stay for a long time before the sweetness becomes overwhelming.

Slightly darker than golden, not too hazy for the style. Classic big and solid weizen head, good retention and some lacing. Aroma screams banana, and i mean vividly fresh banana, with some phenolic/clove notes in the background. Its very intense and fresh though a bit monothematic. Taste follows the aroma, obviously with dominant sweetness, nicely attenuated by a slight hint of tartness and a thouch of warming alcohol feel. Again, intense but a bit monotonous. Medium bodied with good but wonderfully soft-textured carbonation, making this an easy and refreshing but still pleasantly creamy mouthfeel. A straightforward banana weizen, and an excellent one at that.
UPDATED: APR 26, 2017 bottle. nice taste of citrus and other fruits. strong finish makes a good mouthfeel.

From meny; pours hazy bright golden with a giant white head; aroma is banana with some phenolic notes in the background and maybe a hint of alcohol, smells somehow like Belgian yeast; taste is medium sweet, fruity banana, slightly tart, fades into gentle spicy clove with some bitterness, very smooth and hides the alcohol quite well; creamy mouthfeel with medium to high carbonation and quite light body
Todella maistuva, hedelmäinen ja mukavasti banaaninen, runsaalla suutuntumalla varustettu vehnäbock.

Bottle. Pours pale cloudy with big foamy white head. Aroma of wheat, fruity, banana, peach, coriander, lime, lemon. Heavy malty background, heavy sweet, lot of fruits and wheat on tongue. Heavy body, oily texture, lively carbonation, fruity sweet finish.
golden, cloudy, rocky head, frothy, white foam, banana, cereal, chocolate, herbs, citrus, cheese, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, sticky, fizzy,
Golden, yeasty color, white head. Smells of clover, fruity, some honey, little alcohol. Medium body with a malty and sweet taste. Finish is warm and sweet.
Pours hazy yellow with two fingers of frothy white head. Aroma of wheat, honey, dried fruit. Taste is sweet, wheaty, mild alcohol, smooth finish. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

0,5l bottle from Damian Bottle Shop, Bratislava, BBD: 20.01.18 Pours deep cloudy golden liquid, big frothy white head, Aroma: lot of clove, banana, wheat, Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, light to medium sour, ripe banana, clove, very sweet fruity, juicy, Palate: medium body, average carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, long fruity sweet aftertaste, Overall: excellent weizzenbock, light colored, straightforward - banana and clove, strength is evident in the taste.

Goudgeel, troebel, witte schuimkraag en iets langzaam bewegend koolzuur. 
Aroma: Tarwemouten, banaan, kruidnagel, bubblegum....typische Duitse hefe. Verder ook fruitige tonen van abrikoos.
Smaak: Brooddeeg, tarwe, zoetig, banaan, kruidnagel,  en een lichte zoetige alcohol kick. 
Licht bitter gehopt en ergens ook een heel klein zuurtje.
Volle body, zacht en romig en in de afdronk meer zoet dan bitter.
Zeer goed!
12 oz bottle pours pale yellow with small white head. Aroma of bannana carries over into the taste, nice beer

Bottle. Pale cloudy yellow/orange. Great head. Aroma of bananas, clove, lemons and oranges. Taste follows aroma. Fruity. Sparkling. Creamy. Great mouthfeel. Alright carbonation. Some warmth from the alcohol which is well integrated. A little bitterness in the aftertaste. Balanced. Not too heavy and filling. Delicious. Tastes just like a stronger Weizen. Not too complex but all around awesome.

Bottle 500 ml, Bucharest at Bistro GUXT.

Superb golden hazy color. Very nice fine and creamy head, with good retention.
Aroma is subtle, complex and mysterious, very well balanced. Ripe bananas, cloves, bubble gum, bread, some peaches and citrusy hints, discrete bitterness. 

Taste is divine. Bananas, caramel, citrus, cloves, peaches. Some bitterness too, just enough to balance the malty sweetness. Very well integrated alcohol.

Aftertaste starting sweet-bitter and finishing sweet and a little sour, with some bitter and fruity hints.

The palate is velvety, very pleasant.

Exceptional, almost perfect, one of my favorite beers.
Hefetrübes goldgelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, fruchtig, Bananen, etwas Orange, etwas süßlich, leichte Würze, spritzig, sehr süffig.
BBE 20.10.17. Vaalean haalea väri, mukava. Lievä käni. Oli varmaan ihan hyvä börsta.

On tap at Prost! Classic cloudy pale yellow with a full dense lasting pillowy white head. Mild soft light malt and fruity aromas. Big time banana and a touch of the clove Alice in the flavor. Very smooth velvety feel. Big and rich for a light hefty looking brew. Delicious.

Aroma: Clean and slightly sweet.
Appearance: Cloudy light golden and active effervescent.
Taste: Full of wheat residue and again, slightly sweet.
Palate: Soft and full.
Overall: As when I imbibe other wheat beers and if present, I like to leave some yeast in the bottom of the vessel and for final swallow; swirling the remaining liquid to mix w/the yeast and pour it into the glass. Purty. Real Purty and Tasty, too, Real Tasty. Prost @ yeself and enjoy!

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2017 I had drunk this beer for the first time at the brewpub Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà in Rome in April 2016 and I have fallen in love with it. Back home, I couldnt find it but now I have found it at the supermarket!

33 cl. bottle. A cloudy goldenrod yellow with a creamy white head. Good lacing. Aroma is wheat, citrus, clove with notes of apricot and banana. A very delicious and pleasant savory taste with medium sweetness, light sourness and light bitterness. Its medium-bodied, creamy-textured and quite fizzy. Finish is semi-dry with a bit of bitter aftertaste. This is one of my favourite beers. An insanely well-balanced, outstanding beer.

Bottle. Cloudy, yellow in colour with big white head. Aroma of clove, ripe banana, malty biscuits, taste similar, fruity, medium sweet. Medium body, moderate carbonation, finish is lightly spicy. Really tasty, chewy but quite refreshing beer.

Bottle. Cloudy, yellow in colour with big white head. Aroma of clove, ripe banana, malty biscuits, taste similar, fruity, medium sweet. Medium body, moderate carbonation, finish is lightly spicy. Really tasty, chewy but quite refreshing beer.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

De color ámbar muy pálido y turbia, en lo primero en lo que te fijas es en su gran corona de espuma, de color blanco anaranjado, densa y persistente.

En nariz es compleja, muy afrutada (plátano y pera) y también pan recién hecho y especias.

En boca es muy cremosa y densa. Lo primero que te asalta es el plátano. ¿Os acordáis de las gominolas de plátano? Pues imaginad una explosión de aquellas gominolas, pimienta y clavo y algo de mantequilla. Deliciosa!!
Kurvajó egy sör, meg is van az új kedvenc sörtípusom. Weizenbock, azaz búzabak. Na én itt se vótam.

On tap @ Prost! Pours hazy milky golden yellow with medium creamy white head. Aroma is fresh banana, heavy clove and allspice, sweet and dry on the finish. Taste is likewise - rich, creamy mouthfeel; light lingering sweetness on the back with a crisp herbal aromatic note that lingers slightly. Rich full flavor, though not really boozy, 7.7% is well-hidden here. This is tasty.
Bottled. The aroma has banana, bit vanilla. Bit hazy, yellow-golden coloured beer with a big white head. The taste is light sweet, has banana, clove, bit vanilla, wheat. Nice and full. Good stuff.
On tap. Pours hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma of bananas, malts, caramel, clove. Medium body with average carbonation. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter.

Big foamy head with good retention.
Hazy light yellow colour.
Aroma is ripe banana, sweet malt and spicy with some caramel hints.
Malty taste with ripe banana, medium bitterness and spicy notes (clove).

Aroma: yeasts, wheat, banana.
Appearance: yellow haze with big white head.
Taste: wheat, bread, yeasts, a bit oily, beverages and light.
Palate: high carbonation, a bit sparkling.

Yields a hazed yellow-amber color with a creamy white head, which falls down to a fluffy lacing atop the surface.

Smells juicy of lusciously ripe bananas, sugared cereals and a soft spice pillow. Clove and wooden vanilla among white peppers build the yeast soothed spice profile in this.

Mouthfeel is velvet and soft, although the carbonation is at a medium level with a refreshing, vivid finish. 

Tastes of ripe bananas, fresh cut grass, dried orange zest and spicy, soft yeast. Its spiciness is quite profound, while maintaining well entangled into the soothing yeast, calming peppers, clove and allspice. Finishes with moderate spices, white bread rind and toffee, pretty light once the spices recede.

Sweet and refreshing at the same time, very pleasant to drink due to the astonishing balance, I kinda miss some additional depth, justifying the higher abv on this.

Pours hazy lite yellow hue with a small soapy white head and sparse lacing. Nose is big fruity banana clove lots of yeast character. Very nice. Flavors of big banana lemon and lots of spicy yeast character. Very nice brew!

Bottle. Hazy orange amber with a pillowy white head. Sweet fruity, slightly spicy aroma. Fruity sweetness with a yeasty spiciness and light tingle of carbonation on the tongue. Medium to full bodied with a creammy malt and slightly spicy finish. Very good.

Probabilmente una delle migliori Weiss in circolazione, da buona scuola tedesca. Buon aroma, gusto deciso e retrogusto equilibrato, non eccessivamente pesante. Ottimo labbinamento con carni rosse e formaggi.

Pours the color of tang with a nice cloudy glow with a thick white head. Aroma is fruity, citrusy, and slightly clovey wheat malts. Taste is bright like appearance with a fruity bubblegum taste tinged with clove and black pepper. It all klings to the palate and leads to a bready and slightly nippy black pepper bite for the finish.
500ml bottle, pours a cloudy golden colour. Nose is sweet, some citrus and banana. Flavour is sweet candy, some citrus, some wheat malt, and banana. Medium bodied mouthfeel. Not bad.

Отлично& креплен& пиво, хороший аромат и сбаланс& вкус, прекрас& Алкогол& 7,7%, но его не чувству& вообще и пьется очень легко. В послевк& сладост& ощущает& Срок годност& до 02.05.17. (Bottle 0,5/ 7,7%)
Hints of banana and cloves. A great drop with fantastic head and pale colour.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Impresionante lo sabrosa que es esta cerveza con mucha banana vainilla ahumado y sumamente floral. Equilibrada y refrescante. Un manjar.

Bottle. Cloudy golden amber with a small white head. Aroma is sweet and soft, some citrus and banana, a touch of grain and candy notes. Taste is sweet citrus as well, some wheat malt, banana and candy too. A bit on the sweet side, but a bit of an older bottle so likely hops have faded. Still quite nice.
Découverte dans la Saveur Box. Bière jaune opaque avec généreuse mousse blanche. Bon goût de banane et fruitée. Excellente bière. A goûter pour les amoureux des Weizens.

Cloudy golden color with a good amount of activity. Thick frothy white 3 finger sparkling head, lasting around 10 to 15 minutes, with average legs.

Aroma of pleasant wheathy sweet bread. Flavors of belgian yeasty caramel, vinous estery fruits, sweet malts, banana, floral and herbal spices. Thick sugary fruitiness with minimal sharpness.

Smooth full thick body with a perfect amount of carbonation. Medium strength to strong finish, ending with some powerful citrus yeasty spices, and faint smoky clove.

Overall an excellent quality craft offering great flavors, and a warming and refreshing feel. Although not very well intensified being highly spicy but it does calm down over time. Faint diacetyl feel.
Golden hazy with rich creamy white head. Sweet aroma with spicy coriander notes. Sweet taste with some sourness followed by mild bitterness. Sweet aftertaste.
Bottle->weizen. From Whole Foods. Cloudy gold with huge frothy white head. A: banana, cloves, bubblegum, spice. T: spice, banana, yeast, wheat, coriander. Somewhat crisp. Ok for it is, I guess.

500 ml bottle from Cork Keg & Spirits in Rockford, IL, served at cellar temp in a Weihenstephan glass. I dont have a big glassware collection, so its cool to once in a while be able to have the proper vessel. This pours a pale hazy gold, big white fluffy head that dies off fairly quickly leaving a mostly clean glass...expected banana-clove nose, hints of caramel and vanilla, just a touch of alcohol noted; a bit weak at first but grows quite expressive after 5 minutes or so and some nice grassy, vaguely farmy notes appear as well...body is very soft and the malt presence is just enormous, this is one of the fullest mouthfeels on a weizenbock - or any kind of wheat beer - Ive ever experienced, its like a wheat milkshake...lightly to moderately sweet throughout, moderately tart, doughy (in just the right way), with just a little bit of warming alcohol and pepper at the finish. Im surprised that it took me so long to get around to this, but Im sure glad I did; while it probably doesnt replace Aventinus among commonly-available examples of the style, its a good competitor and I suspect Ill be getting a few more this fall.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden, large white head, some lacing. Pleasant wheat aroma, banana, apricot, tangerine, mild spicy, cloves and white pepper. Rich and smooth mouthfeel, mild carbonated, full bodied. Smooth wheat taste, sweet fruity notes, banana and apricot, cloves, bubblegum and some peppery yeasty notes in the finish.

Pours hazy golden orange from the bottle. Leaves a massive white crown that slowly turns foamy and fades. The tradional Weizen aromas are all here: banana, bubble gum, yeasty bread. Taste is crisp, lightly bitter, and ends in a drawn out and spicy finish with hints of clove and pepper. On the lighter side for a Weizenbock; a light warmth from the alcohol is there but remains overall very subdued. This is a bock you can enjoy on a summer day just as well as in the winter. Overall a balanced and enjoyable offering from one of my favorite German breweries.

Straw coloured and cloudy. Fruity and spicy, with a malty wheat flavour. Full, moderately sweet taste with low bitterness. Pungent and spicy finish. Full body. Overall, a good weizenbock. Naturally, this is not as malty as other bocks (especially doppelbocks), but the yeast provides more flavour here.

From a bottle into a Rodenbach Grand Cru stem glass. Pours cloudy gold-yellow with big head and lace. Aroma of banana, grains, malts. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of amber malts, banana, slight alcohol, minerals, slight bubblegum. Overall rich, flavorful, decent though a bit more banana and less toasty malts than Id expect in a weizenbock.

Shared 16.9 oz. bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a large creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, spice, yeast, and possibly coriander. Taste is wheat, spice, yeast, banana, coriander, bread, and perhaps a hint of white pepper. Nice.

Aroma: lots of orange and coriander, similar to hefeweisen; Appearance: cloudy orange pour with fluffy white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: light bubblegum and spice; Palate: light body with long, spicy finish; Overall: can appreciate the quality but not my favorite style.
Medio litro de cerveza de trigo con una graduación aceptable y muy buen sabor. Muy buena calidad/precio. Recomendable !

Color amarillo claro, como de sidra, con capa de espuma blanca de un dedo de grosor que no tarda mucho en disiparse. Carbonatación a tope. Aroma a trigo, limón, similar a muchas cervezas de trigo. La carbonatación no se nota tanto en boca. Poco cuerpo. Sabor muy similar a la Paulaner pero con un regusto algo más alcohólico (debido, obviamente, a los 7,7%). Buena cerveza, pero esperaba mucho más, no voy a mentir.
Flaske fra DjOeye. Farge orange uklar med hvitt skum. Lukt hvetemalt, banan. Smak hvetemalt, fruktig, noe krydder, fint balansert. En frisk og fyldig Hvetebock
The aroma is dry wheat and a bit of caramel. The taste has a moderate caramel sweetness mixed with a little banana and lemon. Complex and balanced. The texture is fairly soft.

Samea, vaaleankultainen, aika pitkälle lagereille tyypillisen värinen olut, joka vaahtoaa varsin runsaasti. Pilvimäinen kumpuileva vaahtokerros jää myös oluen pinnalle pitkäksi aikaa. Kaunista. Tuoksusta löydettävissä makeaa vehnäisyyttä ja banaania, popkornia sekä purukumia. Maku jatkaa samalla linjalla ollen pehmeän ja täyteläisen banaaninen, vehnäinen ja hieman purukumimaisesti makea. Loppupuolella kielen päällä tuntuu kevyt mausteinen pistely. Melko kevyt suutuntuma, hiilihappoja sopivasti. Oikein raikas ja hyvä kokonaisuus, mutta siinä ja siinä, onko jopa hieman vetiseen kallellaan.

0,5 L bottle, served in Weihenstephaner weizen glass. Poured cloudy golden with a fluffy white four finger head. Lively carbonation in glass, looks amazing. Wonderful aromas of cloves, banana, orange peel, wheat, spices, caramel. Taste: Again cloves, spice, coriander, orange peel, wheat, caramel, hoppy bitterness, bread, banana, vanilla, citrus, hay. Slightly less carbonation in mouthfeel as the Hefenweizen had. A medium to full body with a very spicy and slightly dry bittersweet finish. Alcohol is very dangerously well hidden, this drinks like a banana milkshake. Absolutely love this delicious and very refreshing weizenbock! Prost!
Frisch aus der Flasche in Lichterfelde. Trübes Gold mit stabilem Schaum im Glas. Wunderbare Balance zwischen den den Hefenoten und den Malzen.

$3.59 bottle from Wine Warehouse. Pours cloudy golden with a large white head. Major banana - weird to say perhaps, but almost smells like banana cream pie. Taste is banana, wheat... also strangely reminiscent of banana cream pie. No crust, though. Tasty.
500mL bottle. Pours a hazy orange gold with a foamy, medium-sized white head. Aroma of banana and spice. Taste is of banana, wheat spiciness, and light citrus notes.

Although I can find it here, I didnt know about this until a friend brought a bottle back from Germany specifically so that I could do this review. I do love my beer friends! - Opening the bottle delivers a beautiful aroma of warm banana pudding and clove. The pour is just as rich, with a deep honey-gold color and capped with a foam the color of the middle of a toasted marshmallow. It smells delicious, and looks equally inviting. - A tip of the glass brings home the aroma, lilting over my tongue and filling my mouth with a rich, warm flavor. The spices flood my taste buds; a cool beer with a warm delivery. - The finish is smooth, comforting, and full of mouth-watering Belgian yeast. There is little about this that I could say was harsh. In fact, at $4 for a pint, I will be looking for this as I go-to in my refrigerator. Sometimes you have to go a long way to discover something in your own backyard. My thanks to Josh for bringing this to my attention, I will definitely be drinking this quite often.

Aroma: banana, cloves.
Appearance: hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: cloves, banana, sweet notes, well balanced, alcohol is covered, semi-sweet.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, zesty finish.
Overall: Great weizenbock, balanced and drinkable.

330 mL bottle shared with ebone1988. The pour is a slightly dark golden orange with a thick frothy white collar and a good bit of lace as it falls. The aroma is interesting. There is a strong spicy wheat and a rather unpleasant yeast and wheat there. Its got the standard Belgian yeast profile that I dont like, but its wheaty and just meh. The flavor is more sweet and lightly metallic. There is a clove that dominates for a bit before just giving way to the spicy yeast. Im not a can of this at all. The mouth feel is a little thick and the carbonation is soft. There is a lingering spicy clove on the aftertaste that is not good. Damnit.
I love Weizenbocks. Vitus pours a tad clearer than the hefe with some active carbonation an aroma of yeast and wheat. Flavors are banana, soft wheat, yeast and fruit. Delicious and refreshing.

500ml bottle from aPivo.ru. Pours hazy straw yellow with a large white head. Aroma is banana, spice, bubblegum. Taste is banana, citrus, wheat, clove. Medium sweet with low bitterness. The colour and flavour of the beer make it seem more like a high-strength weizen.

Ámbar, turbia. Espuma blanca de retención media y poro mediano.
Aroma; presencia media de acetato de isoamilo, algo de vainilla, malta. Sabor a frutas maduras. Plátano. Muy maltosa. Algo solvente al final.

Pours very cloudy and bright gold with a frothy white head. Nose is wheat and banana bread with some hops and touches of spicing. Flavor is similar and rich with a lot more esters and layering than a typical German wheat beer. Finish is quick and dry. Alcohol is totally hidden. Very good beer.
One of the best weisse beer in my opinion. Tasty, aroma, flavour. All is perfect.
Bottle at Hippo Tap. Pours clear light amber with a firm medium white head. Aroma is banana and slight toffee. Taste is banana sweet, mild hop bitter, some clove, hint of caramel sweetness.

Pours a clear straw yellow with almost no foam or ring. Fairly thin to medium body with a nice wheat aroma. Classic Hefeweizen taste without the banana or cloves. Pretty much just the strong wheat flavor. OK but not the best.

the aroma is fruity and spicy with hints of banana, yeast, toffee and candy... the taste is fruity and malty with notes of garden fruits, sweet wine, candy and some spices... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...
On tap at the brewery. My long trek to this place is over. When this beer hit my lips, I was in heaven. Smooth beer. Citrus, banana, and some spice.
500ml Bottle - Hazy golden with a foamy head. Spicy lemon, banana and cloves in the aroma. Fruity, spicy and moderately sweet taste with notes banana dominating along with walnuts, syrup and spice.

On tap @Weihenstephaner in Berlin, pours a cloudy golden with thick foamy white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, and slight citrus. Taste similar, lots of banana notes, spice in the aftertaste. Medium body and light carbonation. Very refreshing

Hazy, light gold and lemon color with a thick, white head and some lacing. Nose of banana and bubblegum. Easy entry with a lightly-carbonated, mild body and a banana, lemony finish. Alcohol is barely detectable.
Bottle from Hopfen & Maltz.Murky bronze pour with a huge head. Notes of banana, yeast, some herbal notes and some sweet malts.

Bottle. Pours a pale hazy yellow.

Aroma. Bubblegum, banana, cinnamon and lemon.

Taste. Banana and bubblegum up front, with slight lemony flavours and a sweet bread taste throughout.
Bottle. A pimped up hefe - bananas, lemon and bubblegum. Keeps a lid on the sweetness which is good.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2016 Bottle.
Thick and long lasting white head.
Rich aroma: banana on top note, dried peach, candied orange zest, some clove/pepper, alcohol.
Mild taste, slight acidity in balance with slight sweetness, phenolic bitterness takes over after a second.
Palate thick and creamy first, crisp and dry later, distinct alcoholic warmth on finish.
Very nice, but the aroma is a bit too alcoholic.
Tap at Answer. Lemony yellow with bubbly head and haze. Smells like lemon chiffon and windex but not repellant. Flavor is a little bland and dirty. Meh.
Bottle. Pours amber/gold with tight white head. Yeast and banana on the nose, but more flowers and orange on the taste. Good full mouthfeel. Another great beer from this brewery.
Color ámbar turbio. Espuma abundante y duradera. Aroma a cereal y cítrico. Sabor a plátano y cereal, toques herbales.

BB 18.03.17. Poured a cloudy pale gold colour with a three-finger bright white dense foam head that retained well (diminished over about a five minute period) and laced OK. Carbonation high with fine to medium bubbles. Aroma of nice soft cloves and spice and sweet banana; alcohol well hidden. Taste initially of very sweet banana followed by a hint of cloves; very sweet over-all; alcohol well hidden. Light to medium body. Soft, smooth and slightly creamy with quite a sweet finish. Nice.
Draft at Samo Pivo, Belgrade. Cloudy rich gold-yellow, good rich foam. Heavy rich hefe, banana malt. Heavy rich beer. Delicious, big.
Orange. A lot of banana. Yeasty. Crisp. Drank at bangers for wilson cousins trip.
Totz Amazballz. Best beer in the world. Period. Bring it onnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn. Smiley winkie face??
0,5l bottle at home. Hazy yellow color, big white head. Aroma of banana and yeast, with notes of alcohol and citrus. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Pretty good.

0.5l bottle.

Bright hazy orange color. White head with minimal lacing. Yeasty/citrusy aroma.
16 oz bottle - clear very light yellow with a big fluffy white head. Big aroma of mostly clove....some fresh wheat and spice. Nice flavor of more clove, heavy wheat, light malt and 1135531040430

Pours a cloudy light yellow with a full white head that dissolves. Nose is banana and wheat. Taste is banana with slight citrus with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Body is full with good mouthfeel. As it warms, the beer reveals  a bubblegum sweetness.500 ml bottle in a variety pack Bottled on July 16, 2015

500ml at the Weihenstephan brewpub in Freising. Aroma is banana, lght yeast, light oats. Appearance is cloudy yellow to orange with a white foam. Taste is light to medium sweet, with a very light bitterness. Soft carbonation, very nice balanced. Incredible good.
Hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma is overwhelming cooked banana, some clove and alcohol. Taste is well rounded, sweet and sour. Full body yet good to drink. Overall amazing.

Bottle, 750th rate. Hazy yellow beer, big white head faded. Aroma malt, banana, hint of kombucha. Taste is banana, malt, hint of lemon and cloves. Palate is soft and rich, carbonation subdujed, and nitro like. Finish is a bit sweet, and Im not usually a wheat beer guy, but this is good.
Moda i najbolje penično pivo koje sam pio, odlična aroma, tek nakraju se malo osjeti alkohol iako ga 7,7%...sasvim slučajno sam ga dobio i jednostavno jedva čekam novu priliku..
Draught at Ale &Hop, Barcelona. Very cloudy deep amber. Strong banana aroma. Quite alcoholic taste. Bit much for the afternoon.
Très belle couleur jaune ambrée. Très trouble. La céréale est très présente avec de fortes notes épicées. De lamertume maîtrisée. Un grand plaisir de dégustation.

2015 BJCP Category: 10C Weizenbock
AROMA: Sweet fresh banana bread and lemon fruit. Subtle clove spice. Very pungent and enticing. 11/12APPEARANCE: Lemony yellow; cloudy but plenty of clarity. Effervescence easily visible. Large, white, fluffy foam. Excellent retention and lacing. 3/3FLAVOR: Strong bready flavor; blonde and amber grains. Esters impart sweet banana and bubblegum flavors. Lemon flavor is quite prominent, too. Clove is subtle, but makes a nice garnish. Delicious. 18/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium body suggests a lighter ABV. Bubbly but smooth. Dry/clean aftertaste. Very minor alcohol presence. Refreshing. 5/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: An amazing, near-perfect brew and a premiere example of the style. A sleeper in beer stores everywhere. 9/10TOTAL SCORE: 46/50DISCLAIMER: The author is not a certified BJCP judge; therefore, this score sheet is not necessarily indicative of proper BJCP judging techniques and protocol. The author is grading to 2015 BJCP Guidelines in order to prepare for examination.

FOR WHAT IT IS, this is a great beer. Be warned, this is truely LIQUID BREAD, do not drink if youve eaten food within the day, it is high protein from being unfiltered.. Its a full meal. That being said... This beer tastes of wholesome ingredients unaltered and as nature made them. Full body, tan gold color, strong head light colored. Good natural sweetness lots of body. This beer tastes like homemade bread, some banana, yeasty, tad of clove or herb. The hops are hardly noticeable (personally i wish it had more hop). But it is a true treat to say the least. Easy drinking if youve got an appetite!! 7.7% and well covered, full flavor and can taste the love it was brewed with. The naturalness is bold. Great liquid bread. Drink on empty stomach, probably ice cold too. Good beer, especially at 3$ a large bottle and Purity law qualified.. Unique, be ready, and cheers to this!

Cloudy, pale yellow body with a tall, foamy white head. Sweet, fruity aroma. Lots of banana, spices and a bit of yeast. Soft, kind of sweet taste with a bread like finish. Creamy, smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very well round, really delicious weizen.

0.5L bottle. Cloudy orange colour with a huge white head. Aroma is fairly typical banana, cloves, wheat and yeast, general citrusy notes. Flavour is wheaty, yeast, banana, citrus, cloves and spices, tart with some sourness, also some alcohol but well hidden for 7.7%. Smooth creamy mouthfeel, medium carbonation, low bitterness.

I am a newcomer to Weissbieren. And am hooked. Banana and cloves seem to be the most often used deScriptors and Vitus is not lacking in that. I find it very similar to Weihenstephaners other Weissbier, but only with slightly higher alcohol content. And for the same price where I shop! Its a no brainer! Great beer and it will be a regular for me.

Aroma of wheat, banana, fresh malt, clove, vanilla and yeast. Pours opaque light golden liquid with a very soapy big white head. Sweet taste of wheat, banana, hay, malt, yeast, resin and a light alcohol undertone. Full body with a creamy, smooth, very malty texture, soft carbonation and a sweet finish, very drinkable. This has all the typical flavour notes of a Weizenbier, but somehow it feels much smoother and cleaner and just overall well-rounded. The alcohol is not astringent at all but rather blends in and counters the sweetness a little bit.
Botella 50 cl. Vivalabirra ( Oviedo ) Se nota bastante el toque de platano, tanto en olor como en sabor, muy buena cerveza en su estilo.

Nagy, de nem túl tartós hab, szalmasárga szín. Illata erőteljes, citrusos, banános, búzás és mézes. Íze intenzív, édes-mézes, banános-trópusi gyümölcsös, búzás, némi fűszerességgel - főleg koriander -, icipici karamell, közepes szénsav. Testes, nagyon finom, a magas alkohol ellenére frissítő sör

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2016 
20/4/16
Bottle, 330ml. Pours hazy, light yellow-gold with a huge creamy white head. Strong scent of yeast, wheat and some sour citrus. Mouth feel is slightly creamy with medium body and medium carbonation. Tastes quite sweet with some acidic-sour taste and almost none bitterness. Flavors of yeast, bread, warm spices, citrus, clove, sour-fermentation, light caramel malt, banana, mild alcoholic flavor. Complex, crisp, full flavored, but not heavy, best cold. Nice summery beer without being boring. Slightly heavy.

18/11/16

Bottle 500 ml. Pours hazy golden-yellow, with a tall and thick white colored head. Aroma is gentle, yeasty and sweet. Mouth feel is creamy, body is medium thick and carbonation is gentle. Taste is quite sweet with very little citrus sourness and almost no bitterness.
Flavor is yeasty, wheaty, grains, mild citrus, spice, light vanilla, clove and banana. Nice, but a little to heavy and sweet.

Aroma: Banana, vanilla,clove, white bread, dried fruits, lemon.

Mouthfeel: full-body, chewy with moderate carbonization.

Taste: banana, white bread, a bit spicy. Moderate acidity, bitterness and sweetness make the taste round. Warmy feeling of higher alcohols make this beer a good companion for a cold winter night in front of fireplace =)

Overall impression: Very sophisticated, well-ballanced strong german wheet beer with a longlasting aftertaste.
Bouteille 50 cl - couleur dorée un peu trouble, arômes de fruits, de fumée et épices, finale douce
It pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. It has aromas of banana, wheat and a bit of caramel. It has flavors of bread, banana, spices, and wheat. It has a creamy texture to it as well.

Originally rated on 9/4/08. Vitus poured a hazy yellow body, with decent carbonation that gave it a thick head; which left spotty laceing. Aromas of pears and banana, flavors of cloves, banana and wheat. Alcohol was also present, but for it being listed at 7.7% it was well hidden. Its like a heavy hefeweizen in all aspects, a well brewed beer thats worth a try.

Aromas a plátano y clavo
Aspecto dorado claro con la carbónatacion perfecta espuma fina y persistente
En boca maltosa, un toque sutil ácido
Sabor característico a platano

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft @ Growler Guys. Hazy yellow color with a thin layer of white head. Smells like banana bread and sweet spices, tastes rich with banana, bubblegum, and wheat ale. Really smooth and delicious.
Within the German beer is one of the Vitus -Of Cup is fantastic. On the nose, wonderful. Only I miss a little bit of density and evolution. Maybe not requested style.

On tap at growler guys meridian. pours out a hazy straw topped with a fluffy white head. nose is big banana bread spice clove. Taste is more of the banana bread spice bubblegum sweetness. This is amazing.
Nice foamy head; beautiful pour. The smell hints of banana and spices. Zesty, tangy hops. The high alcohol content is masked masterfully.

Pale, slightly hazy yellow colour. Yeast, flowers, hints of caramel in the aroma. Yeast and hints of caramel at first. Hints of flowers, slight sourness and spiceness in the middle. Spicy and flowery finish. Well balanced, rather medium bodied, well balanced, nice beer.

Bottle received in the local European swap thanks to SinH4. Hazy yellow/golden with a large white head with good retention and lace. Banana, honey, hay flowers, minerals in the nose. Flavour follows: Banana, flowers, honey, hay, minerals. Medium/full body, oily texture, lively carbonation, filling sweetness but ends fairly dry. No alcohol showing.Flavourful but not too sweet and sticky. Good.
Davvero spettacolare! Grado alcolico sostenuto da un corpo notevole, intenso profumo di banana, schiuma compatta fine è persistente
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 La probé por recomendación del camarero de la cervecería Garrison en Jaén. La mejor cerveza de trigo que he probado.

Aroma: wheat, fruity, sour. Appearance: pale, golden, hazy, rocky head, white massive foam, lasts well. Taste: medium sweetness, medium sourness, lightly bitter, nice caramel and bread taste. Palate: medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, slight astringent, sourish short finish.

Pours two fingers of head on a cloudy light straw body.
The aroma is dry wheat and a bit of caramel.
The taste has a moderate caramel sweetness mixed with a little banana and lemon. Complex and balanced.
The texture is fairly soft.
An outstanding beer.

Cloudy yellow with a frothy head. Slight tinge of lemon with banana and bubble gum. Very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gult, tåkete med tydelig karbonisering i glasset. Banan, gress, et lite røykpreg og hint av petroleum i duften. Banan dominerer i smaken sammen med noe krydder. Litt over medium munnfølelse.
Bottle at home. Hazy, yellow colour with a small white head. Nose is nice weizen with some light banana. Taste is low bitterness, with low sweetness. Nice, but not outstanding.

Pale honey. consistent and white foam, regular feature in style, accompanied by a dense and hops aroma. robust and fresh, typical entry of Weizen. very creamy body that brings a touch of spices, citrus and fruity notes of banana and orange. velvety finish.
Mooi goudblond licht troebel bier met romige witte schuimkraag. Aroma van banaan, hooi, graan. Witbier met pit. Volle, romige, fruitige, beetje zoetige, smaak. Topbiertje.

Hazy gold color. Highly carbonated. Fruity aromas of bubble gum and green banana. Very malty and yeasty in the bouquet. Tastes like a strong hefeweissen. Very warm. Spicy phenols. Rich caramel flavor. Has a bit too much banana flavor, but overall a very good beer.
Banana aroma, white head, good lacing. Sweet flavor with a hop finish. Cloudy straw color.
Aroma of spice and fruit, pours a slightly hazy pale gold color without much of a head. Taste of banana and clove with a medium body and a mild banana finish.

Bottled - Hazy golden colour, large frothy white head with excellent retention. Serious wheat and banana nose with some cloves and a bit of spicy hops. Complex taste of bread, sweet malts, banana, cloves and a touch of vanilla and peach. Full body, velvety texture, average carbonation, fruity and yeasty finish. Well rounded classic weizenbock, highly recommended.

Bottle. Clove, banana, citrus, vanilla. Rock solid head. While the aroma is spicy, the flavour is soft and amazingly well nitegrated. Velvety mouthfeel, chewy malt base that is far from cloying. While the flavours are sweet, the taste is not. Nothing else to say - a classic of its kind.

Where: Old Line Fine Wine Spirits & Bistro. 
How: Big bomber bottle.
Appearance: Pours a slightly hazy straw-gold, creamy tight-knit head.
Aroma: Spices, rich, with lots of banana and bready sweetness. 
Taste: Sweets, breads, booze, spices, fruit and vanilla.
Palate: Medium body with creamy, abundant carbonation.
Overall: Pretty top notch, give it a try for sure.
Aroma is wheat, banana and yeast. Taste is much of the same, but with some alcohol comes in late. Taste is slightly bitter and slightly sour. A nice beer.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2016 Aroma : banana
      Apearrance : Lemony yellow gold with thick long lasting white head
     taste : flowers and orange banana cloves very sweet overall alcohol  is well hidden light bitterness
     Palate : good full mouthfeel very smooth finish

Bottle. Pours a bright gold colour with a thin white head, wheat aroma, the taste is smooth with a dry fruit finish. 




,

Very nice. Slightly spicy, good carbonation. Some malt mixes with it. Unique some citrus, spice, a wheat backbone it seems. High quality. A bit of yeast flavor but everything blends so well.

Bottle 500ml. Served just below cellar temp. Pours a cloudy honey with a white, dense, foamy head that lasts perfectly. Aroma has strong notes of sweet dried banana and clove with wholegrain bread, dried apple, white pepper, coriander (light) and touches of cinnamon. Flavour has next to no bitterness with notes of sour wheat, clove, cinnamon, dried banana, dried pear, lemon zest with light notes of white pepper and coriander in the finish. Light bodied with medium carbonation, creamy mouthfeel and a decent length finish. Deceptively well hidden ABV; feels more like 5%!

Copenhagen 24/2 2016. 50 cl bottle from Meny. Typical German label with a lot of heraldic shields and ornaments to give you the right medieval feeling when consuming this beer. Pours hazy yellow with big white head. Settles as thin patches of foam. Aroma is intense and quite lemonadelike. A little citrus, fruity sweetness from banana and bubblegum. Medium carbonation and watery palate. Flavour is kind of watery. Follows the nose but a bit more bland. Fruity sweetness with banana and light lemon. Refreshing lemonade that completely hides its quite prominent alcohol content. Lives up to its name: Lively and refreshing. And you can get a sweet buzz on at the same time.

Aroma principalmente a plátano y clavo , color amarillo ligeramente turbio, generosa espuma blanca y con buena retención. 
Gusto a banana , especias, miel...
Melosa , cuerpo medio -alto , carbonatacion media.
Mi Weizenbock preferida, fantástica.

Aroma: Banana, spicy flavour from yeasts

Appearance: Bright yellow colour and creamy white head

Taste: Some fruity sweet and light sour

Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation and the Aroma finishes

Bouteille de 50cl. Couleur jaune pale, léger trouble. C est la banane qui attaque avant même la mise en bouche. En bouche, c est l arôme ultra dominant ( avec un peu d épices)  mais il s accorde bien avec l équilibre doux/acide/amère du goût. On sent peu l alcool, on a peine à croire qu elle titre à 7,7%, carbonnation moyenne. Original. Trouvée à VnB - Noyelles Godault

Bottle pour into tulip glass from Downtown Discount Beverage. Aroma is moderately strong banana, fruity esters and cloves. Appearance is hazy yellow (like honey) with two finger-width foamy white head with good retention and beautiful sparkle and mild lacing. Taste is as aroma--moderate banana and fruity ester sweetness with clove and some late alcohol taste. Palate is medium bodied with creamy, silky texture, perfect amount of carbonation to notice/complement but not dominate, and mildly sweet, long fruity finish. Overall, this was a real pleasure all around.

0,5lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos, Greece
Lot of carbonation. The banana aroma is there but more and intense and spicy. Very drinkable and enjoyable, one of the best of its kind. Orange-golden color with creamy white head, thats not staying for long though. Medium body and aftertaste. Very nice at all.

Very hazy deep gold in color with a rich soapy white head that laces considerably. Aroma is grains, mild banana and some spice. Taste is banana and wheat bread. 
Excellent mouthfeel - very balanced.
Totally not my type of beer. Felt like i was drinking yeast. Got bit better when it got warm, but still barely drinkable.
Golden yellow colour with white foam head. Yeasty aroma, banana and coriander. Taste is medium sweet, ripe fruit and creamy.

Bottle. Cloudy, light honey colour with frothy white head which dissipates quickly. Rich aromas of pineapple, banana, guava, pawpaw and bread malt. Initial wheat sourness, followed by some alcohol, which is washed away with delicious sweet banana and spice. Perfectly carbonated.

Pours hazy yellow with dense white top. Nose is quite weak, some fruits, flour, banana, wheat. Taste has also banana, flour, corn, some weak spices. Abv is well hidden. Nice sweet beer!

0.5l bottle from kadewe, 1.78. pours an opaque banana yellow with a small quickly disappearing white head and little lacing. lots of banana on the nose, some coriander and cloves. flavour of banana bread. no hops. oily mouthfeel. sweetish, creamy. flat carbonation. alcohol is very well hidden. nice.

0,5l bottle at home as part of the Euro Local Swap courtesy of Beerhunter111, big thanks. BB 25.05.2016. light yellow hazy color, medium big white head. smells of spices, ripe fruits, peach, light yeast. full body, medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of spices, light sweetness, ripe fruits again, peach, banana, lightly citric, a bit soapy, lightly peppery. finishes dry with notes of spices and peach. decent stuff, not overly complex but drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2016 Hazy yellow with a big frothy white foam. Nice wheat taste. Not too much banana compare to Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier. Full body and very little alcohol. If i want smooth wheat beer i will choose Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier if feel like getting a stronger wheat beer this is it!

Or i can enjoy both at the same time! Weihenstephaner night out!

Golden color, cloudy liquid and big head.
Fruity aroma... banana and citric fruits
Taste is well balanced... not too sweet.. and not too alcoholic..
Very good beer

Flasche - Was das Aroma angeht, fällt das Vitus deutlich hinter das normale Weizen zurück. Hier gibt man sich klarer, struktureller, unaufgeregter. Gut gemacht, aber etwas eindimensional. Der Alkohol ist perfekt eingebunden.
Hazy golden liquid with frothy white head. Aroma of banana, coriander. Taste of banana, wheat, yeast. Light body, creamy feel, average carbonisation.

Hazy yellow with a big frothy white cap of foam. Fantastic example of the style. Wheat. Not too much banana. Bit of spice. Caramel. The yeast is excellent. Classic. No alcohol. A little tang. Full body. Creamy and effervescent. Complex and interesting, yet balanced and approachable.
Very light and frothy, yeasty taste. Smooth, refreshing and very creamy. Great beer. .
Yellow color with large white head. Aroma wheat, lemon, bread. Taste lemon peel, spices, honey, alcohol warm.
Couleur citron orangé et trouble une vrai weizen, bon goût de banane et citron. que dire cest une super bière qui se bois facilement malgré le taux dalcool.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is light bread, spiced fruits, cloves, floral, coriander. Taste is fruited breads, spicy fruits, chalky. Floral, fruity, spicy and refreshing.
By far my favourite weizenbock. Delightful aroma of bananas, white bread, yeast, baked pears and apples. Sweet and spicy taste following the same notes, extremely well balanced.

Draught @ Haket. Pours very hazy yellow with a frothy white head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly malty and fruity estery with wheat crackers, freshly baked white bread, banana bread, red pears, hay, minerals, cloves and lemon peal. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter, very tiny sour, slightly malty and fruity estery. Mouthfeel is soft, round and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and tiny bitter with freshly baked white bread, banana bread, red pears, hay, minerals, cloves and lemon peal. Pity about the red pear esters. Not a fan of those.

500ml bottle. Hazy golden body, big white dense head with good retention, almost no lacing. Aroma of herbs, cloves, banana, coriander, yeast, citruses. Taste of banana liquor, yeast, sugar, honey, a touch of herbs. Great sample.

0,5 l NRW-Flasche aus der Brauerei in Weihenstephan. Mandarinenfarbendes, trübes Bier mit einer dicken cremigen Schaumkrone. In der Nase leicht säuerlich, Aromen von Bananen, Weizen, Nelken. Im Antrunk eher süßlich, Bananen, Nelken, Waldhonig, danach eine sehr dezente Bittere. Der süße Geschmack
Hvala vedranu na ovom pivu...ispijeno u dubravi pored ibenika ..slatkastom pivo čudnog okusa banane...nisam ljubitelj...

From a 500ml bottle on 5/12/2015. Pours a very light golden with a medium white head. The nose features lots of ripe banana, yeast and spice. Take a sip and its a real banana bomb, with some bread, butter, yeast and clove also n the mix. Full bodied with average carbonation. A very nice big, sweet, banana dominated wheat beer.
Sample at Örebro Öl & Whisky 2015. Fruity smell with foam banana. Sweet taste with foam banana, ripe bananas. Nice.

500 ml bottle from LCBO served cool in a tulip glass. Cloudy orange-golden with a large, fluffy, off-white head. Intense banana with quite a lot of clove spiciness to balance, really bready, yeasty, some kinda brighter fruitiness...peaches maybe, a little booze. Medium plus body, silky carbonation. So much banana, less clove spiciness, a little buttery, bread, bread dough, yeast, lightly boozy; somewhat sweet with minimal bitterness and a long boozy banana finish. Nice stuff.
0,5L Bottle from the local Albert Heijn supermarket. Nice but quite heavy, especially while watching a soccer match. Backlog from 2014/06/13.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
kräftig hefig mit Abklängen von Weizen und Banane, trotz des Alkoholgehaltes recht süffig.

2015/11/18 - Pours a hazy, yellow, honey colour with a big, foamy, white head that quickly reduces and leaves no lacing. Aroma is yeast, wheat, banana, dough, honey, citrus, cloves and spices. Taste is honey, banana, spices, orange, yeast, wheat and dough. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with smooth carbonation and moderately sweet finish. Delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl. Fresh citrus aroma with a mild, gentle wheat front. Pours hazy golden, as a typical Weizen would look like. I actually expected more orangy color. Wheat, fruits, raisins, some yeast in the taste. Sharp bites of alco are there, but are rather pleasant for the style/season. Slimy in texture, medium bodied. Slow, yeasty finish. A nice style, and I love it, but I suspect that the batch we have here in EE are not the best one.
Aroma has banana, toast and citrus. Very cloudy, golden color, quite minimal head. Very similar as Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier but more alcohol. I liked the Hefe better.

500 ml bottle. Bright cloudy yellow with white head. Nose: banana, spices, lemon, berries. Taste is more fruity esters and spice. Lovely wheat malt flavours. Medium-think mouthfeel. Subtly bitterness on the finish. A classic.

Very cloudy pale good with a good head despite the high alcohol. Aroma bready, wheaty, and yeasty, with a slight lemon zest note. Taste very yeasty and wheaty, with some banana notes and sourdough. Im not a fan of wheat beer at all, but even I thought it wad pretty good :)
Sin duda la cerveza de trigo alemana mejor elaborada, por supuesto es mi parecer!!!!!

On Tap. @Deutschland, Oviedo. 02/11/2015
Color amarillo, aromas y sabores a trigo, levadura, buen cuerpo.

bottle at home, possibly from Sabine, cheers!surprisingly pale hazy green gold with fluffy white gold head. banana foam sweets and spicey clove aroma, full bodied, quite sweet, peppery spice, wintermix herbs, light prickly carbonation, wheaty sweety, clean proper weizenbock, doesnt show its abv at all, ace

Hazy light blond orange, white head
Banana, yeasts
Same in taste, plus orange peel and cloves
Beautifully balanced and dangerously drinkable
Bottle from Stirchley Wines at Brum Beer Fest; hazy golden yellow pour with a frothy white head, aroma has spice and a hint banana, taste has smooth spice, some citrus, pleasant.

Hazy beer with big and hard head.
Aroma: ethers, ripe banas, cream, some spices.
Taste: moderate balanced sweetness with light spicy bitterness.
Flavour: Banana, apricot liqueur, some yeasts, ethers similar to Belgium ales. 

Very pleasant and drinkable.

50 cl bottle from City Center One, served in a snifter. Pale yellow to tan, with huge white head that lingers. Aroma is yeasty, grainy, banana notes, touch of apricots. Medium to full body, low carbonation. Taste is medium sweet with low bitterness. Texture is oily to creamy.

Ehh was ok won't have it again though ...... Not sure why I have to keep typing an answer here

50cl bottle at home. poured a deep golden colour with a big white head on top. lots of carbonation, cloves, and ripe banana, crisp malts, earthy plums. taste has lots of ripe fruits. creamy chewy finish. enjoyable
Aroma is permanent marker, banana, clove. Appearance is yellow, white head. Taste is harsh, banana, clove, permanent marker, not my thing. Mouthfeel is crisp, light body. Overall, not my style.

500ml bottle, poured into a weizen glass. Slightly cloudy golden yellow with a two to three finger head. Tightly laced bubbles and lingering lacing and head until the end. Smelly a little doughy and earthy with a hint of banana. Full flavour and mouth feel with a balance of sweet and bitterness to make you keen for the next sip with a lingering palate of slight banana sweetness at the end. Overall magnificent.
Hazy gold pour, small white head. Aroma of toasty malt, figs, fruit, yeast and esters. Flavor of figs, dates, wheat and yeast.

Cloudy gold color, persistent white head. 
Yeasty nose. 
Medium body, moderate flavor, hot and moderately gazzy mouthfeel, avg length. 
Sweet, touch of bitterness, low acidity. 
Orangey (zest and juice), malty, yeasty, evident wheat character. 
Good but not my style.
