0,5l Flasche.Orangenes trübes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Riecht angenehm nach Banane, schmeckt vollmundig nach Banane, Vanille und im Nachgeschmack ganz leicht nach Rosinen. Wunderbar ausgewogen!

Floral bouquet. Cloudy, yellow to golden color with quite a few bubbles. Thin head in a mug with minimal lacing. Very sweet taste with an almost overwhelming clove taste and notes of honey and flowers. Very smooth palate and one of my favorites.
Aroma of pears, bananas and wheat. Bananas, cashews, almonds, and hard fruits. Full bodied, and a fantastic example of a bock.

Hazy, yellow/gold appearance with a small white head and a fair amount of lacing. Wheat and yeasty esters prominent in the aroma. Flavors incorporate the wheat, spices and some soft fruit. Smooth, lush, slightly sweet aftertaste. Full-to-medium bodied, nicely carbonated mouthfeel leading to a long lasting finish.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2016 It is one of my favourite beer. Gold and troubled color and the carbonation is weak. The taste is sweet with banana and plum touch and the final sensation in the mouth is pleasant. I drank this beer in a nice place in Lausanne, pee bar.

Bottle BBE: 30.06.16. Cellar temp. Pours a hazy gold-amber with small, tight, off-white head. High intensity nose, strong on over-ripe banana, sweet foam bananas and Belgian yeast, with some corned beef, vanilla, and rice pudding. A medium-strong banana sweetness dominates the taste buds, with only a gentle bitterness underneath. Its full-bodied with a thick, creamy texture, medium carbonation and a sweet, chewy finish. A great beer in its own right that has a drinkability that belies its strength, it nevertheless lacks the complexity and depth of Aventinus.

Aroma: Bananas, clove, bread, raisins, plums. Appearance: Cloudy, yellow colour, head high, dense. Taste: Bananas, clove, wheat malts, bread, yeasty, light dried fruit. Palate: little bit of alcohol warming, finish is sweet with alcohol, body is full.

Adquirida en Whole Foods, LES, New York. Refrescante y exquisita. Sabor a malta, banana y naranja. Amarilla clara y opaca con importante espuma blanquecina. Muy buena.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours pale yellow with a big, pure white, thick & creamy, quickly diminishing head that leaves some lace. Big flavors of clove, banana, yeast, dough and funkyness. Medium body, average carbonation and a lightly astringent finish. Reminds me of a good sasion.
Pours a cloudy yellow color. Aroma is of yeast bananas. Really full mouth feel. Taste is malty but balanced by yeast. Lots of banana, citrus and orange peel notes. Nice and enjoyable.

Appearance: Yellow golden, quite hazy. Lots of creamy, white head.
Aroma: Fruit, banana, slight yeast and citrus.
Taste: Lots of fruit, primarily bananas, some wheat. Wow, very different.
Bought: Total Wine (Sterling), 500 ml, $3.99
Info: 15/9-2015

Caramel, allspice, banana, creamy. Low bitterness, finishes clean. It goes down sooooooo smoothly. The higher alcohol content is well masked and Im sure Ill feel it later. An adult banana split in a glass. Ive been disappointed many times by wheat beers in the past, both German and Belgian. This one delivers and is the best one Ive ever had. Heck, its one of the best beers Ive ever had, period.

Bottle. Pale gold, clear. Creamy, low stable head. Aroma of very intense bananas, slightly malty. Taste thick and smooth, a bit sour at the end, carbonation mid, a little tingling, pleasant. Bitterness non-existent but not necessary. Alcohol well hidden. Aftertaste mostly bananas, a hint of malts, a little bit of herbal hoppy. Altogether a pleasant experience.

Hazy golden color with a huge white head that not last longer but keep a nice lacing until the end. Aroma is sweet, citrus hints of wheat, yeast and slightly alcohol and banana notes. Flavor is spicy, hints of banana, burned sugar, wheat and citrus. High carbonation and a medium to full body with a sweet and spicy dry finish.

Bottiglia 0.5l. Schiuma bianca compatta e molto persistente, Chiara e velata. aroma speziato, gusto lieve carbonato,lievito,frumento,lieve frutti gialli. Dolce, di semplice bevuta, alla fine il palato ne chiede unaltra

Pours a hazy darker golden, topped with a big white head. Wheaty aroma with lots of spices. Sweet and wheaty, some banana and bubblegum presence easily notable. Nicely drinkable, doesnt feel like 7,7%. Very fine.

Pours a very light and cloudy color. However the aroma was muffled, as I got almost no smell at all, which was very strange, and mostly likely just my nose as its been stuffy all day. The first sip was a punch of spicy malt that mellowed towards the finish. Part of this was the carbonation but they mixed together so well it was hard to distinguish the two at first. A slight hint of banana as well, which is what makes this one of my favorite german beers. Its light-medium bodied, with a nice bit of sweetness from the malt. Overall this is one of my favorite German beers, and is one I love showing to my friends who havent discovered quality beer yet.

Bottle from supermarket in Platanias. Amber beer with huge white, frothy head. Yeasty lemon wheat flavor with notes of banana and clove. Bittersweet fruity taste with banana, wheat and cloves. Nice one!
Bottled. Pours golden with a big white head. Smells boiled vegetables, canned fruity and fruity hoppy. Tastes a bit nutty, fruity hoppy, hay with a similar finish.
Aroma weel defined for a weissbeer. Apearance turbid,beer head well formed with small bubbles and average life time.Taste smooth ens enjoyable, Taste is litlle sweet.

Quart bottle from Whole Foods PM, and I cannot believe it too me over 10 years of ratebeerdom t find this one. We MUST fix this. Pours hazy and highly carbonated golden with frothy white head. Nose is wheaty pale malt, funk, yeast, white pepper. Great nose. Tastes pale malty, bready and somewhat sweet with notes of hocitrus, white pepper, clove, and a sweet palate. Solid.

Bottle 0,5l from Interspar Zagreb. Blond slightly hazy body, white head. Nice aroma of banana, spices, apples, yeast, liqueur. Taste is dry, slightly sour. Disturbing presence of alcohol. Banana, yeast, pale fruits. Full body, medium carbonation.Not bad, but a bit unbalanced (alcohol).

Bottle 0,5l. A bit cloudy, pale yellow colored beer. Very pleasant fruity aroma, banana, apples, vanilla, yeast, good liquer. Flavor is unfortunately not so pleasant due to harsh alcohol presence, but its still solid beer. Semi-dry, fruity, quite smooth.Good one, but not my favourite.

Bottle, pours light gold with thick white head. Aroma of banana and bread which follows to the pallet along with cloves and lemon.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Alko. Big and lasting white head. Fine balanced aroma with banana that isnt too big. Small sweetness and a fine banana taste. Medium body.
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Draught at weihenstephaner berlin. Spicy aromas of banana, wheat and some citrus. Taste is sweet and spicy. A bit of honey and vanilla in the background. A beautiful beer.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2016 Hazy yellow color with thick white head that stays long. Lots of banana in aroma with some spices in background.Soft mouthfeel, taste of bananas, wheat and some spices. Well balanced, amazing beer. Easy to drink, alcohol doesnt taste on it at all.

Pours a hazy yellow with a thick white head. Moderate lacing. Aroma is big on the banana with notes of citrus and spice. Flavor is sweet, banana and spice. Reminds me of a good banana bread. Creamy mouthfeel that is a little sticky. Medium;full bodied with a sweet finish that becomes just a tinge bitter at the end. Really drinkable at 7.7 abv. Would never have guessed it to be even close. Fantastic.

Cloudy golden, two finger tall head. Stays for very long as a thick film. The nose is very spicy with banana & some fruit. Medium to full body. Well rounded. Sweetish wheat flavour with huge spicy yeastiness. Minimal bitterness. An excellent thing-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
500 ml bottle from Whole Foods. Hazy yellow orange color. Big banana and yeast throughout. Very nicely done.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, wheat, banana and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque yellow/golden beer with a medium/large white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, wheat and banana; ends slightly dry with citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense and balanced, but lacks complexity. Despite this however, the beer is superbly amazing. The banana flavour is so great and makes this beer the best blonde Weizen Bock there is.
Cloudy dark gold with little head, banana, spice and a hint of orange juice on the nose, full bodied and dry-sweet, a touch of sourdough and honey.

Bottle thanks to Mads! Pours a hazy golden with a big, white head. Aroma is very saison-like. Wheat, pepper, yeast, slight funk. Taste is dry and sweet, slightly fruity and with a dry finish. High carbonation and a smooth body. Nice one!

Although the head is thick and rich increases a delectable aroma of banana and fresh wheat beer. The flavor is banana, ripe fruit and a particularly rich flavor of wheat. Slightly spicy coriander put a fine edge on its otherwise sweet malt fullness, and its light and almost anonymous hop bitterness provides long harmonious finish. The alcohol is relatively high, but set in the background of its spicy sweet filling.

Bottle from Stockmann in Tallinn. BB 30.06.16. Cloudy golden yellow with a huge off-white head that retains nicely, leaving little if any lacing. On the nose its so refreshing - lemon, ginger and cinnamon cookies, wheat and dough, warming sweetness... Tastes as nice - wheaty, citrusy, spicy. Crisp, thin carbonation. Nice and firm body. Oh my, this is excellent - the kind of beer that makes you want to just shut up and enjoy.
Love this beer beats most of the other wheat beers in the USA. Check my Youtube Channel for my review of this beer youtube.com/shaftyfingers

@ Kallithea Beach, Rhodes 150710. Bottle (500 ml) from Carrefour. Wheaty, yeasty and spicy with citrusy and estery notes, sweet, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry, sweet, wheaty and spicy.

SB beställningssortimentet, flaska uthämtad Oskarshamn. Svagt skum. Banan och frukt av annat slag. Rund och fin på läppen. Stilig flaska. Inte fullt så fruktig i smaken som på Ruhrhackel. Undrar hur den är på fat?

Draught at Cooper Ales, Wow, rich creamy banana, pear tart, orange zest, wild honey, plenty of vanilla, touch of spice, clean dry finish. Awesome balance, this is pure liquid gold, one of my favorite brews of all time. Prost!
Draught. Murky dark yellow with small off-white foamy head, citrus aroma, sweet taste with citrus flavor,low carbonation, abrupt finish. Great wheat beer!

Pours a hazy pale gold color with a white head. Wheat, lemon, yeast, banana and mild tart aroma. Wheat, lemon, banana, clove, yeast, biscuit and mild tart flavors. Medium light body and average carbonation. Yeast, lemon and banana finish.

Clara,turva,espuma cremosa e abundante como manda o estilo;no aroma fermento,cereais e o frutado(Banana,Tutti Frutti);sabor adocicado e frutado,condimentos e um leve amargor ao fundo,carbonatação alta,refrescante,bom corpo para uma Weiss. Uma Weizenbock diferente(clara).um pouco adocicada em excesso,mas uma boa cerveja.

0,5 l bottle from bier-deluxe, best before 25/2/2016. Cloudy, golden yellow with a huge, creamy, almost stable, white head. Yeasty-spicy aroma of banana and clove with hints of vanilla, citrus and honeydew. Sweetish, yeasty-spicy taste with lots of banana, cloves and vanilla and with hints of cinnamon and honeydew. Short, yeasty, sourish and slightly bitter finish. Medium to full body, creamy and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Delicious, well-balanced and just as you would expect a pale weizenbock. Great, but there are even better ones.
Very, very slight hazy gold. Vanilla aroma. Taste is yeast, malt, and vanilla. Smooth texture.
UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 Pours slight unclear yellow, little head. Aroma is wheat and slight citric and banana. Flavour is wheat and slight citric. Refreshing.

Orange golden, murky color, dense lasting foam head, nice carbonation. A: yeasty, fruity Weizen with fresh grains, banana, vanilla. T: again yeasty, bit doughy, fresh grains (big!). Large fruity taste, mostly banana and pear. Nicely balanced. Mildly bitter development, some grass notes. Aftertaste is fruity, banana. Nice.
Very good Weizenbock, aroma of peach,vanilla and banana. Sweet bready malt, sweet fruits, a little bit of caramel and a remiscence of smoked beef. Very good Weizenbock, so easy to drink.
Cloudy , big frothy white head. Nose of spices vanilla cloves and punchy bananas.very carbonated full body, quite creamy and has warming feeling. Very good weizenbock

Cómo camuflar casi 8 grados en una aparente cerveza de trigo. Excelente, no sólo por esto, sino porque es una magnífica cerveza. Espuma típica. Color más oscuro (ámbar claro). Aroma frutal (plátano predominante), clavo. Sabor espléndido redondeando perfectamente el sabor frutal con un fondo especiado. Grande.Cuerpo. Y ligera a la vez. Peligrosamente bebible.

Cloudy translucent yellow with a meager sized white head. Pleasant yeast, dough, vanilla, bubblegum, malt, lemon, and mildly hoppy fragrance. Full bodied. Very interesting and complex. Initial taste is smooth yeast, malt, bubblegum, lemon, and vanilla wheat, but the finish consists of bitter hops, citrus, spice, and alcohol. Although not my favourite style, very obviously well executed.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 Uitgeschonken in 0,5 liter Weihenstephaner glas. Donkergeel troebel bier met witte schuimkraag, mooie carbonatie. De schuimkraag is wel kleiner dan bij de gewone Weizen van Weihenstephaner. Aroma's van brooddeeg, gist, banaan, kruiden, honing en kaas. De smaak is zacht, fruitig en kruidig. Tonen van vers brood, bloemige gist, rijpe bananen, meloen, vanille, honing, kruidnagel met licht rokerige tonen. De afdronk is licht zoet, zacht bitter en kruidig. De alcohol van 7,7% is zeer goed verborgen, deze smakelijke Weihenstephaner Vitus drinkt gevaarlijk gemakkelijk weg. Het is een perfect voorbeeld van deze Duitse stijl. Geduchte concurrent voor de Schneider Aventinus, als meest smakelijke Duitse bier tot nu toe.
Huge white frothy head atop a clear, well-carbonated Amber body. Nose of bananas and candied corn. Very sweet, nice high alcohol with a wet wheat and cotton candy finish. Decent.
Banana, bread, spritzy yeasty goodness. Cloudy with huge white head that stays forever. Nice lacing. Taste compliments aroma in each and every way. Great weizenbock

Pours like a Hefeweizen with a deep golden straw color but the head is not as lively. Aroma and taste are all bock, but with light floral notes from the wheat. Stronger than a Hefeweizen which can be a nice change. Very palatable and refreshing beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy, peachy gold with frothy white head that reduces to attractive lacing, and plenty of effervescence. 
Aroma is spicy wheatbread with cloves and honey. Palate adds classic banana, coriander, mango, dough, umami.
Outstanding mouthfeel, creamy, yeasty yet slick but still refreshing. Theres significant alcohol here, but it comes out as a warming undercurrent, not a hot buzz. This is a beer you could easily have too many of, while enjoying every tasty, fluffy swallow.

So interesting and good, Weizenbock! Rarity! Nice white top, cloudy yellow. Orange liqueur aroma, lactose and banana. Light body in spite high alcohol. Sweet taste and silky smooth. Minor lemon and grassy notes. Oily texture. Very enjoyable.

Flasche (50 cl) von GeFeKo, Berlin. - Tiefes Goldgelb, trüb. - Nase weich weizenmalzig-süß mit Hefe und milder Frucht. - Antrunk füllig weizenmalzig aber zunächst weniger süß als erwartet. Erfrischende obergärige Fruchtigkeit mit milden herben Akzenten (Orange, Orangenlikör) und sogar zarter Säure. Erst danach auch reife Banane und Malzsüße, Vanille und Nelke. Mild rezent, sehr weich im Mund, vollmundig und enorm süffig. Im Abgang milde fruchtige Herbe mit ganz leichter Hopfenwürze. - Sehr schöner Weizenbock, perfekt abgeschmeckt mit herb-fruchtigen Noten und einem Spritzer erfrischender Säuerlichkeit. Enorm frisch und süffig und fast gar nicht schwer.

Weizenbock. 7.7%ABV.

Nice fresh wheaty nose.

First mouthful has a nice clear carbonated mouthfeel. Very well rounded and gentle.

Nice almost fruity slide into the hops which are fresh without being harsh. Not too much alkalinity, you dont feel like youre getting a mouthful of pot ash.

Theres a residual hint of formic acid reminiscent of the head on a Delirium Tremens.

One of my nicer gentler beer experiences, lulling me into a false sense of security then giving me a nice buzz to remind me that it is 7.7%ABV after all. Thank you, VITUS! I love you man!

Goes on Favorites List.

Bottle at home. Poured a hazy but strong honey with two fingers worth of a white head. Aromas are floral, cereal, and some spice (still thinking on which). Tastes medium sweetness, lightly bitter, umami. Pleasant and stand-out mouth feel, full body, lively carbonation, long finish. Good beer this!

The wheat Bock from this highly acclaimed and classic Bavarian brewery. Frothy, rocky, irregularly shaped, egg-white head with good lacing, towering over a misty ochre blonde beer with peachy hue and fierce sparkling; remarkably pale for its style, as most Weizenbocks are dark. Pleasant aroma of soft, soapy wheat, overripe banana and banana milkshake, chamomille, bread dough, mango, bubblegum, sour berries, lavender, cloves, apple cake. Taste starts with a mixture of sweet and sourish fruits, lots of banana and bubblegum as in a Hefeweizen, orange accent, red apple, mango, spicy hints (cloves); strong carbonation, as is custom in this style, with a soft, fluffy, mellow mouthfeel; there is clear and clean basic wheat sourishness as well as a very agreeable bready malt sweetness, while the stereotypical banana and cloves flavours persist; finish is a bit oily, malt sweet, with a big dosis of the fruity yeastiness as well as a clear, but undisturbing presence of warming, slightly liqueurish alcohol. Very good example of its style, in fact one of the best I had so far, friendly, generous and elegant.
.5 liter bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head. A big sweet banana ester nose. Lemon, banana, cloves, soft palate. Light tropical flavor with base sweet malts. Nice. Clean.

Bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a cloudy light yellow, with a big fluffy white head that quickly fades into a disk on the surface. Nose is bananas and cloves. Taste is malt with Belgian yeast notes of cloves and bubble gum, with a spicy rye finish. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2015 Bottle. Pours cloudy straw yellow with big white head. Aroma is wheat, clove, yeast, banana, some yenka bubblegum. Some herbs. Taste is sweet and develops from bready malts to yeast banana and bubblegum. Slight minty finish. Smooth yet light body. Very nice!

16.9oz bottle poured into a hefeweizen glass. The aroma is strong of spicy clove with undertones of banana, lemon, and biscuit, with a lighter note of creamy, vanilla lactose. The lemon notes strengthen later in the drink. Its a murky, pale shade with a creamy froth, foamy white head that only has a light retention and lace. The taste is a bright, medium high sweet and medium bitter combination. The beers texture is creamy and thick, smooth, with a soft fuzz carbonation and a medium full body. Flvaors of lemon, clove, banana, and a hint alcohol hit the palate first, and it finishes crisp with a lemon and orange acidity and a zippy spice. Theres also a mellow, clean alcohol warmth that leaves an astringency and an aftertaste thats dry and clean, with notes of clove and vodka.

0,5 l, flaske, 7,7 % ABV, BB: 01/11/15, hentet af laboko i Tyskland - tak! 24. maj 2015.
Honninggul ufiltreret Hvedebock med flot, høj, hvid og vedholdende skumtop på 6-7 cm (serveret i hvedeglas). Let boblende i glasset. 
Aroma af banan, og humlearoma af let citrus. Nuancer af hvedemalt i en igennem god aroma.
Dejlig frisk og sødlig, men også ganske fyldig smag. Middel sødme og let bitter. Krydret. 
Mellem fyldig krop, og vel karboneret på et middel niveau ideelt for øltypen. Konsistensen er glat, og mundfølelsen fantastisk dejlig blød.
Et flot glas øl, en lækker blød mundfølelse og en rar frisk smag...what's not to like? Topklasse indenfor øltypen!

Keg, Brewdog, Leicester. Hazy yellow gold with a white foam. Aromas are wheat with hints of caramel and banana. Bready yeast with lemon rind and leafy herbs. Flavours are sweet wheat with herbal notes and coriander heat. Banana with oak barrel. Restrained alcohol with a peppery finish. Very good.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow colour. Huge white head. Strong aroma of banana, clove, bread and spices. Flavour banana, bread, clove and alcohol warmth. Nice medium sweet finish with alcohol warmth. Full body and medium carbo. Excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tried several times on tap and, obviously from bottle. Now reviewing from 50cl in Ayingerweiss glass. Pours an abundant, dense creamy and white head; nice deep golden to light orange, cloudy and bubbly. Smells instant spicy, vanilla, yeasty, clove, fruity, super estery, banana, creme bruleè, complex and aromatic. Tastes yeasty, spicy, sweet fruity, lemon pie, wheat and cereal syrupy; medium +plus sweetness, quite low+ citrusy bitterness. Creamy, medium to full bodied, well carbonated; dangerous for its drinkability and the almost 8%. Rich and complex, very probably the best blond wheat/weizen beer in the world (beware of aventinus), highly reccomended
0,5 liter bottle. Golden trouble coloured beer. Defintely tastes a bit like the all known white beer from weihenstephaner, its a bit more spiced and thanks to that an other character.

Jeez, Im lucky to have had the Ayinger weizenbock a few days ago. This one may just have the edge. Bright, cloudy golden pour is beautiful. Thin white head with some grip. Esters and ripe fruit aromas on the nose are pleasing, but the flavor is outstanding. More banana and a solid wheat malt backbone make this one smooth-sipping beverage. Way too easy to drink.
Lovely wheat beer, nice aroma and sweetness, probably coming from the 7.7% strength.
Out of 0,5l bottle. Tall white head. Incredible nose. Pleasant carbonation. Complex body, definitely above average. Wd highly recommend this one.

It pours classic Weihenstephaner huge billowing head, cloudy yellow. Has a really sweet and sough, dough aroma, and also strong lemon taste. I saw someone describe it as not banana but banana peel and I agree, its more citrus rind that straight citrus. I didnt realize it was 7.7%, 3 standard drinks in a bottle, and it definitely has kick.

16.9 oz bottle, poured into a tulip glass at ~45 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a somewhat cloudy (fingers visible but blurry on the opposite side of the glass) brilliant golden yellow, and forms a massively fluffy white head that barely collapses even when drunk - I dont know that it ever went below a half-finger in height, with appropriately off-the-chain lacing. Carbonation streams continuously through the beer as tiny bubbles.

Smell: Pure ester heaven. Rich notes of banana and clove swell out of the glass, with hints of coriander, peaches, and lush ripe wheat.

Taste: Coriander citrus opens the flavor profile, and is swiftly joined by banana and spicy clove. A spot of peach flavor enters as it moves along, and bits of white pepper emerge at close to the same time. Underlying it all is a light biscuit-cracker malt, which comes more to the front at the finish, leaving behind a lingering mixture of wheaten malt, banana, and peach after the swallow.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied yet silky, this is an easy-drinking beer, not unlike the feel of a good hefeweizen.

Overall: Less "imperial dunkelweizen" and more "imperial hefeweizen", this is definitely what one would expect from Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier Turbo Edition. Im quite the fan, though ultimately I give the nod to Tap 6 Aventinus for Best Weizenbock Ever.

500ml bottle from Saveur-Biere.com. Pours hazy gold with healthy white head. Gorgeously sweet weizen-bock aroma, continuing to a lovely fluffy taste with plenty of overripe banana esters to go around. Creamy, fruity, full and delicious. Yum.

Bottle - 500ml. Beautiful cloudy golden body with a thick white foamy head. Well balanced malty/hoppy aroma with yeasty and citrusy hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Its fresh malty/hoppy taste carries herbal, citrusy, and yeasty notes. Ends with with a decent bittersweet finish. Enjoyable.
Bottle, pours clody pale golden with medium, white head. Spicy aromas, cloves. Taste is also spicy, malty, medium-full body with strong carbonation.

Bottle @ De Tolly, Tartu. Pours hazy yellow with nice firm white head, Aroma is sweet and sour, yeasty, wheat, spicy, a bit cardemom, fruity, orange. Taste is sweet, yeasty, floury. Medium body. Well balanced. Good beer.
Bottle. Large head with light honey cloudy colour. Fruity and flower smell. Lime sour and creamy taste with notes of citrus and grapes. Heavy bitter finish and long taste.
50cl bottle. Pours milky yellow with big, fine snow white head. Fresh aroma of yeast and malt. Rich spicy and malty flavor. Very smooth and drinkable.
Bottle. Pour into a stein with a large head, aroma is fruity, toffee, citrus rind. Taste is citrus, banana, clove. Great

0,50 bottles purchased at Beerville store in Belgrade-Serbia. Ciao Vlada! Pours cloudy vivid golden, a bit pale with a never ending and tick white cap. Nose: wheat, banana, clove, spices. Mouth: gentle carbonation, mild and pleasant bread feel, medium dry finish. Never too sweet neither too dry or bitter. Perfect execution of the style (which sadly I do not admire). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska från Saveur-bier. Gyllenfärgad, lätt disig högt vitt skum som lägger sig efter 5 minuter utan att lämna några rester. En storebror till en hefe. LIte större kropp, högre sötma och lite alkohol i bakgrunden, lite mindre syrlighet och skumbanan. Men samma kryddighet och jästsmaker. Riktigt gott och väldigt välbalanserat.
Aroma a platano y clavo, color claro turbio, sabor a trigo, espuma persistente .

On tap at Brauhaus Schmitz in Philly. Cloudy gold with a large creamy white head that disappears quickly. Lemony wheat malt nose. Yeasty lemon wheat flavor with notes of banana and clove. Bittersweet fruity mid taste. Tart yeasty finish. Quite tasty. Prost.
Sweet aromas. Banana, bread, spritzy yeasty goodness. Cloudy with huge white head that stays forever. Nice lacing. Taste compliments aroma in each and every way. Great weizenbock.

Bottle, 50cL. Home. A bubbly pale yellow opaque beer with a big creamy white head ; great retention. Aroma of banana, citrus, cereal, spices, alcohol, biscuit. Medium to heavy sweet, light herbal bitter ; ephemeral refreshing breeze ; warming background. Full body, smooth thin silky texture, average carbonation, sweet warming background. Overall, pleasant weizenbock ; great aroma ; too sweet ; thin texture.
Golden colour with small but compact head. Aroma of dark fruits, bananas, citrus and some hebs. Taste of hops, dark fruits and bananas which prevails in aftertaste. Very drinkable beer.

Poured from 1 pint, 9 ounce bottle purchased at Market District Giant Eagle in Columbus, Ohio, tasted on March 12, 2015. Cloudy yellow hue, banana/clove aroma, banana/spice/wheat flavor with some depth. Not exactly my thing--it seems to have more hefeweizen attributes than I would have expected-- but graded leniently since it is well made. Anyone who is a fan of the style or of hefeweizens should definitely try it.

Golden orange color, hazy with perfect head and lacing. Aroma of clives, banana, yeast. Taste a bit sweet with lemon sour notes, very drinkable, slightly sweet finish with a hint of akcohol reminding this is bock beer. Absolutely great brew.

Bottle 0.5l from Slovenia.Thank you Jernej for sharing this beer.Pour it dark hazy orange color.On the nose caramel, banana.Very good balanced and complexed.Great flavour.Taste and aroma of caramel, banana, vanilla, cloves, spices, good smoth yeast on the end.Perfect

Nice bright yellow color. The beer is nice cloudy, like a proper weizen should be. The thick layer of fluffy rough foam drops to leave a nice thin creamy foam. The smell is very nice. Nice and fruity with a nice splash of sour. This comes back in the mild taste. The beer is really soft, it massages the tongue. It has a really nice mouth sensation. The taste is not strong. The mild taste is perfect. It is a nice and mellow drink. You can taste some nice sweet citrus fruits. The finish is long and sweet, very pleasant.
Taste is, as they say, subjective and this may not be the most beautiful or the best looking beer but the aroma is fantastic and the taste, imho, was/is amazing!
Full body wheaty body. Light moderately dry. A touch of sweetness. So well balanced.
Uma surpreendente cerveja de trigo. Picante, refrescante e muito saborosa.

Lightly hazy gold pour with a pillowy white head. Aroma is banana peel, citrus, wheat, and Clive. Taste is banana peel, bubble gum, light citrus, and faint spice. Medium body with prickly carbonation.

Cerveza de trigo galardonada con el premio a mejor cerveza fuerte en wba y bien merecido, tiene buena apariencia una espuma muy densa gran sabor y graduación alcohólica (7,8) bien escondida, me da mil vueltas a fransikaner o paulaner una gran cerveza de trigo muy recomendable
22.2.2014. Very pale for the type, hazy, thick head. Aroma has citrus, banana, yeast. Taste has banana, spices, warmth of alcohol and yeast. Some sourness, crisp carbonation. It works.
Pours quite pale with a large white head. Delicious blend of banana, clove and caramel with some yeast notes.
A nice, solid beer. Good aromas and flavors of bananas, wheat, spices and perhaps some apricot or peach. The alcohol is hidden well. Relatively light and crisp finish.

Bottle @ Gambrinus, Tartu.
Yellow with cloudy head. Refreshing and very enjoyable. Good wheat beer. Fruity aroma. Alcohol well disguised.

Hazy yellow beer, big fluffy white head. Nose is fruity, lots of banana esters, yeast, some alcohol hints, cloves. Flavor blends together more than the nose, bananas, spice notes and booze make for a surprisingly mellow blend. Some booze in the finish with more banana. On the sweet side, but not cloying. Nice and fruity.

Botella. Amarillo anaranjado. Espumaca blanca compacta. Es aspecto es muy bueno..aroma dominante a banana, aunque recuerda un poco a zumo multifrutas y una hefeweizen...en boca entra como una hefe pero luego cambia para se otra cosa, sabores frutales y a levadura propia del estilo. No tal dulce y cansina como una jefe, mas refrescante frutal y equilibrada...con un punto amargo al final. No me gustan las de trigo pero esta es otra movida me ha gustado bastante mucho!!! Birroteee en su estilo seguro!!! Los grados muy bien camuflados
500 mL bottle. Yellow orange pour, big foamy white head. Normal wheat beer aroma, banana, cloves, spice. Taste has more of a citrus taste, some pineapple. fair bit of yeast. Lively carbonation.

Bottle, 0.50l. Clear deep golden color with large creamy white head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of wheat, banana, yeast and caramel. Taste starts with sweet and rich grainy malt, following is refreshing fruity and yeasty, mouthfeel is spicy and warming, while finish is mild bitter. Full body, oily texture and lively carbonation in palate. Incredibly drinkable with well hidden alcohol...
Hazy pale golden with lots of frothy head. Lots of fruity Esters and bubblegum, lemon notes. Fruity and delicious.
Pours a cloudy pale colour. Taste is of bubblegum and some spice. Not a bad beer
Cloudy yellow color, big white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, lemon, banana, spices. Dry sweet taste with gently bitter finish. Medium body and fizzy carbonation. Excellent wheat beer.

Aussehen: strohgelb leicht bräunlich und opal mit schönem weißen Schaum
Aroma: Banane, etwas Honig
Geschmack: süß, Banane, Brot, malzig, wärmend. Trotz der fast 8% erstaunlich süffig. Kaum bitter. Stimmig

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. pours orange with a creamy head. Body is medium with medium to high carbonation that eventually settles as it approaches room temperature. Aroma is big with wheat, cloves, slight banana and some citrus zest. Alcohol was slightly present in the aroma. Taste is just as inviting as the aroma with lots of spice. Cloves and wheat dominate with hints of cinnamon and citrus zest that finishes with a mild hoppy bitterness. Great beer especially for summer drinking!

Keg at Brewdog Camden. A cloudy pale amber colour with a thin off white head. Aroma of wheat, herbs, lemon, grapefruit, clove, banana with some sweetness and a hint of vanilla. Taste is smooth and of wheat, lemon, banana, clove, bread and yeast. Moderate carbonation and a light body. A sweet, wheaty, citrus finish. A great balanced wheat beer, high drinkability.

Poured from a 16.9 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a nice malt and maybe caramel aroma with some spice tossed in.
Appearance- This is a murky gold colored beer with a large white head.
Taste- A well balanced flavor that shows wheat and a great malt flavor. Very good
Palate- A medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation and a crisp finish.
Overall- An outstanding beer! I could drink this all the time.
Het ziet er goed uit wanneer je het uitschenkt, maar weisbier zal nooit mijn favoriete bier worden qua smaak

On tap at the Wharf in Aalborg. Aroma of banana and sour wheat. Flavor is smooth tropics pineapple and bananas. Finish is smoothly sweet spice. The fact is the only thing that could make it a lot of fun with it is not an issue that the company said in the morning and I'm still not sure what I was just about everything.

0,5L bottle (from Stockmann, Tallinn), BB 01.03.16. Pours hazy orange with huge off-white head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is very intense, fruits, citrus, wheat, some sweetness, banana. Flavor is very sweet, wheat, fruits, citrus, some bitterness in the background. Alcohol is well covered, mostly noticeable by warmness in the throat. Overall: a little bit too sweet even for me, but otherwise great weizen.

Bottle. Hazy yellow body, tall head. Aroma has fresh bread with dried apricots and yeast. High yet smooth carbonation. Mild bready taste with more dried apricots. Very well rounded, alcohol is totally covered. But since its a world class brew from one of the oldest breweries in the world I expected even more.
Golden with a foamy white head. Aroma of yeast and banana bread. A good wheat beer flavour, oranges, banana and a bready finish. Nice but too fizzy to be excellent.
0.5l bottle. Hazy yellow color with big white head. Aroma of banana and wheat, creamy. Taste is sweet. Very good beer.
Big white thick long lasting head, honey cloudy color. Aroma of banana and wheat, medium sweet taste.

Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aromas of banana, bread, herbs, spice, lemon, hay. Taste is medium sweet, light-medium bitter, some other savoury touches. Lively and quite smooth, medium-light body. Really enjoyable.

Pour: slightly cloudy w/ golden straw color. Big, fluffy white head. Smell: wheat, alcohol, bubblegum, spices, & rye bread. taste: wheat, yeast, spice (nutmeg, allspice), bubblegum, & dark bread. fizzy, semi-dry finish. A unique wheat brew! new flavors 2 interpret. An A+ weizenbock
Slightly sour, very yeasty and slightly fruity wheat lager. Light carb and good body. Refreshing and easy to drink. Mildly sweet but not too much so.
Colore biondo leggermente torbida e schiuma di buona persistenza. Buono aroma, splendida al palato con banana in evidenza. Alcol giusto. Ottima

Cerveja perfeita. Aroma frutado e suave, sabor equilibrado apesar da graduação de 7.7 
Excelente cerveja e uma das melhores que já provei
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 500 ml bottle. pale straw colour. Aroma is much like the classic weihenstephaner hefeweizen: fruity with subtle banana. creamy spritzy mouthfeel. Very good.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

Soft creamy orange aroma. Thick long head. Creamy mouth feel. Cloudy Cloudy golden color. Probably the best beer I have ever had. And at the brewery in Freising Germany. Actually had two! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Smuk tåget gylden med et stort holdbart hvidt skum. Duft med bananer, koriander og en antydning af alkohol. Smagen er sød og bød med en eftersmag, der kun er meget let bitter
Keg at brewdog bar, manc. Cloudy yellow and small white head. Aroma is clove and strong banana. Taste is sweet and crisp. Tingly and medium.

En pression @ Six Roses Bar (Lille Fr). Bière de type blanche Allemande, plutôt corsée (weizenbock). Assez trouble, le nez présente des esters de banane et de clou de girofle typiques des bières de blé Allemandes. En bouche cest costaud, avec un corps plutôt prenant et agréable. Cest définitivement une bière à consommer lhiver. Attention, cela se boit tellement facilement, quon risque dy laisser des plumes.

Bottle @ Home The nose on this beer sets the too which all other Weizenbocks are compared. A rush of bannana, hints of clove. Taste is great, perfect mouth feel, the carbonation is moderate. The real beauty of this beer is the complexity of the flavor, subtly spicy, deceptively easy to drink but still a beer of substance.

Poured from a pint bottle into a weizen glass on 12.21.13.

A: 2 1/2 finger fluffy head. Golden.

S: Banana, banana bread, lemon.

T: Follows the nose. Banana, lemon, yeast.

M: Creamy smooth.

O: This is the best weizenbock Ive ever had. Its a banana and lemon bomb. Fantastic!

Excellente véritable blanche allemande au col de mousse abondant. Bouquet de bananes mûres/clous de girofle, corps plein très porté sur le blé, bonne pétillance, se boit tout seul mais attention aux effets secondaires !
A great balance of tastes, beautifully textured , perfectly viscous and smooth as Silk.

Looks like a Weizen. Aroma is concentrated sweet bananas, estery, spicy. Warming, spicy taste with a warming finish, a little bit metallic in the finish at first. Weizen texture, not boozy despite the warmth. A fantastic Weizenbock (which already is a style I particularly enjoy) though I personally prefer Aventinus.
Yellow orange color. Incredible mild feeling with surprisingly sweet taste. Slight bananas. The consequent improvement of a wheat beer.
Bière blonde aux couleurs tirant sur lambre trouble. Des saveurs épicées et une finale asséchante voire collante.

Hefeweizen on steroids. Same look and pour, stronger smell, much stronger taste. This one is a great bigger beer: it packs a punch but is not cloying, not too malty or over the top. Very nicely done.

Would drink it again!

Appearance: Light golden and hazy, with a moderate white head that holds nicely. 
Aroma: Smacks you in the fave with intense banana and bubble gum esters. A hint of alcohol on the nose as well. 
Taste: Layers of rich bready malt up front, spicy clove and banana in the middle, and some doughy/wheat character on the back end. 
Mouthfeel: Heavy, creamy body and high carbonation. 
Finish: Very malt forward with lingering banana esters. 
Overall: Great example of the style with the rich bock maltiness intermingling with the German weizen yeast charter and esters.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2015 Bottle into a glass. Pours a hazy yellow with a thick white head. Bananas and fruits on the nose. Medium mouthfeel. Beer has a perfect balance of the bananas and cloves, with a slight bubblegum flavor. Almost exactly like the regular wheat, only stronger and more flavorful. Almost no alcoholic taste. A wonderful wheat from the masters of the style.

500mL from The Abbey in DeLand, FL. Pours a murky golden orange with a thin white head; really nice lacing. Bright fruit aromas - mostly citrus. Some light earthy notes as well. Taste is quite sweet, somewhat watery, and thin on the finish. Acquire. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Excelente Weizenbock! Possui corpo e graduação alcoólica notável. Pouco aroma de banana e sabor marcante com ótimo drinkability.

Pint Bottle poured into Weizen glass. Appearance is cloudy, light copper color with tons of foamy, off-white head. Aroma is full of bread, banana, and clove. Taste is malty sweet, bready, some toast, fruit, and a very slight bitterness. Palate is full-bodied, very soft texture, soft carbonation, and a smooth finish. Not as good as Schneiders but still an excellent Weizenbock.

Bottle, on tulip glass. Big white head. Hazy deep yellow. Hop, wheat bread and lemon on very fresh aroma. Strong, fresh, open delight. Nice airy palate. White bread, dry fish. Very tasty.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle, 500 ml from Vrutak, Zagreb. Wheat and banana fruity aroma. Sweetish flavor, yeast, banana and wheat. Good beer, but I cant say Im overwhelmed with it.

Like a good heffie, but richer banana esters. The greater alcohol presence is subdued, and allows one to focus on the subtle yet enjoyable biscuit/bread notes. Im not a huge fan of heffies over 6%, but this one would be quite nice once and a while.

Weizenbock quand tu nous tiens, mais pas nimporte laquelle : LA Weizenbock qui a gagnée les WBA en 2011.
Alors là, je ne sais pas par ou commencer, que ce soit la couleur ou le goût, le nez ou le goût : tout y est.
Bon allez zou, je me lance.
Visuellement : Malt dorge et de froment oblige, cette Weizenbock nous offre une robe ambrée avec un col crémeux, légèrement trouble dû au non filtré, cest franchement beau.
A la narine, un arôme dépice, de malt ou des malts plutôt, agrémentée de levure
Pour le goût, alors là, mais là mes amis, on a quelque chose, on a quelque chose de bon mais de très bon, cest fruité (agrumes/banane), encore une fois le fait quelle soit non filtrée nous donnes davantage de saveurs, la carbonation est pour moi au poil, cest précis, cest fin, cest gourmet/gourmand et assez puissant (7,7%), cest assez long en bouche, cest rond. Bref un délice.
Cette bière est un must have
Sehr angenehmer, fruchtiger Weizenbock. Heu, Getreide, Pflaume. Hervorragendes Bier!
bread, hay, roasty, floral, citrus, herbs, cheese, cooked vegetables, woody,
Mouthfeel starts creamy and carbonated, finishes dry and lets the fruity flavors linger. This is a fantastic example of the style, great drinking beer.
Poured a hazy golden with an off white head. Aroma of sweet malt, banana and dark fruit. Medium body, flavour as the aroma , light liquorice.
Bottle, pours clody pale golden with medium, white head. Spicy aromas, cloves. Taste is also spicy, malty, medium-full body with strong carbonation. Good weizenbock.
Smells good, looks good, tastes good. Really enjoy the fruity zest, it has a lot of zazz!
On tap @ En Aithria, Athens Greece. Orange color hazy with a big white head. Aromas of banana, malts and yeast. Same on the taste. Medium body with medium to high carbonation.

Draught at Coffee Tree, Kfar Saba. Hazy orange with medium creamy off-white head. Aroma of wheat, fruity (mostly banana), yeasty, grainy, faint sausage notes. Flavor of wheat, fruity (banana, citrus), some graininess, the alcohol is quite noticeable, sweet-sour finish. Light carbonation, Medium-bodied
Me gusta una de mis favoritas, sabor inigualable su aroma es tal cual el que llevas a tu boca.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 500ml bottle. Aroma is sweet banana and peppery spicy hoppiness with a little alcohol. Flavour is very sweet, lightly sour, lightly bitter and lightly spicy. This is my second try at this beer and it is much better than the first time. An excellent and  complex beer with a fresh taste. Lightly carbonated and lubricious without being sticky

This is the perfect Weizen. A Weizen Bock is always preferred when available versus a regular Weizen. This one is a Helles, in color. The hop nose is subtle and subdued, appropriate for the style. The flavor of the Weihenstephan yeast strain is perfectly balanced with this high Gravity Bavarian Wheat Ale. The ethanol content is insidious and beckons one to order just one more, again and again. Weihenstephan is my favorite Weizen yeast strain. Although variety is truly the spice of life, shall I constrain myself to this strain, or shall I train my brain on another strain? That is the question.
Cervezaca con todas las letras. Creo que la mejor que he probado de trigo. Muy buena.

Aroma is coriander, biscuit, yeast, orange, and banana. Taste is very light sweet wheat grain profile. Light hop profile but overall well balanced. Overall very very good with a nice complexity that finishes astonishingly smooth. Appearance is a slightly cloudy straw body with a bubbly foam head that retains well.

Robe dorée, opaque. Leffervescence est fine et la mousse se dissipe rapidement. Saveurs de bananes mûres puissantes. On sent également un léger goût de caramel. Arrière-goût vanille. Longue en bouche.
La meilleure bière de blé que jai bue jusquà présent.

500 ml. Bottle pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head. Aromas of banana, cloves, light wheat. Light bodied, very delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2015 Jaune à peine orangé très trouble, belle et fine effervescence se dissipant rapidement et laissant un petit col.
Nez de bananes mûres, caramel, épices et alcool.Attaque solide, épicée, poivrée, bananes caramélisées, biscuits et levures.Corps crémeux et solide.Longue en bouche.La weizen bock autrement dit la weizen "forte" parfaite.Chapeau !

Sweet banana yeast aroma. Hazy a amber body. Sweet spicy and bit tart. A bit of a caramel background. Head starts off very foamy but does settle fairly quick to light film. Feels soft and silky in the mouth. Clean refreshing finish with just and edge of a bite.

Bière de blé non filtrée, comme la présente le brasseur, respectant la loi de pureté, mais comprenant du malt dorge et de blé. Elle est en bouteille de 50 cl et titre à 7,7 % abv, un beau niveau pour lAllemagne Prix de la meilleure « strong wheat » aux WBA, mais catégorisée en weizenbock.
Couleur doré pâle, paille de blé, avec le léger voile adéquat.
Bulles très fines par milliers en fontaine au centre. Splendide.
Mousse blanche épaisse, bien crémeuse, avec texture duf battu en haut.
1ère bouche douce avec une prise originale très fruitée, très fine, avec quelques fleurs.
Arrière-bouche fine, longue, agréable.
2ème avec du blé, des épices douces. Une coloration de saveurs très originale, qui fait penser à certains bonbons acidulés de jadis.
3ème où la cerise blanche vient en avant, avec de la pimprenelle.
Arrière-bouche très agréable, fleurie, mais pas complexe.
La longueur donne un peu damandes, mais lensemble devient quelque peu écurant
Les jambes sont lisses et longues.
Lalcool ne fait pas son niveau, et aide peu à lharmonie de lensemble.
La finale ne fait aucun effort pour nous apporter de lampleur. Elle est alignée sur le reste.
CONCLUSION : une bière qui surprend agréablement sur les premières bouches, puis devient lassante, sans vraie complexité et aucune ampleur, surtout en finale.

Bottle at home. Pours a pale hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is wheat, and fruity esters, banana, citrus and spices. Taste is wheat, yeast, fruity banana and citrus, and spices. Nice and refreshing.
From tap at the Beerstore, Thessaloniki. Hazy pale yellow color with white head. Citrusy fruity aroma, yeasty. Taste is sweet, fruity, banana, yeasty again. Medium oily body with average carbonation.

Dit is nou eens een lekker bier zeg. Gedronken van de tap bij Jays Waalwijk tijdens de Weihenstephaner dagen.
Flinke schuimkraag. Mooie troebele kleur. Volle smaak, heerlijk.

Bue à la pression en 33cl au VnB avec Renobob, couleur blanche trouble mousse très crémeuse et effervescence moyenne, une bière blanche à lallemande côté grillé et banane, mais avec aussi une grosse attaque sur lalcool ce qui rend la persistance en bouche bien plus importante.

Great beer. From bottle hazy orange pour. Small head. Aroma of cloves and bananas. Spicy taste like a Weiss beer on steroids initially sweet and spicy with a nice acidic finish. Full mouthfeel. Low carbonation. Hides the alcohol very well.
Trüb, gelb, dicker Schaum. Bananig, hefig in der Nase. Am Gaumen Hefe, Weizen, leichte Säure. Vollmundig.

Half litre bottle poured into an oversized Tripel Karmeliet tulip. A: Colour was orangy golden, hazy. I expected a huge head to form, bit that wasnt the case, there was only a moderate amount of foam on top, not much lacing clung to the glass. S: Yeast, clove, banana and esters. T: Mainly followed the nose, but also added some orange and milky notes. The really impressive aspect was how well the booze was concealed. M: Minimal carbonation, slightly thick texture, smooth. O: Understated but classy, not much more to add.

Golden to orange color, hazy; lasting, fluffy, white head - Aroma of ripe banana, yeast, some spices, some floral hops, hay - taste: medium sweetness, light bitterness - medium to full body, thick texture, average carbonation - finish: light bitterness, some banana and spices

Important message: Yes, this is a Bock Beer, but if you expect the traditionnal Bock beer taste, you might be disapointed. This beer is based on the traditionnal Weihenstephan Weizenbier, and this alone makes it quite unique. Its so different from what you think to know of Bock beers, and its soooo good! Danm, this beer HAD to be elected worlds best strong weizenbier!

0,5 l bottle
Appearance: Cloudy pale orange color with a fluffly white head. 
aroma: sweet bananas, hay and spices, bread and yeasts, cloveand some caramel
Taste; moderate sweet with wheat, bread, caramel malts, yeasts and the Some banana esters.. Finish is a very light bitterness there are however some spicey tones there. 
Quite nice, and very friendly.
full body, average carbonation.,


Good brew but more a Weizen then a bock.

Bottle from Booths, Media City. Pale amber-gold with a thin head. Has a fine wheat aroma and taste, perhaps a little more so in the former than latter as the flavour does not linger too long. Theres a touch of spice here but does not make the beer too indistinct from its style.

Cloudy pale pour. Aroma is strong wheat esters with some banana vibe. Taste is strong tropical fruit of the same quality but quite sickly. Palate is like brine - turns me stomach. Overall not my sort of style at all.

Couleur jaune trouble, très légère mousse. Fort nez levures, banane, paille. Super gout fruité, banane, malt, paille, notes légères beurrées . Corps presque cremeux. Fin de bouche longue fruitée, houblonnée, épices. Super!!
Bottle. Hazy, golden, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.
bottled. hazed golden with a lasting off-white head; aroma of clove, vanilla and burnt banana; some caramelised banana flavours, plenty of warming alcohol, hints of sherry, sweet and invigorating

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2016 Hazy pale yellow liquid with big head. Medium to full body and carbonation. Sweet but not overwhelming. Aroma of banana and toffee. Taste like banoffee pie. Medium long finish. Taste as a Hefe-Weizen but stronger.
Excellente!!

A surprisingly light yellow hazy body. The white fluffy head settles down quickly. Nose has loads of sweet bananas, hay and spices. Taste is quite sweet and the the finish has an interesting bitterness. Carbonation is quite soft and the palate feels rich. Overall very nice, rich and creamy but easy to drink. Excellent aromas!

Colore giallo chiaro paglierino, ricorda la buccia di limone, con toni verdastri. Schiuma fine, decisamente abbondante e molto persistente. Torbida. Aroma citrico e floreale, un po di polvere che stona leggermente. Un aroma fresco che stimò le bene le ghiandole salivati. In bocca prevale il caramello da chewingum, ma si avvertono anche sentori di frutta gialla tropicale (mango, ananas e un po anche banana matura). Leggera nota citrica. Retrogusto non molto persistente, dove si e verte ancora il chewingum. Carbonizzazione un po accentuata, con bollicine finissime. Alcool non molto elvato (7,7 gradi), ma che si sente. Una piacevole scoperta.

(Bue sur place en fût): Des poires mûres et du blé sûr qui pataugent dans une mare épicée au cou de girofle. Le corps est juste assez aérien pour disperser les sucres et avec la touche sulfureuse en finale, la buvabilité est monstre.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 500ml bottle served in its own weizen glass. Re-reviewed at the Wiehenstephan monastery @ Freining, Munich area, 28th of September, 2012.
A: Pours a huge fluffy bubbled aired white head is formed when poured. Good retention and some lacings formed and left in the glass. Cloudy pale orange color
S: Smells pretty good. Wheat, cereals, bread and yeasts. Smells like a hefeweizen with the difference that its even sweeter. Banana-clove is there and also caramel and honey in the end
T: Follows the nose: wheat, bread, caramel malts, yeasts. Some banana esters. Very light bitterness
M: Medium and bit molasses body. Medium carbonation. A bit sweet with light bitterness. Very pleasant and drinkable
O: Great Weihenstephaner specimen. Refreshing and delicious
[ BA Review @ 6/18/2011 ]
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours hazy yellow, nose is bready, esters, banana, taste is sweet, banana, dry, estery.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 15C adapted to light color bock). Bottle 50 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: sweet wheat aromas mixed with vanilla and some faint banana. no hop aromas. some alcohol. APPEARANCE: gold color and hazy. large moussy white head with good retention. TASTE: sweet vanilla flavour, mixed with a strong wheat presence. very low bitterness with a relative dry finish. PALATE: medium body with moderate carbonation. OVERALL: a very interesting variation of the traditional weizen bock style, which uses a dunkelweizen.

Poured from bottle to glass. Straw hue with creamy white head that lingered. Aroma is clove, banana, melt, straw. Mouthfeel is nice with a light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness with a clean finish. Overall a decent brew.

Yellow golden near-clear body, huge persistent off white head, very few dots inside mug.
Aroma; caramel malts, floral hops, milk, bun dough, coriander. Taste; caramel malts, spices, ripe banana, grassy wet hops, yellow apple, sweet bread dough. Smooth on palate, soft carbonation. Finishes with caramel, milk, chocolate, cocoa notes. Easy. Abv dangerously well hidden....
