Good bodied fruity brew with tons of bananas and a fine balance of wheat, yeast and slightly acidic fruits. Some alcohol warming in the finish.

Maybe my favorite weizen bock. Such a wonderful beer. I had this on tap at Der Schwarzer Kolner in Brooklyn. The pout is lovely, with a big thick almost craggy head. Its a hazy yellow honey color, with healthy co2 that bubbles up, its wonderful to behold. This is a beer you really should sniff for a moment, because there is so much in the aroma- strong banana, citrus notes, floral notes, bread and yeast, hay, and a hint of bubble gum too. Its a great sniff. In the taste some of the aroma notes carry through, with bubble gum, lemony citrus, and a slightly sweet alcohol in there too. The mouthfeel is sticky, but in such a pleasant way paired with the co2, which provides a nice smooth finish. One of my all time favorites.

"another winner from this impressive 1000 year old brewery! this was ever so slightly my favorite between the kristall weisse, dopple & weizenbock. looked lighter than the abv or flavor would imply. great fruity spiciness and bready beer, all rolled into one. very nice. gotta do a side by side with Scheider Aventinus. "
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2014 Pours light straw with full white head. First taste has caramel, just a tinge of bitterness, banana, hay. Just very playful, smooth and creamy.

Keg at at BD Glasgow. It pours hazy gold with a medium white head. The nose is spicy, cereal, straw, grain, sweet banana, Frosties and wheat. The taste is bitter-sweet, doughy, massive banana, cereal, wheat, straw, orange peel and light alcohol with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Hides abv very well. Banana bomb! Nor half bad!

Flasche. Es ergießt sich ein eher dunkles Gelb, mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Fruchtiges Aroma von Grapefruit und Limette. Später ein bisschen Brotaroma. Ausgewogene Malzsüße im Geschmack, mit Noten von Banane, Orange, Apfel, Kaugummi. Außerdem Hefe.
Gutes Bier.

A nice little banana/bubble gum combo on the aroma. Pours to a fluffy, puffy white head. Once it settles, theres a sweet taste throughout and especially on the finish. Though the alcohol content is elevated, it never disrupts the taste.

De color ámbar algo pálido con reflejos verdosos y turbia.
La espuma es blanca, muy densa en buena cantidad y persistencia.
Una nariz intensa y expresiva con el cereal como protagonista con ese fondo acida y un punto cítrico de este punto de cervezas.
En boca resulta cremosa y refrescante con un cuerpo medio, tambien se intuyen los lúpulos, final ligeramente amargo.
Muy buena cerveza de trigo.

Smaak is vol zacht zoet banaan, limoen en een handvol specerijen. Mooi troebel grijs-geel met standvastige kraag de gehele rit. Nasmaak is licht zoet fruit als mandarijn. Aroma is een mix van honing, banaan en wat hooi.
Lys blass gyllen farge med et hvit skum. Aroma av hvet, banan og krydder. Smaken følger aroma, litt tynn munnfølelse.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2015 Aroma of banana, fruits, pepper, spices. Flavour is sweet banana, rather sweet overall but not too much. Finish is spicy and dry. Quite full-flavoured and well-balanced. An exemplary Weizenbock.

Blommig jästdoft med toner av rengöringsmedel på en ganska lätt maltbotten och med inslag av citron. 
Färgen är ljust gyllene och ett livaktigt skum som halveras tämligen snabbt.
En oväntat platt smak med brödkaraktär, bananfrukter och sackarin. Litet kryddsting med framför allt nejlika. En riktigt intressant öl.
Eftersmaken är tämligen kort och jästig. 
Helgjuten kropp men för lite kolsyra.

Aromes de pera, plàtan, llaminadura i poma. Color daurat, tèrbola amb abundant escuma blanca. Sabors de pera i plàtan, també alcohol i quelcom de formatge. Final dolç i sec alhora. Efervescent, balsàmica i refrescant. Li trobo a faltar quelcom mes del malt.
Very nice brew. Pours hazy gold with a fluffy white had. Aroma is lemon and funk. Bubbly carbonation in body, finishes sweet and sticky.

Initially clear golden body with an ample slowly disappating white head. Banana esters combined with clove and bubblegum flavor. The appearance changes to cloudy once the full bottle is poured. Aroma is something to behold. Another winner from Weihenstephaner. Normally I think of Weizenbocks as a bit darker and more caramel malts, this reminded me more of a strong hefeweizen, bordering on an abbey tripel style. Really solid beer and one I thouroughly enjoyed drinking.
So I just cant get into these Belgian beers. Ive got a Anglo-American palette, what can I say?
Wonderful aroma propelled by some dense foam, alcohol is not noticeable at all and blended perfectly, full banana esters taste with a pleasant full bodied mouthfeel.
Hazy dark yellow colour, with a huge head. Smell is fruity, banana, and spicy too, cloves. Taste is malty, and again very spicy, licorice also. Alcohol detectable but not too evident. Very good beer.
Dark wheat beer. Dark colour, sweet aroma. Also somewhat sweet taste. Worlds best wheat beer strong WBA 2012.

Voor de verandering weer eens een Duits bier geprobeerd, een weizenbock deze keer. Lich geel van kleur, wat zoet-bittere smaak, banaan, kruidig. Verrassend zwaar, 7,7%, maar dat merk je niet tijdens het drinken. Lekker fris pittig witbier.

Rating #995, flaske fra SuperBest Vermlandsgade   
En grågul øl med højt hvidt skum. Lækker sødmaltet duft med masser af bananer. Smagen skjuler alkoholen godt, men er en anelse besk og ubalanceret. Der en en del banan, græs og humle, men alt i alt er øllen hverken særlig gennemført eller kompleks. God, bitter eftersmag. Medium tykkelse, måske endda lidt tynd de 7,7% alkohol taget i betragtning. Sødmen er undertrykt og den er egentlig ikke så forskellig fra en almindelig hefeweizen. Jeg ville til enhver til foretrække en Aventinus frem for en Vitus. Den er dog ganske drikkelig, men jeg forstår ikke de høje ratings her på siden.
UPDATED: SEP 26, 2014 Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en La Birra. Color dorado palido. Sabor a trigo, banana.

Weihenstephaner Vitus has a very thick, spongy, white, crackling head, a hazy (which gets even more so, when the bottom contents are swished & poured in), yellow-gold appearance, with strong bubble streams, and some lacing left behind. The aroma is strong and pungent: banana bread, banana pudding, yeast spice, some coriander, and some white wheat bread. Taste is of banana bread, banana pudding, some spice, sugar, and a touch of alcohol. Mouthfeel is fluffy and medium, and Weihenstephaner Vitus finishes semi-wet, easy drinking, and just a tad hot. Great stuff! RJT
Poors very black with stable head. Very roasted malt aroma with lots of chocolate and coffee. Taste is very sweet. Heavy body.

citrus, earthy, hazy, golden, sparkling, white foam, lively, light body, bitter, 

Holding up your glass to the sunlight lets one enjoy the beautiful appearance of this beer. Quite refreshing. Perfect for a hot summer day. Though I didnt get any gazeous substance to smell when I opened the bottle. Weak smell and weak character. Would make a good beer for drinking with friends but too weak for a tasting experience.
My favourite weizen bock. Soft caramel taste combined with traditional weizenbeer banana taste makes a great combination.
Bottle 0.5 l. Hazy pale yellow liquid with big head. Medium to full body and carbonation. Sweet but not overwhelming. Aroma of banana and toffee. Taste like banoffee pie. Medium long finish.
Aromas of honey, banana, clove, cereal. Hazy orange, lasting white head. Some sweetness, fruity, honeyed, some perceptible strength. Medium bodied, tongue-grabbing.

Pours a lovely light straw. The color white if wine only hay and with fat head of white foam that falkls slowly enough. The nose is sutlry fruit. The stuff your grandmother is putting in a pie. Apple skin, baked pear, light banana, clove, honey, spice a bit of cinnamon. Oh my stars. The taste is luscious Ripe and succulent fruit.l The apple skin crisp and light, the pear baked and sweet together with the clove. The honey malt The tall and crisp whet malt. That stands in the glass like a strange sentinel. Golden glowing flaky like flakes in the cereal bowl but sweet and soft too. OH! The banana light ans smooth. The mouthfeel is fruity, cisp, creamy . well carbonated and this finishes dry and with so much fruit you cannot stand to believe its not under a pie crust.

Transfer from BA review on 1-10-13-
 Served on tap in a pint glass

 Appearance Served a hazy golden-yellow colored brew with a one finger thick white head. The head fades slowly to leave a great level of lacing.

 Smell - The aroma is a mix of wheat and yeast with a light citrus smell, consisting mostly a mix of orange and a lighter lemon smell. With these aromas are notes of coriander and clove as well as some banana smells. 

 Taste The taste has many of the flavors that were detected in the nose. It starts out wheaty and bready with a moderate yeasty taste upfront. A sweeter citrus flavor also greets the tongue initially almost entirely orange in nature. The citrus flavor lessens some more toward the middle of the taste while flavors of banana, coriander and clove come to the tongue. These flavors take the taste to its end where an almost candy/bubblegum like sweetness joins the flavor as well as a very light alcohol taste, leaving a nice sweet wheat banana bready flavor to be left on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel The body of the brew is on the slightly thicker and chewier side with a carbonation level that is on the slightly higher side as well. The chewier body is quite nice for the wheaty flavors while the carbonation is very nice for keeping it drinkable and for accentuating the spice and fruit flavors of the brew. 

 Overall  It is kind of like a souped up hefeweizen or maybe like a hefenweizen-grand cru hybrid. It is great tasting and potent but very drinkable. Rather well done.

Hazy, cloudy rusted wheat yellow body. Rocky white head that pretty much doesnt recede. The alcohol really comes out early before becoming very grainy with loads of bready notes. Banana throughout. Its medium bodied and dry.
Excellent taste and aroma, very boozy though.
Bottle from greens. A little bit spicey with a lot of banana and wheat. Pepper and clove. Full bodied and chewy grain. Pretty solid.

Bottle bought at the bottle shop at the Weihenstephaner brewery in Bavaria/Germany. Overall a fatntastic weizenbock full of nose piercing banana aroma, yellow light golden color, delicious wheat and banana taste with a smooth and mild alcohol in the finish plus some mild hops. A superb brew!

Pours a cloudy dingy off yellow with a creamy frothy head with decent retention. Aromas of juicy fruit, banana ester, light mellowed caramel, grass. Flavors of slight juicy fruit, mellowed caramel, slight hint of toffee, grass, medium banana ester and light bread. Medium to high sweet. This is a good beer. Just about on the side of a desert beer. Good as a sipper. Slightly astringent aftertaste but mostly mild.
From bottle. Pours a hazy straw yellow with a big white head.Aroma of wheat and banana and bubblegum. Taste is nicely sweet, no bitterness, wheat, bananas, and bubblegum. Delicious and easy to drink.
Pours golden with dense white head. Aroma of bananas, bubblegum, vanilla. Tastes very smooth, of banana, vanilla and butterscotch. Maybe a little thinner than would be preferred.

quite dense ivorywhite head leaves some lacing. turbid dark yellow colour. lot of banana and clove in the aroma. taste like the aroma with a slight citrus and dry mouthfeel. medium body and carbonation. abv well hidden. bottle 50cl

Bottled 500ml. -from Magic Beer Room Zagreb. Hazy orange/golden coloured, small to medium sized white head, mild wheaty alcoholic nose. Sweet malty, wheaty and slight yeasty with notes of banana and light caramel. Touch of spices and alcohol in the finish. Pleasant weizen but a bit too sweet.
Pours a cloudy yellow color. Aroma and taste are wheat, banana, and spices.
Full, deep wheat taste for a dark beer without a bitter note. Took a few sips to appreciate the full complexity of the taste; then it was very enjoyable. Worth drinking again.

Pours hazy pale straw, with a huge billowy white head, that leaves sticky lace in its wake. Aroma is big on banana, with some spices and lemon, and a touch of bubblegum. Flavor is sweet banana, tart wheat, citric acid, and spicy clove. Medium bodied with a long sweet and spicy finish.  Sweetness gets a bit cloying near the end of the glass, and the alcohol peeks through, but all-in-all a tasty beer.
Pours a hazy gold color with a finger and a half white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, wheat, and spice. Taste is malt, fruit (lots of banana), and spice. Alcohol is well hidden. Love this one.
Jolie couleur dorée un gout leger et épicé très agreable au palais se boit très très facilement
Great smooth weizenbock. Soft body of wheat and fruity yeast, with some notes of sweet malt and nuts. Tasty.

Hazy yellow, orangish pour from draft. Citrus aroma. Taste is banana clove. Very robust Weiss beer. Finishes very strong for the style of beer. This is your grampa's hefeweizen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with full head and lots of carbonation. Aromas of lemons, banana, dough, and wheat. Flavors of candied fruit, cloves, bananas, and wheat. Creamy, foamy and fruity. Really nice.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Banana, apple, bread, clove, pepper, citrus. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, sweet with a light bitter and slight sour. spicy but refreshing finish. Lovely!

50cl bottle @ home from Mitra. Slightly hazy pale golden color, extra big creamy white mostly lasting good lacing head. Aroma apple, caramel, cereal, parfume, banana. Taste medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, hint of umami. Light to medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, sweetish fruity finish with medium duration. Very refreshing, cant feel the difference between this and just another weizen beer, not bad thow.

Tu sais que tu as une bonne bière quand les mouche de vinaigre sen fut des bananes et voyagent à travers la maison pour atterrir la dedans. Cette bière a un arôme très fort de banane mûre avec un peu de blé, levure et alcool. Cest jaune brumeux avec une grande mousse blanche stable. En bouche cest pas mal pétillante, mais avec les bulles douces. Cest assez onctueux mais la carbonization lui rend presque léger. Le goût est des bananes mûres, un peu sucré, du blé, et des épices légères. Il a une bonne chaleur dans la finale que me rappel un peu les bières Trappistes. Excellente.

Hazy wheat-yellow coloured, good lasting white head. Thin but spicy aroma. Taste has the fruity (banana), soft and creamy tones of a typical German wheat beer, but accompanied by nicely spicy yeasts, and a relatively high alcohol grade. Full body, medium carbonation.

very good. delicious. smells like fresh bread out of the over. the head was great. 

http://youtu.be/-Efys_NFZyQ I actually drank it on youtube and talked about some soccer and how to mangle german words.

Pours a cloudy gold with stark white head. Honey, straw, lemon on the nose. Very sweet citrus notes, slightly bready, very yeasty, with plenty of honey and bananas. A very drinkable summer beer, but it?s almost too sweet.

50cl pour at Dacha Beer Garden in DC. Pours a very hazy yellow with some creamy, white head. Nose has a ton of spice, bubblegum, clove, coriander, bananas, yeast, some straw. Flavor follows right along, mellow banana, clove, white pepper, bubblegum, mild malt, a little grassy, some straw. Creamy, full bodied, spicy finish.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a cloudy pale orange yellow with a small white head that is quickly gone leaving a ring. Nose has bananas, light cloves, honey and bread. Light sweet front well balanced by a light spiciness and a banana bread finish. Mouth is creamy with active carbonation. Very nice.
Hazy bright yellow appearance, medium to thick crisp white head. Wheat, fruit and spice aroma with hints of ripe bananas. The spice and banana come throw in the flavor big.
Hazy bright yellow appearance, medium to thick crisp white head. Wheat, fruit and spice aroma with hints of ripe bananas. The spice and banana come throw in the flavor big.

Bottle. A fruity aroma, light sour (grapefruit, lemon), later also malty (bread). The large white foamy head has a long duration, the body is pale yellow. The taste is light fruity, it starts light sweet, then it gets malty. The body is medium strong and creamy with a normal carbonation.

Bottle, trade with McTapps. Body is hazy yellow with high creamy long lasting head. Aroma is loaded with bananas, spicy, yeasty, pretty fruity too. Taste has high banana sweetness with low noble bitterness, really fruity. Body is full, high carbonation.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

.5L bottle. Pours a straw color haze, very much like a traditional Hefe. Subtle bananas on the nose also get a whiff of alcohol. Taste the alcohol/fruity esters. Great mouthfeel and finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
pours cloudy yellow with a frothy white head. aroma is banana. Taste is fruity sweet with bananas. very smooth drinking.
Hazy yellow beer has aromas of banana and clove typical of wheat bear yeast. Fine carbonation. Flavor is lemon, wheat, and a little sharp. Finish has some fruit sweetness and is long lasting.
Full of banana aroma and flavour, but not over sweet, with a decent finish .
This is a damn good beer! Has a great bready aroma and flavor plus a sexy golden color.

A very malty aroma and beautiful golden color. This beer pours a little on the thick side. A slightly spiced, malty, yeast beginning that finishes with a little less spice and turns pretty clear. A great beer to enjoy towards the end of a long hot summer day. 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

It had a golden color, which was lighter than I had expected and a hazy unfiltered body. The head is just off white in color and builds up tall and thick then very slowly fades making slick patchy lacing on the glass. The aroma had sweet malty wheat notes with yeast and estery fruitiness. There are estery flavor notes of banana, apple, golden raison and bubble gum within a mildly sweet and tangy wheat malt. Also there are hints of clove and some mild spicy hops for balance. It has a solid medium body with a palate that is smooth and a touch slick with pleasing carbonation. Outstanding!!!

Bottle, pours a cloudy honey color with a white head, slightly sweet taste of yeast and fruit, very light bitter, nicely balanced and drinks very smooth and fast if you are not careful, very good beer
Nice. Hazy yellow orange pour. Nose is assaulted by banana. Wheat and lemon also are there. Taste follows nose, but banana is not as dominate. Great beer.
0.5l bottle. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is banana, cloves, wheat and yeast. Taste is sweet with some sourness and alcohol bite. Medium to full body and soft carbonation.

Bamberg Jolly Day 3 26/01/2014. Bottle shared at the Weihenstephaner Am Dom in Freising. Aroma is lemon, wheat, orange and sour dough bread. Bright orange / yellow with a big frothy white head that lasts. Flavour is sweet banana bread, wheat and some berry notes. Palate is slightly sweet, some what cloying. ~Solid beer overall.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2016 Aroma of honey, wheat, weak banana, welcoming yeast, very overpowering. Dry mouthfeel, but still incredibly oily and creamy. Taste is very well balanced yeast, banana, honey that isnt sweet, some clove. Very very special mouthfeel.
Beautiful fine foam, fresh fruity nose and good finish make this an absolute top Bock beer. Little higher in alcohol, but still a very smooth finish.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with a huge, long lasting, creamy beige head. Aroma has notes of citrus, banana, wheat, yeast and spices. Sweet flavour with citrus, banana, wheat, yeast and spices. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium to full body with oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent and refreshing beer.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2014 Pour is a hazy gold with a white creamy head. Aroma is filled with floral yeast, banana, clove, wheat, hint of cinnamon. Taste is fruity wheat, sweet with a subtle bitterness. Sour lemon and orange also come into play. Palate is light bodied, fizzy carbonation, and a light bready mouthfeel. Finish is medium and full of spicy, floral wheat. Awesome beer. My favorite weizen.

Pours a hazy yellow-gold with a light creamy head. Strong banana notes lead the nose. 

Heavy carbonation gives way to a refreshingly balanced and sweet wheat beer. 

Incredibly smooth from start to finish. Perfect for a summer day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Vituiks män. Ei vaan, pirun hyvä vehnäolut. Aika pehmeä vaikka onkin volttia. Jukan luona Vinksun kanssa.
Pale honey color and a consistent white head, accompanied by a heavy hoppy aroma. Creamy and robust body, with a touch of spice, citrus and fruity notes such as banana and orange.

Bananig ist es natürlich auch. Aber ebenso finden wir Alkohol, Malz, ein paar Nüsse, Pflaumen und etwas Hefe. Schön dick mit einem fruchtigen Körper und ein wenig an Schwere zum Schluss. Feines Gebräu.

Well balanced weizen bier, blond plus a creamy body, the wheat felt on flavor is in equilibrium with the other components of this beer. The mouth feel is smooth, what makes you feel the whole beer at once. One of the bests wheat beers imho.
Excellent beer, reminding me of a Hoegaarden Grand Cru. Wonderful aromas of banana and wheat. Light to medium body, well balaned and refreshing. Tastes like more!

Bottle. Pours orange with an amber tint, some haze, and a fluffy off-white head. The aroma is sweet banana, spice, wheat, and clove. The taste follows suit and adds some light citrus and honey notes. The palate is light, clean, and refreshing yet full bodied. A perfectly balanced wheat beer with complex flavors. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,5 l bottle. Am unclear pale yellow in the glass. Medium head. Dusty banana and herb yeast on the nose. Starts yeasty, dusty, mandarins, light herb with caramell. Later more citrus, light alcoholic. Easy to drink. A good one but maybe a little bit overrated due to the name?

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2015 Delicious! Fuller body than teh regs from Weihenstephaner, but overall comparable to the original. Sweet banana and clove flavors lacy wheat. So good! Boozy at times but very refreshing. Certainly heavier than the original hefeweizen, but this bock is the business!
Light golden pour, slightly hazy. Awesome nose - light mouthfeel yet full of wheat goodness. Really nice to have this on tap.

Pours out of the bottle in a cloudy golden colour with steady creamy head and smooth body. Wonderful aroma of wheat, caramel and hops. Taste of mild but aromatic hops, wheat, berries, herbs, thyme, mild spices and nuts. Smooth and nice to drink - big beer.
Pale and lightly cloudy. Light foam head. Aroma of grass and cloves. Taste of hay, cloves, honey. A bit of spiciness to the finish. Fairly sweet and really delicious.

A real Germany treat! The wheat is mild and flavorful, the aroma is superb. An excellent summer beer to be enjoyed with seafood!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Has a lemon color and a very fruity aroma. White foam and a nice banana citrus flavor.

Poured into a 330ml Weihenstephan glass. Slightly hazy lemon blonde colour. Large frothy white head, good carbonation. Aroma is typical weisse beer, banana, cloves, some lemon and spice. Creamy texture. Taste is banana, a hint of red fruit, vanilla, spice. Has a slight booze warmth. Unsure what makes this a bock but either way its well made kit!

Consumed in bright sunlight at a world beer festival in Hiroshima. Possibly not the optimum Weizenbock conditions. Liked it though. Wheaty, creamy, ice cream, banana, but touch of extra fruit that booze brings. Maybe cherry like. Light spiciness, and bit sweet. Good stuff.

Hazy yellow to orange color, white head. Fruity, malty nose, wheat, banana, cloves. Malty taste, fruity esters, hint of alcohol, light sweetness and a dry finish. Good balance between sweetness and bitterness. Velvety mouthfeel, medium to full body, pleasant carbonation, warming alcohol.

I really liked this beer. The aroma was off a little, but that may have been because I found it on a shelf in the store. I am not sure how long it may have been sitting there.

Light yellow, cloudy in color. Has the banana flavors of a great German wheat beer, but also a malty finish that is not found in traditional wheat beers.

I would get this beer again, and may try to make it as a clone.
50 cl bottle from greece. a real classic. maybe not the best wheat beer but its absolutely fine. banana aroma is a problem or a fact (?) for all that kind of beers. and also good with bockwurst.

Pours an opaque light yellow colour with a white head. Sweet aromas of wheat and banana with some alcohol detected. Yeasty banana flavour with a strong wheat presence. Other sweet fruit and peach flavours, finished with alcohol. Cant really fault this much

Pours a light yellow color with a big, creamy white head. Very inviting, sweet aroma as the beer is poured as well. Tastes like gum, banana, and a little bit of spice. Packs a nice punch at 7.7% without compromising on bitterness whatsoever. Absolutely loved this beer, will definitely be at the top of my drinking list for the near future.
0.5l bottle. Pours cloudy pale golden color with creamy white head. Taste is sweet, banana, alcohol, malt, wheat. Aroma banana, wheat, hops, citrus. Soft carbonation. Very good beer :) I liked it.
On draft at Red Coat Tavern. Cloudy yellow with big white head. Sweet clover taste with a medium thick finish.
Cloudy yellow, wheat lemon nose. Very mellow taste, wheat, clove, lemon. Finish is buttery with a hint of booze.
Pours a hazy straw color, fluffy head. Fruity smell, with peaches, bananas, and a hint of clove. Tastes a bit sulfury, maybe this bottle was exposed to light. Creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle pour. Lovely opaque orange that appears almost like it is lit from the inside. Full two fingers of Head that leave nice lacing. Nose is banana yeast and corn flakes. Full body. Fruity (lemon, bananas), some dough, and just a bit of sweetness. Creamy mouthfeel. Superbly executed.

500 mml Bottle tasted on 29/04/2014. Pale and clear golden colour with a small duration head. Aroma and taste is predominantly banana and spicy. Carbonation is nice and the high average of alcohol is well balanced. Good combination between sweet and bitter. Next one please!
Cloudy straw colored liquid, white head...Oh never mind...I love it. One of my favorite beers and a textbook example if the style. Read the definition, drink it, love it.

Goudgeel bier redelijke kraag. Beetje muffige geur. Smaak is wat zuur, licht zoete afdronk, sterker in de alcohol. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear, light golden. Airy, fading white head. Aroma of yeast, taste is malty, spicy. Yeast and a little ripe banana. Medium finish, medium carb. Nice.

Bottle from Vino Wines. Hazy pale golden body with a fluffy white head. Lively carbonation. Nice lacing. Aroma of sea salt, lemon and yeast - smells like a Belgian Tripel. Flavour of salt, bitter coriander, orange rind, crushed aspirin and yeast. Nice bitterness. Medium body with a creamy texture. Soft fizz. An outstanding beer.
Bottle. Pours cloudy pale golden color with nice white head. Nose is spice with cloves and banana. Maybe lemon. Tastes sweet, like a mild tripple.
Golden pale, cloudy and with a beautiful white head. Aroma: Banana. Taste: Banana and soft for 7,7% of alcohol. Very good.
0.5L bottle at home, yellow/golden beer with a medium/large head, aroma is yeast, fruit and some alcohol. Taste is yeast, banana, fruit and some alcohol, actually very good.
Hazy bright yellow appearance, medium to thick head. Wheat, fruit and spice aroma, sweet with mild bitterness. Balanced and rounded, great Weizen Bock style.
at my home 0.50 l bottle hazy golden blond coloured body with a white head and with a grain yeast hops aroma a grain yeast sweet fruity hop taste with a bitter finish
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours a hazy golden with a layer of cream colored head. Aroma of yeast and funk/spice/banana. Taste of banana and bread.
Bottle. Hazy gold body. Large tight creamy white head. Nose is banana, wheat, clove, spice, lemon, hops, minerals, green apple, white sherbet. Tangy. Dry finish. Crisp and refreshing. Pretty decent.

Appearance: Cloudy pale golden color with a thick white head that leaves a fine lacing.Aroma: Wheat, yeast, mild acidic, some spices and banana.Palate: Medium to full body. Slight sweet and an ok bitterness. Average to rich carbonation.Taste: Wheat, malty, fruity, some spicy notes, yeast and balanced banana.Overall impression: Nice refreshing and tasty.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet in SKi, Norway

Bottle. Pours cloudy pale yellow with airy but stable white head. Clear, grainy aroma, with notes of yeast and hops, and a touch of banana. Sweetish, malty flavour, with notes of banana and yeast. Touches of hops. Raough aftertaste with sweetish hints. OK. A nice Weizen Bock.
The best Wheat beer I have ever had - easily my favourite. Pours hazy and golden with light foam head. The first touch on the back of your palate starts the cascade of flavour...magnificent
bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma wheat citrus spicy and hops flavor wheat citrus yeast spicy alcohol fruits and hops

Bottle. Pours a fairly hazy golden color with a fairly thick white head on it. Nose pretty light and filled with wheat, with some citrus coming off it, making it smell like a nice summer beer. Taste is pretty light and citrusy, and feels almost creamy. Very smooth easy drink. Not bad at all.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 Bue en bouteille de 50cl. Excellente bière, très bien équilibrée, avec un peu plus d’alcool que la moyenne des bières allemandes classiques ce qui lui apporte une corpulence très appréciable. On sent les céréales, les agrumes. Un délice !
Very good Weizenbock. Nice feeling in the mouth, good taste dominated by bananas.
bottle. hazy golden with one finger head. sweet with big banana and light clove. very full flavor. excellent for the style.

Shared a 50cl bottle from Ruppert (Luxembourg). Pours a hazy yellow colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is banana, clove and chewing gum notes. Average carbonation and medium to light body. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a more sweet and dry finish. Overall, a very tasteful beer that almost can serve as a meal.

One of the best wheat beers we've had. Pours a very cloudy yellow with a super thick white head. Smells of wheat, citrus and ginger. Taste had a lot of Belgian flavors, some more ginger, and a sweetness in the finish. Had in the bottle.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a thick and persistent white head. Nose is yeast and fruits. Aromas are fruits (banana, pear), spices (clove, pepper) and yeast. Medium carbonation, smooth texture. Really nice and well-balanced weizenbock. Refreshing, tasty and aromatic. A great one !

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From bottle. Nose is clove,bread and banana. Taste is bready spicy clove slight alcohol. Head is 3 fingers.
สีเหลือ& ขุ่นมาก ฟองเยอะ& ไม่ค่อย& กลิ่นหอ& กลิ่นแอ& ยอดเยี่&
First, I admit Im not a fan of wheat beers. Having said that, this one is an excellent example of a wheat beer.

Bottle 0,5 l. Hazy, yellow color. Big head. Not so much lacing. Aroma: banana, pepper, cloves. In taste banana, alcohol, spices. Sweet. Full body. Some spicy hop notes in aftertaste. Overall: good beer, but maybe too sweet, even for weizenbok.

Straw color, barely hazy, and a noisy snow white head. Complex, appetizing nose: citrus, yeast, peach, caramel, tobacco, banana bread, bubblegum, clove and mixed spice. Suggestions of solvent and butterscotch. Sourdoughy flavor with spice, vanilla, lemon, blueberry?, black pepper. A tad soapy; also nuances of celery seed. Tomatillo tartness. Gentle bitterness. Abundant carbonation lifts an almost buttery/oily texture. Green appleskin and arborvitae aftertaste.

Flasche 50cl. Milchig-trüb, hell, viel Hefe in Suspension. Der Hammer dieser Bock, bringt alles mit, wovon Kenner träumen. Weizig, leichtfüßig kommt er daher, süffig, im Mund explodieren förmlich die Aromen. Banane, Nelken, obergärige Kellerhefe. Phantastisch!

Pours a very hazy golden straw color with a huge head. It took me several minutes to pour the beer. Aroma is yeast, cloves, some banana and even a little pear. Taste follows the nose with a nice tartness. Slightly creamy, medium bodied, and very easy to drink. This is sort of a hefeweizen on steroids.

This is a great beer. Pours a light color, citrusey odor, cloudy in appearance. Taste is citrusey but not overwhelmingly. The ABV for this is surprisngly high for a light weizenbock. Very good beer though, would recommend.

Pours a hazy sunny golden with a full bubbly eggshell head that settles fairly quickly to a ring and doesnt really lace. Nose involves clove spice, lemon, hearty grain, pepper. Fairly sweet, quite tart, fairly bitter. Medium to full bodied, fluffy, a bit oily, active, with a lingering dusty tart and bitter finish. Tasty.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hefig fruchtig, bananig, würzig. Geschmack stark hefig fruchtig, minimale Würze.
Lichte goudkleur, troebel, redelijke schuimlaag. Bijna geen geur. Smaakt zacht, beetje naar banaan. Lekker!

Pours a gorgeous glowing hazy yellow color with a huge thick white head. Aroma is very strong, banana, orange zest, bread, dough, maybe some nectarine. Taste is orange zest, banana, awesome creamy malt, bread, no sweet note on the end like the aroma. Crazy drinkable, very refreshing, awesome beer.
Slightly hazy yellow appearance. Great head 2-3 inches. Very creamy palate. Pleasantly spicy warm aftertaste, will drink again!
Cloudy yellow color. Full body. Nice white head. High carbonation. Sweet banana finish.

On tap. Hazy dark banana. Half inch head. Floral aroma. Grapefruit and banana notes. Smooth finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml. bottle. Aroma of citrus, spice, pears, hay, and funky yeast. Hazy gold pour with a creamy, white head. Very fruity, rich, and delicious. Probably one of the best beers of this style. This is one of the oldest breweries in the world and it shows. The alcohol is well hidden, hits you in the head rather than the mouth. Medium to full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, long smooth finish. Similar to a hefeweizen but with more character. An excellent beer!
Un vrai délice, un nectar. Assez douce, un magnifique goût de banane. Une de mes préférées.

On tap at The Cooper's Tavern. Hazy pale golden color with fizzy white head. Spicy aroma of cloves, banana, lemon. Taste is great with lots of fruit esther, yeast, cloves and banana. Full and lovely mouth feel. A very good weizenbock.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2017 Sweet aroma, sugary malt, lots and lots of banana, some spices, cloves, maybe little bit alcohol deep down, little hints of apples. Bit hazy yellow to golden color, big white creamy head. Taste is again full of banana, bread and yeast, pleasant amount of sweetness in aftertaste. Creamy texture, medium to full body, slat carbonation, great mouthfeel. Extremely good weizenbock.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Hazy golden color, average sized white head. Full body, rich oily texture, soft carbonation. Aroma is wheat, banana, caramel. Alcohol is not detectable. Medium sweet, very light bitterness. Long sweet finish full of banana. Great!!

Beers of Germany (The Craft Beer Social - PA Chapter #1) Social

Aroma - characteristic I associate with Hefeweizen also show up here - Wheat, Banana, and Bubblegum going on.
Appearance - yellow body; liquid is cloudy; and the head is full about 1 1/2" and fluffy.
Taste - the taste is dominated by wheat and that Hefe like yeast.
Palate - body is medium; texture is thin to medium; the carbonation soft; and the finish short and yeasty.

16.9oz Bottle A - Pours a hazy orange golden. Pillowy white two finger head. Great retention. Ok lacing. S - Banana, yeast, coriander, & clove. T - Biscuit malty base, citrus, & yeasty funk. M - Medium bodied. Slightly slick. Soft carbonation. Citrus finish. O - A boozy complex wheat beer. Enjoyable.
Hazy gold wheat beer with a lasting head. I was expecting a much darker color. Fruity and complex taste.

Pours hazy pale gold, with a typical big white rocky head one expects from a Bavarian wheat beer. Nose is traditional weizen, only more so. Lots of banana, along with some green apple and clove. Not much in the way of hops, but a faint wheat character. Flavor is much sweeter than a regular weizen, again with lots of banana and some clove. Finish is fruity, with lots of green apple, and some dry, bready wheat character. Little bit full bodied for the flavor.

I was expecting something a lot darker and richer, but this was much more of a clear, light looking beer. Aroma was sweet and fruity, not super complex, but the taste really reinforced the aroma. Nice, sweet, fruity and tasty. Very drinkable at 7.7%, which is a little dangerous.

German weizen boch that pours blonde yellow with an ample head. Delicious wheat beer that is so rich in taste that you can't say no. Weihenstephaner never fails and neither do the Germans at beer making.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A melhor Weizenbock já degustada. Coloração amarelo ouro, turva, espuma intensa, encorpada, agradavelmente amarga.

How: Bottle.
Where: Weihenstephaner am Dom, Freising.
Appearance: Hazy yellow colour with a white head.
Aroma: Banana, fruit, malt, spices.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Wheat, spices, fruit, some vanilla, banana.

Muy buena para una weiss. Faltó color, pero todo lo otro está muy bien. Espuma, sabor, final, aromas, y sobrw todo: se deja tomar muyyyyy fácil! Ciertamente mañana paso por el super y me traigo un par de botellas más.

Bottle 0,50L. Hazy yellow colour with huge, frothy, mostly lasting white head. Biscuit aroma dominate, but there are also banana, caramel, butter and honey. Full bodied, oily beer, slightly acidic at the start, become moderate bitter at the finish. There is also some alcohol in taste, but not overhelming. Excellent beer!

Day 3 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, bottle at Weihenstephaner Am Dom - Freising, 26/01/14.
Hazed orange amber with a good sized off white covering that retains well.
Nose is bitter orage marmalade, yeast, bready, banoffee pie, spice, hint of apricot.
Taste comprises toffee, spice, earthy, light booze, yeast, bitter orange tang.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation.
Decent W-Bock, plenty of depth and a well toned boozey edge.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
500 ml bottle @ home.February 02, 2014
Beer bought @ "Vinmonopolet Oslo City".Best Before October 2014.
Beer tasted from a large wine glass
Dark golden cloudy color with a white/beige head and medium carbonation.
Aroma is yeast,floral notes,citrus,spices,alcohol and some sweetness.
Taste is a bit sweet,floral and a bit alcohol.
Finish is a bit sweet and bitter at the same time.
A nice brew,but i prefer Aventinus from Schneider when i want a Weizenbock.
Bottle from Boots in Ripon. Slightly hazy golden ale with a white head. Really nice sweet fruity aroma. Taste is sweet too with wheat notes, but also floral with a kind of buttery finish. Nice.

DATE TASTED: January 24, 2014... GLASSWARE: Schneider Edel-Weisse...OCCASION: celebrating a week of sickness ... APPEARANCE: thick, snow white head that occupies half the glass; cloudy, faint pale orange body; smooth wispy cloudlike lacing... AROMA: beautiful clove and cinnamon/nutmeg mix with grapefruit and citrus to produce a celebration of scents... PALATE: as drinkable a 7.7% ABV as youll find; soft, warming sensation at the throat; slightly active overall...TASTE: slightly tart at the lips; a clean, ever-so-subtle malty base; a bit yeasty late; unmistakable wheat, clove and citric kick--a pleasure... OVERALL: as far as gift sets go, this Weihenstephaner is among the best in recent memory--five above-the-standard beers and a handsome weizen glass made the price equitable...formidable but balanced, smooth yet arresting, this beer delivers the malt that sets it apart from its gif-pack brethren...
Excelente! Embora o alto teor alcoólico se mostre presente os aromas são muito ricos.

At the brewpub. Hazy golden beer with a nice white head. Fruity caramel aroma, bready, citrus, biscuits, some spices. Spicy citrus flavor, biscuits, hay, some warming alcohol and some floral notes. Malty bready finish with caramel and some warming alcohol. Nice beer.
cereal, nuts, floral, banana, pale, hazy, white foam, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,
botella 0,5l. color dorado, densa espuma jabonosa, aromas a citricos, platano, en boca es equilibrada, destacando notas a platano, a trigo, citricos y especias, notandose sus 7,7 ABV
What a beautiful wheat! This is a great rich smooth beer with citrus notes to top it off, I would and will buy again, what a treat!

Relativ heller Weizenbock, sehr süßer und hefig-bananiger Geruch. der Antrunk ist vollmundig-süßlich, schön mild und erstaunlich süffig-weich. Der Hauptteil bleibt angenehm mild, die 7,7% sind nicht annähernd zu schmecken. Gelbe Früchte, schöne bananige Hefe, angenehme Süße. Der Nachgeschmack ist lang anhaltend, toll vollmundig und hefig-süßlich-frisch! 
--> Klasse Weizenbock! Mild, Süffig und frisch! Einfach klasse!!


Test vom 11.7.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,14,13,13,12,14 - 13,40
0,5l fles gedeeld met nikos. Goudgeel troebel bier,rijk aroma en smaak met gist, mout en banaan. Mooie volle body en afdronk, zeer aangename lichte bock.

500ml bottle, pours light golden brown with lots of haze. Aroma is banana, spice over a generus caramel backbone. Taste is sweet and mildly bitter to finish, the alcohol is evident. Body is full, carbonation is lively. Nice beer.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a bright white head that leaves behind silky lacing. Aroma was a bit oxidized at first, but seemed to dissipate as it rested. The taste was sweet and mellow with a spice and clove finish. Mouthfeel was extremely smooth with a subtly dry finish.

Bottle from Gator Bev in Gainesvile. Pours hazy yellow with a massive 3 inch fluffy white head on top. Nice sweet wheat malt aroma with banana esters, spicy yeast, some buttery honey. Just right. Light to medium bodied with lots of bubbly carbonation and a clean crisp finish. Flavor is sweet wheat, funky banana spice and yeast, hay. Very crisp with lingering hay and banana on the palate. I have really started to appreciate these nice and easy drinking classic German brews that Weihenstephaner makes. Cheap, too! Good stuff.
Bière jaune trouble avec un haut col de mousse blanche. Nez de malts, épices et banane. En bouche : forte carbonation, levures, banane, lalcool se fait ressentir également.
A: Hazy golden with wooden head and carbonation. S: Banana, citrus. T: Sweetness, banana, some acidity at the back of the mouth. Strong alcohol. M: Thick wheat. O: Too much alcohol overtones.

Slightly hazy golden/straw with nice white head and visible carbonation. Banana, yeast, cloves, fresh grassy and a touch of grapes. Taste is medium sweet, just a light tart touch and sweet finish. Medium bodied, creamy feel with lovely think carbonation. Great stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 16.9 oz bottle poured into weizen glass. Hazy straw color with towering white head bolstered by tiny and big bubbles. Streaks of yeast slowly fall to the bottom. Aroma is green banana, clove, lemon, alcohol, and a little bubblegum. Taste is ripe banana, green apple, and wheat malt sweetness. A touch of clove and pepper spice lead to slight bitterness and moderate alcohol on the finish. Medium body, ultra creamy texture, medium-high carbonation, warming and abrupt finish.

Clear yellow color plenty of head and plenty of lacing. Aroma is malt, lemon, straw, grass, spice. Tastes the same. Alcohol is potent. Nice. A little watery...which is peculiar for how strong it tastes.

Received as part of a tasting pack for Christmas, and I was nervous. I notoriously dislike anything remotely "wheat" related when it comes to beer. Pour slightly orange with that cloudy look that made my stomach churn, until I took the first step. This may open up the style for me.

16.9 oz bottle pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of malts, bananas and citrus. Taste is malty, bananas and spice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy gold with a foamy white head. Aroma is sweet and enticing. Taste is of banana at first finishing with notes of citrus. Bit of a metallic finish, could just be this bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great banana aroma, best hefeweizen that I have had. I have only had this served in bottles, and it always pours with a nice, thick head.
Pint bottle poured into a weizen glass. Fruity and slightly spicy take on the awesome hefeweizen from this same brewery.

not normally a "strong beer" guy and @ 7.7 I was a bit reluctant.
OK I was wrong, this beer rocks, smooth, tasty, refreshing.
I had read review that said "sessionable" maybe but the next day would be hell.
wheat meets bock perfectly
The head is good, the body cloudy and yellow. It smells banana, vanille, IPA-hoppy, creamy. The taste is banana, vanilla, creamy-soft. Ok 3.4

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a huge lacy white head. Aroma is yeasty banana, sweet malts, tropical fruits and somewhat boozey. Taste is over moderate sweet with not much bitterness. Dangerously well sessionable. Medium to full body.

Bottle.

A- Spices, wheat, banana.

A- Golden color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Spices, wheat, yeast, banana.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, yeasty finish.

O- This is often called the worlds best wheat beer. I would have to disagree. Not that its bad but I dont think it quite deserves that title.

Bardziej niz weizenbock przypomina regularna pszeniczne na sterydach. w aromacie przewaza cytrusowosc poparta kwiatami, lekka nuta kolendry. czyli jak wit! w smaku czuc pelnie pszenicznego slodu, cytryna, swieze biale ciasto, lekki kwasek na finiszu. alkohol niewyczuwalny. swietnie ulozone piwo.
Yellow lightly cloudy with nice thick head. Apricot and banana in the aroma. Fruits, banana, malt with sweet candy in the aftertaste. Mild bitterness in the aftertaste.
500ml bottle into dimpled mug. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a fluffy white head. Spicy, fruity nose, a bit of a sour flavour on top of grassiness and malt. Alright. Perhaps weizen isnt for me?

Bottle at the brewery. Lots of esters and phenols in the nose. Slightly sweet malt backbone, like the others I had, some soapy character to the beer. almost a green apple character as well. Very light in color - not what I was expecting there. Overall, enjoyable.
Excellent weissbier, great typical German beer!! Great taste, and beautiful color!! Cheers!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Astoundingly good wheat beer. The frothy, long-lasting head releases aromas of bubblegum, banana, and grain. Forget about gimmicky spices; this weizen bock is all about the wheat. Its mouthfeel is soft and refreshing. Taste reflects more of those bubblegum and banana qualities. In summary, this is a world-class wheat ale.
Aroma: sour. Appearance: golden, hazy with white head. Taste: sweet. Palate: sweet long, little fizz. Overall: decent Weizenbock. Bottle at the Octoberfest Pub, London.
Very refreshing and tasty weizenbock. Something special with this one. Nice and thick white head.

Absolutely splendid colour, typical german white tastes, but I found it less convincing than for example Schneider oder Teuffels Weisse.

Still a really good beer
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a cloudy pale color with a bit of head. Nice hefeweizen, but a little on the sweet side and a touch of sour.
Niet doorzichtig goudkleurig bier, witte schuimkraag, veel kleine bubbeltjes. Fruitig, banaan/citrus.

Visual: The last of a 3pack gift box. Pours cloudy pale marmalade orange with a decent-sized dissipating foamy head, not much lacing, lots of fast activity.

Nose: banana-apricot-peachy with a bit of citrus tang, very appetizing. (7)-aromatic strength.

Attack: crisp fizziness, apple-fruity sweetness

Mid-palate: (6)-sweetness, (MAIN) wheat malt, light barley malt, apple juice, (HINT) banana

Finish: off-dry transition, light wheat-malt very light hopped bitter finish.

Summary: An excellently balanced brew; the high ABV is well managed with a full body and sweet backbone. Very crisp drinkable texture. (Note: numbers above are on a 10-point weak-strong scale)

Uklar gul i utseendet, med medium skum. Masse kullsyre ved åpning av flaske, skummer over. Lukter banan samt gjær. Smaken er dominert av banan, men en god miks av søt og sur lurer i bakhånd. Mye som skjer i munnfølelelsen, litt tørr og også litt bitter.

Rating #769 - Nov 15, 2013- 750ml bottle from Sherbrooke in a quasi-tulip glass. Nose is pastry shop, banana, and a mild floral note. Bold and medium-full bodied for 6.5%, medium alcohol warmth. Medium-heavy carbonation, quite bubbly golden pour with white cap. Mouthfeel is clean, taste is banana, nice yeasty kick, finishes perfect with a hint of pine needles not off-putting. Wicked beer, one of my favourite styles certainly.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2014 If you like weizenbier this is a must. Just the right amount of the typical banana flavour with a long sweet finish. Lovely golden color, one of the most beautiful beer to see poured in its own glass.

AROMA:malta(cereal, bread, hay) hops( grasas). Yeast ( dusty, leather, ) banana, vanilla, 
APPEARANCE: turbia, white foam, frothy, 
TASTE:light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
PALATE:medium body, creamy, thick feel, carbonation lively, long finish, 
Calidad , muy buena weizen-bock, primer olor a levadura y trigo, en trago banana y vainilla , con alcohol al final por ser bock, densa y refrescante

∆ Bottle from Hopfen und Malz Berlin. Aroma: Medium Citrus Acidity, Banana, Some Vanilla. Appearance: Light Golden Colour, Cloudy, Minimal Head. Taste: Sweet At First, Then Light Bitternes Long Aftertase. Very Good Refreshing Weizenbock.

S: Lemon zest, caramel malt, dusty yeast, hay and spices. P: Golden pale with a frosty white head. T: Yeast esters, bananas, cloves, spices and some lemons. The second half takes a bit of a turn with vanilla banana cream, hay and even some waffles. M: Soft with medium carbonation. O: Wow, what a great beer, I never found anything offensive and my bottle was gone in a flash.
Big banana aroma. Cloudy golden color. Sips full bodied with banana and spices. Middle and finish is mostly sweet with mild bitter taste. Prob would be great with some potato pancakes and kraut.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a cloudy gold with a white head. Taste sweet, banana, citrus. I thought this was very good. I would most definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big bottle. In Orlando. Thanks M-law! Pours a cloudy, yellowish color. Aromas of banana, wheat, spiced yeast, lemon. A light sweetness with some nice spiced notes. Smooth and easy to drink. If I could find this easier, I would buy this brand a lot more. Great beer. Great mouthfeel. Great balance.
Pours hazy with tons of carb. Aroma is light sweet malt and spice. Taste is similar with a touch of sweet on the finish, very tasty
Weihenstephaner quality. The weizentaste is very much present with a little addition of caramel tastes. Might be one of the best around.

500ml bottle from Appellation Wines, Dalry. Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Aromas of banana, bread, and something sweet too. Taste has more sweetness, a hint of spice, but not clove, more peppery. Has a creamy, rich structure and clean bitter finish. Lovely stuff.

50cl bottle from labiere.pt. Color is hazy gold. Head is medium. Body is medium, carbonation is present. Taste is light to medium bitter and low sweet. Aroma is wheat, citrus, light hop, fruit, banana aroma.
Golden yellow, with a giant white head. Honey and citrus. Full bodied and delicious.

bottled: unk

Initially overflowed the bottle real quick. When poured, the beer is american cheese orange with a solid quilt of fine creamy foam. Smells of clove, butter, wheat, shortbread - nice nose. Flavor is rich with wheat, a touch of nougat, some banana, spices, corn, and a hint of bread. Full bodied with tight, hi carb and an off dry finish. This is a really nice beer, cant understand how Ive missed out on this one. Best weizenbock Ive had.

Keg at Summerhall beer festival. Golden yellow, smallish white head. Banana and coriander on the nose. Lovely carbonation. Sweet with caramel. More coriander and fruit. Really drinkable (and dangerous considering the abv!)

Bottle. It pours a rather cloudy yellow color with a white head. The aroma is very spicy with clove, banana and bubblegum. Sweet and wheaty. The flavor is full with dough and wheat, huge spicy pepper, clove, banana and bubblegum. Sweet and spicy. Full bodied, high carbonation. A perfect choice if you have a hankering for a high gravity German wheat beer. Really good.
Poured from a bottle it is a cloudy effervescent beer with a white head. The aroma is strong with the smell of sour fruit and has the taste of bananas that li vere on the palate

From a 375 cl bottle shared in Avon NC. Pours a could yellow gold with an off white head. Aroma of apricots. Flavors of peach and tart fruit. Medium bodied, high carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Crisp, slightly tart finish.

From a bottle. Pours opaque gold with a frothy bubbly white head. Tastes like very creamy banana, bubblegum, sweet, smooth, and bready. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like dough, cereal, yeast, bubblegum, vegetables.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with thick, creamy white head. Aroma is cookie and cereal malts, banana, orange peel, light spice, and faint grassy notes. Flavor is bready malts, light floral hops, banana and light fruit esters, and some faint caramel sweetness; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Love this one. Full rich taste of wheat fruits and yeast and still it is a subtle well balanced beer. It is a heffe weisse with an extra kick.
Robe jaune foncée, trouble. Goûts de banane, citron, céréales. Les arômes se tiennent bien et on a une fin légèrement épicée. Une bière avec du corps, légèrement huileuse, qui se laisse apprécier.
Bottle: Hazy yellow to light orange color with a creamy white head. Very fruity aroma with banana, spices, yeast and plums. Flavor is also fruity, light spicy.

hazy yellow, frothy white head, vanishes not completely, no lacing, sweet butterscotch and banana nose, buttery, wheat, dough, herbs, coriander, clove, hint of citrus, sweet wheaty buttery taste, banana, full bodied, slick texture, smooth medium sweet taste, banana, prickly spicy on the tongue, hint of lemon, light bitterness, alcohol
(bottle) hazy copper colour with a small off white head; aromas of bananas, banana bread; clean and balanced favour; excellent

Bottle 50cl. Large white head. Hazy light orange color. Good and slow carbonation with this full body. Aroma of wheat, yeast and carbonation with a touch of permanent marker. Taste is apples, wheat and sugar.

500ml bottle. Pours hazy orange with a creamy white head. Aroma is floral and fruity. Banana, honey, lavender, wheat, slight citrus and clove. Taste is orange peel, dough, cloves and banana with floral notes. Full body, thick and creamy texture. Well hidden alcohol. Pretty good.

Cerveja de trigo bock. Coloração clara e espuma clara e persistente. Aroma fraco e sabor marcante e gostoso.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice one! I only had one bottle to taste from and I was surpised by the light color of it. Taste is thick and full. Banana like smell and taste. This one is something special!

Bottle. Pours a hazy body, with a large white head that stays until I finish my glass. As soon as I open the beer comes an intense aroma of banana that fades away really quickly, leaving only some yeast left to smell. Taste is medium sweet, and its actually a bit cloying. A bit excessively carbonated, not annoying though. Medium sweet aftertaste. Oily texture, medium bodied. Pretty decent, although nothing too exciting.

Une bouteille bue dans le camp de chasse. Une robe jaune foncée et très embrouillée. Les arômes se tiennent dans le creux de ma main : de la banane douce et du blé citronné. Les saveurs se tiennent en équilibre sur ma langue : de la purée de banane et des citrons sucrés. Au palais, un corps vraiment gonflé par les particules du blé. Une texture un peu lourde et huileuse. Heureusement, des bulles vives. Une finale douce de blé avec quelques épices qui finissent par se manifester.
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2014 500 ml bottle. Hazy dark golden with big white head. Aroma of banan, phenols, strong cloves, malt and faint toffee. Taste of alcohol, banana, strong cloves, phenols, malt. Nice!

Proefnotities kwijtgeraakt, dus uit het geheugen. Duidelijk tarwebier, qua aroma lijkt het een kruising tussen een hoegaarden en karmeliet. Kruidig. Redelijk zuur van smaak, licht zoet en licht bitter. Mistig, geel bier met een witte kraag.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with thin quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is wheat, hay, alcohol, plums. Flavor is wheat, alcohol, hay.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2013 Bottle from czar, thanks! Pours a hazy yellow with a creamy white head. Aroma is of wheat and bananas. Taste is sweet a little with banana flavors and spices. Intense hefe character. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy. Carbonation is higher. Nice!
On tap at Biercab. Golden colour with white head. Wheat, banana aroma. Wheat, sweet taste, with some fruits (banana) and malts. Ligh to medium body.

This is turning into one of my favorite beers - - and a particular godsend since I spend half the year in Germany (where the craft beer movement is just now STARTING to get some traction). For a weizenBOCK the Vitus is lush and lovely - - the banana and clove are wafting, enchanting. For a WEIZEN it has an assertiveness and fullness that is lacking in most weizens. Absolutely delicious. This combination of fullest weizen character with bockish assertiveness and a gorgeous frame rules supreme.

50cl bottle into tulip. Lille. Purchased at beirkoning Amsterdam. 

Appearance: cloudy orange yellow liquid. White foamy head with decent retention. 

Aroma: yeasty bread, dough, citrus, fruit, floral hops. Smells incredible. 

Taste: semi sweet with a balancing bitterness. 

Palate: full body aided by perfect carbonation. Thick texture. Long finish. 

Overall: for the style this is very well done. A really terrific beer. More depth and body than a standard wheat beer. The palate and taste of this beer is fantastic.

Pours into a nice pale orange cloudy yeasty body with white creamy head. Aroma are bananas, honey melon, citrus and some grass and vanilla. Palate is slick, oily, mouthful and little tart. Carbonation is soft and smooth. Taste is sweetish, caramel, wheat malty, with hints of orange fruits and some flowery hops and dryness. Finish is mild, notes of wheat disappearing into your throat. Only ABV 7,7 gives it a slight warm dry kick. The palate on this Weizen bock is really smooth and balanced. Very nice.
Great experience especially if it can be found in draft! Personally for me the aroma part plays not a significant role as the taste and palate in which this very beer passes with flying colors!

Beautiful golden colour. Aroma of banana bread and straw. Sweet banana and malty taste. Doesn't betray the ABB at all. Very, very drinkable. Fantastic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A great and complex wheat beer, unique and strong, resembles to nuts and cereal with notes of raisins.

Bottle on SBWF. Hazy orange with a large white head. Smooth sweet ripe fruit aroma with cloves and banana. Taste is sweet ripe fruits, banana, very light bitter. Finish is smooth sweet with a touch of bitterness and just a hint of the alcohol,
Bottle. Pours a beautiful orangish yellow. Very cloudy. White head. Decent lacing. Aroma is heavy banana moderate wheat and other fruits. Taste is heavy sweet. Good finish.
Blindbrovad. Berusad och på tok för generös med betyget. Måste nog dra ner lite. Underbar. Härlig restsötma (så har jag skrivit av vad som går att tyda). Oerhört bra.

Bottle, new to the Twin Cities. I have been looking for this beer for years. Light color, and it seems weizen bocks can be a variety of shades. Aroma of a high quality hefeweizen. Sweet flavor, banana, wheat, and also alcohol, and this beer seems a bit thin on the palate as far as consistency. Very good.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2014 Bottle: Golden yellow, straw-like color with lots of haze - completely opaque. Very volatile; huge, creamy white head froths up in no time. Aroma is clean bananas, pears, lots of wheat, baked bread, Bavarian yeast, clove, and other spices. Good combo and execution. Taste is fruity esters, banana, mild dirtiness, sweet malt, buttered bread, faint bubblegum, a touch of phenol alcohol warmth in the back, finishing with lingering notes of bananas, pears, and clove spice. Not a style Im crazy about, but Weihenstephaner does not disappoint.
Hazy yellow, good head. Lots of carbonation. Cream of wheat, unripened banana, subtle spices, orange peel, bit of grass. Very nice

Aroma: Banana is pronounced
Appearance: translucent pale yellow with huge white head
Taste: Sweet and fruity

On-tap. Cloudy yellow straw color with a big white head. Aroma of banana, clove and ripped fruits. Sweet with banana, bubblegum, spicy notes and nice alcoholic touch, pretty tasty. Medium-bodied, soft carbonation, refreshing. Great beer.

(Bottle). Pours a hazy golden yellow with persistent white head. Aroma is spicy with banana, yeast and clove. The flavor is also spiced with clove with wheat and yeast. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from whole foods. Pours hazy yellow with a huge white head. The aroma has big lemon, some yeasty funk, a little pepper. The taste is light citrus, slight spice, really light body.

Clear golden orange beer with a huge white head. Pouring the yeast in makes it hazy and opaque. Aroma is instant wheat beer, banana, with some sour citrus and bubblegum like sweetness. Pouring the yeast in adds some more yeast aroma and removes some of the sourness. Taste is fruity with banana and bubblegum like sweet. The 7,7 % ABV are totally innoticable at first but the alcohol pops in at the finish. Mouthfeel is pretty full and carbonated. Theres not much bitterness in the finish. I think I havent had a blonde weizenbock before, but this is a really decent brew.

Pours hazy yellow with low white head
Aromas of skumbanan, wheat, hints of citrus, pilsner malt
Very well balanced wheat with medium sweetness, nice carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy yellow, foamy creamy lasting head. Aroma, whity, yeasty malty fruity.
Taste of fruit, banana, wheat, malty. Nice!


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It tastes like a stronger version of the hefeweizen. Pours with a large head (if you arent careful) and a straw color. Tastes of citrus and banana. Malty flavor and thick/stocky texture with just enough bitterness to keep it from being too sweet. As good or better than their hefeweizen.
Gold color with a towering head. Aroma of bread, wheat, yeast and a bit of lemon. Flavor of buttery bread crust. Strong wheat. Moderate ripe banana and a little bubblegum. Thick body.
smells like a wheat beer with a bit of banana....not a big fan...tastes like a quality beer...just not the kind I like... bold flavors malty,banana-y, light on the hops...decent
August 2010. From bottle. Orange amber color with a white head. Malt, yeast, banana, bread and spicy aromas. Flavors are fruity with caramel and sugary notes.

Light straw pour with frothy head and cloudy throughout. Aroma is full of malt, caramel, bread, and a bit of booze and yeast. Flavor is pretty sweet but balanced with the full body. Finishes with a hint of bitters and makes for an amazing beer

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 50 cl bottle, 7.7%. Was expecting a dark one, this one was yellow instead. Cloudy yellow colour, unexpectedly bright for the style, massive white head as the regulae weihenstephaner weizen. Aroma is very fruity with banana and clove, spices, lots of doughy malts but not too thick. Mouthfeel is balanced indeed, not heavy, pretty easy to drink. Spicy finish, proper carbonation, medium to full bodied. Damn good.

Cloudy yellow or cream colour with a prominent but very fine bubbled but pillowy head. Huge esters in the aroma with spicy lees, a hint of vanillin, and banana bread. On the palate is it rich, yet soft, but creamy texture. Flavours are vanillin and banana bread and a long yet soft finish. a nice beer, im impressed with the amount of rich flavours in a beer that is really this soft. well done!!

Good weizenbock. Wheat and citrus aromas. Fresh smelling. Cloudy dark yellow color with a big white foamy head. Light and smooth palate. Somewhat fluid and creamy. Good carbonation. Wheat was very
predominant with lemon and other fruity esters. Not much of a hops presence, which was to be expected. Easy to drink.
Color dorado, espuma blanca persistente. Aromas dulces de uva. En boca muestra un dulzor afrutado compensado con una ligera acidez. Una gran cerveza de trigo

Hazy gold with a big head that stays around, sheets of lace. Taste is sweet grass with bananas and cloves. Grows much larger through the palate, adding coriander, and light candy corn. Drinks easily for the abv, well-conceived, excellent for the style. Highly recommended.
aroma is spicy with banana cloves appearance yellow lightly cloudy,taste is sweetish with spicy tones and a sweet finish,a bit thin for its abv overall a nice but not a really top weiss

Pours hazy golden blonde into weizen glass, huge head, high carbonation. Aroma is banana right off the bat, spices, pumpkin, lemon. Mouthfeel is smooth, creamy, medium carbonation. Taste is big banana notes, lemon, apple, bready, spices. Finish is dry, fruity, doughy. Quite tasty.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, pale yellow, good carbonation, nice white head but not so much retention. Nose is yeast, lilies, clove, some banana. Mouth is light-bodied, yet creamy in a way only a wheat beer can be, clove and banana hint of bubblegum, biscuit, grass. Prost!
i get what the fuss is about now. id still take their straight up hefeweizen first, but this tangier, boozier, slightly sour cousin is still pretty fantastic. will buy again at some point.

Bottle. Cleat golden with large fluffy white head. Aroma is banana, cloves, wheat, lemon, spiciness. Taste is bright banana, orange, toasted wheat, slight spiciness, some sour and yeast. Body is medium full with high carbonation.

Light golden colored beer, with an fantastic white thick head. It is an high carbonated beer, whit a full body. In the smell there are over time bananas, yeast, grain, a bit sweet. In the taste there is fruit again, mostly banana, a bit sweetness and there is a string hind of peper. The aftertaste is light bitter and has refreshing touch comming from the peper touch. Overall it is very nice beer, which a bit sweet with a pepery touch.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy golden in color with nice head. Malt sweetness on the nose with banana notes. Spicy taste with clovelike notes . Very good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bomber to wheat glass. Nice pour...big fluffy white head. Hazy yellow color with lots of tiny rising bubbles. Made me think of champagne.
Aroma was muddled. Wet grass, fruit, banana, musty. Taste was really disappointing. Yeast, oddly sweet/sour, banana...other flavors I cant identify.
Maybe I got a bad bottle but this is not for me.
