Sweet wheat and yeast, hints of banana and clove, with other fruity notes. Excellent.

Pint nine bottle poured hazy yellow color with white head. The aroma of wheat, banana, clove and sweet malt. The flavor Wow, solid wheat and banana, some mild clove. Solid malt backbone. Just an incredible flavor all the way around.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Old rating rerated 21.08.2013, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and fruity, wheat, citrus, banana, yeast, dough, hay, hints of bubblegum. Taste is slightly fruity and dry, hay, yeast, wheat, citrus peel, grass, alcohol, dough, citrus, hints of banana. Medium bitterness. Nice.

Cleaner, crisper, slightly more effervescent than the Hefe or Dunkel. The family essence of banana and clove spice are still present, but in a brighter wheat version. Sweeter, and, at the same time, lighter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (500 ml). From TheJester, thanks! Hazy hay color with a small fully lasting white head and some lacing. Aroma of banana, wheat, citrus and light spices. Taste is slightly sweet with wheat, banana, spices, yeast and citrus. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Slightly dry and kind of creamy mouthfeel. Great balance and really drinkable for a 7,7% abv beer. Another super beer from Weihenstephaner!
Bottle. Cloudy gold color. Great head. Aroma is a spicy clove aroma. Taste is a spicy clove taste. Its really good.

Un style magnifique, si rare du côté gauche de lAtlantique. Arôme intéressant aux notes du coriandre et des malts mais pas si puissant comme on voudrait. Une couleur jaune et légère tout en gardant une apparence épaisse. Goût des bananes et des malts encore avec un palais doux et aux notes de maïs et des épices. Géniale bière allemande en bref. Même si produite en masse.
Pours a golden copper color with a grapefruit aroma. Taste is slightly creamy with a fruity aftertaste. A good beer for the style, simple and refreshing.

Bought a bottle at Berts Bierhuis. Has a light golden straw color, with a thick, frothy and sparkling collar. Has an aroma of wheat, pepper and hints of banana. The typical flavors of a bock beer come cleary foward in the taste along with malty tones. A light tone of banana makes this beer a little creamier. The finish is nice and a little peppery. Overall, a really nice Weizen Bock. It reminds me of the Weizen, but this one has a better taste.

From 500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy golden straw colour with a 2-finger white head that collapses to a collar. Aromas of lemon, banana, cloves, apple and bubblegum. Taste starts off with soft apple flavours, before a bite of spice and lemon zest in the mid-palate and banana at the end. Creamy, soft palate. Quite a clean finish, no hint of alcohol. Apple-clove aftertaste. Really good.
GCB: Bottle. One of the best german beers Ive had. Perfect yeast flavor and nice full mouthfeel.

Pours a very opaque golden with a huge 3 fingers of frothy white head that dissipates quickly. A lot of carbonation. Nose is very grainy and wheaty with a lot of yeast, banana and a hint of cloves. Mouth is very similar. A lot of wheat and banana. A great balance of sweet and spice. The clove is once again present, but a hint. A light body with a moderately dry finish. Awesome beer.

Bottle, thanks Hirigalzkar.
Pours hazy golden with a big pillowy White head.
Estery banana aroma. Bit too sweet taste, banana, alcohol and wheat.

Thanks for the bottle bartlebier! Have had this many times but never rated it. Pours a hazy light honey color with a nice white cap. The smell is floral, wheat, yeast, banana, clove. The taste is similar to the nose with a touch of alcohol on the end. Body is light/medium with fairly active carbonation that is finely structured. One of the great wizen bocks!
delightful Hellas beir hints of cinnamon and wheat. perfect beer for fall light in color but heavy in flavor.

I had been wanting to try this for a ling time and today I finally picked up a bottle. I was expecting a great beer and my expectations were met and exceeded.

Pours hazy gold color with a clean white head that hangs around for a long time and leaves lacing on the glass.

Smells-Bananas and clove.

Tastes-Similar to the smell. Fantastic balance of sweetness and spice. Banana/bubblegum tastes up front. Some floral notes but this is for the most part a sweet beer.

Mouthfeel-Decent carbonation with a dry finish.

Overall- Another phenomenal beer from one of my favorite breweries. Must try.

Bottle - pours out cloudy golden with thick white head. Nose of banana, cloves and spice, yeast, and citrus. Thick and smooth mouthfeel. Strong taste of banana, very syrupy sweet, slight dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle. Effervescent, and clear golden in color. Aroma of clove, wheat, plum, and banana. Taste is quite full, with bubblegum, wheat, plum, and toffee. Quite light-bodied and refreshing for such a deep flavor.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2013 Cloudy golden-orange with a thick white head. Great aroma, wheaty, banana, bit spicy, yeasty. Flavor is sweet malts, banana, some citrus and a bit spicy. Medium body, high carbonation. Great beer
Found it on tap in Southern Cal, really enjoyed it. Had a couple of bottles at another establishment which were not quite as good, but still one of my favorites.
Draft to taster. Looks good for the style; a slightly hazy gold with white lacing. Smells spicy and yeasty. Tastes like it smells with a solid mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

15th July 2013Euston Tap. Keg. Very hazy gold beer, little white head. Palate is smooth with fine carbonation. Sweet wheaty malt, Sweet floral bubblegum. Smooth finish. I like a sweet beer but a sweet Weizen Bock doesnt seem right. Perhaps this is a wrong-un. Bordering on cloying.

Bottle at the Sybarite Pig in Boca Raton, FL. Poured into a German Pilsner glass. Yellow gold with some haze and a two-three finger head. Head lasted about 3 minutes. Good lacing throughout. Aroma was bread, yeast, cloves, banana, and floral notes. Taste was very much the same and sweet. Aromatic finish of floral notes. Medium carbonation and medium body. Very good beer.

Bottle courtesy of Deanso. Poured a hazy medium amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is mellow banana leading to a crisp, yeasty, acidic flavour with those bananas and weak malt on the palate. Its a little more zesty than most wheat beers ive tasted and super refreshing as a result.

Bottle @ home. la migliore weizen bock che io abbia mai assaggiato. Appena la si stappa si sparge per qualche metro un distintivo profumo di banana matura. Colore biondo ambrato, con tipico cappello da weizen, finissimo, compatto e stabile, ma meno persistente della versione standard. Il gusto è pienissimo, tendenzialmente dolce, lievemente acidulo per via del frumento ma attenuato dal calore alcolico. Luppolatura debole, amaro quasi assente. é di buon corpo, carbonatazione decisa, e nel finale è dolciastra/alcolica.

Pours hazy golden with a large white head. Smells fruity, spicy, sweet. Taste is sweet and fruity. Medium-bodied with a slick texture and average mouth-carbonation, Weihenstephaner Vitus finishes with some mild dry sweetness.

Pours a hazy yellow, 3 fingers or so of head as it goes into a stein, but thats what I wanted. Aromas of banana, bubblegum, and clove of course, but with a bit of dough behind it. Taste is doughy with some more banana. Little hints of dark fruit around the edges. Very very velvety texture. Pleasant. Nice.

(bottle) Pours a hazy yellow with a towering white head that retains for quite a long time and leaves significant lacing. Based on appearance alone, one would guess that this is a regular hefe. Aroma holds all of the characteristic components of a solid weizenbock. The bananas are here in spades, mostly of the dried stripe, with further scents of yeast, light vanilla, clove, and some cinnamon all come into play. Think I got some peppermint too and something that reminded me of floor cleaner. Shades of Dancing Man. The flavor is also nicely done, and continues the dried banana theme, with further flavors of baked bread, clove, and tart wheat that really shears off the finish and makes it crisp. Alcohol is only subtly perceived. Mouthfeel is full and creamy and the carbonation is lively. Overall this is a quality weizenbock.
Golden orange looks, foamy nice long lasting head. Aromas of bananas, citrus and a hint of alcohol. Taste very similar, quite sweet actually. Refreshing, balanced.
Bottles orange golden pour with a good amount of white head. Citrus, followed by banana, clove and wheat aromas. Clean wheat, banan and clove flavors.

Weizenbock dorata. Bel cappello di schiuma. 7.8 abv. Dolce e profumata. Ottima

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Enjoyable beer for the summer. Cloudy golden/yellowish in appearance with a nice white fluffy head. Aroma of light fruits, like orange, lemon, and bananas. Bread and yeast also come thru. Taste is translated from aroma, but not as bursting. Fruits, wheat and bread dominate the flavor. Creamy mouthful. Excellent beer. $2.99 a bottle, slightly more than a pint. Would recommend to others.
Smells of slight citrus. Nice hazy yellow/orange pour, though a little lighter than I prefer, both in color and in taste. Overall a solid beer and very refreshing.
50cl bottle as a gift. Pours yellow hazy with large head. Banana aromas, with a hint of Citrus. Well balanced weizenbock.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2013 Draft at The Brass Tap - City Place. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Hints of yeast and banana aromas. Mild tropical fruits, cereal, yeast, banana, and clove notes. Decent mouthfeel and body.

Nice, yellow colored beer, but "semi-cloudy", until the yeast is poured into the glass. It becomes orange and cloudy. Nice, sweet and smokey aroma, with a touch of banana. Nice, sweet taste with a touch of banana. Nice, full sweet aftertaste.

Mooi, geel pilskleurig bier, Maar mid-troebel totdat je het depot uitschenkt. Het bier wordt dan oranjekleurig en troebel. Heerlijk, zoet rokerig aroma, enigszins banaanachtig. Lekkere, zoete smaak waar ook het banaanachtige in zit. Lekkere, volle zoete nasmaak.
Ottima bionda. Ottima doppio malto. Ottima weisse. Aroma pieno di banana, con sentori leggermente speziati di pepe rosa. Corposa il giusto per essere la birra ideale in ogni momento.

50cl bottle from the brewery. Pours a cloudy orange colored body with an inch thick, creamy and frothy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is sweet wheats with a good amount of banana and citrus, some bubble gum, and light clove notes. Flavor is similar. Sweeter wheats, a bunch of citruses and bananas, clove spices, and hints of bubble gum. Finishes clean and slightly sweet before leaving a fairly lengthy aftertaste. Medium, smooth body and a soft, moderately lively carbonation. Overall, a pretty nice weizen bock. A touch sweet, but pretty well balanced and easy drinking. Good one.

Not just one of the best wheat beers, but one of the best beers that i had ever had. Just the right amount of everything...alcohol, hops, wheat, banana and cloves taste. Perfectly balanced! Got that, American brewers? If you cannot make a balanced brew, then give up and leave it to the experts, the Germans and the Britons.
Holy cow amazing beer beautiful head orange, banana, on tap at Library Alehouse, yum!
Cloudy golden colored with a nice white head. Smooth, citrus and spice with a crispness to the finish. Lightly sweet, punchy, and quite good.

Mittel- bis dunkelgelb, klasse Schaumbildung, trüb. Citrus-Hefe-Banane-Nelke im intensiven Aroma als auch im Geschmack. Der harzige Hopfen bittert kräftig und lang nach, geil! Erstaunlich süffig obendrein, Referenzklasse!

Pours a cloudy straw color with a dense, frothy white head. Aroma is sweet carmelized banana. Flavor is the typical bavarian hef components all amped up. Strong clove, overripe banana, accompanied by a rich sweetness. Full, round mouthfeel. Pretty amazing stuff thats always priced very well.

Pours a hazy light golden with a huge white head with good retention and decent lacing. Aroma of tangy wheat with light fruit and clove. Taste also has the tangy wheat with mild banana and apple. Nice clove and light peppery spice. Mouthfeel is creamy and come what crisp with a medium/full body and medium/high carbonation. More balanced than a Hefeweizen with less banana flavor. Enjoyed the spices and the taste overall.
UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 Great wheat beer, well balanced beer, hides the higher alcohol strength well. Great example of german wheat beers!

Bottled. 
Cloudy orange color with medium-sized creamy head. Rich estery banana in nose along with bubble gum and light tinny phenols. Mouthfeel is smooth with a carbonation that is not that hard. Really malty flavour profile, with excellent balance with quite a lot of banana without being too offensive. Tinny phenols are there nicely in the background. Superb beer and really the best of the Weizenbocks.

This was my first weizen bock back in the day, and may very well still be my favourite weizenbock. It pours a cloudy reddish-gold with a huge white head. Wheat, banana, and spices make up the aroma. Flavour is smooth with a spicy sweetness that makes this extremely refreshing.

A pleasant surprise! Cloudy golden straw appearence with frothy white head. Nose of creamycitrus and ripe bananas. Frothly and creamy on the palate. Overall a great beer. Paired it with goat cheese. Went great.
Lovely creamy fruity wheatbeer. Somewhat spicy at the start, followed by clear banana taste. Like it a lot! Easy to drink a lot of it!

Coloração amarelo claro e muito opaco. Baixa formação de creme de pouca persistência.
Aroma floral, fermento, frutas (destaque para banana).
Bom corpo, média carbonatação.
Sabor banana e especiarias com destaque para cravo e fundo levemente picante.
Muito boa!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smell with peach, orange, floral; light yellow gold; fruity, smooth, full body, longing with slight sourness, right texture, very good beer, but not at level of its label for "world best wheat beer award"

Pours lemon zest yellow from bottle at sauce on danforth Sally the bartender says she gets banana on her straw sample sip. I dont know if shes right about that one but she seems to know her beer (plus she has cool tattoos). This is clean & complex & marina says she will never drink another beer after this one. And thats a pretty serious recommendation.

look: 3  smell: 4  taste: 4.5  feel: 4  overall: 4
A - Pours a hazy sunset orange with a white head that creates thin lacing and descent retention.

S - Peppery banana, clove, stone fruit, dense wheat malt, acidic fruit.

T - Hints of apple cider, cinnamon, banana, clove, bubblegum, stone fruit, very clean wheat malts, light pepper, with a kiss of citrus. The pepper comes out more on the finish.

M - Medium body, fluffy feel.

Super tasty German beer. A poetic marriage of flavors with a peppery hint on the finish. Awesome!...This is what I expect out of this brewery every time.

Serving type: bottle

10-06-2012

Bomber into glass..  cloudy orange pour with big ass white head.. Nice interesting creamy fruit aroma.. Taste is a  nice sugary fruit..some orange.. Pretty awesome beer.. Love it..will look for again... Actually may buy more tomorrow...impressed
Exelente cerveja. Seus sabores são distintos e pontuais. Sente-se o doce dos maltes e um final levemente picante. Apesar de ser de trigo, têm uma identidade própria.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2016 Aroma frutal/floral exquisito y muy intenso, lo más obvio es el plátano maduro pero también se intuyen albaricoque, melocotón, clavo y cierto peso de la levadura. De color anaranjado brillante, y de espuma densa y esponjosa, presenta en boca un gran cuerpo acompañado por un dulzor muy comedido y armónico. Perfecta como acompañamiento de comida o simplemente para disfrutarse sola, una maravilla.

Poured from a 16.9 oz. bottle into a Weihenstephaner Vitus chalice. 

Vitus pours a dark and cloudy golden straw color. A frothy off-white foam matures gracefully as I pour the bottle, never quite reaching the cusp of the glass. 

The nose on this is like an imperial version of their hefeweizen - bold and crisp (at least by 500 year old German brewing standards), with a bouquet of banana, clove, and light fruity esters. No dark fruit in this Weizenbock, though.

Banana sweetness and clove spiciness really dominate the flavor of this beer. A syrupy honey sweetness comes into play first, with the banana and clove coming in next, and then there is a long, slow finish as the beer tries to diminish the sweetness. The finish is a bit drier than the start, but it is still a rather sweet beer.

There is a light and crisp feel to the beer from the carbonation with a little bit of syrupy sweetness on the back end. Overall the mouthfeel is very clean, though. There is no residual sweetness on the lips or tongue after each sip. 

I think the regular Hefeweizen is the better beer; it still packs a flavor punch but has a lower ABV and the mouthfeel is a bit superior. Still, it is not surprising that this beer is quite drinkable. I could have a few glasses of this anytime.

Bottle, 50cl, Mitra Nijmegen. Had this with friends as digestif at a vegan dinner party. Smells dark put pours pale golden with a small head. Tastes of pancakes with vanilla and raspberries, banana. A bit too sweet for me now Ive tasted more darker beers and come to appreciate them.

Spices, mostly cloves mixed with banana with a lemon flavor on the linings of the flavor. Beautiful palate and a beautiful head. Was expecting it to be very drinkable, but the beer is so good it lets you know you are drinking a 7.7 percent beer.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2014 Pours a hazy gold with a one finger, bubbly white head. Aroma is sweet with notes of citrus, banana, and some spice. Berry nice. Taste is balanced with citrus, banana, some mild spice, and a short aftertaste. Medium body with a medium-high carbonation. Clean and refreshing in the mouth with an effervescent carbonation. Overall a very refreshing brew. Citrus, banana, spice, but not overly sweet. Very drinkable.
Goudblond, mooie kleur. Aroma lijkt op pittige bakbanaan, wordt sterker naarmate temperatuur. Smaak is tikje honing, met een wat kruidige smaak. Mondgevoel is met name wat koolzuur en wat droog.
Fra fat på Tap1 mai-13: du salige katt for en herlig hveteølaroma! Nellik og banan i harmoni. Flott skum, passe uklar og med en smak og munnfylde som ønsker sommeren velkommen! En sterk klassiker.
Pours a nice golden beer with a good white head. I smell lemons. Taste is banana. Good one. Palate is perfect for this beer.
Has a sweet honey flavor. A beautiful head from the tap. Hides the high alcohol content well.  Best beer Ive tasted yet

Bottle. Light straw ale with a thick white head., which calms well. Smells doughy and wheaty with banana leaves and a little lemon. A nice amount of carbonation makes this pleasant to drink with some cereals, dough and banana making this a really tasty sup which belies its 7.7% ABV. Some spice and vanilla bite keep this from being boring.

0.5l bottle from Csakajósör. Huge white head, long lasting. Smells perfect, tastes perfect: honey, banana, orange and co. Some herbs, too. Colour is yellow, with an unusual pale shade. Very hazy. Taste is perfect, too. Fresh and charming. Honey mixed with citrus, banana. Normally I prefer beers with a lot of hops and this one has almost none, yet, it is so well composed, so harmonic, that I do not miss the hops. Perfect Bavarian beer on a perfect night for Bavarians (FC Bayern just won CL...)
Very unclear and golden. Typical weissbieraroma. Taste of overripe bananas, but still refreshing.
Lys fin farge og utseende. Høyt skum som avtar raskt. Smak av sitrus og banan samt noe søt honning. Et flott friskt sommerøl. Melkebaren.
Et godt friskt og leskende øl med en frisk ettersmak av m.a banan som varer.  Svak lukt av citrus.

bottle 
Light orange yellow colour, creamy lasting offwhite foam.
Aroma iscomplex,  sweet, light to moderate malty, moderate yeasty, banana, honey.
The flavor is sweet, fruity, mild hop, citrusy and banana, malty, light bitter, long duration.
Medium body, carbonation soft.  
Goooood!

Certamente uma das minhas cervejas prediletas, talvez a minha preferida da Escola Alemã. Complexa, aroma e sabor únicos, toques de castanha inesquecíveis, uma cerveja pra deixar sempre na sua geladeira.

Pours an average frothy white head that mostly diminishes. Body is yellow and hazy. Aroma contains moderate malts (light bread, hay), light hops (citrus fruits), light yeast (dough) and banana, grape, raisin, pear, pineapple, cherry, cassis, coriander, vanilla, cola and spices. Flavor is light acidic (lots of fruits), then some sweet and some bitter. Body is medium with a bit thick texture and soft carbonation. A very refreshing beer. I love it!
On tap. Has the nice wheat characteristics but is a little stronger, bolder and more flavorful.
Pours hazy straw with impressive head.   Aroma of cardamom like spice honey and banana.  Flavor adds breast notes and a lingering spicy banana aftertaste

On tap at Blue monk. Hazy yellow pour with a thin white head. Aroma is not too strong, but Im getting some fruit, wheat, and yeast. Taste is very fruity. Banana, bubblegum, spices. Really smooth mouth feel with low carbonation.

Hazy pale amber with frothy white head.  Nose is meaty citrus with lemon moving towards more of an orange aspect.  Notes of refined yeast spice, faint vanilla, and light floral esters.  Flavor is more of the orange-lemon citrus with light banana and faint bubblegum.  Has a medium+ body but finishes with a lightly dry, carbonated finish.  Lingering orange/lemon/banana.  Very drinkable.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2014 The beer pours a hazy yellow color with a large white head, and the aroma blends banana and wheat. The taste is mildly sweet and a touch sour, and the aftertaste has some banana flavors with mostly some wheat. The palate fuses a a medium body, average carbonation, and a thick yet slick texture.
Balanced with proeminent alcohol. Complex and strong with a fruity taste at the aftertaste. Amazing.
50 cl bottle.  Pours yellow hazy with large head.  Fruity (pineapple) sweet refreshing taste with and a distinct acidity.  Love this beer in the summertime.

Strong notes of clove and spice mixed with sweet caramel notes and dark bread. Deep golden with a big foamy head. Sweet with balance from the spice flavors. Medium full bodied with a sweet spice finish. Their yeast produces a very different profile from similar Germany brewers.
50cl bottle at home. Hazy yellow with a medium white head. Very fruity: pineapple and banana. Medium carbonation. A very tasty white beer.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2015 Szép sárga nem olyan sápadt, mint általában a búzák. A hab erős, sűrű és tiszta fehér. Tetszetős.
 Az illata nem szúrós, nem szemtelen kellemesen kukoricás és édesen élesztős, citromos. Nagyon élénk, friss de ugyanakkor tömény, édes, testes. Kicsit belgásba hajlik. Azonnal édes ragadós utána jönne a komló, küzd nem győzhet! Nyer a szesz és a sok maláta. Ragad tőle a szánk. Még mindig nem az én stílusom a búza de ez most nagyon ízlett.
Mégis csak a germánok ebben a királyok.
Wonderfully complex and rich. A spice bread with fig, nut, and honey overtones, caramel and coffee under.

500 ml bottle purchased 15 months ago at Escondido BevMo ($2.99).  Pours a very hazy straw/gold hue with three full fingers of puffy white foam.  Aroma of yeast, banana, lemon, bready-wheaty malts, and a hint of clove.  Flavor of juicy banana, honey malts, wheat bread, citrus, and some spice.  Interesting sweet and tart elements (neither very strong) in the flavor.  Tingly carbonation enhances the experience.  Solid weizenbock.  (1099, 783)
Very impressive. Weihenstephaner are so consistent... The aromas of this beer jump out- sweet banana bread, donuts, almonds... the flavours linger on the palate. very good
Crispy, acid, Sweet, Very nice weizenbock. High alcohol cannot be tasted, it only supports the structure. Orange and strawberry taste.

Poured from 500 ml bottle. Slightly hazy, sparkling bright golden yellow with enormous, smooth, creamy off-white head and very good lacing. Aroma of bananas, wheat, grass, light fruit, yeast, caramel and spice. Taste of caramel, wheat, bananas, yeast, light fruit, coriander and other spices. Medium/light body and medium/low carbonation with a silky smooth mouthfeel. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle shared by Rune 22.Aug.2011. Thanks! Gushing. Golden hazy body with huge frothy head. Flowers, grain and pineapple.Sweet! Taste: wheat, lemon, herbs, grass and overripe fruit, yeast and alcohol. I think its too sweet and that the alcohol is too noticeable.
Bottle from Dan Murphy.  Pale hazy gold, strong cloves in the aroma and flavour, wheat malt, dough/bread/yeast, warm alcohol aftertaste.  Can tell its a good beer, just didnt like it much.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur dorée pâle et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, agrumes) et épicées (clou de girofle, notes de coriandre), de blé, moyen de gomme balloune, léger de pain, de houblon floral et herbeux ainsi que des faibles traces de sucre brun. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture aux notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes aux petites notes acides, moyen de bananes, faibles traces de pommes mûres) et moyennement épicées (clou de girofle, traces de poivre et de coriandre) avec des notes de gomme balloune lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de blé, un moyen goût de pain avec quelques traces de miel puis en finale lon retrouve une légère amertume de houblon à la fois floral et herbeux ainsi que de faibles traces dalcool. Post-goût moyen, composé dun goût de levures fruitées (léger de pelures de bananes et de zeste dagrumes) aux notes épicées avec un léger goût de blé ainsi quune légère amertume de houblon herbeux.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a nice big head. Spicy, wheat, yeast aromas. Spicy, yeasty, clove, bread flavors with a touch of alcohol. One of my favorite beers, a classic german beer.
I love wheat beer. The strength of this beer comes through a little bit of a wine taste. Very spicy finish for a wheat beer. Not a light summer beer.
Cloudy blond wheat beer, a bit of spice.  Nice body; I just am not a big fan of wheat beers.
Originally rated 17052012. Draught at Oluthuone Leskinen, Oulu. Colour is golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, banana, some wheat and malts.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2013 Head: huge, off-white, creamy, persistent. Colour: golden, hazy.  Aroma: yeast, slightly fruity (banana), but not as much as ordinary weissbiers. Wheat, again, not as strong as in normal weizens. Some alcohol and and spice too. Taste is sweetish, spicy and of course some wheat.

A weissbier on steroids: fuller body and sweeter, but without the refreshing sourish wheat bite that the non-bock weisses have.

UPDATE: Drunk colder (8-10°C, I guess) is much more intense and enjoyable.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: nice hazy blond beer with medium white head and small carbonation. Smell: wheat, citrus, litchi, lemon with high domination of banana. Really nice ! . Taste: wheat, banana with citrus note. Good balance of malt really nice to drink, fresh ! Aftertaste: wheat, bread, citrus, lemon, orange and banana.

Golden yellow with large white head.  Aroma lemon, grain/wheat, esters.  Light-medium body, some carbonation, no alcohol.  Flavor matches aroma, some sweetness and a touch of banana.  Citrus predominates.  Not my favorite style but well made.

Huge banana scent when you crack the cap. Bubbles crawling out of the neck and spilling down the side. Metric asston of head. Cloudy yellow guy. Yeasty, a bit of orange and pear flavour. Rye grains and alcohol. 

The bottles are pretty variable in complexion, but most share the above traits. This has become my go-to beer for the first quarter of 2013.
Refreshing and crisp. Pale yellow and hazy. Fluffy soapy white head. Sweet malts, fruity banana flavor. Great brew.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden straw color with a finger of very fine white head. Good retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is sweet, banana, bready, wheat. Flavor is banana, sweet up front, fading into mildly bitter, malty, mildly alcoholic finish. Good alcohol masking. Soft to medium carbonation, medium-full body, and smooth texture. A delicious beer, drinkable, smooth, well-balanced.

Bottle pours a cloudy gold with a thin but retentive white head. Aromas of pear, banana, and spices. Lively carbonation. Taste is rich and sweet maltiness, well balanced. Banana, citrus, coriander, and an herbal, fizzy finish. Great alcohol masking.

Pours light golden and hazy with a thin white head.  Smells like apple cider.  Tastes primarily of apple cider as well with the spiciness and tartness.  There is also hints of banana in there.  Its about as far as you can get from the styles I like, but this is still very pleasant  and easy to drink.

16.9 oz bottle. Nicely labelled. Served in a weissbier glass at a temperature of about 45F. . 

Pours a pale golden color with a slight haze. A lot of mixed-size carbonation is apparent in the rising bubbles. The massive off-white head is remarkably thick, has great retention, and leaves batches of sudsy lacing clinging to the glass. The aroma is yeasty and bready, with a strong but not overwhelming amount of cloves and banana. The flavor is a bit stronger than the aroma, although the qualities are about what I expected after sniffing it. Mildly sweet thanks to some nice tartness from mid-taste on. Remarkably well hidden alcohol; drinks like ~ 3% ABV!

Good feel albeit a bit too thin  Not fizzy or too lively despite what looks like generous carbonation. 

Clearly excellent and particularly refreshing example of style ... but not a favorite style for me.

Pours hazy golden with a huge perfect white foam. Smell is typical of Hefeweizen, fruits and some spices, has a big body and the tipical "banana flavor". A classic

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the LCBO, this beer pours a cloudy straw colour with a massive frothy head. Aroma is of pear, apple, coriander, and yeast. Tasting notes include sweet malts, pear and apple peel, coriander, lemon zest, crackers, yeast, all compacted in a smooth and crisp balanced mouth feel. This is an excellent representation of the style!

Hazy light orange witha creamy head. 
Good wheaty aroma, not giving away its ABV.
A bit sour, refreshing.
Delicious, could drink this everyday. Sticky sweet and wonderful. Has the nice hefe characteristics but is a little stronger, bolder and more flavorful. Excellent.

Entre douceur et force, une merveille !
La plus vieille brasserie du monde encore en activite nous offre une blanche au top de la categorie.
Dune blondeur pale et trouble surmontee dune mousse dense avec des bulles miniscules, elle fait plaisir a voir et donne deja envie de sy plonger.
Les aromes sont un peu faible en intensite. Les epices, coriandre, citron dominent et une fois en bouche cest la banane qui fait sont apparition.
Douce, ronde et enveloppante, elle nen est pas moins traitre avec ses 7.5% car si elle se boit facilement, elle attaque aussi facilement.
Une superbe realisation.
Tasted from a bottle. Poured a hazy, light golden color, with a white head. Citrus aromas. A great tasting wheat.

The best beer of the style that Ive tried. Pours absolutely blonde with a body thats got a  hazy grapefruit thing going on.  Lots of carbonation.   The head is big and foamy, and the smell is citrus and cabbage.  The flavor brings forth peaches, too, and bananas and some spice, and some nice tingle in the finish.  I thoroughly enjoyed it.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014  Early 2012 - Draught at Euston Tap - Didnt take notes.  Perhaps too cold, tasted a bit under-whelming.  Nice though.  (3.6) Oct 2012 Bottle, room temp.  A gusher - quick action saved 90%.  spicy, not sweet like the hefe, bit sharp, lacks the banana esters of similar beers. (3.6) Nov 2012 - Cold bottle.  Spice, sweet, drinkable.  Tasty.  (3.7) Jan 2013 Room temp bottle.  Again, a gusher and I had to pour quickly.  Sweet pineapple and mango, less banana with an enduring slightly spicy musty aftertaste.  Really nice. This is probably the best wheat beer Ive ever tasted, and yet Ive had several bottles with the same bottling date that were disappointing.  (4.3)

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Solid brew with well integrated banana and clove notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle 50cl from alko @ home. pours slightly cloudy light yellow, nice white head. aroma of banana, wheat, maybe some citrus. banana, spices, wheat in the flavor. smooth, well balanced weizenbock.

Not bad. Has a little different taste to it. But a good taste. Might get again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer is hazy and apricot hued with an inch of white head. The aroma brings banana, clove, spice. Like a stronger hefe with more sweetness and alcohol. The flavor offers a heavy dose of sweet bananas, booze, wheat. While this is good, I much prefer the standard Weihenstephaner hefe. Medium bodied with mild warmth in the finish. Pretty good.

Bottled in August of 2012.
Appearance: A towering fluffy white head explodes on the pour with great retention. The head towers over a murky golden body. This is a great looking beer, it just takes a bit to settle down.
Aroma: The yeast is strong providing banana and spice aromas. Supporting the yeast is a slightly sweet doughy aroma. The aroma is a bit muddled, but smells great regardless.
Taste: This is complex throughout the sip. On the intro the malts provide a sweetness to this, a touch of caramel, while apples and banana come through during the mid taste. The finish adds a touch of spice, very mild.
Palate: Medium bodied with a creamy full texture, soft carbonation.
Overall: This is an outstanding beer. This is something that every beer drinker needs to try. The balance is fantastic with a nice mix of malts, fruit and spice. What a refreshing beer.
A falta de probar muchas otras cervezas especiales de trigo creo que esta es la mejor que se puede probar ahora mismo en el mercado.
Malty tones with fairly strong banana flavor. More subtle notes of citrus and caramel at finish. Taste lingers on the palate long after swallowed.
Great weiss beer. Aroma and taste full of banana and maybe a hint of honey. Great head and nice body. The big alcohol vol is completely unpresent as of taste or smell.

appearance: Hazy pale yellow color with a huge thick foamy head. Lovely and delicious looking. 

smell: Full and rich smell of banana, yeast and wheat. Bubblegum sweetness, fruits, flowers. Great smell!

taste: All the great things i smelled. Full Banana bread flavor, bubblegum like. Some fruityness and floral stuff going on. Wheat and yeast. The only slight letdown is the bit of metal like bitterness it has. Like the cap rusted a bit through the beer or something. Its only with the first few sips though, seems to blend in better later on. Does give it a bit of freshness to it though. 

mouthfeel: Creamy, full bodied with medium carbonation. Does fit with all the flavors. Not very "light" though, but the flavors balance it out with freshness. 

overall: One of the best white beers ive had. It tastes like a better version, more strongly defined, as the regular Hefeweiss of Weihenstephaner. Its packed with flavors with only the bit of metal/citric like bitterness as a slight downside.

50 cL bottle from the LCBO, served in a branded weizen glass. Pours hazy golden with a large white head that fades to a thin cover and leaves a small amount of lace. On the nose there are notes of banana, pepper, spice and wheat, along with yeast and subtle hops. The flavour is moderately sweet with huge banana. There are also subtle notes of wheat, lemon, spice, and yeast. The finish is moderate in length, fruity-malty and slightly spicy. On the palate it is medium in body with a smooth, creamy texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a nice fruity wheat beer with huge banana notes and a creamy texture. Very nice. 2013-02-26

Bottle @ Home. Pours hazy dark yellow with a huge, but fast fading, white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, sweet fruity, banana, spice, light lemon. Flavor is wheat, yeast, sweets, bubblegum, apples, banana, lemonpeel. Medium body, lively carbonation, lightly warming alcohol in the finish. Nice, refreshing and very easy drinking. 250213

Lots of spices and banana up front, which I enjoy. Not the most complex of weizenbocks I have ever had but nonetheless this is solid. A bit light on the palate but overall it looks good, it smells good, and it tastes good. One of the beers I would like to stock up on for the warmer weather.

16.9 oz bottle. Poured a beautiful unfiltered orange yellow color with a thin white top that lasted throughout. Taste of banana, clove, coriander, lemon zest, and spice. Bad ass carbonation. Overall a solid brew!

Love the bananas and the spice thick upon drinking cloudy gold pour with thick white lingering head with very nice lacing. Sweet with a twangy aftertaste which is not bad. Overall a very tasty and complex beer

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2016 A hazy golden color with a thick white head that lasts long and leaves lacing. The aroma is full of banana, the fruity ester profile is very noticeable. Also wheaty maltiness and yeasty spiciness are very much present. Taste is light sweet, very wheaty, fruity and spicy; this is both strong and balanced, perhaps tilted a bit more towards sweet maltiness and banana than sour wheaty notes that appear in the mix. The palate is medium to full bodied and a little sticky with low to moderate carbonation. Vitus is the most typical example of a weizenbock I can think of - in a good way. An enjoyable, refreshing and rich beer.

Bottle. Yeasty banana, bubblegum, lemon, and clove aroma. Cloudy golden yellow with a large white head. Banana, orange, clove, and wheat malt flavor. Light to medium creamy body, moderate carbonation.

0.5L bottle.  Wow, the guys really know what theyre doing over at Weisteph.  Big bossy head, appropriate for the style, hazy.  Really wheat-y aroma.  Its everything I like about hefeweizen, but better.  Very very tasty, highly recommended.

Pours a hazy golden blonde color with a thick sticky foam. Aromas are bright fruit esters with citrus banana and a touch of spicy bubblegum. The palate follows the nose with a great round mouthfeel and a touch of sweetness.

Pours light brown straw. Cloudy. Overall, decent for a weizen bock, but strong banana and citrus flavor is a bit overwhelming, seeming to mask a lack of complexity. Dry malts and lively carbonation with a sour finish.

It poured a hazy yellow/orange and initially leaves a big three inch white foamy head in my weizen glass. The head does eventually die after five minutes. The very hazy yellow/orange body does show some light slowly moving carbonation. The smell has the clove up front with the esters powerfully backing it up. Some lemon comes out as well. As the beer warms, it gets a bit more peppery. The taste is sweet yet peppery at different times. It comes across pretty smooth in the taste. The palate is about a medium and initially sharp cutting my tongue like a knife. Fortunately, as the beer warms, it smoothes out a bit. This is not exactly a sessionable beer, a one and done bomber, though the alcohol isnt tasted, it gently gets felt after a good hour. There is a slight sticky aftertaste and finish. Overall, this is good for its style and good for me.

Poured from a bottle into a Weizen glass, the Beer is cloudy straw gold, aroma is very nice fruity with malt and some spice.that taste is banana, bread, spice, crisp carbonation, a little tang and then some alcohol warmth on the back end very very nice
bottle 50 cl. Golden, hazy with a white head. Aroma of wheat, spices, banana and light yeast. Medium bitter taste, øight sweet with a wheat and yeast end. Nice weissbier, but not my favourite style.
First smell I had was smokey, aroma after of light banana. Light in flavor but still slightly full bodied. Soft on the palate, malty, and sweet.
Blonde brillant hazy . Floral scent. Full body . Balanced between citrus and banana. Vanilla and mint. Sweet , bread . Good persistent. Easy drinkable.

When pouring to the glass, my nose filled with banana flavor! Nice hazy yellow look with white head. Very strong banana flavor. Taste has some citrus fruits balancing the sweetness of banana. Very interesting beer indeed. Im a bit more an Hefe Weissbier guy, so for me this is too strong Weissbier.
50cl bottle. Thick beige head. Low smell. Incredibly soft taste despite its 7.7%. Very round aftertaste. Become my favourite Weizen
Bottle from all in hua hin, thailand. Aroma of wheat, banana, citrus and little yeast. Hazy golden yellow color with long lasting smooth white head. Fantastic smooth taste, balanced, sweetness.

Dark brown color with small tan head and little lacing. Aroma and flavor have decent spiciness and strong banana with light fruits.  Strong malts.  A little bland compared to other good weizen bocks Ive had, but still okay.

Bottle. Hazy light brown color. Moderate off-white head. Sweet, banana, fruity, wheat, grainy notes in aroma. Sweetish, grainy, yeast, slight notes of honey in flavor. (Cheers to brothers who are vitus!)

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2016 50cl bottle - If you ever crave a well-concocted, smooth but powerful banana milkshake with a dry almond malt backbone and a splash of orange to make you happy, then look no further! // Revisited vintage bb08/2015 (8 month old): keps up very well, adding massive almond cake in taste to banana in flavour. Spices mellowed out, body nearly dry - works well with all kinds of food (asparagus risotto and salmon).

Bottle 50 cl from Bier-Bienne (CH). Orangy blond visual of Weissbier, with a nice huge and white head, nervous crackling. Amomas of banana-yeast, orange, lemon, spices clove-coriander, chewing gum. The taste is similar, classic Weiss and splendid. Its soft-fruity, without bitterness, rather sourish. Good volume in mouth, roundness of alcohol, very long finish, perfumed and always fruity.
Aroma has balance between banana notes and malt. Color is dark straw, cloudy. Aroma carries in to flavor.
Very good, lots of flavor. Weizenbock, maybe better than hefeweizen. Wheat, yeast, old world. Lightly acidic. Total Wine beer tasting class.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2016 cloudy yellow colour, massive, creamy white head; aroma of wheat, citrus, banana, some smoke and yeast; taste of banana, yeast and citrus with smoked and mild bitter aftertaste; really great weizen bock

Neede to be quick when I opened this as it immediately began to foam out of the bottle. Good 3/4 inch head throughout the pour. SLightly spicy nose reminscent of clove and honey with a touch of the ol Duvel in it.
Very pale hazy yellow with a developing tast of honey and melon. SLight sapply juicy quality too.

Good, but not quite in the Aventinus league for me.

Type: 500ml bottle
Glass: Pilsner glass 
From: Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, Calif., on Jan. 5, 2013
Price: $3.49 
Misc.: Part of the bottle reads Brewed under the purity law, of 1516.

Poured a golden yellow color with three fingers of rocky white head. Below average lacing with average retention. 

Smelled cloves, banana, lemon, honey, grass, sour fruit and some sweet floral notes. Nice on the nose.

Tasted pretty close to the smell, albeit with a healthy dose of alcohol and some skunky malts. Tasted cloves, banana, yeast, lemon grass, honey, corn and light skunky malts. Big alcohol finish. Sweet or tart as well.

Medium-to-light body. Oily texture. Lively (above average) carbonation. Astringent finish.

Not a surprise, but once again another good Weihenstephaner beer. Just a good weizenbock.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Hazy yellow with medium white head not lasting well.
Aroma.. bucket of banana and wheat. yeasty. Some spices that I cant define.. I would guess its coriander.
Sweet it is all the way.
Thou I am not fan of banana - wheat beers, this one is nice. I imagine hot summer day and this one would fit right in. If it wouldnt be so sweet, then I would rate bit higher

Hazy orange and gold with a dense white head. Aroma is dominated by yeast characteristics - banana and bubble gum. Flavors follow aroma almost exactly. Moderate body - expected a bit more for its bock status. Overall a nice rich weizen.

Kaatuu lasiin sameankullankeltaisena ja muhkealla valkoisella vaahdolla, vehnismäiseen tapaan. Haju on vahvan banaaninen, ruohoinen, yrttinen ja hieman sitruksinen. Maku on banaaninen, yrttinen, sitruksinen, ruohoinen ja havuinen. Suutuntuma on melko mieto, humalan pistely tuntuu kielellä. Kokonaisuutena ihan ok weizenbock, mutta selkeästi parempia ovat esim. Schneider-Weissen tuotokset.

Golden pale yellow with big white head.   Taste of banana. High carbonation. Okay.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Cloudy yellow color. Thick head. Aroma of banana and bubblegum. Some sweet taste and fruity finish. One of my favorite beers.

Colour: hazy, golden. Aroma: hops, spices, citrus. Taste: citrus, spices. Palate: mild, dry, medium bitter finish. Overall: very nice weizen bock

Cloudy yellow color and medium white head, that it goes out fast. Strong banana aroma. The same in the flavour. Hard carbonation.
The best.

(draught 0,3l @ Netopýr (Brno))
Sweet, light wheat, strong banana aroma. Cloudy yellow color. Medium white head. Medium sour, banana taste, very light alcohol. Light fizzy, light creamy texture. Astringent finish.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2013 500 ml bottle. What a delicious beer! Golden yellow, clear liquid with massive head rapidly dissapearing, but leaving a nice white layer. The aroma is quite noticeable. Citrus, banana, bubblegum and wheat. The taste is stupendous, medium sweet with a bitter, salty end. Full body with a thick, creamy texture, but at the same time very easy to drink (especially when the beer settles). Average carbonation and long and delicious finish. This beer is very similar in my opinion to Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier, but a little superior in all aspects. The best Weizen Bock I have tasted so far and a wonderful beer to drink in every occasion.

Pours a straw yellow color with thick marshmellowy white head. Murky with active carbonation. Very light and easy to drink.  Thick sticky lacing.  Aroma of banana, bubblegum, and candy. Taste like bananas, wheat, and hints of clove.  Nice sweet taste with a slight spice on the finish.

AROMA: orange, mango, hint of nutmeg?
APPEARANCE: pale, frothy, hazy, white foam, 
TASTE: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
PALATE: medium body, creamy, lively, astringent, long finish, bitter, 
OVERALL: Well-balanced tastes, with a bias towards sweet and the spicy fruitiness makes this a nice Christmas Weizen.

Colore paglierino, come anche è il suo profumo, paglierino e fruttato. Allingresso una leggera carbonatura pizzica piacevolmente il palato, per poi dare spazio ai dolci malti, anchessi paglierini, e al luppolo fruttato, coronato da una punta dalcool. A quel punto perde un po di corpo. Si riprende alla fine con un dolce aroma bananoso che riempie la bocca...inevitabilmente, se ti trovi una banana davanti sentirai di doverla mangiare! Forse un po ambigua, ma sicuramente un ottima birra!

Bottle. Pours hazy golden, with a finger thick creamy head. Aroma is banana, banana and then some banana, as well as bubble gum, yeast and grass. Body is creamy with fairly lively carbonation. Flavour is sweet with yeast, fruit, grain and hay, with banana and fruits in the finish.

500 ml bottle, at home, poured into a weizen glass.

Pours a deep yellow/ close to orange colour beer, with three fingers of white, thick soapy head, with excellent retention. Some activity in the glass. Body is hazy, semi-transparent.
Aroma of citrus fruits, bananas, bubblegum, very complex and pleasant.
Wow, fanastic taste! It follows the nose but much more enhanced and empowered. Wheat, bubblegum and bananas the most noticeable elements, with some clove and pepper noteson the finish.
Medium to thick on the body, with just the perfect carbonation. Very smooth and drinkable. The alcohol is very well hidden.
A fantastic beer, aroma and taste blew me away. Make sure to try it if you find it.

[4937-20121115] 500mL bottle. Light citrusy lemon yeast aroma. Hazy, light orange brown body with a big long-lasting creamy white head. Bitter lemony yeast flavour with a refreshing finish. Medium body. Nice to try. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4
(w/ jercraigs)

500 ml bottle. Pours an almost opaque golden with a resilient white head, Smell is fruity, some lemon and banana. Taste is very fruity: unripe banana, mango, orange, lemon. Its like a tropical jungle in my glass. Some yeast, vanilla cake. Light bitterness in the finish, but mostly refreshing. Medium body, lightly velvety mouthfeel. Average to strong carbonation. Very good. Although not super tasty, it was quite refreshing.

Reviewed 10/30/2012. Thanks to Momar42 for the bottle! About 10 oz poured into a pint glass.

A: Pours a very cloudy amber color. The head is a two finger off white shade with one of the most beautiful general textures Ive seen in a head before. Shame the lacing is low, though.

S: I half expected bananarama, and thats what I got. What sends it over the top is the complex notes of tangerine, cloves, bubblegum, and light grass intermingling with the banana that turns it into a real aromatic winner.

T: This takes what made Weihenstephaners hefeweizen so great, and amps it up to 11. Light banana to start, before giving way to some earthy, wheaty notes. I love how it isnt overly sweet (a problem I found in both Ayingers and Schneiders weizenbocks) The finishing flavor, in particular, is superbly wheat forward. It manages to be balanced, smooth, and complex all at the same time,

M: I only have one problem with the beer - the finish is just too astringent and chalky. The smooth, slick body is excellent right up until then, however. The carbonation, just like the texture, is fantastically controlled up until the midtaste, but is also a little too intrusive on the back end. However, both tighten up quite well after several sips.

O: An excellent beer in general - but not quite as great as the regular hefeweizen. To be fair, thats one of the best beers *ever* in my opinion, so it makes me a little sad that this is merely fantastic, rather than utterly transcendental. But still, the fact that its gotten to a point where Im chiding a beer for only being excellent means that Vitus should be searched out and consumed immediately.

Color is pale golden, cloudy  with big white head>Aroma of bananas, citrus peel, a bit soap,  elder... refreshing. Taste is sweet, fresh and just a bit bitter. excellent balance.  Light body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. One amazing beer.

Bottle from Asahiya. Smooth ripe banana aroma, with some fresh-mown hay, esters, and it all rises up like banana bread fresh out of the oven. Cloudy but bright lemon honey color, with a thick creamy white head and great lacing. Tangy at first, and then a lovely soft sweetness; gets sweeter in mid and final, with just a hint of something citrusy in the the final. Medium body. This is superb. Smooth, well-rounded, and tasty stuff.

Bottle @ The BeerMongers...  Poured a vibrant, hazy yellow with a thick forming, fizzy, white head.  Nose had cloves, bananas, esters, and yeast spices.  Very nice.  Lots of fruit and wheat in here.  Tropical/citrus juice with cloves, bananas, mangos, and some wheaten malt sweetness too.  Nice carbonation, soft mouthfeel.  This hit the spot.

Cloudy bright yellow pour with a long lasting foamy, slighty fizzy brilliant white head. Looks great. Huge nose of spice, coriander, banana, clove, bubblegum, wheat and some sharp leathery yeast. Flavour picks out the banana, bubblegum and spice from the aroma, as well as the tangy yeast. Lovely smooooth mouthfeel and muted carbonation. Finish is lush and sweet, with a slight twist of sour toward the end. Delicious.

From 50cl bottle bought @ La Birreria (Andorra). Cloudy pale yellow body with a puffy thick and long lasting white head that leaves a large amount of lacing. Bread, clove, plum, raisin and vanilla aromas mixing in nicely. Medium sweet, light bitter and light sourness. Full body with a creamy texture and average carbonation very well balanced and powering more aromas. Long finish with a sweet spicy aftertaste and a nice warming from the alcohol content which is quite well hidden anyway. Superb weizenbock with a surprising appearance because of it pale yellow color, but still inferior to the Schneider Aventinus that still defines perfection for this class.
On tap at the Weiphenstephan beer garden at the Christmas Market. Full bodied, un filtered, bananas, wheat and sweet honey.

Golden and hazy, of course after the gigantic head settles down.  This beer has that banana bread smell that I love.  While being a very thickly bodied beer, still flows nicely down the throat.  Very impressed by the quality of this beer.

Well this is just a fantastic beer. There are a lot of good Hefes out there, and this one, while being a Bock style, is no different. It has the typical hefe nose, of banana, spice, lemon and custard.It is sweet, but not cloyingly so, with a nice spicy herbal bitterness to counteract. Creamy, seemingly medium bodied despite the heavy ABV. Dangerously drinkable. Excellent.

Bottle - Honey, wheat and banana on the nose. Clear pale gold with a foamy head that disappears quickly.  Refreshing and sweet, banana, honey, wheat and a subtle alcohol taste that lingers.  Good body and quite deceptive for such a high ABV,

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 Aroma: strong banana, bread, Appearance: pours all head, settles down into a medium white head, the beer is a lightly hazy slightly light gold color Taste: like a liquid banana, some bread, a bit of warmth on the finish but itâs subtle Palate: flat carbonation, heavy mouthfeel, possibly some alcohol coming thru, still has a froth to it even though the carbonation is lacking Overall: drinks like a imperial hefeweizen, hides the abv pretty well, tons of banana in the aroma and flavor, a good hefeweizen for cold weather
Cloudy pale gold with a thin white head. Bubble gum, candy, spicy smell. Taste is slightly sour, spicy, peppery, banana lollies. Finishes peppery, some alcohol warmth. This is pretty damn good...
A delicious fall wheat. Heavier than a hefe but not quite a weizenbock. Golden pour with a white head and a long spicy aftertaste.
Aroma of bubblegum, wheat and slight clove.  Pours hazy yellow with a hazy head.  Taste is sweet with wheat, bubblegum and corn.  Very pleasant.
Cerveza color dorado claro, con espuma blanca. Muy refrescante. La mejor cerveza de trigo.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2012 @Arjan bedankt, kleur Goudgeel, 
aroma van weeig tarwe zoals bij witbieren, koriander, citrus, sinaasappel. Smaak: fluweelzacht op elkaar afgestemde tonen van banaan, en de smaken zoals deze ook in de aroma terugkomt.redelijk zoet Lichte body redelijk dun,niet bitter. 
Ideaal voor op het terras in de zomer

A huge, fluffy white head floats atop a hazy gold body. Wheat, pepper, and sour citrus in the aroma. Banana is the first flavor that comes through. Although it is a bit on the side of imitation banana candy flavor rather than real banana. After that, black pepper, wheat malt, finishing with bitter orange and coriander. The spices become more pronounced as it warms. Bit of heat from the 7.7% ABV.

This is definitely a beer to enjoy. Loads of flavor, great balance, excellent drinkability

Slightly cloudy gold pour. Aroma of banana bread and a little alcohol. Mouth is creamy. Flavor is big banana and spice esters. A little lemony and sweet. Some alcoholdetection. A delicious turbo hefe.

16.9oz Bottle. The pour was a murky golden yellow with an average (1-2 finger) white rocky head that lasted throughout, reducing slightly to a small cap with excellent sheets of lacing.

The aroma was of a light biscuit malt, light citrus hops and a sweaty yeasty with notes of banana, green apple, citrus (lemon), clove and a touch of honey.

The taste was lightly sweet and very mildly malty with a hint of citrus that lasted throughout, and finished with a spicy yeast taste and had just a bit of banana at the end. The flavor stuck around for an average duration following the swallow, with a refreshing spicy citrus taste left lying on the taste buds.

Mouthfeel was right between light and medium in body with a dry, creamy texture and a soft carbonation.

Overall this was a very tasty and refreshing brew that had a great spicy banana ending and an awesome drinkability...

From the bottle to the glass.  Cloudy golden color with low-medium density head(large bubbles).  I let the head fade away to get the blunt force of the aroma.  Banana, spice, and a little bit of herb.  Medium sweetness with just a little sting from the booze.  Overall, delicious

500ml bottle from LifeSource, in Salem.
$3.79
Slightly hazy ,deep gold coloured beer with a bubbly half inch thick white head.
Very nice strong honey/toffee scent to this, then some phenols and laid back spiciness..nice really.
Taste is much the same as the aroma but maybe has a bit more fruit in it..again nice.
Nice smooth easy mouthfeel..goes down dangerously easy!!
Overall a good beer.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors cloudy yellow with a good white head. 
Aroma banana, yeast, wheat, bread, also some citrus. 
Taste awesome banana like sweet, some good bitters. 
Mouth-feel nice creamy feel, just enough carbo. 
Amazing beer, the 7.7 alcohol is hidden so also dangerous beer :)

Smooth despite the high ABV. Poured with a thick, towering fluffy head, color is hazy golden orange. Body is slightly chewy with a little tanginess. Aroma is very grainy, like a loaf of bread. Taste the same with subdued banana and sweetness. This is very easy to drink, but beware the ABV. It will knock you out!

A  lucky find from the LCBO. Delicious. Hazy golden...yada-yada. Definitely spicy. The 7.7% is WELL hidden. Do not pass up this beauty if you come across it. I returned to place of purchase the following day and grabbed four more bottles.

Bottle pours cloudy gold with two finger white head. Aromas of wheat, bread,  lemon, banana, pepper. Moderate/High bitterness and light sweetness. A bit peppery and acidic. Body is lively. Excellent beer.

Location: Draft at Pilsener Haus, 11/10/12


Aroma: This one has a nose of wheat and citrus mostly, with lots of spice

Appearance: It pours a hazed orange color with a foamy white head

Flavor: The taste is similar to the nose, and is somewhat sweet with a mild bitterness

Palate: This one has a medium body to it, and a somewhat tingly feel

Overall Impression: 
This one was a quite good example of the style.  A really quality German-style beer with a lot of flavor and some very nice components.  Id certainly drink this one again.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2013 On tap at Wvrst. This was incredible. Served hazy gold with a fine white head. The nose was like the Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier concentrated - intense sweet citrus, a little lighter on the clove and banana, tons of spicy yeast. The taste was crisp, dry, not noticably alcoholic, with a clean, lightly hopped finish. The character of the aroma perfectly matched the taste, and both were perfectly balanced. Definitely on the lighter end of body for a 7% abv beer, but I honestly have no complains.

bottle whith and thanx to 77 ships.
smells fruity, tastes like a blond beer VS orange VS banana, yet not a fruitbeer. it was orange/blond, hazy and had a fast fading foam.

Smells of peppermint banana and a little bit of funk. Light with significant head. Light taste with a little funky yeast and weird after taste. A little dry, not my thing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours gold, murky and effervescent with a pillowy head. Aroma is spicy, herbally citrus and creamy banana.  Flavor is more of the same with a mild alcohol kicker. Palate is unexpected, with spritz on the tongue and a full mouthfeel, very nice. Ill try to revisit this style more often.

Bananas, overripe green apples, clove, a mild alcohol sting, musty furniture, ripe strawberries, spices, a hint of citrus peel, and other yeast esters in the aroma. Taste is mildly sweet/tart/bitter, without overdoing anything. Terrific mouthfeel, with a rather thick but velvety body and perfect carbonation. It glues everything together perfectly.

Aroma was slightly wheat and sweet. Color was like a hefeweizen, with a cloudy yellow body and a white head. Taste is sweet and not as sour as a hefeweizen, so like a hefe without hefe yeast. Very carbonated, making the liquidy consistency feel more full.

500ml bottle, slight hazy honey gold hue, with a frothy white head, good wheaty, pale, toasted malt, doughy, yeasty bananaish nose, with some light stewed apple, pear, apple sauce, cinnamon, nutmeg, spicy accents, with a faint vanilla, apple strudel note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice yeasty spicy cinnamon apple pie, nutmeg, bready dough, fruity stewed apple, apple strudel character, with some honeyed pale, pilsener, munich, toasted malt, light candied ripe apple, pear flavours, leading towards a yeasty, fruity, spicy cinnamon, apple sauce, doughy, wheaten maltiness finish.

Pour out of bottle, thanks Aaron, thanks Aaron! Hazy yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of wheat, citrus, coriander, some slight lemon, yeast notes prominent as well.  Taste is a mix of biscuit, bread, some hints of yeast, slight citrus, finishing fairly spicy with coriander, sweet.  Pretty tasty.

First impression - very nice for wheat beer, Im not big fan, but this one...!
Sweet, spicy, taste. Hazy pale in color. Aroma of malt and fruits. Frothy white head. Very ale-y.
Aftertaste is pleasantly astringent.
0.5L bottle @stockmann

Banana aroma. Pours hazy yellow with medium white head that leaves a lace. Tastes medium sweet, light sour and a bit alcohol. Finish is abrupt. Carbonation is lively, body is medium-full and texture is oily. Overall, its a great beer.
Bottle. cloudy yellow pour, pillowy white head. Yeast, bread, caramel, alcohol, a little banana and pear. Soft. A little boozy. Malt backbone balanced with the wheat character. Very nice.

Nice wheat beer drinkable and not too heavy. Banana grapefruit fought. Not too shabby.     

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nearly clear pale yellow. Huge fluffy head. Aroma of over ripe bananas, wheat, yeast. Tingly carbonation, close to full bodied, heavy clove and coriander spice palate. Nice sweet wheat creaminess. Warm alcohol and grassy hops on the finish.

500ml bottle.  Pours a bright yellow color with a thick foamy white head with good retention.  Aromas of banana, wheat, and bread dominate, with hints of spices and light hops.  Taste has sweet wheat malt upfront followed by bananas, apricots and biscuits. Lots of yeast esters and very fruity.  Medium smooth body with moderately high carbonation.

Poured in last yrs erdinger wheat beer glass. 3 finger head,extremly fast & lots of small carbination aggressivly. Orangy to light and light yellow with some orange in front. Smell is light of like orange sida and wheat. Taste starts off orange soda like & then this light smoth malty banna bready like taste slides in & you taste some carbination on some sips. Later a little warmth from the strong %. German hefen wizzens & dark wheat(ex. dunkel) r my fav wheat beers,so this is not the best German wheat beer I had and DEFF not the worst. I like this a lot thought cheers. One bottle will give a nice buzz cheers! :)

500ml bottle, 7.7% a/v

Pours a cloudy light gold, very obviously a wheat beer. The head is rocky and amazingly pretty. Aroma is also fairly typical for a wheat brew, spices, a bit of banana and orange, nothing at all tells you this is nearly 8% from the nose. Taste is initially very wheaty and smooth but quickly turns into a nice deep malty palate with a lingering taste of alcohol and going down warm! There is almost a bit of a disconnect between appearance and smell compared to the taste and palate. Very intriguing and a great fall/winter sipper

500ml bottle. Cloudy golden colour with average to huge, firm, frothy, white head. Wheaty aroma with notes of citrus, dried banana, spicy background. Taste is moderately sweet, wheaty, fruity, pear, a citrus touch, ester. A bit faint, flabby - disappointing.

On tap. Banana, cereal and clove aromas. Pours hazy pale gold, with nice whiet head, creamy and compact, long-lasting, some lacework. Medium-bodied, soft carbonation and oily texture. Taste is mild, cereal, with some developing bitterness. Good and long aftertaste. Alcohol is well integrated. Quite enjoyable, but dangerous due to its high abv.

From the worlds oldest brewery - 500 ml. bottle split with Dylan / Kraddel - bright golden with a white head - as soon as opened, I can smell the banana, citrus, flowers, spice yeast, heavy on the spieces - tastes like  banana, pears, esters, flowers, heavy on the spice yeast, plenty of spices in the back, sharp, touch grain, wheat heavy - bit hazy body - it is good but I expected much more to be honest - bit of a downer like their hefe I must admit my ignorance of beer as thus, cristal on the other hand was awesome

Bottle. Pours a nice golden orange color with a frothy white head. Aroma is of over ripe banana, sweet malt, toffee, caramel, peppery notes, clove, citrus and grassy notes and bubblegum. The flavor follows the nose with nice banana notes, sweet malt, caramel, toffee, peppery notes, clove, bubblegum, grassy notes and citrus. The body is medium with a chewy mouth feel. Overall a pretty nice Weizen Bock!

16.9oz bottle - pours hazy light honey with rich white head and decent lacing.  Nose is banana and cloves.  Flavor adds wheat, light citrus notes and pepper.  Sweet.  Medium to full body.  Sticky mouthfeel.  There is this toffee/butterscotch aftertaste that I dont particularly like and its making me decide that my expectations were not met.

Pour is yellowish orange. Very cloudy. Aroma of Belgian yeast and wheat. Taste was basically the same. Nicely balanced but a little strong on the fruitiness if the yeast. 

---Rated via iPhone

slight hazed, golden body with an enormous white, creamy head. aromaif full of banana, with clove and light coriander in the back. medium to full bodied and nice and oily on the palate. taste is mellow sweetness with banana and a very balanced, semi-dry finish.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2012 Pours a cloudy light orange-yellow color with a frothy thick head that lingers a long time.  Aroma is banana, cream, wheat, lemon, and bubblegum.  Interesting taste, very creamy and full bodied for a wheat beer.  Almost like pureed bananas.  Light lemon sweetness comes through in the finish along with a bit of spiciness.  The moderate but frothy carbonation adds some texture to the beer.  Im really starting to like weizen bocks and this one is really good.

I dont know if its the best beer in the world, but if not, it should be so near (almost, amongst the wide distributed beers). Its very complex, rich in flavours and aromas, steady, perdurable and complete. You can find citrus, pineapple, grain, floral regards, smooth touch of pepper and spices, etc. Very refreshing, but, at the same time, serious and elegant. The kind of beer you can have in a pub, beside the fireplace or in the best restaurant. Just IN-DIS-PEN-SA-BLE!!

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 Aroma is spice with hints of banana and perhaps cloves. Pours a cloudy yellow with a foamy, mostly diminishing white head. Taste is on the sweet side, but not over the top sweet. Bananas, bubble gum, cloves greet the pallet. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall this was a very enjoyable beer. It would be a great accompaniment to many different foods. Would drink again.

Pours with an insane head. Beautiful banana, cloven-spice and yeast aroma and taste. Perfectly complex and drinkable, with enough ABV to pack a punch. This might be my new favorite German beer-- I just hope I can find it on the east coast when I move.
Color arancio opaco, ottima schiuma solida e persistente. Aroma fruttato con sentori di banana. In bocca è dolce con buon equilibrio tra malto e fruttato.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with white head. Hints of alchool but not disturbing, good banana flavor. Good aftertaste. Overall, very nice

On Tap. Pours a cloudy gold with a foamy white head and lacing. It has a great clove and banana aroma with the same in the flavor along with a balanced, sweet aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A hazy yellow color. A wonderful Weizen and malty aroma. Lemon, citrus, clove and spices.

Cloudy, straw yellow with a big, bright white head with good retention of copious sticky, foamy lace. Ones expectation of a slightly darker color is forgotten upon the first sip. Wonderful, big, Hefe aromas of soft banana esters, spice and clove phenolics, wheat, caramel malt and Juicy Fruit rise up from the glass upon warming. Faint notes of clover honey and vanilla are detectable. The flavor of this beer, to me, is literal perfection. Caramel, spice, animal crackers, over-ripe banana, Juicy Fruit gum, rich honey-puffed wheat cereal. The finish has a pronounced chalky, powdery yeastiness.The super-charged classic Hefe flavor is wonderfully opulent and concentrated. The lavish quality of the combined flavor, aroma, and body is simply alluring, and I was drawn in to indulge. This is my idea of beer pleasure, right here. The mouthfeel presents a rich, palate-caressing medium body from the traditional decoction mash. The sweet, rich finish also reveals a slight, nearly imperceptible touch of volatile ethanol. Ideal CO2 level. Perfectly drinkable.

Hazy light-coloured yellow with decent white foam hed, lacing to glass. Aroma is that of a spicy single-bock wheat beer. Taste is perfect weizen, simply nothing to add. Has to be drunk at right temperature. A really special beer with full body and a distinctively great mouthfeel. Prost!  (Velp 201209)
A solid effort, however having just drank the schneider weisse I have to say this wasnt as good for me

16 oz. Draft at Rooneys on Ramstein AFB, Germany. The best weizen bock Ive ever tasted, hands down. Spiced scent, clove, with sweet wheat, wonderful balance. Cloudy golden pour, big bubbly white head, intricate lacing. Thicker body, which I liked, with a syrupy feel, yet a somewhat crisp finish. Odd, but pleasing. Spicy clove fronted flavor with a sweet apple note similar to apple pie, just amazing.

A very tasty beer and definitely one of the most beautiful looking beers in the glass ever. Pours a hazy golden amber with a generous white head. It just looks like a classic brew. Yeast and spices on the nose. Wheat, banana, clove, and yeast on the palate. Rich finish. Delicious.
Bottle. Great beer. Pale yellow with dense white head. Aroma grass, sweet sugary malts, pineapple. Taste sweet malts, pineapple, fruit esthers.

Wow. Poured this into my tall weisbier glass. Beautiful sight. Aroma is yeast and wheat. Mouthfeel is amazing. aroma is amazing. Yeasty. Full bodied. creamy almost. A lot of depth and flavor. This is a true beer. Truly great. The taste has "history"...just feels like what a beer is supposed to be like. So good.
Aroma has wheat, citrus hoppiness, toffee, banana. Hazy golden. creamy frothy big head medium long. Taste is abundant, crisp, medium full. Easy to drink and fresh.
One of the best beers I have ever had! Rich refreshing, yeasty, fruity, and malt. Orange and gold color, taste is just damn good!

16.9 oz bottle into a tall pilsner glass. Bargain of a beer at $2.99

A - Dark yellow/light amber body. Quite hazy with rising carbonation. Massive fluffy bone white head forms and settles down to a permanent finger high cap. Moderate lacing.

S - Mostly ripe bananas. Some light spice and tart peach juice. Some standard yeast spice, but the aroma is rather one layered. No malts or wheat present.

T - Similar to the nose. Ripe bananas, a nice peach/pineapple sweetness, and a touch of yeast spice. Barely a hint of biscuity malt. Finishes somewhat cloying and coating with some alcohol present. Light to medium mouth feel with a pleasnt level of carbonation.

O - An solid yet plain beer. Not as vibrant or excellent as their hefe, Still very delicious with a fantastic banana and peach presence.
0,5 bottle. A pale weizenbock with a great white head. Sweet aroma with notes of banana, wheat and malts. Sweet malty taste with notes of wheat and soft bitterness.

Nice beer this, not really up on my German beers but enjoyed this. Pours a nice cloudy pale orange with a long lasting big white head. Nose is really fruity. Taste is the same and really full on banana esters coming thru. Edging towards a bit too much but not quite. Just on the edge of being really enjoyable. Good stuff.
UPDATED: AUG 27, 2012 Wow!!! A clean and refreshing wheat beer. Vitus takes wheat beers to the next level.
Pours a cloudy gold with a thick dense white head.  Bread, fruit, banana, raisin, and clove notes.  Rich full body with a creamy smooth mouthfeel and a hint of alcohol.

pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head that goes away quickly, above average carbonation, and a little lacing.

smell of banana, yeast, some citrus, and a touch of spice.

taste is smooth, wheat, a little bit of sweetness, and a touch of citrus.  ends crisp and refreshing.

Hazy golden yellow wheat beer with huge but brief white head. Aroma has refreshing citrus in it and a strong yet pleasant yeasty aroma. Body is medium to full. Strong flavor of sweet banana. Carbonation is pleasantly present. I truly love this wheat beer. Not very complex but it is a true enjoyment to drink this.

One might think this is a Belgium beer if unaware. Aromas and flavors of cloves, spice, bananas, apple, and yeasty dough nuances. Very enjoyable, with a great mouthfeel. Fine, dense carbonation gives a full, silky sense in the mouth. Good value. Nothing to complain about. Enjoyable. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Appearance was hazy orangish gold with billowy white lasting 4 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are sweet malt, then fruity esters of yeast, slight wheat, bananas, clove, bubblegum. Taste is heaven in a bottle with fruits of bananas, clove, bubblegum, mild lemon,  sweet malt. Palate was creamy crisp CO2 with light meduim body, then glorious average length slightly warming fruity finish. The Best Wheat Ill had.
Near perfection, clean tasting and fullfilling. A variety of flavors for the palate to sift through. World class.

Purchased at Market Basket in Seabrook, NH. Pours an unfilitered orangeade into snifter with a bulbous off-white  bubbly head, 75% carbonation, which sinks to a minimal head after not too long. Smells right off the bat of bananas, banana peppers, cloves, wheat bread, wine dregs and slight aged booze. Tastes immediately of crisp wheat malt, cloves, vegetables, spicy yeast, flower pedals, and citrus. Ends tangy with a hint of caramelized salt. Its mouthfeel is fluffy; I like.  Im surprised I havent had this before. Glad I coughed up the $3.

From large bottle. Big head on this one. Light amber color. Big taste here. Very complex, fruity. Apples, plums, raisins, oranges, you name it! More sour than sweet, in a good way. Great mouth feel. Long, pleasant aftertaste. 
Warning! Other wheat beers may seem insipid by comparison.

Bottled. Pours hazy golden with a large white head, leaving a fair lacing. Nose of wheat, yeast and banana. Sweet flavor of clove, banana, yeast, alcohol and notes of citrus. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. Ends up with some alcohol notes and again banana. Once more an excellent brew from Weihenstephan.

Pours cloudy golden with a white head. 
Creamy texture, banana and wheat flavours, soft sourness. 
Full bodied, plenty of fizz. Refreshing strong wheat beer.
I like it !

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2013 Good taste, leaves a good after taste on the palate. Why, o why cant Americas big breweries crank out a beer this good? In order to get a very good USA brew, you need to go to one of the micro-brewries, for example: Dogfish, Three Floyds, or Goose Island.  Americas big breweries, dont give a hoot about what the throw out there as beer.

Huge pillowy head, as if it were filled with down. Wheat and roasted banana aroma, but it all comes down to the taste which is just heavenly with its banana/alcohol/clove/dark fruit body and somehow refreshing aftertaste. I drank the first quarter of the glass, then couldnt help but reach into the fridge for some Danish blue cheese. Highly recommended combination.
Pours a hazy golden colour with a big foamy white head. strong aroma if banana and clove with a hint of orange citrus.flavour is crisp citrus and banana and a light spicy finish.

Bottle at home. Pours almost clear golden orange with a creamy forever lasting white head. The aroma has loads of banana, wheat and citrus. The flavour is sweet malty with notes of sweet banana, caramel, wheat and citrus. Well made and high drinkability.
Keg in Euston Tap. Cloudy dark amber, big white head. Nose is cloves, banana, orange citrousy. Taste is cloves, banana, orange citrous, caramel. Bif fruit weizen bock.
0.5l bottle. Hazy, light golden/yellow body with a huge off-white head. Very wheaty aroma with some banana-like and citrusy notes. Flavor of banana and yeasts with some booze.
Very tasty, and easily accessible weizen. Above average body, good balance, middle-of-the-road style.
Troebel lichtgeel.  Ruikt  wat zurig en de smaak is banaan, citroen. Smaakt ongeveer als een erdinger met als groot voordeel dat de smaak en body wat voller zijn.

Tap flight at Whole Foods in Schaumburg.  Cloudy marigold color with a dense white head that reduces to a ring surrounding a white haze. Big banana aroma. Not just banana, but a combination of green, ripe, and overripe banana combined. Taste is allspice berry, dried lemon peel, and wheat.  Medium palate. Good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
No és el meu estil preferit. Cervesa ben feta. Però tanta olor a blat mareja. Me la imaginava més fosca i amb més cos.

50 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra. Hazy golden with a big white head. Malty banana cloves aroma. Upon tasting a yeasty orange like sensation emerges. The alcohol is well concealed and the carbonation is very lively. Great beer.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with a off-white head. Nice malty aroma and fruity with caramel, vanilla. Spicy taste and very smooth, with vanilla and banana. Nice all around.
Really enjoyable, solid wheat beer. Smooth but rich taste, spicy aftertaste.

Pours pale gold with a tremendous, long-lasting, slightly off-white head.
Aroma is wheat, cloves, banana.....very strong earthy spices.
Taste is all and more of the same....creamy and smooth.
A really great beer.

The beer pours a hazy straw color with a large white head. The aroma is full of cloves and bananas with a little bit of toffee thrown in. The flavor is very similar.
