I get a lot of strong banana and clove notes, as well as a little bit of pepper. There is a very creamy mouthfeel and medium carbonation. A very nice weizenbock, one of the best I have tried.
Grumlig gyllene öl med ett väl tilltaget weissbier-skum. Klassiska, väl tilltagna dofter och smaker av jäst, banan och en aning citrus. Döljer alkoholstyrkan mycket väl.
Its voted to "the best beer in the world" ... And i have to admit it is the best. Just try it!!
Cloudy gold pour.  Medium head that faded quick.  Aroma of yeasty bananas.  Some wheat in there too.  Taste has some light fruity qualities.  Mouth is full.  After taste is full of grain and bananas.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2012 This beer presents itself as a cloudy golden beverage with a bubbly white head a lot like whipped egg white. It has a creamy hay aroma but I?m not convinced by the word banana to describe this. It doesn?t seem at all sweet, but has an appreciable bitterness and that distinct wheat-y sourness. It?s a strong, full bodied drink with a satisfyingly thick texture, plenty of fizz and a bitter, slightly sour aftertaste. Overall this is a refreshingly cloudy drink. While I wasn?t taken too much by the aroma, the appearance, taste and palate befit this as a strong wheat beer. It is surprisingly refreshing and leaves a lovely wheat flavour in the mouth. I very much enjoyed drinking this; a great, big wheat beer.

Bottle. Pours an unclear dull yellow colour with a big frothy white head, almost like wipped egg-white. Lovely aromas of sweet banana and some spices and citrus. Smooth flavours of fruits, banana and pale malt and some yeast with a touch of alcohol. Lovely. Incredibly soft and slik mouthfeel, and a light bitternes. A wonderfull and well-balanced pale weizen bock.
500ml bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $3.29 Very good!

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow-gold with a large off-white head that has good staying power and good lacing. Aroma is wheat, lemon, grass. Flavor is medium sweet wheat, lemon, orange, banana. Rich and creamy in the mouth. Alcohol is well masked by this flavorful and full-bodied beer.

Bottle from Total Wine:  Pint glass: Pours a clear gold color with a nice dense head. Aromas of bananas, floral and hay. Very good depth of flavors with malts, bananas and citrus flavors. This is an outstanding Weizenbock. Very well balanced with good depth and complexity in both aromas and flavors. Nice creamy mouthfeel and the perfect amount of carbonation gives this beer a strong finish.
UPDATED: AUG 14, 2014 Hazy golden yellow colour with huge head, some yeast particles. Aroma is wheat, yeast, banana.Flavour pretty much the same, bit sweet, some citrus and a lot of banana.
Bottle from Alko. Thick yellow color, white head. Sweet taste with banana, wheat, grass and alcohol. Good wheat with a twist.

From liter bottle into Stone Old Gaurdian tasting glass. Lightish orange-gold with a slight haze. Pure white, super-smooth shaving cream head, with bubbles packed super tight and looking pristine. Sticks for days. Aroma is weizen-like fruitiness and spice, and high alcohol. Flavor is pretty bocky, but actually not too boozy. The best way I can think to describe this is a German Belgian beer: those spicy/fruity/funky aromas and flavors remind me of Belgian goldens or tripels, but this has a Germanness underlying it, always. Nice to drink, and apart from the aroma, you might never guess this is 7.7%. Palate is a really nice balance of bounce and smooth. Definitely among my favorites from Weihenstephaner.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2017 Figured Id rated this before... on tap at Proof.  Fold pour with solid off-white.  Spice, wheat and soft citrus aroma.  Tastes are clove, caramel, yeast, bread, bubblegum, banana.  Lively medium texture.  Pretty good.  Pleasant surprise.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2015 Draft at Bierstube. Cloudy golden yellow with a large pillowy white head. Expected yeasty wheat bread flavors but has a nice slight citrus hop kick. Grassy orange juice. Challah. Banana peels. Dill. Fizzy body. Good stuff.

0.5 l bottle.

Cloudy yellow liquid with an abundant long white head.

Aroma has notes of banana, cloves, belgian yeast, citrus, fresh bread.

Full body, perfect carbonation, creamy texture.

Alcohol is  hidden very well.

Pours cloudy yellow with a massive white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, and some slight citrus notes. Great delicate bubblegum, spice, and banana taste. Surprisingly light and refreshing body, considering the 7.7% ABV. Very tasty.

Bottle from Berlin: hazy golden with a frothing white head. Great wheat aroma. Lots of banana along with other ripe fruit, sleight vinouse and also, spicy herb. Hight carbonation, nice balance. Alchohol, wheat sweetness, that light fresh wood and a light bitter finish. Nice
Cloudy gold, lasting white head.Nose of banana & cloves. Sweet start,spicyyeast, citrus notes. Fruity finish

Bottle from Purvis in a tulip glass. Served a bit warmer than I should have.

Thick head that is rather quick to disperse. Beautiful cloudy golden colour. Wheaty aroma with a bit of spice. Spices (mainly comprising of cinnamon and cloves) leap out on the palate with a fading banana aftertaste.  Thin feel on the tongue with a lively carbonation.

A truly fine beer from Weihenstephaner.

0,5 l. bottle poured in to a weizen.  Deeper golden colour with a big foamy, white head. Powerful fruit aroma with particularly banana, also other sweet fruits, coriander and some good yeasts. Taste is sweet and spicy. Medium body with a creamy texture, lively carbonated. Long lasting, very fruity finish with lots of yeasts and spices, hints of vanilla. This a weizen on steroids, I would recommend it for every wheat beer lover out there. Good stuff...
Fizzy with a nice foamy head. The sweet/hint of bitter combination Id expect from a Weihenstephaner. Very refreshing.

from bottle. pours a golden hazy colour with a frothy white, two-finger head. aroma is pear, apricot, banana and clove. basically tastes like the "normal" weihenstephaner hefe but definitely has a certain alcohol punch and a way more creamy texture to it. medium body and lively carbonation with a really long lasting fruity like finish. really enjoyable weizenbock, although i prefer others like the aventinus. however, very drinkable and recommendable!
Bubblegum, orange, grass, clove, banana, and straw in the aroma.  Flavor starts sweet, with carbonation and lots of spice providing a smooth finish.

New to the style, I wasnt sure what to expect here. Aromas were plentiful of clove, bananas, basil and light lemon zest. The taste was fairly fruity too, but quickly fading into a lemongrass twang with a mellow finish of yeast.

Another bottle share with Chipalsa. Thanks!! Nose is sweet and yeasty with some winter spices and bubble gum-like aromas. Rather interesting. This one had  a golden hue to it in the glass. The taste, for me, was all over the place and interesting. I got notes of ripe tomatoes, spices, yeast, aspartame, lemon/citrus, and wheat. A good brew but strange to me...
Great tasting strong wheat beer with sweet fruity taste. Also a taste of vanilla and spices. Good for a thirst quencher or session drinking.
Hazy, opaque gold with a thin white head. Banana/ester nose. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Pure flavors of banana and pear. Long, layered finish.

Pours a clear pale golden with a large pillowy white head. Aroma of esters, phenolics, and light wheat graininess. Flavor sweet banana and cloves with some wheat grain.  Finishes slightly sweet. Very nice rounded out body while still being a good refresher.

Appearance: Vitus pours a hazy, golden, light amber. Held to the light, oranges and yellow burst from the haze and almost make it glow. Superior. The head here is a finger and a half high mass of stark white, tiny bubbled foam. The thickness takes its time dissipating. It makes for an attractive and "classic" beer look. What should I expect from the oldest brewery in the world though? 

Smell: Cloves and bananas are the first things I detect. They dominate at first but theres a sweetness here followed by a wheat tang. Its neat, you can actually smell each layer come apart. Underneath everything is a peppery-ness to it all. Theres also a faint peach or apricot aroma...quite intoxicating. 

Mouthfeel: Very light. Vitus goes down incredibly smooth. Theres a weight here though, almost like a "cereal" texture inside it all. 

Taste: The first taste that hits has a creamy banana taste and quality. Its light but it lays on the tongue with confidence. As the creaminess fades and the beer moves to the middle of the tongue, theres a peppery-ness and the strong flavor of cloves. Each layer here is very simple and distinct. Its really something of beauty. As the beer finishes, everything smooths out and goes down as if it had never happened. Too drinkable. 

Overall: A reasonably price beer that looks, smells, feels and tastes amazing from the oldest brewery in the world. Could a beer lover ask for more? Id say no. Vitus is an all time favorite and a real showstopper for me. Pick this beer up. You will not be dissappointed.

Bottle from Beerart, Thessaloniki: Hazy golden colour with big white head. Aroma of banana, orange, licorice, yeast, wheat. Sweet taste, with banana, clove, lemon, yeast and wheat. Medium bodied with average to high carbonation. Overall, a very very very good beer, although it does not completely fit my taste.
Bottle at DØE. Hazy orange colour  with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, fruit, spice and wheat.

500 ml bottle into signature weizen glass, bottle code of 1291(mid 2011 bottling).  This took a while to fully pour haha.  Pours hazy golden orange color with a nice 3 finger dense white head with incredible retention that reduces to a thick cap that lasts.  Some spotty lacing on the glass with plenty of carbonation streaming up.  Aromas of big banana, clove, pepper, biscuit, orange, wheat, bubblegum, earth, and yeast spices.  Very nice aroms with good complexity and balance.  Taste of big banana, bubblegum, lemon, clove, pepper, orange zest, bread, wheat, earth, and yeast spices.  Fairly spicy finish; with lingering notes of banana, citrus, pepper, clove, bread, earth, and yeast spices on the finish for a good bit.  Incredible flavor balance of maltiness and yeast spiciness; with great complexity.  Medium carbonation and body; with fairly slick and creamy mouthfeel that is extremely smooth.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden for 7.7%, with pretty much no warming after the finish present.  Overall this is an absolutely fantastic weizenbock style.  Insane flavor balance and complexity, and extremely smooth to drink for the level of alcohol.  This one is definitely better when it is fresher (previous review was with an 09 bottle).

Buona. Aroma di pera, banana mediamente speziato. Al palato troppo carbonata (mio parere), gusto dolce bananoso, alcoholico e cerealoso. Buona ma lontana dalle eccellenze tipo lAventinus o la Meinel Weizenbock.

Pale yellow pour nice layer of white fluffy head .... aroma of wheat and bananas are fresh and very prominent with light citrus ... taste of spicy fruity yeast, bananas and wheat ... light detections of citrusy fruits ... dry lightly bitter finish and some warming abv .... easy drinking and smooth mouthfeel .... definitely a nice and flavorful brew

Draught at Taam HaIr food fair in Tel Aviv.  Cloudy-orange in colour, creamy, steady white head, fresh banana, fruit and a little clove aroma, sweet and subtle sour notes. Full body, soft carbonation, sweet aftertaste. Loved it.

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy pale orange with a healthy creamy white head.  Aroma is definitely more spice heavy than the usual wheat beer, with clove, yeast, banana, and black pepper.  Taste is more of the same, heavy spice, yeast,  and a big hit of banana and a mild sweetness.  For a wheat beer, this comes through with a little more malt, and a metallic bitterness that usually isnt present, especially in the finish.  The 7.7% is definitely evident.  Thumbs up.

Hazy yellow with big, foamy, white head / Bright nose of lemon, banana straw, clove, and coriander / Medium body, moderately tart and sweet, creamy, with beautiful balance and long finish with just a hint of bitterness / Flavors of orange, lemon, banana, clove, straw, and coriander / Near perfect, with an especially luscious body.
Cloudy golden orange. White frothy head. Banana, herb aroma. Fruit, spice flavour.Refreshing bitter finish.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of wheat, spices, candied sugars, bread and citrus fruits.  Medium hazy orange hue with an average white head that mostly diminished and left no lace.  Flavor is medium sweet and bitter.  Palate is medium bodied, watery with a lively prickly carbonation.  Overall a well done W Bock but not my favorite style.

On tap at a bar in Tel Aviv. Golden yellow with a big white head. Smells malty with citrus, fruit and yeast. Full wheat body with spices and light fruits. Med carbonation. Lots of wheat of the aftertaste with spice. Very balance, refreshing, and what I expected. Well done brew.
Pours a nice golden brown with decent head that dissipates. Smell is of wheat and fruit, and taste is similar, with a bit of an alcoholic aftertaste. Very good for a wheat beer.

Pours dark straw, light gold with large, long lasting white head, quite cloudy, strong carbonation.  Aroma of banana and clove, strong pils sweetness and bready malt, some sweetness.  Flavour has high carbonic acid bite on the back end, starts with banana and light sweetness, very light overall flavour with wheat the most prominent, finishes dry from carbonation with spice notes.  Thick and creamy mouthfeel, coats the mouth well.  Not much of a weizenbock, but a very nice strong, dry wheat beer.
Relatively light weizenbock which acts as a little brother to Aventinus. lacks a little fullness, but thankfully not alcoholic.

Pours a hazy yellow-orange. Much lighter than I expected. Light bubblegum banana nose. Flavor is much more like a hefe than a weizenbock. Bubblegum sweet, and light clove and banana. Definitely doesnt taste like 7.7% Wonderful.
Light touch of spicy hops, not too bitter. Bready, yeasty, citrus, some malt, but not heavy, with grapefruit dominating the finish. Mildly flavorful; a good fall or spring brew.

Pours a translucent straw color with a 3 finger head that lingers briefly then dissipates, leaving no lacing. Prominent bready malt. Mild lemon.. Hint of citrus hops.  Flavor starts sweet then mellows into a bitter character then has a brief finish.  Medium body with lively carbonation. Sticky palate.  Pretty good.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 Nice yeasty aromas with banana hints. 
High on carbonation with a really nice balanced body.
Fruity enough on taste. Citrus is more than taste-able.
Great refreshing wheat beer, full body tangy taste on the tongue, good alcohol content

Recently rated the best beer in the world. We were excited to try and it did not disappoint. Beer is golden and yellow with a white head. Surprisingly fruity and sweet. Somewhat yeasty. A great summer or winter beer. Aroma of bananas.

500 mL bottle. Coriander, cardamom and grapefruit on the nose, grassy and  a little buttery. Pours a cloudy pineapple color with an even head and little lacing. Refreshingly bitter with a lingering tart wheaty-banana aftertaste. Light to medium on the palate well carbonated. Not really well versed in wheat bocks, but this is enjoyable enough. Calls for some tropical fruit based desserts.

16.9 oz bottle.  Muddy golden brown with sheets of tiny bubbles mostly sustaining a snowy white head.  Nose is dough, caramel, clove and banana with a toasty finish.  Zesty carb, almost too sharp; a rest on the tongue reveals a creamy center.  Taste is clove bubblegum, anise, allspice and toffee.
On draft pour.  Haley golden color with picture perfect head.  Classic banana and clove esters from the yeast.  Very smooth for the alcohol.

500mL bottle from LCBO.  Pours cloudy yellow with a massive white head.  Aroma of banana, cloves, and some slight citrus notes.  Great delicate bubblegum, spice, and banana taste.  Surprisingly light and refreshing body, considering the 7.7% ABV.  Very tasty.

@ Ahven. Yellow hazy, good head. Wonderful weizen esters bouquet; banana, cloves, wheat, the works. Soft silky mouthfeel, intense taste. A bit bready finish. Excellent weizenbock. Not too hot or heavy, just a tad thicker weihenstephan.-- rated with lankku
Bottle at The Fiddler.  Hazy yellow with big white head.  Aroma Of banana, citrus, spice and yeast.  Same aspects in flavour with initial sweetness

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2012 Tap at the Euston Tap. Middle yellowish brown colour with smallish head. Strong aromas, wheat, spice, bit of alcohol. Taste is complex, great wheat beer fruity spice with a sweet punch from the malt. Long finish. Excellent beer.

Bottle. Hazy yellow/orange with a foamy white head. Aroma of bubble gum, banana/clove and fruity wheat. Flavor is sweet wheat malt, lightly tart yeast and a faint hop bitterness. Medium body with active carbonation and a smooth, frothy mouth feel. Not one of my favorite styles but this is good and drinkable.

One of the worlds great beers and I meet up for the first time, we have somehow missed each other over the years. We come together in Cork, Ireland of all places during Nov 2010: I saw and bought this bottle in The Abbots Ale House, and reviewed it in my hotel lounge. Sadly the glass used was a half-pint tumbler, I would have loved the correct glass.

The beer poured a lovely lemony yellow, slightly cloudy, almost murky. A pure white head sat on top for both pours, the beer a darker lemon colour on the second pour.

The smells were a fantastic mix, yeast, vanilla, sweet banana and semi-sour cooking apples all rolled into one.

The taste held all the aroma ingrediants along with some grapefruit citrus hints added. Unusually for this style, a maltiness could also be found in the wonderful amalgamation of flavours.

I was at one with the world while drinking this beauty. The 7.7%ABV just sits within the flavours without being noticed, a truely amazing and one-off beer (as ColoradoBobs has been telling me for years).

Yellow, quite cloudy body with an orange tint, supporting a large, creamy, white head that reduces to a fully lasting .5 cm layer rather quickly. Fair lacing. Did I mention that this was a gusher? Very strong sweet fruity and yeasty aroma with firm malty and hoppy notes. The banana is overwhelming, also spices, soap, perfume and hints of vanilla. The taste is initially very sweet indeed, followed by a light acidity and bitterness. Strong sweet flavours of sugary banana, citrus, spices, soap, perfume, also sweet honey and alcohol in the back. The body is surprisingly full (this is my first wizen bock, I was prepared for the usual light hefeweizen body), a smooth and syrupy texture with a very faint dryness in the aftertaste. An intense and highly enjoyable beer, barely on the right side of "not too sweet".
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 3 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

Great starting aroma of spice, citrus and a hint of banana. Hazy yellow and very effervescent . Looks more like a traditional hefe. Sweet, spicy, tart flavor, even some salt. Stands out as an easy drinker amongst a group of beers that start easy and end hard. The weizenbock is one of my favorite styles - a real champagne of beer -  but it throw the digestive pH off enough to relegate these beers to occasional treats. This ones somewhat more accessible than Ayingers example, though I felt it wasnt quite as good.
Nice colour with a medium head.  Lots of banana and spice aroma.  Plenty of banana and spice flavour with a nice hint of bitterness.  Very enjoyable.

Pours a cloudy orange colour with a tall frothy white head. Aroma is very wheaty with some yeast, banana and spices. Taste is also very wheaty with some yeast and banana leading to a slightly sour wheaty finish with some noticeable alcohol. Lovely soft mouthfeel. Top class beer although I was hoping for something darker being a weizen bock. Not sure it deserves the recently bestowed "Best Beer in the World" title either, but what do I know.

Smells of wheat, bread, corn, herbal, banana, citrus and fruitiness. Medium gold with a thick frothy creamy head. Smooth rich thin oily body. Taste of banana, corn, bread, hops andand a sweet fruitiness like peach. Nice to drink cold on a hot day. Sweet with low bitterness.

[ASPETTO] 			
color oro chiaro, leggermente aranciato, opaca			
[SCHIUMA]			
bianca, media presenza, piuttosto compatta, media  persistenza			
[OLFATTO]			
profumata con note di cereali, crosta di pane, miele, a cui si aggiungono lieviti e sensazioni floreali. Ce posto anche per quanche sentore alcolico.			
[GUSTO]			
saporita, con un inizio maltoso e dolce. Una base di lieviti e fumento accompaganno unendosi a sentori fruttati per un finale speziato e leggermente alcolico.			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio, ben carbonata  rimanendo comunque soave in bocca; alcohol percettibile soprattutto nel finale.			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
buona weizen bock, equilibrata, morbida in bocca ; la maggior sensazione maltata e lalcolicità la rendono più consistente e complessa sia al naso  che in bocca; finale dinamico , speziato e duraturo.

Pours an almost clear golden yellow/orange with a monster fluffy white head.  Smell is some light fruity esters, light spice and dough.  Taste is grain, clove and spice, some banana. Very light and refreshing for almost 8%.  Finely crafted brew.

Hazy golden pour, huge white head. Loads of banana, and yeast. Honestly im having a hard time fiding the difference between this and their regular hefe. I guess its a shade darker.....maybe. The cloves might be a little more pronounced, and its a touch maltier. When i had it on tap i actually thought i had been served the hefe by accident.

Hazy orange golden colour, firm white head. Aroma of malts, banana, loads of yeast, quite spicy and very fresh. Sweetish malty flavour, light bitterness and loads of spices. Finish malty and fresh.
(Draught @ Café Jos, Nijmegen)
Bottle from Ale Yeah! in Decatur, GA. Full, fruity wheat. Flowery hops and creamy mouthfeel.

Brown bottle, 500 ml, best before 16/02/13, purchased at the LCBO, savoured April 4 2012; eye: straw, hazy, light effervescence, voluminous white head, nice lacing; nose: yeast, bread, coriander, alcohol, clove, fruity; mouth: yeast, bread, coriander, maple, wheat, acidity, light citrusy, light fruity, finale in maple with presence of spices, medium body, good carbonation, lightly bitter and sweet, slick texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 500 ml, meilleure avant 16/02/13, achetée à la LCBO, savourée le 4 avril 2012; il : paille, voilée, légère effervescence, volumineuse mousse blanche, bonne dentelle; nez : levure, pain, coriandre, alcool, clou de girofle, fruité; bouche : levure, pain, coriandre, érable, blé, acidité, léger citrique, léger fruité, finale en érable avec présence dépices, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, légèrement amère et sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien bon

Fine head, lasting, Light golden in colour. Smoked nose with ham, wheat, raspberry and a little yeast. Medium body and some length. Taste is fat with raspberry and wheat. soft and not alcoholic. Really nice.
Pours a cloudy golden color. Smell is bursting with spices, banana. Taste is very flavorful, banana, clove, spice, very complex, alcohol well hidden. Overall a top notch beer.

Poured from 16.9 oz bottle into weizen glass
Aroma: orange zest and corriander.  Lemon peel and grass. Hay.  
Appearance: bright orangish yellow with 4th finger head that faded slowly.   Hazy and lots of bubbles. 
Taste:  medium sweet and light sour. Hardly any bitter.  
Palate:  medium body and full texture.  Very rich and full.  Average to high carbonation.  Slight Sour aftertaste.  Alcohol taste is just barely there 
Overall:   very good beer.  I enjoyed this.  Aroma and taste are great.

bottle. Cloudy orange colour, big frothy head. Aroma of banana, yeast, spices. Big taste relflects the aroma, also some floral notes. Bubbly and syrup mouthfeel. This is a big, bold, and very good beer.
500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours slightly hazy, straw coloured, with big frothy white head.  Nice big spicy aroma, pepper, banana, similar taste.  Highly bubbly, almost like champagne.  Real good!

500ml @ Håndverkerstuene, Oslo. Murky light orange/brown in color with a great foamy head. Not the greatest retention, but I blame the glasses this time. Aromas full with the typical weizen bock bready aromas, banana, clove, some citrus. Full body. Great mouthfeel! 
This one is the best from Weihenstephaner. But my favorite is Aventius from Schneider, which is a bit darker in color and packed with more flavors.

A cloudy orange with a small foamy head that caps the beer through out. The aroma has some banana, wheat, clove, some orange and lemon. The flavor has the same with a nice lively mouth feel. The finish is dry and very refreshing.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2012 poured from bottle into a pilsner glass. Pours a clear gold color with a nice and foamy head.

excellent depth with really good aromas of bananas, lots of various white florals, and some bits of malts.

very smooth and really good medium body and feel. Very good depth with flavors of malts, bananas, and citrus flavors with a touch of white florals.

this was a real quality weizenbock. Well balanced with real good depth in both the aromas and flavors. The feel was extremely good

Had a hard time finding this one in Ottawa, so got it at the LCBO in Niagara Falls on my trip there. Pours a cloudy golden-amber colour with a soapy off-white head that dissipates averagely and leaves minimal lace. Quite a spicy smelling beer we have here. Belgian yeast and soft wheat as well. Wet mouthfeel that is medium-full bodied with no burning at all. Matly wheat taste with some of the spices nicely blended in. Very mild aftertaste of bananas and bubblegum (but not as dominant as most weizen). A good beer, but not sure why this one is rated so highly. Kind of soft in all aspect.

(500mL from the LCBO)  Poured cold, a hazy pale gold with a relatively small, rocky white head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum sweetness, yeast, wheat, a little spice and alcohol. Flavour banana, wheat grain, grassy, lightly citrus with spice.  Crisp at first, moderately sweet in the middle with grassy bittering hops and alcohol drying the finish. Fairly full-bodied, well-carbonated with lively bubbles, some light booziness but very refreshing. Very good beer, like an amped-up hefeweizen.

Ive been wanting to try this one for years since I seen it pictured in a Michael Jackson book.  Has some strong spice notes.  It really is well balanced between both the brew styles.  Even has that something "extra" that makes it stand out.  Absolutely terrific and well crafted beer from one of Germanys finest

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a cloudy, pale orange-yellow with large white head.  Aroma is banana, wheat and a light spiciness.  Flavour is quite wheaty with some banana and other fruit as well as a little spice.  Solid body.  Pretty good.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2015 Golden colour with a lasting head, you can tell that it is more alcoholic than the average weissen but far from being something bad, it makes it unique, well balanced and having an smashing flavour

Pale yellow with a tight white head.  Alcohol, bananas,spice(clove?) in the nose.  Light fruity sweetness in the middle, still the small  bite of alcohol.  Surprisingly light bodied and lively.   I expected something slightly darker, but this was  a real pleasant surprise.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Vika. Pours hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma of banana, wheat with hints of yeast and spices. Very fruity and quite refreshing. Not much bitterness, but some acidity. Alcohol is well hidden.
Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a fizzy white head.  Aroma is grain, wheat and some banana.  Taste is a great malt and grain profile, small hop appearance and banana and corriander.  Great beer.
Wow, this beer brings so many memories back for me from Germany. Aroma is spot on for a great Weizen. Pours a beautiful thin yellow with a very thick white head.

pours hazy light golden with a tall off-white head, excellent retention and lacing. bananas, light acidity, wheat, citrus, very hint of sweetness. medium to full body, soft and lively carbonation, big grassy medium finish. excellent brew!
banana, bread, had additional mild fruity elements.cloudy, medium sweetness, light taste, hoped for a fuller taste but not terrible at all, light body, would have another, on tap

500ml bottle 
7.7% ABV 
I tried this beer on March 2, 2012 after purchasing from the Queens Quay LCBO outlet in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a hazy gold colour with a generous snow white rocky head.  Aroma is yeast, wheat, banana, and spices.  The mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour is sweet malt, some yeast, and some fruit tones.  Tastes great.  If only wheat beers looked better!

A bit underwhelming and disappointing. Pour is a beautiful hazy yellow with nice bubbly carbonation and a thick, dense head. Beautiful yellowish head with some light lacing. The nose is sweet and wheaty with a few notes of bubblegum, clove, lemon rind and a bit of banana. The middle has sweet malty notes, but not much else at all. A nice wheat, yeasty and lemony finish. A few bubblegum and clove spice notes, but not much else. Overall, not a fantastic brew, but pretty tasty.

500. Pours a hazy bright gold with a towering dense and creamy white head. Smoky bacon tang on top of a bit of wheat sour. Creamy light body with lively carb. Banana, wheat, and bacon mid palate with a bacony finish. Good beer.

On bottle
Light hazy golden
Intense palate of banana
Medium body and complexity
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: 1 month from racking. Poured a murky honey-gold in the glass, massive white cap and lively natural effervescence. Aromas of clove, apricot, bubble gum. Nice wash of biscuit malts in front, well balanced with fruity tones, some spice, hop presence gives sufficient bittering to create some pleasant layering. Finishes rather dry with some nice noble herbal bitterness. Warming, satisfying. Flavor and character are that of a great double wheat beer or imperial wheat rather than a heller bock. Very drinkable.

500ml bottle pours a cloudy golden color with a big fluffy white head but not much lacing.  Smells mostly of bananas, but the complex arome has lots of bread, malts and some other fruits.  Taste is on the bitter side, with some pepper.  Medium to full body.  Perfect carbonation and a satisfying finish with alcohol that creeps up on you.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a fluffy head.  The overpowering banana aroma had me scared.  This is subdued in the flavor however, which is dominated by wheat malt, stone fruit, and a peppery finish.  The mouthfeel is excellent, with a chewy body balanced by a bright clean finish.  Just the right amount of bitterness, and no hop aroma.  Some alcohol is definitely evident.  Very enjoyable and versatile overall.

Chalice from bottle. A: pretty strong nose, lots of fruit, mandarin orange, wheat, hint of lime, some red fruit - maybe dragon fruit, not sure. App: very hazy, medium darkened golden color, frothy khaki head. T: very pungent, goes from sweet in the front to bitter in the back, lots of fruit with a tad bit of malt, alcohol goodness. P: bubbly on the tongue smooth down the throat.
alcohol, banana, toast, cloudy, sparkling, white foam, cloudy, amber, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, full body, slick feel, lively,
Nice amber colour with medium head. Aroma is fruits, yeast and bread. Aroma is sweet. Some caramel, banana, yeast and some bitterness. Decent.

Very enjoyable brew.  Combines two of my favorite styles into an extremely solid product.  Pours a light brown with light tan head, minimal lacing.  Aroma obvious of wheat, toasted caramel malt, yeast, and spices.  Flavor matches well and goes down all too easy.

Nice amber colour with foamy German lasting head. The nose is full of bready and fruity yeast. The taste is sweet caramel all over the palate with a hint of a sour note at the back. Very enjoyable but loses a bit of drinkability because it is just so sweet

Strong banana and wheat aroma.  I really enjoyed this one compared to the other I had by this brewery.  Great soft taste, some citrus, soft carbonation.  Pleasant beer to drink.  Definitely have again. Bottle.

Remarkably similar to the hefeweiss in a lot of ways.  Pours a swampy light orange, plenty of head.  Aromas of bananas, bread, cloves.  Taste is maybe a little sweeter but retains tartness/bitterness to balance.  Alcohol is utterly invisible.

Bottle 50cl, a cloudy golden orange beer with huge creamy head. Nose is on banana and fresh bread. Aroma is malty with bread and wheat notes slightly fruity with a light caramel body, very creamy, alcohol is well hidden. Finish is long with apricot, almond and caramel notes, bubblegum hints, very smooth, some hops bitterness at the finish. A great one even if lees syrupy that great weizenbocks.

hay, cheese, citrus, herbs, coffee, butterscotch, smoke, vanilla, soy sauce, golden, sparkling, white foam, rocky head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, salty, full body, creamy, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish, bitter,

March 6, 2012; 7.7% abv, 500 mL bottle. BBD: 26/02/2013; refrigerated, beermug
Nose of fruity esters, mostly banana with some cloves. As it warms, there is a bit of mustiness in the nose. Pours a beautiful hazy and dark golden colour with thick white head. Nice active carbonation. Bottle is pretty nice, too. Tastes as it smells, flavours of banana, spice and bready malts. There is some hops, though well blended and clean, mostly herbal and earthy tastes. Alcohol is well hidden, which could get dangerous. Beer is very clean with a light refreshing body. Flavours sit nicely in the mouth. This is excellent, both tasty and refreshing. Glad I have more.

Yeah this is great! Up front its very cereal with almost buttery notes. Middle is very yeasty with a very dry spicy finish. Big carbonation in the mouth with a medium creamy feel. Pours straw coloured and very cloudy. Big massive head that dissipates to a small foamy white layer.

From the bottle, hazy gold with a soft white pillowy head. Aroma is hay, caramel, vanilla, floral. Begins with a soft subtle tartness that makes way to a sweet sharpness on the end. Very pleasant.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 10, 2012 Very tasty! Has some nice spice with some sweet flavour. A very nice wheat. I really enjoyed this beer. Top shelf regardless of style.

500ml bottle from the LCBO. pours hazy golden with a lasting white head. basically an imperial hefe. one of my least favourite styles but pretty well executed. when i think weizenbock i think aventinus and this pales in comparasin.

From the tap @ Kirjakauppa, Pori. Pours hazy yellow with medium creamy head. Aroma has wheat, spices and grass. Taste is sweeter than the aroma with wheat, banana, yeast and coriander. Medium carbonated and medium mouthfeel. Slightly bittter aftertaste. Smooth and well balanced. Hides the alcohol well. A really good beer but still lacking that special something in it .

Hazy golden pour, a finger of white head.  Wheat, clove, orange, banana in the aroma.  Tastes as it smells, wheat, clove, orange, lemonpeel, banana, a bit bready.  Medium bodied, fairly creamy mouthfeel.  very slight hint of alcohol.  looking forward to revisiting this after a few months.

0.5l bottle from LCBO, served in a weizen glass. Pours a bright orange-yellow. Huge frothy white head. Tons of carbonation. Aroma: Strongly smells of bananas, orange, cloves and grass. Palate: Smooth, medium bodied, though thicker than most weissen. Fair amount of carbonation. Taste: Quite sweet. More oomph than typical weissen. Complex flavour. Quite nice - very pleasant to drink.
Hazy yellow colour. Usual weizen banana like flavours and aromas, enhanced. Very enjoyable

It pours murky golden yellow with a reddish tint; the head is off-white and foamy. The aroma has notes of: sweet wheat, honey, bananas, slight coriander, and peppery yeast. The taste is medium sweet that finishes with a long medium sour note; there are notes of: lime zest, bananas, coriander, yeast, slight pepper, and slight sour dough. The palate is medium full bodied, lively carbonation, mouth-filling. Overall, it is the best Weihenstephaner product that Ive tried, thus far.  Though, it is a mediocre wheat beer in general.
Pours  golden nice wheat beer head, aroma is very nice, floral and lots of wheat in the flavour, dont really taste much bockness to this one, but very nice stuff

500mL lickbow bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head that dissipates but never really goes away. Smells like yeasty hay, malty, spicy, citrusy, hits every note you would want it to. Tastes like a well done Belgian Strong Blonde, yeasty, powdered sugar, spice, lots of spice, checked by sweetness, but good sweetness and not over or under attenuated because its a well-crafted German beer that has been brewed for the past few centuries and by now they can pretty much make world class beer in their sleep.Mild banana. Lemon lime. Spritzy palate, medium body. I like it, and the price is awesome. Salty finish? I would drink this again, although what I really want from Weihenstephaner is the Korbinian, but surely the LCBO will deliver, guys, lets just wait...................

This is the brewery that actually made me love a Dunkelweiss, so, I mean, theres that.........

Pours a large, fluffy, off-white head, many centimeters in height and made up of medium-sized bubbles, creating a dense, sponge-like effect.  Head declines over several minutes to a persistent cap atop the beer.  Leaves small spots of lacing, nothing exciting.  Body is lighter than Aventinus, this a dark and hazy yellow-gold with orange and yellow highlights when held to the light. Hazy to the point of barely being able to see my hand through the glass, but can still make out some modest carbonation.

Aroma of wheat malt, old bananas, vanilla, and some bread. Not noticing phenolics or spices; wouldnt even be thinking about them if others hadnt mentioned detecting them. Seems simpler, less complex, than Aventinus.

Taste opens with sweetness and tanginess from wheat malt, dense banana bread, noticeable phenolics such as nutmeg and clove. Transitions midway to large amounts of pale wheat and barley malt sweetness with intense bananas, reduced phenolics, vanilla, and caramelized sugar.  Taste closes out with slight ethanol and some mild, but noticeable chocolate notes, which is a little unexpected, but interesting.

Body is medium to medium-heavy with modest carbonation, allowing for a smooth, creamy mouthfeel with just a bit of foaming up on the palate. Finish is dry, slightly sticky from sweetness.  Instead of being obviously smelt or tasted, alcohol burn is felt in the back of the mouth, throat, after each sip.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090530.
Pours cloudy golden colour with large foamy head. Aroma of citrus, herbs, wheat, banana, apricot and some spices. Flavour of citrus, apricot, wheat, spices and mandarin. Very fruity brew.
4335
Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a high head. Aroma weiss, banana. Very well balanced, hides the alcohol totally. Some citrus feel. Classic bock weisse. Not Bad.

Drinking this beer. in a glass. light gold haze. small white cap. smells of bananas. Also some cloves. Citrus is here. Other things too. I find yeast. Darker than most. Smells pretty good. Said above before. Better than feet. Praise the lord. Taste is solid. Nice and soft. Obvious alcohol sucks. Bananas are toasty. Wheat is darker. Cloves weak enough. Coriander works well. Light citrus intrigues. Smooth in yap. Goes back well. Pretty much forgettable. Old Spidermans on. Such riveting action. Love fight music. Is Spidey Ok? Parafinos Wax Museum. Another timeless classic.
amber color with slight haze, aroma is sweet banana, citrus, coriander, flavor is banana, orange coriander, and some malty sweetness, very clean and crisp

500ml brown bottle. Golden hazy pour. White head which flares up impressivley upon first pour, but settles to a thin creamy ring and leaves little to no lace in the glass. Nose has lots of yeast - cloves and bananas esters. Taste has some soft lemon and clove spice upfront with some sweetness, big wheaty middle. Finish has a hint of hopping, light spiciness and ends fairly dry. There is a slight perception of alcohol, but pretty laid back for 7.7% abv. Soft and creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied. Overall this was an enjoyable brew with all the usual weizenbock characteristics present. Its certainly not as complex or "big" as others Ive had in this style, but I think this is a beer I might pick up from time to time. A good value at under 5 bucks a bottle.

50cl bottle. Murky golden colour with a large, frothy, creamy white head. Aroma is moderate banana, sweet,  and moderate malty. Flavour is fruity, slightly citrus with a final moderate bittery with an average duration. Dense on palate. Carbonation is low to medium. Texture is oily. Body is medium to high.
Bottle from Coppers in Newcastle. Cloudy yellow coloured with a sweet banana and vanilla flavour, warming alcohol followed by a sweet, fruity and dry finish.
Pours golden yellow with a nice half inch head. Aromas of banana and wheat. Nice sweet taste of banana and wheat with a nice tart finish. High carbonation and very refreshing and drinkable.
que buena birria; una de las mejores de trigo que he probado.  esta cervecería no falla

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 16.9 fl oz bottle, $4 from BellaVino. Half-hazy faded yellow color. A very nice one-finger amount of persisting foamy white head. Really big body, pronounced, but smooth and fine carbonation. Spicy clove taste on a malty wheat base. Citrus peel. Kind of sour and acidity. After sampling a few weizenbocks from lesser-known breweries and really enjoying them, Im disappointed by this offering from Weihenstephaner. Decent, but not nearly as drinkable or tasty as others Ive tried. 6/5/5/3/12 Re-rate, 7/26/15: 11.2oz bottle from Dutchs. Hazy golden orange color. Thin off-white head. No lace sticks. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of crisp moderate carbonation. Sort of an abrupt texture. Mild dry finish. Nice big banana, mild spice, some nutty character. Moderate-plus sweet taste, lighter to moderate bitter. Unique, interesting weizenbock. Pretty solid and tasty. Not the benchmark for the style that I see the Hefe Weiss as being, though.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Re-rate: Sunny color, slightly hazy, with massive foamy white head. Heady Banana cream pie on the first whiff, followed by dried wheat. Flavours are very nice dried wheat, and banana, with a hint of bubble gum.
Yellow/orange colour. Lively bready aroma, very nice. Bready malty wheat taste. Excellent beer.

Cloudy, straw coloured with a thick, creamy white lid. Bags of citrus fruit, berries, banana and tiger balm interestingly. Hugely aromatic. Wow all come through on the palate, particularly and a hint of the tiger balm. Medium low carbonation and full bodied. Vibrant full or aroma and flavour. Love it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle- Pours a hazy golden color with a billowy head that slowly fades to nice lacing. Aroma of fruit, primarily banana, with spice some fresh grain and bit of citrus. Taste of banana, mild fruit, some sweetness and a nice subtle bitterness and a clean finish. Fairly medium body, smooth and creamy. very nice balance, not being overly sweet. Easy drinker, good example of the style. Well worth a try.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Cloudy gold pour with a white head. Tangerine and sweet spice aroma. Banana, pear and tangerine flavour. Fruity finish.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy, light orange with a large, off-white head.  Sweet aroma with banana and wheat notes.  Flavor is sweet with wheat, banana and clove notes.  Strange mouthfeel and finish.

One of the best examples of this style. Pours a hazy golden color with a prominent white foam head that retreats to the edges over time. Aromas are heavy banana, clove. More prominent than in a typical hef. Flavor again delivers with the banana and cloves but there is also a pleasant minerality working behind the scenes. Full on the palate with a nice creamy texture as it warms. Just an excellent beer.

very flora, tropical fruits, banana esters, pous golden hue,hazy, strong white head, stays around, really getting banana at first followed by tropical fruits, not heavy, very light crisp Citruis esence,overall, A good solid weizenbock
user_location: @RED BHUT JOIKIAS!, Paulsboro, New Jersey, USA

text: Heerlijk bier. Iets zoetig maar toch sprankelend fris. Jammer dat het aroma vooral zurig en gistachtig is. In de nasmaak blijft vooral het zuurtje over.

500 ml. Cloudy golden with a lasting ring of foam. Aromas of spicy banana, wheat and toast. Tastes of biscuit, caramel, lemony bread yeast, clove and banana. Medium body is well-balanced, and an easy drinker.

A: Bright golden yellow body. Massive white creamy head with billions of tiny bubbles. Great retention before crashing to a hearty skim. Spotty lacing left behind.

S: Light banana, wheat, and clove notes. Other subtle sweet fruits lie in the background. Ever so slight booze notes.

T: Like the nose, this is a bright banana, clove and wheat blast. The notes are definitely stronger here than in the nose though. Again, there are some miscellaneous fruit notes hiding in the background. Most notable is a slight mellow navel orange sweetness. Also some sweet, fresh biscuit maltyness is present.

M: Refreshing, moderate weight body. Clean, crisp finish. Substantial, but not distracting carbonation levels.

O: Overall, a very enjoyable brew. It doesnt quite have the flavor complexity of Aventinus, but that shouldnt stop anyone from picking this brew up and giving it a go.
Bottle. Yellow, slightly cloudy with bubbly white head. Pronounced banana clove flavour. Some well controlled sweetness. A well balanced and thoroughly enjoyable beer.

Bottle. Poured hazy yellow. Clearly unfiltered. Yeasty nose. Wheat notes could almost be confused with Belgian yeast. Some sweetness yet finishes dry. Usually not a wheat fan, but really enjoyed this and maybe it will help expand my personal horizon.

Sample at Winking Lizard. The beer is a slightly cloudy pale yellow color with a medium foamy white head that recedes steadily. Small patches of lacing. Aroma of yeast, banana and malt. Medium body with a sweet wheat and banana character as well as notes of earthy malt and yeast. The finish is sweet with a banana aftertaste. Above average overall.

Bottle. Rating #782. Hazy dark yellow pour with a white head. Light aroma, subtle lemon and banana notes. Flavor is similar, light fruitiness, more banana and lemon, slightly acidic and pretty tasty overall. (2100)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle - Pours hazy yellow with a nice foamy white head. Big fruity nose, with banana, cantaloupe, light clove, and a sticky sweetness. Taste is a little sharper, with some biting carbonation and a hint of the 7.7%. It still has all the sweetness of the aroma, with the big banana/bubblegum aromas, with a sweeter, more pronounced wheatiness. Tastes pretty much as Id expect, but Id like it to be a little more restrained on the sweetness. The body is nice and full, slick and syrupy, with a nice carbonation level. Very good stuff, if a little sweet.
From a bottle. Pours cloudy golden with white head. Typical hefe aroma, banana and cloves. Similar taste. Crisp and clean.

500 mL bottle from Beers of Europe into a pint glass.  Yellow/orange cloudy beer with a good bubbly head on it.  Good wheat aroma with a little more to it.  Pleasant weiss beer, but not as different as I was expecting.  Dry, wheaty, slightly boozy.

Pours hazy yellow into the glass with a small white head.  Strong citrus attacks the nose with candy and banana notes.  Faint hints of thyme.  Taste is mostly sweet with a light sourness and bitterness.   Light body with a very creamy texture.  Finish is bitter and lasts for about 15 seconds before you are ready for another sip.  This is highly drinkable.

Bottle (past its shelflife). Hazy yellow pour with a big white head. Banana, bread, caramel and wheat in the aroma. Same hints in the taste. A lot of bread notes with the banana, bock notes and wheat notes. Very nice and long aftertaste with some hops. Very nice!
Pours a cloudy yellow, with a thick white head. Aromas of fruit and banana, with a full body feel and a sweet, smooth finish
UPDATED: APR 28, 2015 Had bottle a truly great beer really refreshing taste good look and smell will drink again

On tap at Csak a jó sör. Cloudy, light yellow liquid with minimal white head. Aroma is sort of bitterish with citruses some slight herbal notes and almond maybe. Taste brings in the more usual wheaty sweetness: a bit of honey and sweet wheat mush. Very complex weizen bock, I really like how balanced and still exciting is the taste and the aroma.
Tap - average foamy head, hazy light straw color, mild spice aroma, mild spice aroma, mild wheat/dry hop flavor

500ml bottle

Pours light yellow with a small white head. Aroma has notes of banana, malts, yeast and earthy notes. Taste is quite fruity and malty with notes of bananas, spices and earthy hints. Full bodied, smooth finish. Nice, quite balanced weizen bock.

Flaske 0,5l. Gave fra Rune. Drukket hjemme 19 Sep 11. Gyldenbrun. Veldig uklar. Ikke pen. Høyt luftig skum som varte noen minutter. God hveteølaroma. Sitrus o.s.v. Veldig søt på smak. Litt plommer, litt rosiner. Mye kullsyre. Antydning til bitterhet i ettersmaken. Skuffende.

Bottle, Coppers, Ncl. This is a really excellent beer. Pours a hazy pale gold, with a large, pillowy, white head. Beautifully sweet, but not sickly, subtle spices and cloves anda lovely sugary aftertaste, which is totally in balance. Has a lasting finish, with the alcohol arriving quite late, to give a warming sensation in the chest.

My favorite of the Weihenstephaner line.  Aroma of spice and citrus.  Body medium to light.  Tastes of banana, wheat, and some darker fruit.  Tried with Jay, Jess, and Vaughn at the KC beerfest (10/17/2009) before Jay and Laurens Oktoberfest.

On tap at gourmet Haus. Pours a hazy gold with massive carbonation. Smooth full and billowy white head. Great spice on the nose. Delicate. Well rounded mouthfeel of chewy biscuit. Spice throughout the finish.

03.12.2011. 0,5l Bottle. vinmonopolet.no. Yellow colour with large white head. Unclear. Sour at first with notes of lemon. Wheaty with flavours of yeast and herbal lemony hops. Rather thin body. Stinging taste of carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy light copper colour. White head. Aroma mostly banana but has also caramel in it. Pleasant yeasty taste with a slight bitterness.
Amber with nice head. Aroma yeast, fruit, citrus, Taste sweet fruit, yeast,  and sour citrus, wheat. Medium body, text smooth, carb aver, alcohol hidden. Easy to drink.

Very strong on the nose. The aroma dominates this beer. Hard to place the smells I get from it. Standard couldy/hazy wheat beer in appearance. Goes down very very easily. Has a soft fruity blend. Overall not one Id normally go for but could happily drink at any time of day or night. Bloody hard to describe!
medium sweetness, lightly bitter, distinguished wiess beer flavours huge range of palate, smooth, foaming gentle finish. Overall after much hype, this beers delivers. Worthy of the score!

500 ml bottle.  Served in a weizen glass, the beer pours a cloudy straw gold color with a couple inch frothy white head that sticks around for a while.  Theres a small amount of lacing left on the glass.  The brew smells like wheat, lemon peel, banana, and cloves.  Taste is pretty much just like the aroma, but theres also the addition of some bubblegum and orange flavors.  Its a little sweeter tasting than I was expecting, but thats a good thing in this case.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit creamy and has good carbonation.  Overall, I think its a pretty good brew.  A great deal for just $2.99 a bottle, definitely recommended.
A typical wheat beer color but a little bit deeper than it. In the aroma there is some honey with wheat. The flavor like a banana tree in the middle of a lemon field.

0,5l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. The color is an interesting mixture of white and amber. Its hazy, coludy with white frothy head. Harmonical aroma of citrus, resin, alcohol, hay and a little banana. Light sweet taste. Full body with creamy texture. Dense and strong, very delicious! Lively carbonation. Long bitter-sweet finish. Its the best weizenbock, Ive ever tasted. Stong, delicious, characteristic, harmonic. One of my favourite beers!

Bottle 500ml @ home
Pours cloudy deep golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, banana and citrus. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2011 Nice beer overall, great aroma.... Its even better if you pair this beer with a fine cheese.....
Excellent Weizen Bock. Very light in color, very rich in taste, borderline sour. Sweat - banana-like. Very easy to drink.
500 ml bottle that pours a cloudy yellow, with aromas of banana, bread, and some citrus.  Favors of clove, bread, lemon zest, and a touch of sweetness with a slightly dry finish.

Location/Date: Bottle on November 16th, 2011..
Appearance: Pours a yellow cloud.
Aroma: Aroma is wheaty, bready and citrus.
Taste: Sweet like a hefeweizen.
Palate: Medium body, lignering aftertaste.
Summary: I found this to be quite tasty, fits perfectly with my late 2011 German beer kick.

[500ml bottle, Appellation Wines, Edinburgh] Hazy, opaque golden with a huge fluffy head. Sweet banana aroma, but plenty of citrus fruit in there as well. Bready yeast on the nose too. Rich, sweet mouthfeel, far more banana than clove on the initial taste, then a sweet honey finish with some lemon fruit on the end. Very nice, more than a hint of alcohol about it as well [17112011]

Thought this was delicious.  wheaty with a full flavor and a lot of fruit and citrus, particularly banana.  Huge full mouthfeel yet quite easy to drink...hides the alcohol completely.  Bigger, bolder and fuller than your basic hefeweizen, and I liked it.

500ml bottle. A gusher, just caught it in time. Poured with a large frothy, rocky, slowly fading white head leaving a loose lace & a sparkling, slightly hazy golden orange body. (Poured in 2 halves. The second time round, with the sediment agitated, it poured darker & opaque with haze.) A dryish estery, banana, lemon forward nose with a hint of range & some delicate wheat. Bright & crisp sweetness, dryer towards the end on the tongue. Sugary banana, esters, wheat & an ever so slight (almost non-existant) bitterness. Lingering, lightly tangy aftertaste. Fresh but chewy, juicy medium body. Generous carbonation, firm mouthfeel & a slight warmth in the throat. Really enjoyable & refreshing despite the hefty-ish ABV. I liked the full sugary fruitness that was tempered by that characteristic weizen dryness.

Bottle. Moderate aromas all around, with light bread and hay for the malt, lemon for the hops, soap and cheese for the yeast, with clove and banana in the background. Head is large, creamy, white with fair lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is hazy amber. Flavor starts lightly sweet and acidic, then the long finish is lightly to moderately sweet and faintly acidic. Palate is medium, slick, with a lively carbonation. Great balance and strong fruity sweetness in this Weizen Bock. Which is probably why Marianne loved this.

11-NOV-2011, draft @"Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa", Rome.
Cloudy beige with a huge white head that really coats the glass. Lovely weisse aroma and taste with all the right yeasty elements and then an extra citrus element that adds freshness to an quite full and creamy brew.
Marianne loved this.

Cloudy pale yellow color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, bananas, & spice; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, clove, and some citrus; Nicely balanced; The alcohol is well hidden; Overall, really good brew.

Poured from bargain $3 / 16.9 oz bottle - Yes!  Really liked this one.  Not that familiar with weizenbocks, but I recognize those Belgian-type flavors of banana, clove, caramel, and orange.  Its like a high-octane Belgian--basically.  Alcohol does come through on the end, but I like it, especially considering the price.

500 ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a large foamy white head.  Aroma of bread, bananas, wheat and spices.  Taste is bananas, yeast, wheat, citrus and spices.  Lots going on here.  A bit sweet.  Very good.

Vitus tiene un color amarillo muy particular es turbia cuando se destapa el olor es bastante marcado a fruta con varios aromas de flores incluyendo clavos dulces,al paladar es muy intensa pero bien agradable,para mi paladar es demasiado  aromatica y, una es muy agradable,varias me cansan un poco. La recomiendo porque es bastante particular ,diferente a las otras weizenbock
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text:
UPDATED: AUG 21, 2012 7/VIII/2012 - 50cl bottle @ Weihenstephan brewery (Freising) - BB: 27/IX/13 - (2012-xxx) 
Ar:7, Ap: 4, T: 7, P: 3, O: 14, Total: 3.5
Cloudy pale yellow beer, aery white head, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: quite some banana, spices, apothecary, bubble gum, disinfectant. MF: lively carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet ripe too overripe banana, sugary, some citrus, bit herbal, mainly sweet. Aftertaste: banana, bit sugary. Im still not convinced.

30/10/2011 on tap @ Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà , Rome (2011-600)
Ar: 7, Ap: 5, T: 6, P: 4, O: 14, Total: 3.6
Cloudy pale yellow to beige beer, creamy white head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: wheat, bit of smoke, citrus, some cheese. MF: good carbon, full body. Taste: citrus fruits, bit of sweet malts, dough, honey, flowers, little sweet. Aftertaste: cheesy, bitter, some citrus.

Bottle. Nice hazy golden colour wtih a creamy white head on top. Good carbonation going on. Aroma of vanilla, banana and sugar. Flavour is full of ripe banana sweetness and feels really creamy. I could drink loads of this stuff... awesome.

(Flasche in Weißbierglas) Das Vitus hat ein schöne, starke Hefetrübung und eine orange-gelbe Färbung, die fast ins bräunliche geht. Abgerundet wird das Aussehen durch eine feine, weiße Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist sehr malzig und wirkt etwas schwer. Der Geschmack hingegen ist nicht so schwer, dennoch aber vollmundig-malzig, mit einem gut erkennbaren hopfigen Gaumengeschmack. Zusammenfassend ein leckerer, süffiger Weizenbock

Bottle. Zero idea why I havent rated this yet, have had it so many times. Being a fan of Weihenstephaners hefe, this is just impossible to dislike. Its like the hefe, just more of everything. Pours a light cloudy yellow with a huge rocky head that leaves tons of lacing everywhere. Aroma is big on ripe banana, lemon, cloves, breadiness, yeast. Fairly sweet tasting at first, it follows up with a spicy and fruity midsection with a good amount of sourness and bitterness to balance it off perfectly. One of the best things about it is its velvety, full, thick, creamy mouthfeel. Very drinkable. Simply delicious.

500ml bottle poured a deep golden color with a big white head with great retention leaving some thin lacing on the glass.  Aroma is fruity with some malts and hops.   Taste is lightly toasted malty sweetness and some fruitiness and a mild pleasant hoppy bitter finish.  Medium body and nice carbonation round things out.  A very nice brew which is highly recommended.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2011 Troebel goudkleurig bier met goede witte kraag. Vergelijkbaar met een "gewoon" weizenbier maar dan met iets meer karamel. Niet onaardig, maar het voegt weinig toe en mist bij mij elke associatie met herfst en bok.

Tasted bottle from Whole Foods into nucleated pint glass. Pours a hazy, deep golden color (less dark than I expected,) with huge, firm, white foam. The head was so long-lasting, I had to stop and wait several times in order to pour the entire bottle. This was my first Weizenbock. Ive been impressed with everything from Weihenstephaner, the worlds oldest brewery. Famous for their lager yeast, and their definitive German lager style beers, I just assumed this was one as well. It turns out, despite regular bocks being lagers, Weizenbock is an ale style. To me, Weihenstephaner ale yeast exhibits many of the same memorable characteristics as their lagers, just more of them: clouds of fruit, clove, pepper, even some banana. Very full-bodied malt-sweetness, balanced by noble bittering hops, virtually no aroma hops. Nice soft, round effect from the wheat. Sparkling carbonation, lasting pleasant aftertaste. Estery and delicious. High alcohol by volume percentage, but utterly undetectable. However, a few minutes after finishing it, it felt like Id had several. Possibly a brewing masterpiece.

Hazy orange with creamy and, eh, flexible white head. Very fruity, with plums, banana, white grapes and red apple, but also quite floral and spicy hops and a bready  base. Taste is quite balanced and easily drinkable. Much like a hefeweizen with some darker sweet notes. Smooth body and dimmed alcohol. Its all a little to much hidden and delicate maybe. Body is great, though. (50cl, 2,00 EUR)

I am biased, I love this beer. Poured half a 50cL bottle into a snifter. Large, lively residing white head. Bright orange color. Traditional banana aroma of a weissen, but this weizenbock has a citrus smell that together with the color fools you into an orange aroma. Light body nice mix of wheat and barley malts in the flavor. This beer is a gift...

500 ml bottle. Hazy orange body with a big, creamy off-white head. Pleasant aroma of ester, fruit and wheat. Not particular strong on aroma but distinct. Flavor is refreshing fruity, balanced sweet malt, hint of caramel and bubblegum, some alcohol as well. Fine body and long aftertaste. Tasty and nice weizen bock with high quaffable potential.

16oz bottle from Westroads poured into a lager glass. Pours a clear gold with a LOT of thick white head. Aroma of banana, clove and wheat. Taste is lightly sweet. Taste of banana, clove and sweet fermented fruit. Medium bodied with a creamy texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, very good. Something I would really like to drink again in the future.

Pale straw color, slightly hazy, with a large white head. Aroma of brown sugar. Taste has a thin layer of sharp hops on top of a heavy dose of very sweet malts. Both the bitterness and the sweetness are intense and highly refined. However, the sweetness eventually becomes overbearing, especially in the aftertaste.

0.5l bottle. Pours a heavy clouded light orange body with a massive big and fluffy white head. Aroma is caramel-sweetish and kinda yeasty with lots and lots of wheat, some spices and its also quite malty. Average to lively carbonation, medium to full-bodied and it has a mild sticky to oily mouthfeel. Flavors are also quite wheaty, surprisingly wheaty actually. Hints of orange zest and cloves, light sweet but definitely not to sweet. Nice light warming tones in the finish and a hint of alcohol in the aftertaste. Have been waiting a long while to tasting this, and the Vitus did most certainly not disappoint me. A good weizen bock!

Bottled.  A blonde beer with a good white head.  Good banana and bubblegum in the aroma with a bit of extra alcohol strength.  A big mouthfeel.  Banana and clove.  Definite bruised banana.  Extra alcohol.  Pretty damn fine.

The beer in the glass is golden yellow and cloudy, with a beautiful white head. It smells sweet yeasty, minimal alcoholic, very spicy. Starts very yeasty-sweet, slightly tart accents. A strong spiciness comes through. The middle part has very much aromas of tropical fruits (mango, passion fruit ...), again with a lot of spicy yeast aroma. Finish has some tropical fruit aromas as well, it is alcoholic warming. Delicious Weizenbock!

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy gold with a big puffy white head.  Aroma of banana, lemon, and clove.  Tastes pleasantly sweet up front and finishes a little sour.  Biting carbonation and light body.  Alcohol is slightly detectable.  Overall a solid, easy to drink beer.

Trüb-helle Farbe, ähnlich einem guten HW. Fruchtig und hefig im Geruch. Geschmack fruchtig mit Malztönen und Gewürznelkenaroma. Dabei leicht pfeffrig nach Alkohol, aber nicht aufdringlich. 
Erst im langen Finish wärmend alkoholisch. Ein guter Weizenbock.Test vom 25.8.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2015 Aroma of apple cider, clove, banana and bubblegum. Appearance is translucent gold with white head. Flavor of cider and banana up front with a spiced clove finish. Palate is very bubbly. Nice.
Really good spice flavor with a smooth finish, crisp refreshing and different, my favorite of the style.

A cloudy dark yellow color with a medium head.  The aroma is classic wheat, lots of yeast and citrus with a hint of bubblegum.  The flavor is wheat, clove, and yeast with a nice dose of citrus, a very refreshing taste.  Medium bodied and one of the best, cleanest tasting wheat beers Ive had, just all around good flavor.

500ml gushing bottle shared with Stefan and Elisabeth. Decent white head, pale golden body. Aroma of wheat, fruits, and lighter traces of spices. Clove, dusty hops, ripe banana, and yeasty fruitiness in the taste character. Sweet and tart endnotes. Medium bodied. OK drinking (Tromsø, 22.08.2011).

500 ml bottle from BevMo online (Pleasanton). Nose is big ripe bananas, yeast, and wheaty bread, with hints of cloves.Hazy yellow with a big pale yellow, lightly lacing head. Flavor is very bready wheat, bananas, white pepperiness, and very light bitterness. Excellent! Wish I had a case!

Bottle. Probably getting near the drink by, though I couldnt find it. Very cloudy medium gold with a fine, low head. Pretty. Aroma dominated by lemon and sweet orange, wheat comes through well. Sweet, spicy, rich wheat flavor, orange, clove, banana, almost tropical fruit: a bit of pineapple. Somewhat bitter fiish. Big, smooth, rounded palate. Low carbonation. Delicious.

16.9 oz bottle. Pours cloudy yellow-orange with a nice pillowy off-white head. Aroma consists of clove and SweeTarts first and foremost with some banana lurking in the background. Taste is sweet and spicy. Flavor is much more banana-pronounced. Also very bubblegummy. Mouthfeel is pleasantly creamy and the carbonation is high. Yummy..

Aroma is cloves and lemon peel. Orange spice. Halfway between a weizenbock and a hefe. Excellent for style.

Appearance is hazy bright yellow. Tall foamy head. Big carbonation. Sunny.

The flavor is strong bubblegum and flowers. Touch of citrus and alcohol. Spicy clove. A sugary (but not too sweet) malt base grounds it -- a real backbone. The astringent alcohol (it IS 7.7%, after all), is the last flavor.

The palate is creamy, chewy, with a solvent-like finish. You can drink this chilled or warm. Its a well-grounded, not too sweet, not too banana-y, dark-flavored hef. You could call it Hef-Wei between.

Pours from bottle as though a brown ale were simultaneously poured into a pilsner. Nice yeast notes on the nose. Nice clove balanced by some malt on the tongue. Finish tends to hang around a bit. Nice!

16/08/2011 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Color miele, torbida, bel cappello di schiuma bianca, morbida e abbastanza persistente. Al naso sentori di lievito, frumento, frutta (banana), leggero agrumato e spezie. In bocca morbidissima, incredibilmente ben bilanciata, dolciastra, con note di frumento, frutta, lieviti. Buon corpo, cremosa al palato, carbonazione soft. Magnifica.
bottle at caley ... hazy amber ... bubbly white head... soft sweet banana ester nose ... light fizzyness ...soft sweet fruits .. nice toffee bubblegum ... soft juicy easy ... clean...

16.9 oz. bottle- Pours a cloudy orange, which is surprising, I was expecting it to be darker, it has a thick pillowy white head. The aroma is very yeasty, banana, some clove and a little pepper. The taste is sharp and tart, followed by a mild mellow banana yeasty flavor. Body is medium to almost full, carbonation is high. Overall I did like the hefe alot better, but its still nice.

Bottle (500ml):
Large banana presence with lots of citrus and cloves. Bread also features and overall this is a nice herbal aroma. Some minor hints of alcohol too.

Cloudy yellow with tinges of orange. Forms a massive, foamy white head that has excellent retention.

Solid banana & clove taste to this one upfront that is perfectly balanced.Good overall sweetness & the taste is clean with no trace of alcohol.

Medium bodied & with a smooth, creamy texture that is quite clean & crisp. Nice dryness to the finish.

An excellent wheat beer, it has a solid, well balanced flavour and some good banana notes that work well to mask the high abv.

Feature in the 1001 Beers To Try Blog:
nice soft aroma,yellow color,hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body,creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, long finish, nice finish.

Orange coloured and unclear. Has a white head, fully lasting. Heavy sweet aroma, malty, yeasty, notes of coriander and other spice. Flavor is heavy sweet, faint acidic, moderate bitter finish. Creamy texture and soft carbonation.

Bottle at The Caley Sample Rooms. Pours a cloudy blonde colour with a huge white head. Big banana nose with cloves and wheat. Super clovey flavour with banana, wheat, yeast and chewy caramel. Dry with a foamy mouth-feel. Moderate carbonation and some CO2 prickle. At first I thought the alcohol was quite well masked, however, this became more prominent the more I drank. Great though!

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2011 Re-rating 5.8.2011: Yeasty, fruity smell. Pale yellow-greyish colour. Thick, lasting head. Aroma very yeasty. Taste somewhat sweet. Soft carbonation. All in all a bit lighter than it could be, but one of the finer weizenbocks available.

Poured into a footed pilsner. Appearance is a hazy copper to gold with an almost purple hue to it. Interesting look to it. Huge billowing white head rests atop the brew. Aroma is full of dark fruits, sweet grassy notes, abundant esters. Taste is super sweet bananas, slight bubblegum note, touch of spicy cloves.  Tingly and slightly stingy mouthfeel. Loads going on in this beer. I like it a lot.

On tap at Euston Tap.  Hazy paleish gold thin white head.  Yes some decent intense bubblegum and banana.  Really tasty.  I like this. First beer of the day on a hot day and it went down way too easy.  Drinkable and enjoyable fruity edge to it.  Good wheat beer.

50 cl bottle. Rated on 29.8.2008
Aroma has a bit aged banana, wheat, yeast and hints of alcohol. Flavour has also ripe banana with hints of citrus and spices. Good weizenbock, but still far from Aventinus.

Pale orange-yellow with a small whitish head. Aroma of spices, banana, lemon, wheat and caramel. Strong yeasty and sweet flavor with a bold spiciness and mild bitterness. Medium-full bodied and a little fizzy. Quite enjoyable.
Sample from a bottle at PIB. Pours cloudy yellow with no head. Aroma of banana, light sourness, yeast, hay and cereal. Flavour of yeast, hay, banana, grass and grain. Medium bodied.

Sampled from bottle at PIB, pours cloudy golden yellow with a small head. Aroma of banana, clove and wheat. Flavour of banana, clove, sweetness in the malts, with a banana-like finish. Medium-bodied and full flavoured. Delicious.
Pours cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is wheat, banana and clove. Flavour is wheat, sweet notes, heavy banana and clove.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden with a huge persistent white head.  Aroma and flavor are banana and bubble gum, some graininess, a fair bit of yeast.  To be honest, I dont see or taste a lot of differences between this and the Weihenstephaner hefeweiss.  Maybe this one is spicier, but I dont get much more malt.  The color is not darker.  Maybe a bit sweeter, but not really fruitier.  I was expecting more bock elements.  Lots of carbonation, but not prickly on the tongue.  Pretty tasty.

Bottle, right now. Medium hazy, high head the fineness of marshmallow, streaming carbonation like an aspirins been chucked in it. Bright, heady aroma awash with banana candy, green cardamom, lemon curd tart and botanical, Belgian-like suggestions. Thick, peppery, banana and reindeer beater-dominated flavour wafting with ground coriander and cardamom-like exoticism despite the reinheitsgewhatsit. A refresher, a summerbier, a beer you could sink by the mass on a balmy Bavarian evening. Or just an evening. Cooled the heat of my midnight turkey Madras just perfectly, so much so Ive just realised German weizen bocks are the most consistently brilliant and astonishing beers in der Welt.

Bottle 50 cl, Alko, Tampere. Pours hazy straw coloured with a great fluffy shortlived head. Aroma is very typical weizen, clove, bananas, lightly citric. Excellent flavor, citric, lots of bananas, sweet, yeast and some smoke. Finishes so fine, well balanced sweet bitter and yeasty. Very good indeed.

0.5 L Bottle purchased from Bier-Spezialitäten-Laden in Berlin.  Pours a cloudy straw hue with a very thick and lasting white head.  Loads of bubbles streaming upwards to the surface.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, and some dry spice notes, in the vein of some Belgian wits Ive had before.  Interesting clove-like spice up front in the flavor gives way to a muted banana and wheaty/grainy profile.  Extremely effervescent, yet the carbonation is not prickly and really smooths out on the palate.  Finishes a little dry but is quite refreshing.  Alcohol is well-masked. This brewery was among one of my favorites upon visiting Berlin.

Again I wonder what it is about the German weizenbeers. Do they perhaps have just one huge brewery and all the other small places we think they also use to make beer, are just label factories? Im still desperately waiting for a German weissbier that can really make a difference. This one: again plain and simple, nothing bad, nothing good.
Pours a nice hazy yellow color with a foamy white head.  Pretty fruity (some apples and grapes) and spicy (peppery?) aroma.  Nice smooth taste with some zip at the end.

Bottle.  Pilsner gold pour with frothy white head and tons of retention.  Nose is malt, yeast, sweet fruit, and something that smells a lot like bubble gum.  Banana perhaps?  Taste follows the nose and was much sweeter than I expected.  Great mouthfeel with a lot of carbo.  I didnt expect much but for the style I really enjoyed this.

Sampled at Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Pours an unclear and yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is malt, fruit, wheat and yeast. The flavor follows the nose with additional sweetness and banana. The palate is sweetness. Overall a boring and very sweet beer.
An easy-drinking sweet hefe. Orange colored with big white head, aroma of yeasts and dogs breath. Flavor is less yeasty and more grainy, standard flavors present. Different from Aventinus.
This beer didnt do it for me. To me it just tasted a bit marginal.. Normal. Not very unique in its style.

(bottled) I was expecting something like Aventinus , this is way differing  and like standard a Hef on booze steroids(i dig their Hef a lot) but this isnt as flavoursome   . Rich bananary and sticky palate. Cloying , in a plesant way.

Bottle from Maruhn, DarmstadtMudy orange-golden color; generous head, compact. The aroma is nice, fruity (banana). The body is lean, it is quite highly carbonated, the mouthfeel is very smooth; good malt and wheat flavor, with a moderate residual sweetness, and good balance of spices and fruitiness; the bitterness is quite low. Very harmonious.

Poured from a 1 pint bottle. Hazy golden yellow with lots of carbonation. Thin white bubbly head.  Thick lacing. Aroma is very strong of orange peel and spices. Makes my mouth water just sitting there.. ok taste; is all spice. Very tingly on the tongue. Leaves the mouth dry. Reminds me of the old orange-julios. Not bad, but not what I expected. The bottle and label was brown.. automatically assumed it was a dark beer. I would buy again.
Cloudy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana, yeasty, citrus and cloves. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. Feels like a strong wit. 270511

Hazy straw yellow with a beautiful dense two-finger bright white head. Diversity of aromas including clove and other spices, banana, pear, grass/wheat, apple. Variety of flavors as well, with a fruitiness that leaned toward tart granny smiths and bread crust and nuts maltiness. Medium body, tons of carbonation, slightly creamy mouthfeel, and a pleasant tartness in the finish.

500 mL bottle.  Pours a very lightly hazed bright golden with a white head.  Clove aroma, banana, with a little grassiness, bubble gum, and wheat.  Wheat leads the flavor with bubble gum, cloves, apple, and banana.  Again some slight hints of grassiness, now with citrus.  Pretty nice.

Bottle purchased at Total Wine, Gilbert, AZ.  Pours a butterscotch-yellow, with a massive white head.  Lots of carbonation.  Aroma is banana, CLOVE, bread/yeast and malt.  Taste is sweet, banana, clove, coriander and yeast.  Finish is sweet and refreshing.  This is as good as wheat beer gets.  True brewing art.  For its style, one of the best beers in the world.
Bottle. Slightly hazy yellow/golden with small white head. Flavour is malt, wheat, citrus, little bitter, hops and a little banana.

Bottle poured into weizen glass.  Beautiful looking beer, straw yellow, hazy, 2 finger fluffy, creamy head that gets down to a thin layer in about 5 mins.  Outstanding nose of intense belgian spice, yeast, esters, banana, and a hint of bubblegum.  Creamy on the palate.  Amazing taste.  Wheat upfront taste with more yeasty spice upfront before ending with an intense dark fruit sweet finish that is gone fairly quickly.  Some more banana and clove throughout and slightly boozey.  Love this brand, love this beer.
Boy do I like these wheat (aka. weiss) beers. More of a malt presence since it is a weizenBOCK. Fruity, yeasty, forest berry taste. Very nice. Zero trace of the abv. Slighty too sweet.

500ml Bottle. Pale golden and cloudy with a thick white head. Huge blast of clove along with yeast and citrus. Medium bodied and effervescent. Flavor is sweeter than a regular Hefe and here is the difference. Overall, really nice brew. Like a Hefe but stronger and sweeter.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: UPDATED: APR 26, 2014 Bottle @ home, poured into a wine glass, the closest thing that I got to Vitus glass. Very cloudy, yellow-orange appearance with a sizable white head. Spicy, banana, clove, lots of yeast, wheat in the nose thats just spectacular. Great wheat malty body, citrus fruits, banana, cloves, lots of yeast, slight bock flavor. Yeasty, banana, bock finish. Silky, velvety mouth feel. Simply outstanding! One of my all-time favorite beers.
