Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is wheat, big bananas, spice, and clove. Flavor is wheaty banana, fruity esters, light clove, and a little alcohol.

Bottle.
Cloudy, dull yellow body with some frothy white head.  Aromas of banana, clove, citrus, and spice.  Tastes as good as it smells with more banana, clove, and a nice creamy texture.  Tasty!

500ml bottle. Pours a hazy light-gold, with a colossal white head, excellent retention and good lace. The aroma is a little muted, thanks to the head, but there are some typical weizen notes lurking in there, predominantly cloves and banana. Spicy hops up front introduce a smooth weizen body, with a fairly standard sweet finish. There is nothing at all wrong with this, but it is a bit too similar to many other weizens, and doesnt really stand out in the way that other weizen bocks, Erdinger Pikantus being a good example, do. Still, it is a nice enough beer.

quando si dice che labito non fa il monaco. lo fa lo fa, almeno nella vitus è così, la versi nel bicchiere e pensi che sia tra le cose più belle del mondo, con quelle 4 dita di schiuma compatte e pannose li su. laroma è di malto, con note fruttate di esteri, un pò di luppolo. in bocca è perfettamente bilanciata, tra la cremosità del frumento e la componente amara dei luppoli, in più nonostante la gradazione è così facile da bere con quella carbonazione seducente.
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Decent but not quite as good as the original hefe. More potent but doesnt present the same overrall feel that the hefe gives. Still good

Bottle. Hazy bright lemony yellow with a huge whipped meringue on top. Aroma fills the room with banana, clove spice, and bubblegum. Creamy smooth mouthfeel, featuring flavours of banana, bubblegum, sweet spices, and with hints of vanilla cookie, marzipan, and wheaty esters. Not even a hint of the ABV. This was so good!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Cloudy amber with a pretty nice sized head. No lacing and the head fades down to a nice layer of creamy bubbles. Big banana, clove, bubble gum, and yeast smell - and alcohol. Nice banana cream pie smell. Tastes are the same with an alcohol back end. Liking chewing Hubba Bubba and a banana. A little numbing. Nice creamy mouthfeel with a big alcohol warmth. Nice beer.
Banana, wheat malt awesomeness. This beer was so delicious after having a tasting night I enjoyed this beer very much.

Milder Antrunk, fruchtig, deutlich aber nicht übertrieben hefig. Ab dem Mittelteil malziger, dann wieder fruchtiger. Zum Ende erneut malzig weich, hier bockartiger, etwas dunkler, leicht cremig. Gut aufeinander abgestimmt, zum Ende auch etwas herb. Sehr süffig!

Just awesome. I thought this was going to be one of the weakest from this brewery and was a punch! nice weizen taste and features. NOt annoying in taste although strong in alcohol. Excellent head and shape.

Flaske: Orangegul uklar øl med et stort skumhoved. Klassisk hefe weiss i udseende. Duften er igen tydelig weiss med en god del banan fra gæren og tydelig hvede. Smagen er lidt mindre banan præget med et stort bid fra alkoholen. Fin fin øl.
Pours a cloudy golden with sizable white head.  Spice, wheat and fruit on the nose.  A flavorful, balanced spicy wheat beer with a slight bitter finish. Prost!

Thanks Pacond for joining me in my ticking quest and purchasing a fantastic bottle of a fantastic beer.  

Really light on the spices and booze, really heavy on the banana esters and wheat malt sweetness.  Owns.
Golden hazy body, white head. Aroma of alcoholic banana and some wheaty bread. Aroma is big, but the flavour does not keep up to it. Still one of my all time favourites.
Draft at Makke.  Yes, in Italy.  Cloudy variegated gold color, solid white head.  Aroma of bubblegum squared!  Taste is sour grapefruit, lemon.  Nice.

I think there is some lemon and banana going on in here. I loved the whole drink. I actually almost got into a fight while drinking this beer, but I was able to keep my cool because of the jovial nature that this beer brought to my late night.

50cl bottle. It pours golden and unusually there is a hint of green near the bottom of the glass. The head is excellent and there is a steady stream of bubbles. The nose has bananas and a sweet toffee note. The taste has more of the bananas, some toffee and perhaps a little ginger. The palate has a very big structure, a creamy texture but unusually it refreshes at he end. Overall, this is probably my favourite weiss beer.

50 cl, bottled. Pours hazy amber coloured beer with a white head. Aroma: Banana, candyfloss, yeast, citrus. Taste: Moderate sweetness. A hint of alcohol. Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, noticeable carbonation. Minimal bitterness.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2015 Head:  Cloudy white, pillowy, two inches.  Body pours a cloudy yellow-orange.Nose: Bananas, little spice.Taste:  Some Bananas, more apple cider, little tart and sour.Mf:  creamy, effervescent, Overall:  Delicious.  Much like their hefe-weizen but creamier and more enjoyable.  Great summer beer.

500 ml bottle purchased at Royal in KCMO. Pour is quite hazy, yellow golden with a three inch egg white head. Aroma is fresh clove and banana, along with a natural grain wheat. There is also a slight lemon citrus. All aromas are well balanced. Taste is citrus floral, moving towards a mineral clove, and the finishing with the wheat grain. The aftertaste is hay, straw and a warming alcohol note. As with the nose, all flavors and nicely integrated and balanced. Palate is medium bodied, unfiltered mouth feel and the pleasant lingering straw and grains. Quite drinkable despite the elevated ABV. Nice brew, really clean.
thin white head, very hazy body, yellow colour. yeast and bananas on the nose. this is definitely a weissen. med/full body. bananas, yeast and coriander. nice but nothing special.

On tap at Euston Tap, London. A hazy golden coloured pour with a decent white head. Sweet, yeasty aroma. Tastes yeasty, wheaty, spice, sweet, banana, apple, lemon, vanilla. Really smooth and easy to drink, I enjoyed this.

Hazed gold, large white head.  Bright fruity, wheaty aroma, banana, pit fruit, yeasty spice.  Softly grainy, slightly tart pit fruit flavors in the middle, more banana, spicey, yeasty finish with clove notes.  A nice strong wheat beer.
One of the best wheat beers Ive had. Complex yet smooth. Fruit, spice, grain, yeast, and slight malty notes, all while carrying a heavy ABV. Very impressive.

Pours a golden, wheat color.  Poured witha very large white head in a lager glass.  Has a spicy smell (sounds odd but thats what I got).  Somewhat sweet taste maybe even a tiny bit of spice.  Light to medium body, but more on the medium side.  This is a great, great winter beer for people that dont like the heavy, roast, chocolate, and/or malty beers.
Bottled from Bierzwerg. Cloudy golden color with nice thick white head.aroma, banana, lemon, vanilla. Taste, banana, raspberries, cloves. Sweet finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Excellent Weizenbock.

Weisse davvero molto buona, tra le migliori mai assaggiate. Dorata scura, classico aspetto torbido per nulla invitante, sufficientemente schiumosa. Aroma penetrante di frumento con note fruttate. In bocca bella elegante ma con carattere, amarognola e acidula, buon corpo. Nonostante non apprezzi il genere, devo dire che questa birra mi è piaciuta parecchio.

Pours a hazy light orange with a large frothy white head.  Aroma is sweet, with fruits and bananas.  Full bodies with dries fruits, malts, and bananas.  Finish is mildly citrus with spices lingering.  Very refreshing and well balanced!

Hazy straw-gold with a thick head.  Alcoholic aroma has lots of esters, yeast, apples and pears.  Sweet, slightly candyish with banana, light spice, hints of alcohol.  Finish shows a little bit of softness.  Nice balance, despite a somewhat rough aroma.
on tap. ottimi profumi fruttati di banana,con note di croste di pane.il tutto si ritrova al gusto,con una buona persistenza e corpo.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from Wegmans.  It pours a hazy, lighter gold color with a pillowy, white head.  Good head retention and decent lacing.  The nose is a mix of light wheat notes, some banana, yeast, and clove.  The flavor mirrors the nose with a  bit of alcohol present and a richer body and mouthfeel than its weaker cousins.  Medium bodied with plenty of carbonation leading to a short to medium, crisp finish.  Very nice indeed.

I poured some of my 16.9 oz bottle into a tall pub glass...

The beer was a lemonade yellow color with a huge 4 inch head that was white and foamy. It smells strongly of lemon, banana, clove and wheat. Very pleasant. The taste is strong on clove and spice along with banana, lemon and wheat. There is a bit of yeast in the aftertaste. The beer is light with a ton of soft, bubbly carbonation, it is just a tad warming but I would have never guessed it to be 7.7%. No flaws in this one, it will go well with my german sausage links I just grilled.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2012 50cl bottle shared with friends.
Decent white head. Cloudy white beer. Quite decent.

Pours cloudy yellow with a large slowly dissipating head. Aroma is sweet, wheat and of bananas. Flavor is bananas, malt sweetness. Litlte hop bitterness. Banana flavored finish. Palate is light-medium bodied. Medium to high carbonation. Overall a really enjoyable wheat beer.

Light banana aroma with minerals and cereal grains.  Big fluffy white head that settles down as it warms up to a fine lace on the slight murky pale yellow body.  Definitely get the banana flavor but its not overwhelming like some Weiss beers.   Nice light corn-like sweetness balanced by a good dose of Nobel hop bitterness and a good alcohol kick and warmth.  This is followed by a light lemony sourness and creamy mouthfeel with a lingering wheat taste.  This is very refreshing and easy to drink which could make it dangerous at 7.7% as the alcohol is well integrated.

Bottle @ Abbots in Cork. Golden yellow and bright, served in its own goblet, which makes it look gorgeous! Looks Belgian. Bright yeasty aroma is fruity with melon, banana, peaches. Palate is slightly tacky. Feels high gravity. Sweet, fruity entry with white plums and fleshy nectarine. Finishes flat/dull, needs hops. A few more floral notes would brighten it up but even so its dangerously drinkable.
Strong yeast and general weizen character to it.  A very good weizenbock overall.

Hazy golden color with a creamy white head.  Spicy yeasty aroma with a hint of citrus.  Smooth, creamy mouthfeel.  Fine carbonation.  Nice hoppiness to the brew, it is present but does not overpower.  Great beer, possibly my favorite from Weihenstephaner.

500 mL bottle. Pours a hazy dark yellow with a large off-white head. The aroma is wheat, bananas, lemons and herbs. The flavor is sweet and tart, with only a hint of bitterness. The palate is light and fairly carbonated. The alcohol is present but unobtrusive. Overall, not too bad, but nothing amazing.
UPDATED: MAR 27, 2011 One of my favorite lagers, heavy malt palate really lets this lager shine, intricate complex malt profile, very refreshing

Järkyttävä määrä, paksua valkoista vaahtoa. Kaadoin oluen tuoppiin ja vaahtoa on tappiin asti, eikä nestettä pohjalla nimeksikään. Lisäksi vaahto ei tahdo laskea millään. Itse olut on keltaista ja sameaa. Tuoksu on tutun hedelmäinen ja vehnäinen. Maussa on vehnää, hedelmäisyyttä, sitrusta, alkoa ja mausteisuutta. Tukevahkorunkoinen olut, joka toimii hefeksi yllättävän hyvin keskellä kylmintä talveakin.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2011 Appearance:  cloudy, buttery gold, three-finger white head (on opening, the head slowly tried to escape the bottle prior to pour), tons of carbonation jets, with bubbles lingering on the side.  Aroma:  banana bread, creamed corn, pie crust, clove, bubblegum, wheat.  Taste:  cloves, yeast, bananas, cream of wheat, citrus (orange juice).  Finish:  long, creamy, with a tongue-coating syrupy mellowness.  Notes:  Wonderful.  Felt like, essentially, an imperial hefeweizen.  Palate was extremely lively with tons of carbonation tickling the tongue, which really helped bring out the flavors.  And yet, the finish was velvety and thick.  Great flavors.  Could drink about a hundred of these, which would be trouble:  the alcohol is VERY well hidden.
A solid Weizenbock form a great brewery. It is bold and slightly spicy with much of the accents form a typical Hefeweissbier but with an added caramel kick.

Gold with thick white head and visibly lively carbonation.  Aroma of clove, moderate yeast and spiciness.  Flavor is refreshing with yeast, immediate nectary sweetness followed by nice wheat astringency on the sides of the palate.  All this is complimented by restrained amounts of clove and banana.  I would have thought this was a Hefeweizen given the color and flavor.  Alcohol content is really well hidden.

Hazy mustard colored pour with a good sized bubbly white head. Aroma holds notes of rich, dark yeast, banana, cloves and other spices, and a delightfully dense wheat profile. Flavor is very refreshing, with some orange and lemon zest mixing with the aforementioned banana notes. Wheat, spice, and yeast continue at the forefront of the flavor as well. The palate is just as a good German wheat beer should be, with a medium body and a crisp effervescence. Phenomenally sessionable, and damn tasty.
(bottle) pale gold large white head. Aroma of banana and clove. Slightly sweet like a bock.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2011 500 ml, BB date reads 15.September 2011 therefore quite a fresh one, into tulip.
Hazy straw-yellow colored body topped by thick, rather low white head that slowly recedes and sticks to the walls. Weizenbock is essentially a Dunkelweizen brewed to the strength of a (Doppel)bock, however, the pale visual appearance of Vitus is reminiscent more of a Hefeweizen than Dunkleweizen. Aroma is Doppelbock-like sweetness with banana esters, clove phenolics and bready malt. A careful sniffing session reveals plum & raisin-like fruitiness that gets more prominent as the beer warms. Very faint alcohol shines through. Flavor is rich sweetness (suggesting the malt hasnt beet fermented thoroughly) with banana, clove and wheat. Hop flavor is virtually absent and the finish is somewhat balanced by light hoppy bitterness and very faint alcohol. The palate is sweet, body medium-full with very smooth creamy texture and moderate carbonation. As stated above, the appearance of Vitus resembles a good Hefeweizen although it is easily distinguished from the later by having a minor head and fuller body. There could be more melanoidin & dark fruit character but its a very decent beer nevertheless.
Bottle. Hazy golden with a thick white  head. Smells of citrus and malts with a hint of banana. Taste of wheat malts with acid tones of citrus.  Good lasting aftertaste with good hops balance.

Very good beer. I like this Hefe its got a lot going on and is balanced with sweetness, fruitiness, complexities and finish. Teh aroma is of dough, spices, banana, citrus- peach and apricot, pineapple. Teh appearance is nice dark gold yellow, with a tinge of amber in the light. The taste is complex. I sense, banana bread first, peaches, apricot, ginger, wheat and spices. Even a little pineapple after a swallow. The remnants left on the palate are a treat rather than a drag. I like its medium rich body, small head, crispness, fruitiness, and it is a treat. Try one.

Not a weizenbock so much as an imperial hefeweizen; a variation of the classic Weihenstephan hefe turned up to 11. Both beers share much in their cloudy straw appearance and the familiar banana and clove nose. The biggest eyebrow-raiser with the Vitus is the assertive spiciness (which work beautifully with the other hefe yeast aromas) and the well-hidden-but-warming alcohol. Seems to transport better than the regular hefe as well, which for us in Australia makes a difference in terms of consistency; I can only hope it stays readily available.

500 ml Btl.  Poured into a weizen glass, pours slightly hazy, almost completely opaque golden orange.  When the last 1/3 of the bottle was swirled and poured straight on top this beer becomes a masterpiece.  Swirling, cloudy, dense orange with a few stray particles floating under a massive frothy dome of puffy white head with droplets of brown yeast residue here and there.  Absolutely 5/5 on appearance!  Unfortunately, the head dies fast, leaving little lacing, but small alcohol "legs" on the glass as it recedes.  Aroma is wonderful and very complex: big spices, clove, wheat, grass, banana, yeast, bread, dough, funk, malt, slight acidity and mild alcohol.  Taste is very much the same, smooth and almost creamy upfront with a strong wheatiness throughout - then followed by the banana/clove flavor and at last rounded out by a rather sizable spicy bite on the tail end and into the aftertaste.  Mouthfeel is light to medium; creamy, smooth, and then a little more abrasive and hot (I think mostly via the carbonation or a combination of carbonation, spices and alcohol) at the end.  After it warms a little it gets more mellow - although the abrasiveness and heat in the end are reasonable (at 7.7%) and a bit unique - they keep it from getting a higher score from me.

500 ml bottle poured into my Franziskaner Weissbier glass.

A- Body is a uniformly cloudy pale yellow hue. Pours with a massice 3 figner+ foamy white head-which eventually fades to a retains nicely at one finger. Some lacing is left behind in the glass. A constant stream of bubbles can be seen steadily rising to the top.

S- This brew pretty much has the nose of a classic German Hefe. Bready yeast is the main character-but a mild amount of clove and banana come through as well-the overall impression of the nose is soft.

T- Clove is the main character upfront with a mild banana and bready yeast backbone. The finish is dry and slightly peppery with a hint of floral hops and a nice smooth bready yeast backbone-and a touch of dry alcohol heat.

M- High tingly carbonation and a lightweight smooth and slightly bready body.

D- This beer is a winner- I cant believe I didnt try it until now- The overall profile is very similar to this brewerys hefe weizen-only its the imperial version- the broadness of the weizenbock style never ceases to amaze me-but if there were a classic example-this would be it!

Serving type: bottle

On tap at the Bavarian Lodge, Lisle, IL. and presented as a 13 oz. serving with a cloudy, orange/gold color, white, silky head foam, and wavy lacing. The aroma was light wheat, smooth malt, spice as clove, banana, a touch of vanilla, and mid-fruit. The flavor was similar with the banana as more of a candy variety, well hidden alcohol, medium bodied, and good carbonation. Flavorful and sessionable, even with the higher abv.

Pours a cloudy yellowish, golden colour with frothy head that fell quickly.

Aroma is banana, cloves and yeast/bread.

The beer is very lively on the tounge, well carbonated and you can feel the alcohol a tad.
Still a very refreshing beer, very spicy and very refreshing. Could sneak up on you at 7.7%. Beautifly balanced

Very light in colour for the style, more like a Belgian golden ale. Big fizzy head and quite fizzy body right through the palate. Not particularly intense in terms of flavour, rather quite austere. Cloves and spices are nice. Doesnt blow me away and I expected better.
Pale yellow with think frothy head.  Strong carbonation.  Aroma of clove/bananas.  Full bodied, dry.  Long finish,.

This poured a cloudy yellow color with a large white head. Aroma was of lots of spices, mainly clove and some citrusy notes too. Flavor was very spicey and yeasty with notes of orange peel/citrus and aa good bit of banana too. Good offering for the style.

A-pours a cloudy straw yellow with a creamy white head leaving a decent lace on the glass.

S-the nose has a fair bit of fruit yeast with some light notes of spice to it.  a fair bit of pear, green apple, lemon, hints of banana.  there is some light toasted bread with hints of yeasty spice in the back.

T-the taste isnt quite as full as the nose.  the fruitiness is still there, light caramel malt and some toasted bread up front, the banana, pear, and lemon come in behind with just a touch of white peppery spice in the back.

M-good body, medium chewy body with a slick crisp finish and assertive carbonation.

D-this is very tasty, the flavor is slightly watered down compared to the nose but still extremely solid.  great flavors working well together with a touch of alcohol in the finish.  I like it a lot!

Hazy golden amber with a robust white head. Tons of vanilla wheat malt in the nose with huge banana clove notes and a yummy wheaty caramel presence. The flavor holds more sweet wheat malt with bread, caramel, banana, and clove. Medium to full mouthfeel with supple carbonation.
Light wheat vanilla aroma. Orange hazy body with with a nice fizzy white head. Slick lively texture, extremely drinkable. Rich, moderately sweet flavour, hint of chocolate. Excellent.
Very enjoyable Weiszen Bock.  Pours very light yellow with soft white head.  Aroma is banana, wheat and florals.  Taste is wheat with banana and some clove.

500 ml bottle. Finland.
Hazy yellow colour with big white head.
Wheat, yeast, banana, citrus and hints of caramel sweetness and hops in aroma. Flavour is sweet caramel, banana, wheat, yeast, some spices and hoppy notes. Warming and rich. Excellent Weizenbock.
Bottle. Slightly cloudy and full bodied with lots of wheat.Very assertive, straightforward and pleasant.
Bottle. Hazy golden with a clean white head. Wheaty aroma with some banana and fruit. Bubble gum with a dry finish. Palate tastes a bit manufactured
light head ,very citrusy mango orange l and alittle vannilla im gettinghjhjhjhjhjhjh

11-dec-2010
50cl bottle at home, beer tasting night. Light yellow cloudy beer with large creamy lasting head. Aroma is citrus, taste is fresh, with moderate sweetness. Well balanced. Aftertaste is very refreshing, this is a good beer!

Világosabb narancssárgás szín, és kemény, hosszan tartó hab a külső jellemzői. Igazán szép! Az illatában ott a szokásos banán, valamint kevés mangó és ananász, továbbá citrusok, enyhe fűszerességgel megtoldva. Az íze telt, jól érezhető a búzamaláta édessége, a banán, vanília és citrusok. A lecsengése keserédes, az utóíze pedig hosszan tart, kicsit olyan, mint egy jobbfajta sodó íze. Az alkohol szerintem eléggé rejtve van benne. Az ilyen sörök azok, amikre igazán érdemes áldozni!

Bottle from Csakajósör-store, Bp.
Poured a hazy orange and its rocky, imposant white head remains at last fingerthick on the top of the brew.
Tart nose of bananas and citrus.
Tasteing begins moderate sharp, mouthfeel is slick.
Sweet-tart aroma of citrus, grain and light clove spicyness, the flavour brings bananas, lemon and alcohol along.
The tart end is of citrus, light spice and alcohol pushes through, which remains in a spicy-fruity aftertaste.
The alcohols a bit obtruding, aside from this its well enjoyable.

Bottle. Bright, vibrant yellow-orange and very cloudy with a pretty white frothy head.  Banana, citrus, clove, and a little tangy in the aroma..deep hefe qualities done well.  Banana foremost in the flavor followed by a lesser degree of clove; dark chocolate and apples associated with others in the range is missing here, but still damn good.  Medium body with sparkly carbonation.  Good brew.

Bottle from Csakajosor.hu. Poured with a golden color and an off-white, creamy foam. Deliciously fruity aroma of banana, mango, vanilla, ginger with just the right spices. Grainy sweet taste in a medium dense body and medium carbonation. Yeasty, sweet aftertaste. Complex, excellent!
Bottle 50 cl. Pours golden yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is fruity, banana and some spices. Flavour is lots of wheat, some banana and spices. Excellent beer.

Pours a bright glowing yellow, sun shining on hay. Profuse billowy white head recedes leaving a sticky spiderweb of lace. Nose shows clove and lemonzest with notes of fresh baked bread and cider.  Favor is rich and bready with a strong spice character. Alcohol comes through as does some banana. Too intense one the wheat/weisse yeast after a while.
16.9 oz bottle. pours golden with minimal typical German lager head. deep golden slightly cloudy color. has the banana, slightly wet hay aroma of so many German brews...little bit of sweet citrus.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2013 Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle this beer poured a cloudy golden color with a large yellow white head that lingers and produced good lacing. The aroma was moderately yeasty with notes of banana, clove and citrus. The flavor was sweet with notes of bread, yeast, clove, banana and faint citrus. The finish was long ,dryish and wheaty with notes of bread and clove lingering. Full bodied. Excellent.

Pours a very hazed golden peach with a monstrous head of foam, which very slowly dissipates, leaving behind some very nice lacing. Lots of carbonation rushing to the top, and this continues for some time. The aroma is of a multitude of yeasty esters, the primary ones being--not surprisingly--clove (the most prominent), banana, and bubblegum. The taste is similar, but there is a certain cloying sweetness as well. A bit of the wheat seems to be coming through in the taste, although the mouthfeel is a little thin, so its not coming through in that regard. Drinkability is quite high, especially given the high abv, which there is no trace of in the taste or mouthfeel.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-22-2010
Bottle from The Cave. Spicy bubblegum & yeast aroma. Cloudy yellow brown colour. Tastes of  bubblegum yeast & cereal. Well balanced but a bit too strong for me.

Bottle at the Euston Tap. Pours cloudy orange with a strong, white head. Big wheat aroma with bubblegum, yeast, clove, citrus and banana. Flavor is quite sweet and full, with more bready yeast, mild spices and alcohol, followed by a very light bitterness. Medium to full in body with heavy carbonation and faint warmth. Finishes sweet, bready and fruity with mild, earthy bitters. Nice beer.

Dusty bubblegum on the aroma. I swear it tastes a bit like chicken. Or fish? Fairly full in the mouth but no huge flavour. Smooth, hard to pin the flavour down, really. Wheaty with a hint of that bubblegum? Fizzy, citrusy candy?

Csak a jó sör, Budapest
Egészen világos narancssárga, ködös színe van. A hab, ami a tetején keletkezik rajta a pohárba töltésekor, hatalmas, nagy buborékokkal teli és fehér, mint a nagymama dunyhája. Ez egy igen kitartó takaróként funkcionál. Illata olyan, mintegy trópusi gyümölcskosárnak, amiben van banán, mandarin, grapefruit, füge, cukordinnye és az egészre ráborult volna egy kis likőr. Ezek a finom gyümölcsök szépen és gazdagon visszaköszönnek az ízében is. Ehhez a ízkavalkádhoz hozzájárul még egy jó adag hársméz, élesztő, puncsos piskóta és vattacukor. Mintha csak egy gazdag, gyümölcsökkel és likőrös krémmel töltött karácsonyi süteménnyel lenne dolgunk. Ahogy melegszik, egyre több és több aroma bontakozik ki belőle. Haraphatóan testes és igen élő, pezsgősen buborékos. Utóíze is rendkívül gyümölcsös, itt már a komló is jelentkezik, keserédes és hosszan tartó. Fantasztikusan összetett és finom búzabak, ünnepek különleges itala. Kötelező darab!

Cloudy yellow with a lil bit of white lace. Nose is strong banana, bread, brown sugar.  Very weizen like in flavor, pretty nice and easy drinkable.  Citrus upfront, with banana and bready malt finish.  Pretty good.

0,5 l bottle, Csakajósör, Budapest.
Hazy straw colored, thick liquid with a strong but creamy, pillowy off white head. Complex aroma with overriped fruits, tropical fruits, banana, fantastic spicies, honey and clove, cinnamon. MMMMMM!!!! Thick body, complex flavor profile with a strong characteristic fruity taste. Banana, lichy and mangosteen, honey and caramel, malt. Mild hop with clove and cinnamon, long fruity aftertaste. Fantastic, complex one!
Pours a cloudy light gold. Smells of a tradtional Hefeweizen. Tastes of citrus, wheat and Hefeweizen yeast and ends with a light alcoholic flavor.
Sampled on tap poured hazy pale yellow with full head.  Aroma was of wheat and sweet malt. Taste was sweet with flavors of straw and wheat also notes of toffee malt.  Medium body
Pours pale gold with thick creamy white head and foamy lacing.  Notes of wheat and nutmeg.  Well balanced taste with a hint of spice.  Sessionable.

Poured from a 16.9 oz. bottle into a weizen glass.

Pours a hazy golden color with a 4 finger frothy white head. Very nice lacing.

Smell: Lemon, wheat, clove, banana and spices. Very strong aroma.

Taste: Clove and banana up front followed by bread and spices in the middle and ending with a light hoppy bitterness. Aftertaste is semi-dry with hints of banana.

Mouthfeel: Light-to-medium-bodied with a decent amount of carbonation. A little slick feeling on the tongue.

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. The alcohol is well masked so you could knock back a couple pints without much trouble.

Overall: Excellent beer overall. Another fine offering from the worlds oldest brewery.

Bottle from Johns Grocery, Iowa City

Ar:  Big fruity weizen nose.  Lots of banana with a bit of bubblegum and some spice.
Ap: Pours a very cloudy orange-straw with a pillowy weizen head that dissipates somewhat quickly.
T: Sweet on the nose, with a light tart bite on the finish.   Nicely balanced, maybe a touch too sweet.
P: Semi-thick, highly carbonated body.  A bit sticky on the tongue, but not in a bad way.

Key Foods, Brooklyn 500ml ($4): Really vividly white head with a cloudy yellowish body. Really spicy aroma, of I guess cloves and the like along with the fruity elements. Taste is on the sweet side of things... very fruity with citrus and banana notes. Quite spicy, but well balanced. Alcohol covered very well. Creamy and not too much carbonation.

Doft: Mycket banan och kryddor
Smak: Ganska len i smaken, trevlig balans av skumbanan, citrus och peppar.

500 ml bottle courtesy of fata2683. Thanks Keith. Pours a cloudy dark yellow color with a big fluffy white head that has great retention and ample lacing. The aroma is moderate in strength with wheat bread, bubblegum and banana. The flavor is similar to the nose with wheat flavors dominating, add a touch of clove and you get the whole picture. The palate is creamy and full with soft carbonation. The finish is long with lingering banana and light cloves. Overall: A first rate weizen bock, I loved it.

The 500 mL bottle yields a hazy amber beer with an enormous, bright white, long-lasting head.  This Weizen has a bountiful citrus-floral aroma and the advertised full-bodied backbone.  Palate entry is mildly sweet, with the expected citrus-floral notes, and the addition of some clove and banana zest prior to a long, well balanced finish.  I was surprised by the fairly tame carbonation level and the well-disguised 7% ABV.  This is a great beer.

bottle pours hazy yellow/orange with a tall white head.  Aroma is beautiful, floral, spicy yeast, wheat, cereal malts, orange peel.  Flavor is rich sweet wheat, clove, banana, bubblegum, bazooka Joe all over the place.  Really a great beer, refreshing, flavorful, and overall awesome.

From bottle. Nose is spice and tropical fruit; esters evident. Pours a hazy gold with a head that just will NOT go down. Definite wheat beer elements on the palate, but theres a bockesque roasty note that counters nicely. Palate could be a little crisper. Good, but I still like Korbinian better.

500ml bottle in a Weizen glass.  Pours opaque golden with a lingering, white head.  Aroma of the spiciness of the wheat and some light malts.  Flavor sort of bland, with a little alcohol in the finish.  A decent beer, but not the best offering from this brewery.

500 ml bottle

I wasnt sure how this would work out but at $2.99 I was willing to roll the dice. If it had turned out to be subpar theres no shame in pouring the rest down the drain. As it turns out I finished all but the very bottom of the bottle. I should get around to trying more of these affordable German beers to stretch the budget. They might not be the greatest beers but the combination of price and quality is hard to beat.

Aroma / Appearance - Exceptionally foamy the pour took a long time to settle down. When it did I was left with a rosy golden body that was the color of the midday sun. Lemon icing, white bread, and basic hops are pretty plain but not awful. It did however exceed my expectations.

Flavor / Palate - Honey, graham crackers, and a trace of dried ham were not exactly the combination I was prepared for. Somehow though it all came together into something that was more than the sum of its parts. While I wasnt exactly rushing to refill my glass I drank more than I thought I would. Given the price point and other factors it gets high all around marks. Eventually I may get around to trying more but I doubt it will be soon.

For the eyes: orange-yellow colour; the head is huge; white; creamy and mostly diminishing; good lacing; hazy body. For the nose: carachteristic sweetness of a weizen; banana; pineapple and cinnamon notes. For the mouth: medium body; oily texture; lively carbonation; smooth, milky feeling. For me: very enjoyable.

Bottle @ Henriks, Bergen. Hazy, almost milky straw yellow body with a classic, big weizen top. Aroma is the usual suspects: banana, clove, sweet bread and hints of citrus peel. Taste is less bready than the regular Weihenstephaner, and slightly more intense. Body is bolder and sweeter as well. Some yeasty tones reminiscent of a Belgian Strong Ale, almost. Very filling; drinking this is like a small meal. The Vitus is a bit different, but equally well-crafted and almost as enjoyable as their regular hefeweizen.

Pours a bright, hazy golden yellow with a big creamy white head that bubbles down slowly to a rocky collar fed by a steady stream of bubbles from the bottom.

There is plenty of sweetness in the aroma with bananas and honey dominating.  Hints of clove as well and this one smells much like a good hefe.

The taste delivers on the expectations of the aroma and really does taste like an amped up hefe.  Big wheat flavor up front, featuring bananas but with an earthy honey sweetness mixed in.  The finish is spicy.

This is a full bodied wheat beer and extremely smooth and creamy.

Super drinkable, very tasty and, overall, just a well-crafted wheat beer.  One of the better wheat beers Ive ever had actually.
draught at the Local Taphouse Oktoberfest. pours golden yellow in colour. plenty of cinnamon and grassy hops to cover the banana/clove nausea. 7.7% was quite well hidden i thought.

500 ml bottle, I thought  Weizen Bocks where dark in color?? NOT this one! Very pale yellow color, hazy, with a huge white head. Typical sweetish hefeweizen aroma with notes of ripe bananas, cloves, yeast and bubblegum. Does Weihenstephaner use the same strand of yeast in all there brews?? They all smell exactly the same with the same after tones. The flavor is sweet and fruity, but still fairly light bodied for its strength. Moderate notes of cloves, very moderate hops.  Very drinkable. Very tasty.  I have only good things to say about this brewer.

On tap. Cloudy orange with a small white head. Packs a good deal of banana and cloves and has a hint of bay leaf, but it is still a little light for a weizenbock, which is perfect when you want more than a normal hefe but not as much as a heavy bock.

Golden yellow clour, avergae white head. Spices and sweet dry fruits in the aroma, some hops also. Herbal taste with balanced bitterness, round flavour but at the end it turns a bit watery. Light bitter finish, I would say medium body. Ok.

Shared bottle at Cardinal 18.8.2010.
Cloudy yellow with a 2 finger off white head. Fair lacing. 
Wooden aroma with clove.
Heavy sweet, alcoholic and bitter with some spice added to the flavors and some acidity in the finish.
Medium body, medium carbonation.

Bottle from Alko, cons 2010-09-29, Göteborg
AR: lovely foam banana, yeast
AP: cloudy honey colored body, gigantic froty/stoty thick foam (bone white)
F. yeasty, weat, soja milk, very weaty - to much you should call it a super weat ale!

Hazy yellow color with a massive billowing foamy white head. Minimal lacing left around the glass, but a nice layer of foam remains. Aroma has elements of banana, citrus and bread - its nice, but mild compared to the rather large & potent flavors.

Taste is primarily citrus at first - lemon mostly, then banana and  some slightly funky yeasty/bready flavors balance things out. Very similar flavor profile to their Heffe.

Very bubbly and well carbonated, with a bit of warmth from the alcohol. Easy to drink, but deceptively strong - the high-ish ABV is hidden well by all of the delicious flavors present.

Will definitely be drinking more of this.

500 ml bottle. Rated @ 3.7.2010.
Pours a hazy golden colour with a creamy white head. Flavour of tropical fruits, mild hops and yeast. Flavour of caramel malts, wheat, banana and bread. Medium bodied, oily mouthfeel. Tasty.

Pale yellow opaque pour with medium white head. Sweet aromas of candied fruit, pineapple, orange peel, clove, bananas. The first taste reminds of a good belgian triple: full body, fruity, sweet and spicy. A bit of bubblegum. The sweetness is kept in check with a slightly dry finish. A bigger, better hefe. Very very drinkable. Awesome!
Light golden pour from bottle with a giant white head.  Aroma is sweet  cereal, malts and yeast.  Taste is banana, cloves and vanilla.  Smooth finish.  Balanced and enjoyable.

(16.9oz bottle).  Pours hazy yellow with giant white head.  Aroma of banana, spices, and a little earthy.  Taste is sour/sweet with little hops.  A little metallic.  Medium/full bodied with thin/creamy texture.  Finish is smooth.  Good beer, but not overly complex.

This slightly hazy light golden brew has that classic german wheat beer quality build and appearance. The aroma is lightly sweet and spicy. The mouthfeel is quite smooth and buttery with lots of sweet spicy flavors from the malts, yeast and hops. Clean, bubblegum finish.
Hazy yellow beer with huge white head.Smell alcohol peach sweat and wheat.Taste banana alcohol some chocolate.Long finish, alcohol and sweet.
Excellent weizen bock. Thick and full. Super rich and delicious. This is a must.

500mL Bottle -- Pours a pale yellow-orange with a small off-white head.  Aromas of fig, apricot, pineapple, caramel, and band-aid .  Fuller bodied with a sticky mouth-feel.  Some bitterness but mostly malty.

Very much unfiltered.  A head that reminds me of marshmallows.  Nose is bananas and clove.  Those are also dominant flavors with a bit of lemon, a mild dry bitterness light bubblegum, and soft fruit.  It is more like a bigger hefe.  This dangerously easy to drink and is quite tasty.

Light colored, frothy. Musty, clove, yeasty, slight alcohol on the nose. Quite fruity, almost a bit sour, slight spices and banana, although fruit is more dominant. This ones on the lighter, crisper, fruitier side of the weizenbocks ive had. Only detracters is their is a bit of a bland-salty aftertaste.

0.5L bottle@ Øl og Mat fest 2010, Oslo.  A yellow-blond cream head upon a shiny, dark yellow gold body.  Soft wheaty, gently sweet toffee-ish malt aroma with lots of fruity esters. Taste is very sweet malty, smooth and wheaty, with banana and toffee flavors. Alcohol well hidden. Near full body. Appears as a sweet and powered up Hefeweizen.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 At Glunz Restaurant on Lincoln in Chicago. A Helles Weizen Bock.  Way way too drinkable for the strength. Yummy. Serving: tap

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2010 Bottle.

A - Slightly hazy golden color with a large, thick, creamy, soapy, sticky, white head. Pretty good retention with a sticky thin layer of lace. Extremely light color for the style.

S - A lot of wheat aroma with banana, clove, and some bubblegum. Touches of vanilla and pepper and some alcohol.

T - A lot of wheat flavor with some pale malt. A good amount of banana flavor along with plenty of clove and pepper. Some bubblegum and yeasty flavors as well. Some spicy hops later on as well. Some alcohol heat also comes out. Some tangy/tart wheat flavor also comes out a bit.

M - Medium body with plenty of carbonation. A bit of a smooth feel with just a touch of drying finish.

D - Easy to drink with a nice amount of flavor and a good body, but a little spicy and a bit too much alcohol heat to really be all that drinkable.

Notes: Definitely not like other weizenbocks that I have had, seems more like a bigger hefeweizen. Overall not a bad beer, but it wasnt entirely balanced and not what I was expecting. Not a bad beer, but I was expecting a bit better given the track record of this brewery.
In bottle; aroma quite lemony. Taste of spciy notes which a lemony, citrusy finish. Overall a good beer but I think I enjoy the Ayinger weizen-bock better
Hazy orange in colour.  Classic clove with a hint of spirituous brandy on the nose.   Rich and strong in the mouth with classic fruity and sulphurous weiss characteristics.

Excellent.  Vitus is a thick hazy light to medium golden liquid with a silky head of tiny bubbles. The nose is sweet with the spiced wheat banana flavor of good German wheat beer. The flavor is all wonderful wheat. There are notes of banana, clove, bubblegum and some other hard to place fruits and spices. Its quite sweet. The relatively high abv is well-hidden from both tongue and nose. The mouthfeel is luxuriously velvety. The finish is a bit tart and sweet, like a candied lemon rind. Vitus goes down exceptionally smoothly, particularly for the strength. Im going through this half liter much too quickly. Vitus is a rich, luxurious and complex Doppelbock.

Pours a golden straw with a nice white head.  Nose has tropical fruits and wheat.  Taste also has some nice crisp, colorful fruits along with cloves, citrus and bready malts.  Clean, refreshing body.  Great beer.
Great beer at any price. I cant believe that it was so cheap. The taste reminds me of a nice golden Helles, but it finishes clean and coherent.

@ the Dixie, pours a peach like color with a small head, aroma of banana, apples with notes of malt, flavor of apple, banana, lemon, bubblegum and cinnamon, sweetener like sweetness and moderate bitterness towards the end, medium body.

Draught, smallish head, murky peach orange colour with some lemon yellow taints, mellow aroma of bubblegum, with some yeasty earthiness, honey vanila and mustard, flavour of bubblegum, banana, nuts and a piercing fruity sourness with no trace of alcohol leading to a medium sour aftertaste with apleasant touch of sweetness, body just a tad to light.  unusual and very impressive.

Draught at Dixie in Tel Aviv. Cloudy golden with a medium creamy white head. Aroma of banana, apples and more fruits, clove, citric hints and yeast.  Sweet wheaty flavor with fruit esters, yeasty spiciness, some malt, caramel notes and a finish with more pronounced spiciness and a bit of alcohol. Medium-bodied. Tasty and quite refreshing but I prefer their regular Weissbier.

Strong clove and slight banana aroma. Very fruity. Hazy dark yellow with very large white head that lingers. Flavor is strong and similar to scent. Spicy clove, and banana, maybe some apricot. Finishes off with a slight flavor of darkness/roastyness. Slight hotness present. Spicy hops is mildly present and goes well with clove. Predominantly sweet/malty. Palate is medium full. Overall this is a very good beer, easily the best I have had of the style.

Sample from bottle at Glunz Beer Expo, April 10. Yes, still a dozen more rating notes from 4 months ago. Lighter weizen, still very cloudy. Looks like a slightly darker witbier. Almost murky yellowish brown, a thing layer of "German" foam at the top. Smell has the yeasty burst of a good German weizen. Taste is pretty good and strong. Maltier than the usual hefeweizen, but I still get the expected wheat and yeast impressions. Some coriander type spice, slight banana, but no other esters. Just a nice malty backing. Neutral German hop bitterness. Stays with me after I finish even this little sample.

Bottle from Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam. Pours pale yellow with a huge fluffy white head. Aroma is typical for a hefeweizen, cloves and banana. Taste is on the sweet side, with some fruity notes. Weak hops and moderate cloves. Easy drinkable.

Pours a cloudy golden color.  Highly carbonated on the palate.  Spicy aroma; cloves & banana.  Slightly peppery flavor followed immediately by some more spice; cinnamon and clove.  Overall, its a nice beer for the autumn.  I look forward to drinking more.

Very hazy and yellow - thick head.  Aroma reminds me of a wheat beer with hints of banana.  Taste has dark spices to it and is very nice (and now that I look up, I see its a wheat beer).   When I have a malt liquor to tick it off the list, Ill be upset with RateBeer.  When I have a beer like this, which I otherwise would probably never try, I appreciate my ticking addiction.

Bottle: Light Golden Pour with a moderate white head. Great aroma and lacing here, like their hefeweizen. Smells of fruit, yeast. Tastes of spice, yeast.  wheat, and mild sweetness. I enjoyed the brew to be sure, but expected something more out of it in comparison to the hefeweizen.

Bouteille de 500 ml dégustée chez Das Bierhaus (Burlington, VT). Arôme: Odeur de céréales et de bananes avec une pointe de clou de Girofles. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée avec une forte densité de bulle. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de banane avec une pointe de clou de Girofles et de poivres. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de banane en arrière goût. (Rating #3145)
Just a perfect brew, served in proper glass ware on tap in all its glory. I cant think of anything Id add or change about this beer.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2010 Big offwhite head. Hazy paleish yellow body. Strong spicy banana aroma with cloves and mealy wehat notes. Sweet sugary banana and earth taste with mealy candy notes. Fullish body. Mealy fizzy mouthfeel. Dry milky yoghurty mealy aftertaste with floral wheaty notes. Nice, but not great. Like a scaled-up version of the normal weizen without the refreshing aspects. (0.5l bottle, Olympen, Oslo. Rated twice; second score off by 0.1.)
Draft. Hazy dark gold with a nice head and great lacing. Aroma is clove, banana, clove, spice, and bread. Nice full texture but still very drinkable.

Bottle. Pours yellow-orange, hazy, with a small white head. Yeasty aroma, with notes of citrus and spices. Big, long lasting taste with notes of vanilla. Lots of candy banana and clove. Spicy (white pepper?) aftertaste. Refreshing and also very complex. Medium bodied. Smooth. Beautiful!

Bottle.  Brillantly vibrant cloudy golden beer with a steady fairly strong white head.  The aroma is fruity and yeasty, and the flavour is fairly bitter and citric with a strong yeasty finish.  Overall a nice drinkable fruity and yeasty bitter beer.

A: The pour is a hazy golden color with a tint of orange and a creamy white head.

S: A very nice citrus aroma and perhaps a bit of pineapple. Sweet wheat and malt aromas and the great German yeast gives off some bananas, cloves, and apples.

T: The flavor is quite similar to the aroma. Good sweetness and yeast contributions and plenty of fruit (banana, apple, and oranges). There is a light bitterness to this one as well.

M: Medium body with a smooth and creamy carbonation. Quite pleasant, indeed.

D: I think I still like their regular Hefeweizen a bit better, but this is still a great beer. I might have to pick up a few more bottles.

[bottle]
Strong sweet malt aroma with some herbs, including coriander, and bubblegum and clove. Murky dark yellow-orange under wispy white and a thick ring. Sweet malt, clove and bubblegum flavour. Excellent Weißbier on steroids. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, sweet finish with a tang of wheat malt sourness.

Pours murky blonde with a moderate white head. Nose is coriander and bananas, with a touch of yeast...not too far off a good witbier. Flavor contains the above, with a bit of floral hops, bitter citrus, and apples. Finish is fruit and yeast. A solid beer that hides its alcohol very well.

A hazy yellow pour with fluffy, white head.  The aroma is a nice mixture of wheat, citrus, cloves, and a hint of banana.  The taste somewhat tangy and sweet all at once with lively carbonation.  It is full bodied and the finish has slight bitterness which makes me drink even quicker.  This beer literally gets better with each sip.

From a 500 ml bottle from the Bottle Barn in Santa Rosa, CA this poured a clear gold with a fat off-white head. Nose is of wheat with banana and cloves. Medium body and a lively mouthfeel. Flavor shows a lot of citrus and banana.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2013 Pours a butterscotch-yellow, with a massive white head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is banana, clove, bread/yeast and malt. Taste is sweet, banana, clove, coriander and yeast. Finish is sweet and refreshing.Smells and tastes like Leffe Blond with German character. Excellent beer but I wish it was bottle conditioned with sediment in the bottom of the bottle.

Pours a nice golden with a tall white head.  Aromas of banana, spice, flowers and lemon.  Very bright beginning on the palate, but lemon and banana flavors shrink to rhubarb, broccoli, and vegetal finishes.  Alcohol is too high, and spicy, promising notes fade into a sickly finish.

Banana and clove dominate the aroma with hints of sweet citrus.  Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a thick white head.  Very spicy, clove and corriander with hints of nutmeg with banana and citrus flavors, bread-like malts as well.  Very nice!!!

Draft @ OBM:
Small white foamy head.
Slightly hazy yellow.
Smell some fruit (citrus) and wheat. As well as hints of malt and sour.
Taste is super fresh and fruity. Taste wheats and fruit (citrus, lemon)and slight hint of hops.
Very tasty and refreshing, nicely balanced and soft and fruity palate.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 500 ml bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 7.7%. Very pale yellow colour, hazy, with a huge white head. Much paler than any other weizenbock Ive had. Lovely typical sweetish hefeweizen aroma with notes of ripe bananas, cloves and bubblegum. The flavour is sweet and fruity, but still fairly light bodied for its strength. Moderate notes of cloves, very moderate hops. A very different character compared to e.g. Schneider Aventinus, but nice enough to drink.
Draft. Medium golden& cloudy pour. Hefe like qualites in the nose, bananas & clove. Taste was bananas, clove, well balanced & great fuller mouthfeel. Very good beer

appearance: cloudy golden orange with 2 finger white head and good amount of tiny bubbles that keep the head going, although the head pretty quickly dissipates to about half a finger. minimal lacing. 
aroma: bready with dried fruit (maybe figs?). very nice. 
taste: very good-- lightly sweet; lightly bitter,
palate: fizzy carbonation, medium body;  excellent crisp finish with some extra sweetness at the very end.

overall-- very good beer. will be having this one again for sure. the balance of the taste and crisp finish is great.

Tasted 6/22/10.  500ml bottle.  Hazy and golden with yellow highlights.  Layer of white head.  Aromas of mild caramel and citrus with a touch banana esters.  Medium bodied with a tart effervescence and a bright citrus note.  Estery undertones with nuances of strawberries and raspberries.  Bright carbonation.  Banana yeast notes that blend very nicely between the caramel and fruity flavors.  Toasty caramel lightly roasted malts.  Lotta flavor with a sticky cloying finish.  Totally Solid brew!
A very cloudy yellow gold with frothy white head. Scent is fruity mainly bananas. Taste is wheaty and sweet.

Clear golden yellow, puffy white head.  Aroma is nice spicy, pear fruity aroma, dry, some sweet maltiness and light banana esters.  Taste is some alcohol, more banana, some spicy esters, nice clove finish.
Pours up flat with no head and no aroma. Has a lot of flavor, though, hint of fruit but bolder, with a great body.

Pours a yellow orange with decently large bubbly white head.  Aromas of banana and clove with maybe hits of a doughy yeast and bready wheat slight spice as well possibly nutmeg?  Taste is delicious!  Big emphasis on the yeasty fruity esters with spices coming into play followed by a wonderful warming sweetness.  The beer is perfectly carbonated leaving for a clean crisp refreshing finish.  Medium bodied but has a smooth texture to it.  Overall a wonderful beer for a warm Sunday afternoon!

Aroma: Bananas and cloves are the main scents with a very big emphasis on the fruit. There is a slight yeast scent blended in there and maybe even a bit nutmeg to add to the complexity.
Appearance: I gave the beer a vigorous pour and there was initially a large, rocky and abundant head but that faded quickly and my glass is left with a solid layer of frothy foam. The color is hazy straw/ golden. The beer is not so hazy that I cant watch some bubbles stream to the top and replenish the head though. The head is a bit of a disappointment since I do expect a bit more from a German Weizen, but the fact that it is a bock may have something to do with it. I love the lightness in color though. Im drinking the beer from my Aventinus glass and the difference in color could not be more striking between the two beers of similar style.
Taste/Palate: Very full of esters with big up front yeast and fruit. This bock is rich, hearty and sweet feeling with residual sugar throughout. The beer is not cloying though due to the amazing carbonation and acidity with really washes my mouth clean of any sugar feeling, leaves me refreshed and my saliva glads anticipating the next sip. The label says we have a 7.7% beer here and Im hear to say that none of that big alcohol shines through. If I didnt know better I would have thought this beer to be a very full and rich hefeweizen with robust character. After a while the banana fades into a fruit smoothie with oranges and spice.
Overall: I kept thinking about brunch tomorrow and how this would be a great substitute for the omnipresent mimosa. The bock is lively and rich which would be an outstanding pair to breakfast foods and theres just enough alcohol to get your Sunday morning juices flowing.
Bevuta in bottiglia al Fondo di Recco (GE). Colore tra il dorato e lambrato, schiuma solidissima, sentori tipici da weizen, con più corpo e più alcool. Un buon esemplare di weizenbock

Bottle, 500ml. Pours a deep, beautiful, murky, golden/amber colour with a magnificent, fluffy offwhite crown. Looks amazing, but unusual for a weizenbock, I was expectinh something darker. Aroma is very yeasty and a touch acid, smells very promising. Taste is heavier and more robust than I expected. I was expecting something more weissbier-like. Taste is subtle and complex. Strong alcohol and bitter finish. Probably the best German beer Ive tried.

Bottle at home. Hazy yellowish orange pour, thick creamy white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is strong weizen yeast with banana and bubblegum. Flavor is fruity sweet with more banana and wheat, some white sugar and alcohol. Lively carbonation and a creamy texture. A bit like a more powerful version of their hefe-weizen. Nice one.

may25. rating this with my towel on. (international towel day).
Cloudy yellow, huge smooth white head.
very nice wheaty slighlty tart, flowery and peach+banana fruity aroma. even though fruity also appears quenching , dry and slightly citrussy. a little more sweet malty alc. aroma than what is in an ordinary wheat beer.
flavor is wheaty, sweet malty, alcohol, banana in the background, citrussy note from the aroma not there anymore. The stronger alc and malt flavor doesnt really do any good to the delicate wheat flavor. Perhaps it would be better if You had it very cold. You dont really notice the 7.7% abv that much. I wouldve put it at 5.6 to 6.6 or so.

Very low aroma.  Flavor is pretty simple and DOMINATED by the banana/clove from the yeast.  A well made beer, and maybe better than my score as a whole, but the appearance,lack of flavor diversity, and muted aroma keep the score pretty low.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2010 Awful...score 96...this cant be, I would rather lick a pencil sharpener or brush my teeth after eating grapefriut...If you like Hoegaarden and the rest of cinnamony heavy metallic taste beers, this one is for you...

Pours a solid yellow-orange with a huge, frothy, white head. The aroma is very strong banana and clove, with a bit of bready malt. The flavor is similar, with a hint of citrus zest on the finsh. Thick mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Nice beer.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of yeast, slight wheat, slight spice, and a hint of citrus.  Poured yellow/gold in color with a large, creamy, dense, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of small, medium, large, and huge-sized particles throughout.  Flavor is light to medium sweet.  Tastes of wheat, slight spice, slight citrus, and slight banana.  Medium body.  Slick, then lightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Wheat and slight spice finish is dry.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2010 Very nice yeasty aroma of banana and hay, pours pale cloudy yellow.  High carbonation, brings a very nice medium-full body to the tongue, creamy, almost sticky texture, touch of bitterness in the finish.  Spicy, possibly from hops, alcohol present on the palate, leads to a bit of warming.

Much much lighter colored than expected... golden hazy big head fluffy... tons of spicy banana aroma... odd malty flavor up front, somewhat thinner than expected, lively at the end, but not all the way through... good flavor esp in the finish, spicy, not as much banana as expected... medium bodied...

Pours a two-finger white head that fades quickly leaving no lace.  Light hazy amber color, yeast left in bottom of bottle.  Medium bodied and strong carbonation.   Nose is a spicy yeast.  Flavor is sweet spices, lemon and yeast. The best weizen bock Ive had (at least 10), it beats Schneider Aventinus. $3.25 for a 500ml bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, MA.

Bottle at Monks Kettle. Pours dark golden with a beartiful white head, correctly rolled and poured by the barkeep. There is a nice wheat aroma that is fruity and fragrant. The flavor is typical of a wheat beer, fruity with some banana ester, but it is heartier than most, with a slightly sour finish.
Very nice beer.  cloudy golder color with head that goes away quickly.  taste is banana, spices and cloves.  carbination is good.  Very refreshing

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a large, fluffy white head. Sweet wheat-beer aroma, with a good amount of banana and cloves. Flavor is somewhat sweet wheat malt, with quite a bit of the sweet banana, and a bit of spice and citrus. Overall, feels more like a strong hefeweizen than what I expect a weizenbock to be. But as a strong hefeweizen, its quite good.

Perfect orange pour into my weihenstephan glass. Hazy orange with a pillowy white head. Nose is spicy wheat, yeast and clove. Banana is mild. flavor is similar to a bigger version of their weiss. Lots of wheat, pilsner and doughyness. Finish is soft and dry. exceedingly drinkable for 7.7% and so far the best light weizenbock Ive had. Wonderful!

Well, this is delicious.  I am sharing a bottle of this with my beer buddy beerbaron617 and we both thought it was pretty damn good.  Pours a beautiful golden opaque yellow, with a huge fluffy white head.  An abundant aroma filled with, of course, wheat, yeast, banana, clove, and even a hint of the citrus.  Its got a medium mouthfeel with a light syrup sensation.  Just the right amount of carbonation, and it makes my mouth feel really juicy.  Great flavor, great nose, gear mouthfeel, probably the best wheat style Ive had in a while.

First off.. Im not the biggest wheat beer fan in the world, however, this is the best wheat beer I have ever had, thus far. It tastes like banana bread, with all  the yeasty, bready, sweet bits that make up a quality wheat beer. Yummmm! 
Just do yourself a favor and get some. Cheers!

500 ml. Pours a lemony color with super-fluff head. Could pass for an ordinary hefe. Kind of low on the carbonation, and the body is very creamy. Some banana and clove and sunny fruit. A slight hint of the high AV, but still good for warm weather. Mostly just a souped up hefeweizen, but thats enough for me.

Pours hazy orange with a rather light head. Aroma is wheaty with lots of banana. Flavor has much more banana and sweetness than I anticipated. Tastes quite a lot like sahti, which I dont really like either. The rather low carbonation doesnt help this case. A disappointment.

What an interesting beer, very dense texture and look. Dirty blonde and very cloudy with a copious head of white foam, aroma showing bright clove and fruit, fruit, fruit. Taste bananas and sun-ripe pear, and a bit of zingy citrus, cloves, Bubblegum. Cloves. There must be hops or the sweetness and body would be overwhelming, and the balance is actually fantastic. A real treat. I should mention the sediment was really glued to the bottom, suggesting a mature bottle was found & it did not hurt this beer.

This was fantastic, drank direct from bottle and will have again in a proper glass.  Perfect balance of standard weiss characteristics (banana, clove, bubblegum notes) and a light malt aftertaste.  Recommended.

500 ML bottle.  Hazy yellowish orange with huge soapy creamy head.  Head fairly thick, that slowly diminishes to a bubbly white color over the cloudy orange color of the beer.   Flavor comes across with a strong banana  with a silky but crisp soft effervescence.  Finished with  more of a bitter tang then I expected with a grainy and slightly sour-fruity taste.  Aromatic an nice to drink.  Good Weizenbock

UPDATED: APR 3, 2010 500 ML bottle in Germany. Cloudy orange off color. Head of off white color was gone quickly. Armoa was of citrus, cloves and banana. Creamy carby feel with a citrus and stronge alcohol taste at first that wears off after the beers warms and you adjust to the taste.  A good example of a orange color WB. Good stuff.

Superior beer.  Cloudy gold w/ thick lasting head; aroma is fruity and soft of bananas with a malt note; flavor is banana with some tang even a note of licorice; feels silky yet crisp with soft effervescence; finishes somewhat dry with a bitter tang of licorice and note of bananas.

Hazy yellowish orange with huge soapy creamy head.
Damn this head wont diminish.
Aroma of banana and spices, 
Flavour is sweet of fruits, mostly banana, some very mild bitter and sourness with citrus. Its a nice beer, but weird, I wouldnt know when it is a appropriate moment to drink this again.

(bottle) Hazy, light-golden colour with a giant and rocky white foam. Sweet grainy cereal-like malty and yeasty aroma with citrus and light notes of banana, also hints of cloves and vanilla are detectable. Moderately sweet flavour with a touch of acidity, medium bodied with a mellow, well-carbonated mouthfeel. Yeasty, grainy and wheaty taste with citrus, banana and mild clovy spices; sweet and sour-fruity, also quite lasting finish with rounded and not too extreme spicy notes; The alcohol is well-embedded. Aromatic and pleasant to drink, thus pretty deceptive Weizenbock. 24.IX.07

Shared this one w/ SkyCop32. Picked up at Maruhn Getränke in Darmstadt, Pours a crisp cola brown color. Aromas of clove, banana, fruit, and alcohol. Flavor is alcoholic clove and spice with a bittersweet finish. Good beer!
Bottle 500 ml.Hazy orange color with big head. Aroma orange, banana, wheat.Taste banana, bread, with great lasting finish. One of my favorites.

Who reads this anyway?  Just try the beer.  Its from Weihensephaner, so more than likely it tastes decent.  This one is good.  The alcohol goes straight to you.  Pours a hazy gold, has a pretty light body, but a wonderful balance of whatevers inside (I have no idea).  Very good brew.

06/03 0.5 l bottle at brewerys outlet in Berlin. It poured hazy dirty orange body with medium sized ivory head. Very nice orange and banana aroma, along with caramel and some brown sugar. Flavor doesnt fail, its great yeasty banana, orange, vanilla and caramel, slightly sweet with only a touch of alcohol being felt. Full in body, cloying brew with sticky mouthfeel. Long, very fine malty sweetish finish. Fantastic beer, best thing I had in a while!

Pours out a light hazy orange/yellow with the massive white pillowy head typical of weizens, the flavor is of clove with a hint of banana, not quite as bold as the hefeweizen.  Very smooth, another winner from the worlds oldest brewery.

17 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy gold with noticeable sediment, and a big fizzy frothy head tinged slightly yellow.  Aroma of spices, clove, banana, yeast, champagne like dryness, bubblegum.  Taste is enjoyable, full bodied, smooth mouth feel, nice carbonation and yeast leaves your throat feeling tingly.  The fruitiness of the aroma seems to be mediated by the spices once tasting it, with bread and dryness on the finish.  Almost seems "belgian styled."  It is quite good.
Very very good stuff...tastes like a slightly spicy, slightly heavier good-quality hefeweizen; the extra malt and alcohol is subtle and only enhances the final product

Bottle from the Wine Society in Nashua N.H. Pours a honey gold color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is banana, clove and wheat. Fairly full bodied with active carbonation on the tongue. Flavor is wheat with the usual banana highlights and hints of clove spice.  Didnt pick up on any of the cheap bubblegum flavor in some beers of this style. Alcohol is completely hidden. Very enjoyable brew and very reasonably priced.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2011 Aroma of bread yeast, lemon and clove.  Very light on banana.  Hazy golden yellow with thick, bubbly white head.  Rich spiciness with strong clove fermentation character.  Again the biscuity/yeasty character is strong.  Alcohol warms your heart.  Carbonation is brisk.
Bottle from the Eastchase Majestic.  Cloudy yellow with a white head.  Aroma is banana, clove, a little yeast, and cinnamon.  Taste is tons of banana, sweet, a little spice.

Bottle courtesy of Fratto. Foggy golden orange color with a white head. Big banana sweet aroma. Belgian yeast and fruity. Taste holds the banana flavors as well. Pretty sweet. Finishes sweet fruit with the slight tingle of alcohol.

Bottle (in NZ). Paler than I expected - a hazy pale orange - but with a big pure white head. Yeasty banana, citrus and hints of raw wheat on the nose. The carbonation and slight mineral characters cut through the palate perfectly. The sweetness is a temptress rather than overbearing, and the wheat adds just enough dryness. Refreshing would be the best descriptor of this.

At the Weihenstephaner at the Hackesher Markt, Berlin. Poured an opaque apricot body with a medium sized thick white head. Gluey banana nose, very very nice. Sweet taste, mostly banana, light, lactic traces, chalky, superb balance and mouthfeel. Light hop, slightly acidic, near the end. Just lovely.

I normally think of weizen bocks as being darker in color but this is the same hazy straw yellow of most hefeweizens. Likewise it pours w/ a huge head that leaves behind big bands of lacing.  Bananas up front in the nose w/ a bit of a tart tang and some floral notes. Medium bodied, slick on the tongue but also slightly sticky and sweet. Just loads of bananas in the flavor and a twinge of alcohol but very easily drinkable despite this. This is a nice weizen for sure but I think the regular hefe is a better brew.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2016 [3/10] Bottle, 8C. Nearly opaque orange with white 2 inch quivering dome of a head that is back inside the glass pretty quickly. Highish bead. Nose of lemon, cloves, bread dough. Quite sweet with balancing citric tartness. Full almost chewy palate with quite a lot of orange, banana and spice. I find the lack of darker malts confusing - why drink this instead of their hefe weissbier? Is the extra alcohol supporting anything? [3.3]Not so cloudy, but has the lovely white head that lasts pretty well. Otherwise the same: apparently I have not become more sophisticated. Id take the hefe over this every time.

Pours hazy goldenrod with a pillowy but diminishing head.  Aroma is sweetened lemon and yeast.  Taste is citrus fruit with hints of banana, vanilla, bubblegum and residual yeast. Full bodied with a very wet mouth-feel.  finishes light but the citrus remains taking on more of a lemon peel character.   Very nice summer beer
Hazy yellow, white head. Aroma mostly of overripe banana. Flavor adds liquorice-like notes. Feels quite balanced, but not just my favorite style.

bevuta solamente in Bottiglia, si presenta bellissima nel suo colore ambrato con la sua splendita testa bianca compattissima.abbastanza Dolce e molto chiaro la punta di banana, arancia e chiodi di garofano finale leggermente amarognolo.
questa si che è una birra!
Bottled at home. Golden colored, big lasting head, lots of carbonation. Nose of malts and wheat. Sweet malty flavor, not enough bitterness to compensate. Not really special.

650 ml bottle. Bottled 090225. Pours a thin white head with minimal lacing, over a cloudy, yellow (SRM 3) body....nose is light clove, light lemon, bit of banana/bubblegum.....taste is again light clove, lemon, bubblegum....mouth feel is medium to light, carbonation low. This is a light Weizen Bock, with aromas and flavors much lower than many. It has all of the right qualities, but they are on the light side. The brewery does call it a single Bock.  BJCP 8/3/12/4/7

Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow with a thick, if not too persistent, fluffy white head. Aroma is strong, yeasty and a little lemony with malty and rubbery hints. Refreshing flavor is crisp, malty, yeasty and lemony with a hint of hop bitterness. Texture is strongly tingly, yet it slides smoothly down the pipes. It leaves a nice tingle on the tongue and inside the lips.
500cl - Doughy yeast aroma with sweet bubblegum and wheat.  Flavor of sweet malts and spicy doughy yeast.  Clean palate.  A tasty brew.

Bottle 500ml. Delicious beer. Aromas of apple, dough, vanilla, spice, and some alcohol. Taste is long-lasting, it has sweet and bitter notes, and also a tart touch. Palate is silky, and full-bodied. Yellow, bubbly, with a white creamy head.
Tastes similar to Weihenstephaners Hefe-weisse only with more alcohol taste. I still prefer the hefe-weisse.

Bottle.  Sweet banana, orange, clove and wheat malt aroma - very light astingent alcohol note.  Cloudy yellow amber with moderate head.  Very sweet orange/banana and clove flavor up front with a very nice wheat malt and light astringent/tangy finish.  Moderate carbonation.  Spectacular - everything I expected from Weihenstephaner.
Hazy golden colour with a very thick frothy white head. Strong aroma, very fruity. Taste is pleasant enough but I found the aroma absolutely overwhelming when drinking.

Wow the spiel above about the beer is pretty spot on. Light yet flavourful. Spicy , a bit hoppy and of course lots of sweet fruit. My new favourite Weihenstephaner and extra points for the great glass!

Sampled at the 2008 Crescent Moon Summer Beerfest. Pours a pale light gold that is very cloudy. The thick white head hangs on for a long time. Has an unusual metallic aroma. I think that Ayinger Weizenbock is way better. Has good banana flavors. Rich and full bodied. Theres a bit of orange flavors in there as well. This is almost like drinking Mrs. Butterworths syrup. Crisp and sweet finish with bread dough and honey notes at the end.

500ml bottle into weizen glass. Body is hazy bright yellow with a large cream-white head that fades quite quickly. Estery nose of  bananas, pears, cloves and vanilla on top of bready malts and light citrus hops. Taste is medium sweet with a nice spiciness to the finish. Rich syrupy mouthfeel with a moderate carbonation and fullish body. Overall tastes like a turbo-charged wheat beer that is still refreshing and sessionable. Just be careful with the ABV.

Pours a hazy golden orange color with a fluffy white head. Aroma is 
clove, honey, yeasty, banana, wheat, and some  earthy notes. Flavor is 
clove, honey, wheat, banana, and a earthy finish.
Bottle. Hazy golden yellow pour with thick yellow head. Aroma bread, banana, spicy notes, and dough. Fairly sweet with a good balance of sourness and plenty of CO2 to give it a lively mouth feel.
pours hazy yellow with huge thick white head. aroma is wheat, sweet malts, spice. drinks similar with a sweet spicy at the same time.
Bottled 50cl. Surprisingly pale appearance. Creamy palate. Definitely a flawless beer. Probably better in summer. Not my kind of style though.

(bottle from Queen Liquor in Colorado Springs). Yellow color with light cloudiness. Large white head which is lasting. Aroma of wheat and yeast/dough. Sweet bread and wheat flavor. Avg duration. Smooth finish with light dryness. Creamy texture. Moderate carbonation. Spare lacing.

Pours cloudy gold with a dense white head which fades away to a thin wisp. Aroma is beautiful - pears, banana, cloves, nutmeg, vanilla, and a bunch of other complex notes I cant quite make out. The beer is full and prickly with high carbonation in the mouth. Clove and banana meld well with fresh baked bread and candied nuts. A very good beer. Id rate it more highly still, but for the fact that its a little disappointingly like an overgrown hefeweizen.

Pours hazy golden with huge, though quickly disappearing head, leaving a thick layer of lace; aroma of wheat, slightly yeasty banana, citrus, some spices and bready notes; thin to medium body with very low carbonation; bready flavor of wheat, yeast and banana; slightly citrus and some spices, even herbal notes in the finish.

500 ml bottle pours a hazy, light golden body with a giant fluffy white head.  Aroma of wheat, cloves, citrus spice and a bit of banana.  Taste is multi-layered:  Bready, yeast, wheat and cloves.  Finishes with some pear, slight honey sweetness, bit of alcohol and a mild, short bitterness.  Medium carbonation, but has a smooth, soft body.  Much more flavor and body than belies the hazy, golden pour!!

When I bought this one I had great expectations... But eventually it was too mediocre. Dark brown color with thick light brown foam. Bitter earthy taste but quite easy going for a bockbeer. As I said before I expected a lot more so I wouldnt recommend it. Its just my opinion though...

(Sample Date: 8/2/2009   Source:Other)   7.7 ABV 1/2L bottle. Big grainy aroma with spicy yeast character. Bready bubblegum notes. Cloudy light straw with medium fine white head. Sweet and spicy. Light fruity yeast notes with hints of banana and clove. Medium body and mouth feel. Spicy finish.

Bottle.

Cloudy gold with a large white head. Aroma of banana, spices, citrus, malt and wheat. The same in the flavor. A lot of carbonation. A very nice Weizenbock.

Dull yellow pour with a fluffy head, still there a few minutes later!  banana dominates aroma. Clove, Banana, dominate flavor, some peppery flavor on the tailend. Very light mouthfeel.  cant believe its 7.7%, very nice brew.

strong banana, brown sugar, alcohol aroma, bananas foster! also lots of yeast and some spicy citrus.
cloudy yellow straw, thick frothy eggshell head.
nice sweet mild flavor, backed by a bit of citrus and cloves, though just a bit watery.
bodys also slightly thin, though nicely textured, almost crunchy, with a nice sweet spicy finish.

Bottle from Wine and Cheese Place in Clayton.  Pours hazy yellow-gold with a big rocky white head that leaves some lacing behind.  Aroma of banana, clove, wheat, yeast, floral notes, and coriander- not unlike a traditional German hefewezen on the nose.  Banana also leads the flavor, with wheat and yeast, as well as spices and herbal notes.  Medium bodied, with active carbonation.  Wheaty mouthfeel.  Nice balance, good beer.

Pours cloudy gold with a big frothy head. Aroma-pear, banana, clove, lemon, bread. Taste-much like the aroma with pears being the most forward then cloves and sugar. Sweet, short and fruity finish. Really great.
Poured into a flute with a medium yellowy head. Aromas of malts and chocolate were prominent. The taste was yeasty at first and ended with malty aftertaste. I enjoyed it very much.

Spicey banana bread, nutmeg aroma.  Hazy pale gold color with lively, pillowy white head.  Lighty banana bread dry fruitiness with a spice behind it.

 Notes: Dec 09 Kaiserslautern

Bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with a large fluffy white head.  Nice big banana and wheat with a nice musky yeast note that shows up as it warms.  Simple but clean.  Medium bodied, light banana and wheat.  Finishes with a bit of warming alcohol and a touch of banana.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Smells like banana and clove, and tastes as such. Some alcohol presence but overall great. A Weizenbock done right.

A nice clovey banana taste similar to other weihenstephaner products. Pretty  cloudy appearance. Very carbonated (again like other weihenstephaner products) and a nice aroma and somewhat sweet taste. A good choice overrall

1pt bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Cloudy orange with ample creamy white head.  Aroma is yeast, bubblegum, spice, banana.  Flavor is bubblegum, banana, spice, bread.  Medium-bodied, lively carbonation.  Medium finish is slightly bitter.  This is an odd weizen bock.  The dominance of the bubblegum aroma/flavor is more reminiscent of big Belgian beers than a weizen bock.  Not a bad beer, just not a great example of the style.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2011 Aroma is full of green fruit, including bananas, pears, and grapes. Notes of nutmeg and clove are also fairly strong. Tart wheat fills in the background. A hint of noble hops emerge as it reaches room temperature.
Appearance is hazy gold with a dense white head that persists to the end of the glass.
Flavor is bright and complex with Bavarian yeast esters up front, sweet malt and tart wheat interplaying in the middle, and alcohol warmth cutting through earthy yeast in the finish. 

------- />
hzy-strw, thk-cmy-wh-hd, full-body.

wheat hay apple banana aroma.

grape floral T1, ^wheat-malt spicey fruity banana §bbgm T2, juicy ^mild ^short §alchl-wrm T3.

faint but complex flavors, no-clove §banana ^wheat-malt, seemed ^fresh.

Hazy golden body, huge, towering head, with the bottle foam still coming out from the bottle even when it is half empty! The usual weizen aromas are there (banana, bubblegum, clover), but everything is overshadowed by a rather unpleasant warm, perfumy, alcoholic note reminding me of  cheap strong lagers. Oily on the palate, medium bitterness in the finish. All in all, a disappointment from Weihenstephaner. Will probably re-rate.

500-ml bottle Marcellos, Lafayette, LA - Aroma: spicy (hop), dough (yeast), clove, banana; Appearance: hazy, orangish-golden color, off-white head, slight laces; Flavor: salty (malt), spicy, bitter (hop), clove, banana; Mouthfeel: full bodied, oily texture, fizzy-high carbonation, abrupt finish; Overall: a beautiful color and has a nice clove and fruity  hop aroma and flavor with a sharp dry finish.
