Not much malt flavor or aroma.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a cloudy dark golden color with nice thick white head.  Not quite has dark as some weizenbocks.  Great mouth feel and highly carbonated.  The taste is dominated by clove and has some banana.  One of the best I have had. Prost!

( 16.9oz bottle) pours cloudy yellow orange with nice lasting head. Nose of clove, banana, and other spices. Taste of ripe banana, clove, spices, and bread. Creamy and very well carbonated. A great German beer!
Bottle from coldbrewky. Pours a hazy gold with a nice sized white fizzy head. Aroma and flavor are pretty much the same, banana, clove, wheat, and bread. Nice light body, refreshing.

16.9oz bottle. Pours golden with a slight amber hue. The off-white head is initially very active and frothy, but gradually fades to a small ring. Aroma of bubblegum, wheat, spice, banana, and slight vanilla. Banana is the initial flavor, which is joined by wheat, spice, caramel, and citrus. Alcohol becomes more evident towards the finish. Finishes sweet and almost syrupy. Thin to medium bodied, with less carbonation than I expected. Its far from perfect, but still pretty enjoyable.

Nice, hazy, banana yellow liquid. Over two fingers of loose white foamy head. Retention is okay and the lacing is alright. The look is good, but the head kind of disappoints.

Floral and yeasty notes hit first. Followed by light hints of tropical fruits. Nice scent of just ripening bananas. Cloves and corriander. Smells are rich and make me salivate.

Nice. Big banana taste. Almost like a good banana puding. Then the spices come into play, along with a touch of nutty flavor. Now its like some fresh banana bread. Notes of wheat and yeastiness. Light notes of caramel/brown sugar.

Very good and creamy beer, here. The carbonation is a little bit sharp, though. Nice, solid medium body. Thick enough to be enjoyable, yet not overpowering.

Truly a very drinkable beer. Great flavor and easy to drink. Also, I know that its a 7.7% ABV, but I cant detect any alcohol presence, at all. Very well balanced brew, overall

Bottle. Pours with  huge rocky white head over a hazy yellow body. Balanced clove-banana aroma and flavours including peach, background malt sweetness and alcoholic warmth coming through. Really nice.

Pours much lighter than I expected...almost school bus colored.  Certainly not as muddy as I wanted...more of an unfiltered haze.  The head was marvelous though...Ive never seen bubbles so dense.  Nose was chewed wheat, yeast, and bananas with touches of tartness, and a little clove.  Flavors were primarily yeasty with waves of cream of wheat, whole grains, oatmeal, cherio made of dried bananas...sprinkles of spice round things out.  Body is nicely full and round, fills the mouth nice and leaves the flavors to linger.  I can say I wish it was even more chewy as I love chewiness in weizenbocks...but oh well.  The alcohol is warming...

Tap at Verdugo.  I was very surprised by this because it was unlike any weizenbock I have experienced.  Nose smells like trappist yeast and Begian wheat!  Color is a paler yellow than I expected also - nothing bocky about it.  Flavor also starts out a mellow, aged yeasty Belgian ale, but finishes with that Weihenstephaner twang and a distinctly German graininess.  Nice.

The aroma is spicy, coriander, orange peel, banana, slight bubblegum.  The appearance is light yellow, fluffy white head (more like a regular wheat than a weizen bock).  The flavor is spicy, and sweet, coriander, pepper, banana, bubblegum.  The finish is very low in hop bittering, and has an astringent burn from the spices.  Medium mouthfeel, maybe a little thin.  Definitely morre like a wheat than a weizen bock, which I expect to be darker, thicker and more boozy. Still, decent and enjoyable.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy gold with an absolutely massive head.  Lots of suds clinging to the side of the glass as it slowly, slowly recedes.  An interesting mix of aromas:  bubble gum and cloves, bananas, a little lemon and grass and just a little bit of a funk to it.  Flavor is a little washed out, but a very nice mix of the above flavors.  With just a little more umph or push, this would be awesome.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Poured a hazy golden color with a big white head that left quickly. Smell and taste are huge in bubble gum with notes of wheat, banana, and lemon. Not really a huge fan of this one but it is very drinkable. Too much bubble gum flavor in my opinion.

served a mug with a small to medium head and no lace. Aroma is heavy traditional Bavarian Weizen - pungent, sweet-sour, fruity, malty, und vundrerbar! Color is a hazy light to medium-light amber. Flavor is prominently a pungent malt with lemony citrus character. Hardly any hop. Finish is like regular flav. One of the richest, most full flavored weizens. Perhaps a session.

Pours a hazy gold with towering white head that fades rapidly after the first sip.
Nose shows lots of banana and wheaty bread, some light sweet malt and a bit of pear. More like a hefe than a weizenbock. Light cloves show later on, along with spices reminiscent of nutmeg and coriander.
Flavour are again more like a hefe. Lots of banana and doughy yeast, the only difference is some soft alcohol and a hint of sweet clean malt.
Medium full body, moderately high carbonation. A little to full on.
I was expecting this to be darker, fruitier, maltier, etc.

Dark blond of colour, small white head (when poured out in weizenglass). Aroma is ruity, with something like peaches, sweet, but full taste, bitter of the hops. Its like me like a tripel one, fruity. hoppy dry. Alcohol is not dominating luckily.

500ml bottle from K&L Redwood City.  Pours a bright clear golden color with a medium white head that dissipates.  Aroma is wheat, banana, clove, yeast, and spice.  Flavor is very nice and fairly sweet with wheat, banana, clove, sugar, light fruits, and spice.  Medium-bodied with a crisp mouthfeel and medium-high carbonation.  Extremely drinkable.

(draft @ The Old Toad - Rochester, NY) Golden hazy pour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet and yeasty with a lot of spice and banana. Flavor begins with a very nice banana, clove, and wheat note but then goes to a malty smoothness as opposed to the dry grainy flavor of a regular weizen. Smooth and spicy and rather easy to drink.

on tap at Taco Mac Windward... arrived at the table a cloudy deep golden with a thin white head ... I feel this would have a much bigger head when poured from the bottle... wonderful banana aroma with some lemon and a touch of spice... medium body that is soft and creamy... really delightful over the tongue.... some yeast, spice and wheat... a very drinkable somewhat stronger beer that can really quench your thirst while bringing a lot of flavor to the table.

Bottle: Pours clear gold, big white head and nice lacing. Nose of strong esters and yeasty hefe notes, banana, clove, bread. Flavor is nice, a bit of nutty fruit, bread and some chewy raisin. Nice malty mouthfeel and a yeasty bready body. Seems like a hefe to me, not a bock, maybe a heller bock.... Nice yeastiness. Looking at the description, I guess I always assumed weizenbocks usually came in the doppel format. Nice twist.
Very nice. Rich and creamy. Generally a solid doppelbock flavor here, but just a bit of wheat bite to it. Very flavorful.

Pours a brilliant sparkling golden straw with white frothy lasting head. Typical banana and clove aroma but can also pick up some malt aromas and tarty citrus. Moderate sweetness with a long aftertaste with some slight hotness. Medium to Full bodied with a dry sharp tart finish.
Bottle.  Yellow pour, great white head.  Aroma of bananas, cloves, yeast and bread.  Flavor is full of banana, yeast, allspice, cloves, coriander and bread.
50cl bottle, Alko. white head that lasts long. aroma: wheat, citrus. Flavour: kinda sweet, banana.
Bottled. Very pale yellow hazy color which pours a huge with thick head. Aroma is Sweet wheaty and banana. Also citrus. Flavor is sweet and also wheaty with notes of fruit and banana. Good.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden color with a white head.  Aroma is roasted, malty.  Its a pretty decent bock, a style Im always iffy on.
Hazy dark golden color with a white sheen. Nice grassy banana nut bread aromas with grainy malts. Frothy light body. Lightly sweet honey banana flavor with grainy malt grist.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
Pours a hazy golden orange with hints of dark ripe banana and cloudy golden yellow hues when held to a light source and a 2 finger frothy white head that slowly fizzles into a thin cap.

Nice spicy clove aroma with a very prominent citrus peel presence. Hints of orange, lemon and grapefruit as well as a very nice ripe banana scent. Smells slightly tart. Awesome!

Extremely well-balance beer thats on the fuller side of medium body. A perfect amalgam of spicy clove, sweet citrus fruit, corriander and ripe banana notes. The spicy cloves are pretty prominent up front followed by a a perfect blend of lemon peel, orange peel, ripe banana and subtle hops. There is also a very nice slight tartness in the dry finish. This is a complex beer that is extremely drinkable and refreshing. Highly recommended!

Draft. Poured a hazy golden color with a white head. Nice aroma profile that included the likes of banana bread, yeasty bread dough, and a bit of clove. Medium bodied with a bit of citrus tartness on the tongue. I tasted banana, distinct clove, and lemon zest. There was also a light bacon note. Tasty stuff.

aroma is eggy banana and not too different from many regular strength weizens. appearance is hazy but quite light colored yellow. flavor is big sharp carb and distinct and crisp wheat with little in the way of spice or esters. id prefer a bit more of a sipper in this style, but in its defense this is very drinkable for the ABV.
not too dark of a pour, but one that i felt deserved a lot of head. definite banana smell on the nose. clean finish.

A hazy golden color with a luxurious white 3-finger head.  Classic aroma of bubblegum/banana/cloves, continuing into the flavor.  A great wheat beer with a little extra kick of maltiness which adds some complexity.  Very clean palate, almost no aftertaste, and very refreshing.
Hazy yellow-orange color. Head is big and rich. Aroma is malty, fruity (banana,apple orange). Taste is sweet, malty, yeasty, frutiy and some spicy. Sweet finale, nice body. Very nice beer at all.

Strong four-finger head.  Good, spotty lace on the glass.  Very cloudy.  The liquid is straw colored.

Okay, something must be wrong.  I smell creamed corn.  I guess there is light wheat in the background.  Very unusual nose, not exactly unappealing, but not expected either.

A smooth bodied beer--heavy body and light carbonation.  The flavor is different from any other beer Ive ever had and I cant say that I like it.  There are elements of bocks and wheat beers as to be expected.  There is a soured sweetness that takes some getting used to.  The creamed corn remains and detracts from the flavors.  Yet, it is a complex offering.  Lots of cream flavors.

I cant recommend it, but I know that it is different enough to seek out to try something very different.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is strong banana with sweet spiciness. Flavour is wheat, apricot, cloves and other spices as well as a hint of melon. Full bodied. Starts out sweet but finishes quite dry. Not Bad.

Hazy straw yellow with a quickly fading white head.  Aroma of fruit, yeast, toasted malt and light spice.  I didnt pick up any banana in this one.  Taste of fruit, apricot, alcohol, malt and yeast.  Reminds me more of a Belgian ale than a weizen bock.  Finishes up very dry.
Pours a lasting read of white head with a hazy, deep straw body.  Smells of earth and yeast.  Flavor is earth, dough, banana.  Pretty big body.

Cloudy straw yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is banana, clove, bubblegum and other things of a yeasty nature. Taste is delicious wheat and yeast but not overly spicy. Hints of ripe sweet fruit like peach and pear. Very rich body with juicy malt and a smooth finish.

Hazy yellow pour withquickly fading offwhite ring of head.  Aroma of sweet wheat and a very bready yeast, but not quite belgian, more like day old bread. Tastes of alcohol esters, rose petals, wheat, and a hint of banana, but hardly noticable.  A distinct peppery spice on the finish.  Not bad, but not my favorite from these guys.

Bottled.
Creamy, voluminous and adherent head, optimal duration. Orange clearly color, much hazy and veiled with optimal and fine fizzy aspect. Intense and alcoholic aroma, with notes of orange, banana, stum, liqueur. Much fraught taste and with strong alcoholic impact. Persistent and bitter on the end.

Bottle.  Pours an opaque gold color w/ a nice frothy white head.  Aroma of clove on pour and heavy flavor of clove once imbibed.  Medium bodied.  Has a bit of a bitter finish.  Overall a very nice brew.
light hazy yellow hue with a layer of tense white head, it has citrus aroma with hint of banana.  it is very refreshing and tasty.

The sort of effortless quality that a brewer can toss off after several centuries of practice. A great-looking beer - cloudy lemon colour with a huge wash of foam. The striking aroma of dusty wheatsacks induced a Proustian scent memory of summer childhoods spent on a friends farm. Also mashed banana and clove. Lovely creamy body. Very well integrated for a 7.7% abv bock - would never have guessed it was that strong. Sticky banana and wheat malt with an acidic finish. Quenching and moreish. (500ml bottle from Leura Cellars. BB 20/9/09)
FCBF 09.  What a nice treat at the brew fest to find a weizen bock!  Hazy, orange, very nice looking.  Banana/clove, big yeast component.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2017 5/15 re rate;  dropped slightly from 4.1............................................... from 3.9......will not wait this long to have again.  Exxxxcellent beer.  very light pour for style.  banana in aroma and taste with bock; light easy to drin,VERY nice..  

citrus, spicy aroma and there is a lingering of black pepper. Creamy texture and smooth  

alcohol was smooth even ough 7.7%

want more, but not sure where I found this - trip to Houston??

Enjoyed with my mates from the Barossa Brewers Club this beer pours mit-hefe and has the banana, clove aroma of the hefe-weisen but its not as pronounced. The palate is chewy and rich and the higher alcohol gives the beer a juiciness. Very nice beer!

Radegast: humpen: Massive beer poured into a massive dimpled mug!  Slightly hazy bright orange/ coppper pour leavin 2 fingers of white, dry head.  The nose is complex, bananas for sure, yeasts and sugars, som bitter notes as well.  The taste is equally complex: the banana tones up front, giving way to spice, through cloves maybe pepper... gives the sweet balance.  The finish is a mix of the sweet/ spice with a slight touch of alcohol.  Great brew.
German bottle into a pint glass.  Solid example of the style. Nice malt back and sweet deliciousness... good stuff!

Bottle vioa the rip and run.  Two inch head settles upon the evenly cludy honey gold elixer.  Remaining quarter inch head is renewed steadily by relaxed carbonation until end.  No lacing to speak of.  Nose of reserved spice.  Tounge is washed with gentle pepper, cloves, and then the honeyed malts emerge.  Mellow muted medium body.  These cats have the unpretentious quality presentation down to a science.  Gonna go get me some more of this.
Color is light gold and a little cloudy.  Aroma is floral, yeast, and wheat malts.  Taste is of sweeter malts.  Has a little n bit of a bite in the end.

Great, banana-yeast aroma.  Twangy, simple syrup sweetness, nice bittering.  The alcohol is edgy.  Reminded me a good bit of Don de Dieu.  Pretty clean, bitter finish.  Nice label, moderately cloudy, murky yellow.  New Leaf Market.
Hazy yellow with a thick, white head. Spicy and fruity tones. Malt, fruit and hops. Medium body with a well balanced finish.
Quite pale with a white foam floating atop a very carbonated body.  Aroma of banana, zucchini bread sweetness.  Strong banana flavor, slight clove and brown sugar.  Medium body.

Bottle at ABC beer tasting. Poured avery pale hazy gold with a white head. Aroma consisted of bananas with an undertone of rum. Flavor was sweet throughout with notes of bananas and wheat, some underlying spices.

500ml bottle.  Pours cloudy blond golden yellow. Bright white colored, foamy head and very nice legs with equally sexy lace.   Aroma of freshly picked bananas.  Dominate banana aroma.  Some mustard seed, a nice clove and a touch of honey sweetness in the nose as well.  Very grainy wheat flavor yields a nice bit of sweetness.  Lots of fruity yeast esters.  Finishes with a lingering spiciness of black pepper.  A nice calming alcoholic presence.  Creamy texture, very smooth on the palate.  Full bodied.  Dangerously drinkable.  Prost!  2020

50cl bottle. Pours cloudy orange/tan gold with thick but short-lived white head. Aroma starts with intense banana. Subtle honey, wheat, and clove follow. Flavor is wheaty, sweet, and lightly grainy with firm malty, wheaty backbone and typical fruity and spicy esters and phenols. The flavor is surprisingly low in banana ester compared to the nose. Spicy, soft bitterness at midtongue balances big bready wheat and medium malt sweetness. The finish is somewhat dry thanks to heavy carbonation. Subtle alcohol follows the grainy, wheaty, fruity, balanced finish. The mouthfeel is vigorously carbonated yet creamy and swishy with a medium-full body. Overall, a very straight-forward hefeweizen with extra gravity. Im more familiar with this style being like a *dunkel*weizen with extra gravity, but this interpretation is still tasty and drinkable.
Slightly cloudy color with a big white head...Carbonation, bubbly mouthfeel...Yeasty bubblegum flavor...Banana and spice...Awesome...

500ml bottle. Light golden straw colour witha masive swell of well compacted white foam and good carbonation. Banana aroma is very strong with a hint of cloves, spices and orange peel. Flavour is sweet and light with a strong alcohol aftertaste.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Providence, RI. Not a huge fan of weizenbocks at the moment, this is a pale one too. Estery banana, and alcohol notes. Raw alcohol, and some touches of caramel.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, citrus and yeast spiciness. The flavour is banana bread, citrus and spice. Superbly balanced, its medium bodied and good carbonation. A refreshing, enjoyable bock.

500 ml bottle. Whitish golden. Strong haze. Medium-sized white head. Spicy aroma with cloves and a little banana. Rich malty aroma with some caramel. High carbonation level. Hints of smoke. Very nice weissbier flavours, but there is a lot more body and a lot more flavour. Very rich. One must love wheat to like this beer, but I find it nicely balanced and flavourful. It leans towards being a little too sweet though. Could perhaps used a little more hops to make it less cloying. Overall a really nice weizenbock.

Pint bottle from Sams.  Pours a hazed orange yellow with a huge off white head.  Strong yeast/lemon/wheat/banana aromas that are sweet with a slight earthiness in the background.  Creamy body and highly carbonated.  More of the banana yeast wheat flavors with somewhat dirty earthy and spicy finish.  Decent weizenbock..
Great head, aroma and appearance. Perhaps a touch sweet, but great body and mouth feel. A very light Weizenbock, but it is excellent.

Bottle at tasting at work. Alround rating: The wheat is quite big and in your face, sweeter honey alcohol character(what i expect from a mead, pepperyness in the finish. Big for the sake of being big it seems, the hefe is the superiour.

a yellow-golden hazy beer with a slightly offwhite head 
smooth carbonation
smells yeasty, spicy and fruity, som alcohol ( seems a little bit harsh at the beginning)
tasts yeasty, spicy, and like fruitpunch
aftertaste is spicy, fruity, bittersweet and warming alcohol ( pperhaps a little bit harsh)

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2009 Spicy nose, cloves, baking spices, banana bread.  Almost ripe peach enters with the malt balanced by wheat tang.  A hefe on growth hormones.  Not that it feels manipulated in a nefarious way.   The "bock," part here means a loss of body  and turbidity that adds a very Champagne like structure and roundness.  Tasty.  Drinkable. 89

From a bomber sized bottle, pictured here. Aroma is refreshing and volatile at the same time. Slightly lighter than other hazy weizen bocks Ive had. First taste indicates lots of sparkling carbonation, welcomed for a high alky beer. Plenty of hefe here, banana, spices and the like. All laced with a wealthy amount of alky content. Finish is just a tad medicinal in the alky department.  One of the lighter weizen bocks Ive had as far as personality goes.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Light colored, frothy.  Musty, clove,  yeasty, slight alcohol on the nose.  Quite fruity, almost a bit sour, slight spices and banana, although fruit is more dominant.  This ones on the lighter, crisper, fruitier side of the weizenbocks ive had.  Only detractions is their is a bit of a bland-salty aftertaste.
a nice citrus aroma, hazy yellow-orange with a pinpoint head. Spicy. Flavor is sour and creamy with an alcohol bite. Nice mouthfeel.

500ml bottle.  Pours a huge, rocky-meringue, lasting white head with a hazy, golden body.  Unexpectedly light color.  Some very light yeast clouds dancing around.  Excellent, clumpy lacing that could be spooned out.  Heavy malt aroma of bread, grain, cereal and doughy yeast.  Big yeasty, phenolic spice aromas - mainly clove and a touch of coriander.  Lower levels of fruity esters, which I like.  Very light banana with a bit of pear.  Medium-full body with a creamy texture and a bit of pleasantly warming alcohol.  Average carbonation with a very lightly bitter finish...just enough to balance the sweetness.  Overall an awesome beer.  Ill be buying some more of this.

Banana and lemon bouquet, not very strong. Dingy yellow color, with a huge white head. Very noticeable alcohol, stinging mouthfeel. Similar to a carbonated lemondrop (lemon juice and vodka), but with cloves. Wheat grass finish.

A hazy golden weizen bock with a super thick and creamy white head. A nice and rich yeasty aroma, with bananas, vanilla fudge,  light sulfuric and mineral notes, very pleasant. In mouth, a nice refreshing wb, not too sweet or heavy, with light banana puree, cloves, again, lighter than expected but well balanced. Medium bodied with light hopping in finale.

Bottle. Hazy deep gold body with a large, frothy white head that lasts. Aroma is thick with grain with plenty of banana esters and a hint of clove. The alcohol is detectable in the aroma. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes moderately sweet, lightly bitter and lightly acidic. Alcohol warming. Slight tang behind the sweetness. Tastes of  sweet bananas with alcohol like bananas foster. Medium to full body with a velvety texture. Lively carbonation. Very nice.

Pours light straw with a lot of fizzy head which congeals into a smooth, pillowy top.  Huge wheat aromas with a hint of citrus hops.  Sweet white peach flavor with a bit of grape; hops only detectable by a faint tingle on the tongue.  Long, bready finish and a round mouthfeel.  Quite good, if a bit one-dimensional; I would have never pegged this one as a Weizenbock.

Bottle. Pours a super cloudy orange with a massive, frothy, everlasting white head and visibly active carbonation. Its really a beautiful sight in the weizen glass. The aroma is spicy and peppery with lots of clove and banana, everything deliciately blanced. The flavor is a little harsher than Id expect from Weihenstephan, but not bad. Its surprisingly hoppy in a husky, vegetal way and a rye flavor is present. The finishes with esters of clove and banana with a metallic twang. This is heartier than the hefeweizen and a little more tart. Pretty good.

Bottle. Foamed over a little bit. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Spicy and yeasty aroma, with clove and banana. The flavor has doughy, bready malts, clove, banana, and a bit of an acidic hint. Pretty good, but Ive had way better weizen bocks.

Cloudy orange with a thick foamy head.  Aroma has some lactic acid, bananas, and dough.  Flavor is full bodied, with some citrus and a crisp finish.  Not my favorite beer from this brewer, but still excellent.

Poured from 500ml bottle into Pint glass.

Pours a hazy golden color with a slight orange glow. It poured with a huge frothy white head. It has strong aroma of banana and cloves which I expected along with some yeast. It has a spicy flavor which I very much enjoy. Some flavors I picked up on were banana, a slight mango, clove and I think Im getting some ginger in there as well. Its a light bodied effervescent beer. Overall its extremely approachable for its higher alcohol.

Prototypical Weizen appearance, the pale body, the large head, and cloudy consistency were unmistakable.  The aroma was also classic banana and clove, and was pretty inviting. The taste was a lot spicier than the Hefeweizen this looked like.  The clove notes were much more pronounced and there was also some sourness apparent.  Very light in the mouth, which is quite typical of wheat based beers, but it was quite a bit lighter than anticipated considering this is a Weizenbock.  Probably the easiest to drink near 8% beer Ive sampled.  Way different than Aventinus or any other examples of this style.

Bottle.  Poured a lightly clouded gold with a huge white head.  Aroma of banana, clove, wheat.  Its a little musty as well - not sure what that is.  Taste is wheat, banana, yeast, clove - pretty sweet.  Mouth is dry and carbonation is lively.  Overall, a nice interesting wheat brew.

50 cl. bottle (2009) in a weizen glass. Pours a hazy golden w/ a mighty robust meringue white head (huge head as befits the style); aroma is sweet banana, wheaty and some oily residue; flavor is more banana, strong wheat and citrus; effervescent mouthfeel, ending crisp, sweet and refreshing. Should have used darker malts. Nowhere as complex and dense as Aventinus, but quite drinkable.
Pours hazy straw color with big white head. Aromas of wheat, clove and banana. Wheat, clove, banana, lemon and yeast flavors. Medium body with fizzy carbonation.

Bottle. Hazy yellow with a huge white head. Aroma of banana, yeast and wheat. The flavour is banana, yeast, wheat and malt with notes of alcohol. Nice and refreshing brew, but not as good as Hefe Weissbier from the same brewery.
Banana, cloves, wheat, sweetness, tang, yup.  All of that.  Great example of a weizenbock.  Hefeweizen plus alcohol with a bit of a kick.  A very nice beer, and quite refreshing.
Huge head when poured. The beer has a spicy lemon yeast flavor and is a full-bodied beverage.

found this strange cult following assembled in from of the local beer store waiting for this mysterious brew to appear so I had to try it. 

Bottle poured into the proper Weihenstephaner glass produced a finger worth of white head that seems to last. The body of the brew was a hazy straw color yellow.

Aromas of the typical German Weizen yeast are going threw my head Bananas, bubble gum and clove. The flavors are the same but with a touch of pepper in there as well as a slight hop bitter. There is a medium to full feel in my mouth with this brew with ample carbonation.

A great Weizenbock another brew I am sure I will be seeing again this summer. Extremely easy to drink and the almost 8% alcohol is nowhere to be found.

0.5 liter, bottle.  Hazy golden color, pours with a massive white head.  Flavors of cloves, bananas, lemon grass, dough.  I catch hints of Belgian style triples in this beer - might be the high alcohol content?  Regardless, this is a great brew and for $2.99 locally, Im loving it.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2009 500ml bottle.  Doughy, spicy yeast greets the nose, with generous amounts of clove and banana, as well as floral sweetness, licorice, lemon, golden raisin, bready, honeyish malts and wheat.  Hazed golden  color with a lasting, uneven, off-white head.  Flavor is mildly tart, sweet and spicy, with a strongly malty presence throughout, the yeast making itself known as well in large degree, and touches of peppery bitterness and banana at the end to wrap it all up.  Effervescence is mild but plentiful on the smooth palate, body is medium-full.  Enjoyable, nicely balanced and full of flavor.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2009 
Name: Vitus
Date: April 04, 2009
Mode: Bottle
Source: Greens, Atlanta
Appearance: hazy yellow, frothy white head
Aroma: sweet banana candy aroma, balancing spicyness
Flavor: lots of sweet banana flavor, candied malt, light balancing spicyness

Name: Vitus
Date: June 20, 2009
Mode: draft
Source: brick store
Appearance: opaque yellow, huge creamy white head
Aroma: aroma is much stronger on the spicy clove with the sweet banana playing backup
Flavor: sweet banana flavor is well tempered by the spicy bitterness
Overall: much drier than the bottle version

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 3.8/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: **4

Pours dull hazy yellow / gold with a large dense snow white head.  The aroma has lots of fresh esters, cream, ton of wheat, peppery kick and some vanilla.  The body starts medium / full and smooth then there is a lot of semi-sharp carbonation.  The flavor begins with the traits from the aroma with a touch of sweetness and more spice.  The finish gets drier and peppery and is fairly crisp.  Another great beer from an amazingly solid brewery.

Thanks to rustychiles for picking me up a bottle of this. Pours a super-hazy pils yellow with a humongous whipped-cream consistency head. Aroma is of wheat, lager, malty munich, and some minor banana. Taste is pretty much in the same place - a very clean and refreshing wheat and munich taste with extremely minor banana undertones. Weihenstephan never ceases to amaze me. A very solid beer.
Bottle @ La Tortula: A clear colored Weizenbock, full of aroma and flavour. A great refreshing beer.

Bottle from Table & Vine in MA.  Pours dark gold with a huge white head.  Aroma is strong of banana, clove, wheat, peach and yeast.  Palate is crisp, with a medium-long finish.  Flavors are a really nice blend of fruit, wheat and Belgian yeast.  Great flavor characteristics washed down easily with pearly effervescence.  Great beer!

From a 1 pt. 0.9 fl oz. bottle  no. 5198.  It pours a cloudy pale yellow with foam, foam, and more foam.  It overflows the glass.  The aroma is clearly of yeast, wheat, and spices.  The mouthfeel is pretty decent and chewy.  The taste is bold , hoppy, and very true to the bock recipe of 1040 AD I suppose.  I thought it was excellent for its style.

a cloudy gold appearance under a large frothy white head.  banana aroma of a hefe.  flavor is also very much like a regular hefe with banana and vanilla notes but with a thicker malt.  thick palate as well and creamy.  overall, not really all that different from the regular hefe.

16.9 oz Bottle-Cloudy golden color w/a moderate white head-looks more like a Hefe than a Weizen Bock. Sweet, spiced aroma. Flavors of bread dough & spice, some banana, had a slight malt backbone/finish. Tasted like they took their Hefe & threw some malt into it, not like it was malt brewed. Wasnt dark enough or malty enough to be a true Weizen Bock, made it a little muddled for me. This wasnt terrible, Id call it solid & drinkable, but not really true to style. Id much rather drink their Hefe, that was a much cleaner, crisper brew. If you want a true Weizen Bock, look elsewhere.

Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a fluffy white fizzy head. Aroma is bread, banana, wheat, spices. Flavor is dough, banana, wheat, spices, yeast, a little fruity. Nice and balanced and very tasty weizenbock. Good stuff.
Thanks to Todd for the spare schwill ;)  Hazy gold pour, fluffy white head and some lace.  Sweet bread and banana on the nose.  Wheat upfront with a tropical fruit and slight clovy finish

Color is a yellow gold with a faint haze and very good carbonation producing a nice white head.  Aroma is a little sweet with a hint of banana.  Taste is creamy and sweet.  Starting with a medium body it goes down smooth with a creamy feel in the end.  Finish is sweet with flavors of honey and banana, then a mild yeast flavor and a touch of bitterness.  After taste is a smooth lingering of the honey and yeast.  Overall this is a very good brew, well rounded and full of flavor
500ml bottle. Hazy gold with a big, tight white head. Aroma of yeast, bubble gum and tropical fruits. Grainy mouth feel, with pineapple, cloves, lemon and a decent dry finish. Very good.

Bottle from Sun Devil Liquor as part of a great haul today. Pours a nice honey color, just slightly hazy, with a fine white head which dissipates to a ring around the glass. Smells like lemon and wheat. Very nice bubbly mouthfeel. Tastes like hops, malt, yeast, and water. Very nice.

Aroma reminds me of lemons, clove. and a hint of banana, very fragrant, a little malty in the nose, like a sweet bread. Appearance is cloudy orange with a thin white head that dissipates quickly. Although it is cloudy, the brew looks clean. Flavor is very complex hitting many fruity and sweet notes finishing with a citrus and clove zing that lingers, very little hops. The lively carbonation is complimentary to the flavors and this good example of Weizenbock beir.
At 30e PINT bokbierfestival (Oct 2007 Amsterdam). Orange body with large white head. Malty and fruity nose. Taste of fruits and malts. Sweet and enjoyable.

Cloudy orange with a white head. Sweet malty aroma with some fruits, light citrus, banana, clove.  Lower carbonation and thicker mouth.  Flavor of banana, yeast, clove, fresh fruits, and malty.  A very enjoyable weizen bock.

Hazy orangey yellow with an average size fluffy white head. Smells like sweet bread and cotton candy. Initial flavor starts off rather sweet then finishes with some citrus lemon bitterness. A little to sweet for a morning beer after NOTB.

Very pale golden pour with a hefty amount of carbonation and a big white head. Hefty amounts of clove, lemon, banana and wheat in the aroma. Very spicy mouthfeel with yeast and wheat along with a bit of banana and an awesome clove finish that lingers for a solid minute after the beer is gone. Im slowly falling in love with the "oldest brewery in the world".

500 mL bottle purchased at the Davis Food Co-Op.  Aroma has plenty of lemon, wiith lots of banana esters.  Some metallic notes are also there along with a bit of sulfur.  I dont think I have ever seen a weizenbock this light in color, although i haventt had many in my life.  Modestly hazy golden body with a large, frothy, white head and lots of lacing present.  Sweet, banana yeasty coconut flavors present to start, which is followed by a sticky, metallic, lager-bock-flavor.  Some grassiness and cereal graininess is in there.  A little warming to finish with a crisp herbal hop bite.

500ml brown bottle served in a hefe glass. Poured a hazy pale gold. Lots of carbonation, typical for a wheat beer. Thick white head. Plenty of clove in the aroma more than banana. This is the way I prefer it! Medium to light bodied, nice smooth mouthfeel. Spicy flavor from both the yeast and the wheat. Also some fruitiness. Lingering clove flavor in the finish. You can taste that there is strength there, but it is not hot. Plenty of malt. This is a classic weizenbock.

surprisingly golden for a weizen bock, large white head.  moderate/high carbonation.  very flavorful with some clovey esters with no discerning hop component and a very clean finish.  the alochol provides a little depth.  very good and unique

Pours a very slightly hazed medium yellow with a tall fluffy white head that has great retention. Aroma is strong banana, yeast, vanilla pudding, lemon, wheat and sweet malts. Flavor is creamy banana laffy taffy, wrapped in a vanilla laffy taffy but not half as sweet as either, a hint of wheat, lemon-lime soda,  some fruity esters, spicy yeast, a hint of bitterness on the finish but not much. The palate is creamy smooth while still being slightly acidic.  A fairly well put together brew, maybe a bit much on the banana notes for me but it was still refreshing, interesting and sweet.

Hazy yellow color with white head.  Some banana notes from the wheat but more like a spicy, higher alcohol hefe.  Good overall flavor.  Reminds me of a wheat belgian without a strong alcohol flavor.  Toned down flavor that is enjoyable.  Worth a try.

0,5lt Bottle from Beer Factory Athens. Hazy golden color with a big white head. Sweet aroma with lots of wheat, banana and citric fruits. Wheaty taste again with lots od banana and citric fruits with a warm alcohol touch.

Bottle in Italy.
Wheaty, but with a strong alcohol character. Sourish, not easy to drink. Compared to their classic styled beers, this did not impress me at all.

500 mL bottle.  500 mL bottle.  Cloudy orange with a small but sticky white head.  Sweet citrus in the aroma, along with the usual wheat and spice.  Less banana than some others.  Flavour is sweet, with yeast and spice, and some wheat near the end.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Body is full and creamy, although it thins out near the end.  Nicely carbonated.  Above average,  but not spectacular.
Quite fruity aroma with banana, citrus, and plum.  10 karat pour with a nice fluffy ivory head.  Clove, sweet malt, and wheat.  Not a bad beer, but probably wont go after it again.

Poured from 500ml bottle.  51 degrees F.  A light weizen bock, hazy straw/yellow color with big white head.  Great banana/citrus aroma.  Spicy with a nice tangy finish.  7.7% abv not noticeable.  Recommended!

Not you typical weizen bock pour. Lightly hazed golden color with a tall white head. OK, typical hefe pour. Sweet wheat and ester aromas. Hints of yeast and fruit. Not real fresh smelling. Sweet malt and wheat flavors in the front followed by a mix of spice. Some cloves and banana in the finish and linger. Thick, yet a tight zip on the tongue. Not sure of the date of this one, but Im quite certain this one fresh would be very good. The deeper I get into this one the more I like it. Nice malt base and very drinkable.
bottle: Hazy brownish yellow, mid-sized head. Fruity nose with banana. Medium- to full-bodied, fruity, malty and yeasty. A bit thin, though.

Aroma: wheat clove and sweet malt with a hint of banana and alcohol. Appearance: cloudy yellow with a smallish white head that quickly flattened. Flavour: banana and clove in spades with heaps of sweet malt and some dry wheaty notes. Palate: thick and lingering banana.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Starts strong and yeasty, modest fruity in the background. Not too dry or sourish. Well balanced, warming finish. Really good!
16.9oz bottle.  Pours a light golden yellow with a small foamy head.  Aromas banana, clove and wheat.  Flavors are banana, and yeasty wheat.  Palate is superb.  What a well crafted brew.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a light yellow with a medium white head and a sour yeast aroma. The flavor is sour with wheat malts, banana, citrus, apples, white grapes, white bread, spices (mainly cinnamon), artificial sweetener and vanilla. A sour and spicey finish. A great beer
Golden color with a wheaty-banana-yeasty aroma.  Flavor of citrus, wheat, banana, and sweet bread.  Nice, but a bit run of the mill for a W-Bock.
chiara bella schiuma piuttosto persistente note fruttate banamne spezie lieve acidità poca in bocca fruttato lievi spezie poco acidula un tocco di malto

Survivorman is in the Outback and Im sipping on this Vitus, good deal. Cloudy, dark gold pour with a large, lasting white head. Strings of lacing decorate the glass. Ripe banana aroma with orange and lemon accents. Strong yeast scent coupled by mild spice and brown sugar. Sweet and musty, this beer is lighter in body than expected and has a noticeable kick. Clean mouth feel and drinks easy for its strength. Its an amped up hefe with big banana flavor and a touch of caramel. A hint of clove and prominent yeast flavors. Dry and firm, its a nice offering.

Appearance: Pours a hazy, pale gold body capped with a thin, fine, white head.

Smell: Crisp wheat nose with fine notes of banana juice, clove spice, citrus, a small handful of cracker crumbs, and a fourth of a Vanilla Tootsie Roll.

Taste: Sweet, tangy wheat malts start, followed by a drop or two of vanilla and a lemony citrus character. Plenty of fresh banana, top shelf bubblegum, and coriander. Even some apple begins the develop. Light spicy hops and bitterness. Lingering tanginess and no more than the faintest hint of alcohol on the drying finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-high, lively carbonation, yet theres still some creaminess to the mouthfeel.

Drinkability: Recommended. An expertly crafted expression of wheat. Its tasty and really grows on you more and more with every sip. Maybe that UGADawgGuy is onto something...
16.9 oz. bottle at Flat Rock Saloon.  Poured cloudy yellowish orange with thick white head.  Sweet banana, vanilla flavor.  Surprisingly nice.

Bottle.

Pale colour, probably the only weak point this beer has is its slightly cloudy insipid appearance.  

The flavour is another story altogether, despite its 7.7% abv. there is no alcohol warming, a sweet vanilla, banana, taste.

Mmmmmmm this is what its all about!

Layers of banana, vanilla, clove and spice that has a complexity and mouth feel that is uncommon for the style.  Intensely sweet, but strongly balanced and flavored.  Nose showcases typical weisse notes.  Light golden colored with a filmy white head.  Stunning wheat ale.
UPDATED: OCT 3, 2009 Cloudy golden brew with an ultra-white, utra-thick head, nice wheat scent, and a clean, lightly spiced flavor.  Real fine hybrid style template.
Tasted, looked, and smelled pretty much the same as the Hefeweizen. However it was a bit sweeter and you could mildly taste the alcohol at the end. Another winner from Weihenstephaner

Nice cloudy pale yellow color, healthy head. Smells of banana and hefeweizen. The flavor is nice, cloves, citrus, lemony, very interesting. I don;t know much about German beers or weizenbocks but this was quite good and Id like another bottle to investigate further.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-12-2009 01:52:42

Hazy pale gold with a tall, long-lasting, creamy white head.
Fresh, lemony wheaty aroma.
Lightly sweet, some lemon notes. Spritzy palate.

The look is cloudy with a yellow golden color and a decent white colored head.  Smell is bananas, some spice, wheat, and some fruits.  Little lighter than I would have wanted.  Taste is banana, alcohol, wheat, and malts.

500 mL. Aventinus glass. Pours a bright, neon cloudy yellow with a nice white cap that settles down into a nice thin layer. Not much lacing. Aromas of cloves, coriander, yeast, pears, green apples. Taste is light and refreshing with a nice wallop of spice, yeast, citrus, and sour apple. Dry, wine-like finish. Very nice though a little too much cardboard at the end.

Hazy straw blond colour with massive thick, lumpy head. Aroma is quite yeasty with a little spice. Texture is rather thin and a little flat. Considering this as a white beer the flavour is quite fullsome with the spiciness at first and a softer, sweeter finish.
Almost clear golden with a huge creamy white head. Very sweet aroma, candy floss, banana and some cloves. The flavour is sweet as well, a bit cloying for my likings. Well brewed but not my beer.
Bottle.  Mildly sweet wheaty aroma, with hints of alcohol.  Cloudy orange body, off-white head.   Fruity flavor, emphasizing banana.  Clean finish.  Very satisfying.

This is Christmas 2008 beer.  The head was frothy and white it filled the glass.  This spicy flavored beer is hazy blonde color.  The Wezen beers se are just not my favorite.  I need to work on learning more about them.  I am an IPA man.  Give me more hops!!!

Pours hazy gold with a puffy, rocky white head. Excellent lacing down the glass. Sugary wheat aroma, lots of banana and bread in this one. Fresh-smelling, nice change from the dank basement you sometimes get with the weizenbock. Bubbly mouthfeel, although it does get syrpuy from time to time. The taste was good, but a little too sweet for me. Solid wheat and banana/yeast ester base. Loved the clove and lemon peel components as well. 

Only problem I had was it was a little too sweet. Kind of got a cotton candy-sugar taste after a while, to the point I craved an IPA or something sour to wash this beer down with. At first I wanted to mark this beer down for it in the taste category, but everything that came before it was too good

Pours a murky yellow gold into the glass with a small white head and lots of hissing carbonation.  Aroma is slightly banana and allspice with a little citrus to it.  Flavor is some bready malt with yeast dominating the profile.  Mouthfeel is superb.  Almost a Belgian, champagne-like mouthfeel that expands with carbonation in your mouth.  This stands out to me as the best German beer Ive ever had.
Strange label.  Orange colour with a decent head.  Fruity esters on the nose and lots of alcohol.  A little metallic in the end.
bottle 500 ml from Alko 3,66 EXP 11.12.08 golden yellow lively white head pleasant scent of banana Taste: banana bit tickling spiciness sweet. Pleasant night cap

50cl bottle.   Finally, Vitus appears at the local bottle shop.   Having seen this beer pimped a ridiculous amount over on BA, I was intrigued.   Well, a thicker sweeter Weinstephaner Hef, thats about the extent of it.   Hazy yellow-orange with a big, frothy head.   Banana, lemon, and bready aroma.   Sweet flavor with banana and a bit of spice.   Medium-full body cut nicely by ample, effervescent carbonation.   Chewy.   Well made; I never doubted that, but I would take their regular weissebier any day.   This tastes almost the same, but is just a bit unbalanced on the sweet, nearly cloying side.

Poured a hazy yellow with a tint of brown and a large off-white head. Cloves and yeast aroma with some sweet wheat malt for the base. The flavor has a big clove and phenol flavor that over powers the malt.  Spicy finish with a light to medium body.

[Bottle] Pours hazy orange with a big white head. Banana is there in the aroma, but more subdued than expected. Some buttery notes were a little offputting when cold, but they disappeared as it warmed and were replaced by some light smokiness that was much more appealing. Taste is banana and clove (as expected, with the banana coming out more as it warmed),  but something was lacking...I think that it needed more spices, and the wheat twang was not as prominent as with some weizens. Good mouthfeel with a slightly above average finish. Overall a good weizen bock, but by no means a great one, and really does nothing to set itself apart. Probably a beer that would be better very fresh--would love to try it in Deutschland.
500 ml bottle. Cloudy yellow color, white head. Fruity aroma. Sweet fruity flavor with citric and spicy notes. High carbonation, medium body. A pleasant wheat beer.

This Weizenbock is a darker, maltier version of Weihenstephaners normal Hefeweizen complete with citrus flavors and an extra alcohol kick. The alcohol does well to balance out the general sweetness of the unfiltered beer and has become a regular purchase for me at the local supermarket. I havent gone back to their standard Hefeweizen ever since buying one of these.
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2008 Excelente opção, nem sempre encontrada. A versão nacional da Eisenbahn ainda corre atrás...

Bottle.  Cloudy yellow with a foamy white head.  When I bought this for some reason I thought I was getting a dark beer... silly me.  And as I’m not much into Weizen beers, I was a bit disappointed.  But this is a delicious beer, with a touch of citrus but not tangy and sour, more like a smooth banana/lemon touch.  Can’t taste the alcohol at all, and it has a very nice buzz to it.  If this truly is the worlds oldest brewery, as it says on the label, I can see why.  This rocks.
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2008 Bottle. A very lovely weizenbock indeed. Cloudy lemon yellow in color, a thin lacing. Notes of citrus, bananas and spice. Great tasting wheat beer for a 7.7% ABV.

Pour is a cloudy lemonaid lookalike with a gianormus white head.  Aroma is a very nice citrus with some clove and vanilla.  Flavor is again some vanilla and citrus with a nice breadyness at the end.  This is a decent and well made beer and its a bargan at only 3 buck a pop.
Hazy golden colour, firm head. Aroma has citrus and spices. Flavour is yeasty, with fruits and spices. Smooth finish.

Poured a light golden color with nice fluffy white head that lasted a while. I was surprised by the lightness of the color. The aroma was very citrusy. The taste was a flavorful balance of bananas, spice, citrus, and wheat. The mouthfeel was very nice. Despite its 7.7% abv this is an extremely drinkable beer that hides its alcohol well.

Bottle@home, shared with my old man.

Apperance: Golden yellow with a generous, firm white head. Looks very inviting!

Aroma: Wheat, Yeast, Spices, Banana marshmallow, Hay.

Flavor: Wheat, Fruit, Citric notes, Yeast, Spices, Cloves.

Palate: Refreshing wth a acidic touch and plenty of carbonation with a solid malt backbone.

Wow, this tastes like a Wiehenstephaner Hefe with lots more body. Very drinkable and tasty. Recommended!

From bottle. Yeasty doughy nose, with coriander lemon-orange notes, mild bubblegum, and a chalky bitter carbonic gassy smell. Light sulfur. A bit of pleasant sour bread tang, too. Light sweet fruity character. Pillowy creamy-foamy off-white head that is huge throughout. Incredible lacing. Dull butterscotch amber body that’s cloudy with dregs. Medium-heavy watery body with medium-soft carbonation. Smooth. Starts pretty sweet, with wheat and spun sugar, orange essence and light bubblegum. Mild tangy quality to it, maybe some acid malt. Light hops in the finish, with smooth yeasty banana-orange aftertaste. A bit of warming, but faint. This is a tasty beer and just a bit too heavy to be considered refreshing.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy gold color (are all their beers this same color?) with a large and lacy white head.  Aroma is wheat, clove, vanilla, and slight coriander.  Taste is vanilla, bubblegum, slight lemon and cinnamon/coriander at the end.  The beer remains smooth throughout.  Surprisingly sweet, but I liked it quite a bit.

Bottle.  Pours a slight hazy light gold with a 2 finger rocky white head and spotty lacing.  Nose is sweet wheat, yeast, cloves and coriander.  Taste is Juicyfruit gum, cloves and wheat with some slight citrus notes.  It has a semi-sweet alcohol finish.  Medium, smooth mouth feel.  Decent stuff, a tad sweet for my tastes but an ok beer to have once in a while.

500ml. Pours a creamy and vibrant golden yellow. Very hazy indeed with a short lived frothy white head. lots of spicy clove and tart bubblegum aroma. plenty of ester as well. slightly sweet body with a bright fruity flavor and a finish that starts spicy but ends smooth. like a good bavarian wheat but more complexity and fuller flavors. not an aventinus style dopple, but should satisfy anyone who like a real german wheat.

Bottle.  Never seen this one before, thank God I saw it.  Smell is awesome.  Frutiy, full of bananas, lemons, a little bit of hops, no alcohol at all.  Really an awesome smelling beer.  Taste is sweet and fruity, easy to drink, no alcohol is detected at all.  Sweet but not too sweet, very easy to drink.  This one went away really quick.  Something I will buy again, great stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2009 Pours a slightly cloudy pale yellow with a big thick white head that doesnt go anywhere.  Aroma is citrus and grassiness.  Taste is noticeably sweet pale malt and some mild hop grapefruit and banana.  Although clearly a weizen, this beer has characteristics of a Belgian tripel.  Very good.

Pours gold with a slight haze and two inch bright white head. The aroma is pretty full with a solid wheat note, some ripe banana, citrus tartness, apple and a bit of grainy malts. The taste begins with wheat and quickly adding in a mild ripe note of banana. By midway apple and yeasty spice surface paving the way for mild lemon tartness. It ends with sweet apples and a resurgence of wheat. In the after taste a bit of vague hop bitterness seems to hang on for a while.

Bottle.  Hazy golden pour with a big white head.  Wheat is immediately apparent, slightly spicy, honeyed aroma.  Tropical fruit aroma - pineapple, banana.  Buttery, pastry sweet nose.  Pear and banana in the flavor, basil-like mint quality.  Dry, champagne bubbly finish.  Lingering but light bitterness.

(bottle) pours a hazy yellow colour with a huge white head. strong banana aroma, with notes of peanuts, cloves and vanilla. heavy fruity flavour with strong notes of pineapple and banana, grainy pale malts and alcohol. strong carbonation with a semi-sweet, medium to heavy body.

Bottle. Poured a hazy yellow with a tall, creamy white head that settles to a ring but renews a thin layer with a twirl of the glass. Light lace. The aroma is banana, clove, wheat, light citrus, and even a hint of mint. Similar flavor with spices standing out. Light to medium body and dry. Nice!

Pours with big and cloudy, white head. Color is witbier-like hazy orange, very attracting. Aroma is much banana-like, wheaty malty, yeasty and slightly alcoholic. Flavor is yeasty, wheaty, with banana and slight metallic note in the end. Medium-bodied, low carbonated and a bit thin palate.

Pours with a murky. golden body topped by a very thin head with no lacing.  It’s slightly sweet and malty with a light banana note and aa slight yeastiness.  Medium bodied and ingly from the carbonation.

500ml bottle. BB 20.09.09.
Woah...wasnt expecting it to be so pale! Decent sized fluffy white head atop a murky straw body.
Nose reminds me alot of the hefeweizen; unripe banana upfront, some tropical fruit (pineapple?), clove spices, bit of rich vanilla malt alluding to alcohol.
Body is dense, creamy mouthfill, lively carbonation, bit of stickiness, tart towards the finish, with a drying hint of alcohol.
Big banana bread body, dense sweet dough, cinnamon and clove, vanilla bubblegum,, a bit of peach and pineapple with sharpness to balance. Sweet finish, slightly bitter with a sharpness that takes the edge off.
Fantastic. And here I was expecting all weizenbocks to be of a darker nature, then comes along this guy...a beefed up hefeweizen. Cant go wrong with that combo!
Draught. Pours cloudy golden, with good head and lacing. Punchy on the nose, of citrus, yeast and bananas! Similar on the palate, with well masked alcohol content. Very decent beer.
Bomber. Bright gold, hazy, unfiltered. Big fluffy white head. Nose is malty, lemony. Taste comes off both bitter and sweet. A bit alcoholic, smooth, spicy. Nice beer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: (500ml bottle from Spec’s on October 11, 2008) You’d think this was a dunkel from the looks of the bottle.  Pours a gorgeous orange with a solid, white frothy head and lacing that slides down the glass. Its aroma is of a serious German Weizenbock. Very sour, citric, and yeasty.  Smells like a brewery. Smells like fermented wheat! Its taste is of banana, cloves, and a hint of hops.  Smooth going down, almost makes you want to pucker. A finely crafted beer.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 500ml. or 1 pint .9oz bottle into a weizen glass.

Appearance: It had a golden color, which was lighter than I had expected and a hazy unfiltered body. The head is just off white in color and builds up tall and thick then very slowly fades making slick patchy lacing on the glass.

Smell: The aroma had sweet malty wheat notes with yeast and estery fruitiness.

Taste/Mouth feel: There are estery flavor notes of banana, apple, golden raison and bubble gum within a mildly sweet and tangy wheat malt. Also there are hints of clove and some mild spicy hops for balance. It has a solid medium body with a palate that is smooth and a touch slick with pleasing carbonation.

Notes: Outstanding!!!

Bottle from South Bay Drugs.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with an orange hue. The head is a couple fingers of creamy white that takes its time to fade and laces spots. Smells spicy, banana, pepper, coriander and clove. Taste begins with sweet malt followed by the wheat and spice.

Draft. Hazy golden-straw colored beer with an off-white head. Wheat and banana aroma. Wheat, malt, banana, spice, yeast flavors. Medium body. Malt/wheat linger with slight citrus, spice, and banana. Nice and easy to drink.
Excellent wheat beer. Pours a nice gold. Be sure to poor really slow, it has a huge head.

(Bottle on 2008-10-04) Orange. Cloudy. Banana and salty liquorice in nose. Full bodied palate with quite a lot of carbonation. Malts, bitterness, some banana, salty liquorice and sweetness in taste. Sweet and bitter aftertaste.

essa Weizenbock alemã não tem uma aparência tão aprazível. Sua espuma tem aparência inicial pequena, cor branca e reduzida longevidade. Há moderada formação de colarinho e o corpo é turvo, grosso e de tonalidade marrom. O aroma é clássico e restrito: banana e cravo (bem pronunciado), nada mais. O sabor inicial é levemente doce e amargo, apresentando moderada doçura e leve amargor no final, de média duração. No paladar, um corpo médio-cheio, textura cremosa, carbonatação forte e final moderadamente alcoólico. A título de Weizen seria agradável, mas peca ao não apresentar elementos de Bock. Mascara muito bem o teor alcoólico de 7,7%. O final mais forte se aproxima de Bock no paladar.
Big Bottle... Nice weizen. Pours very hazy gold with a large white head. Aroma of cloves, wheat, and sweet malts. Fruity--banana, mostly, and some darker fruits--flavor, with a great sweetness.

One of the best wheat beers I’ve tasted.  Pours dark yellow with a nice thick but frothy head.  Flavors are of wheat, but no cereal with a balance of banana, apricot, and honey.  Really unique and tasty.
Pours light yellow, cloudy, with a fine white head. Pleasantly light, yeasty, and grainy in aroma. Very spicy and effervescent. Good solid mouth feel. Sweet backing. Fuckin’ awesome.

500ml bottel ( litle bit too warm when drank). white thick head. Citrus colored, foggy.  Mead like appearance. Typical weisse aroma, maybe even richer and sweeter: bananas, apricots, yeast, chalk. Semi thick mouth feel. First thing noticed about flavour: I can’t believe this is 7.7%! Alcohol is well hidden. There’s also bananas in the flavor. Chalk continues too. Little bit richer than your average weisse, maybe that’s the bock part, other wise I don’t really notice any bock characteristics in this.

Bottled.  Poured slightly hazy paler golden with a short, creamy cap of white head.  The aroms was just delightful.. toasted banana and spicy pepper on a warm impression upfront.. sweeter aged caramel malts holding it up behind.. balance was excellent!  The flavor had warm caramel and banana notes at the core surrounded by black pepper, coriander, and tart citrusy notes.. warm again on the finish and entirely satisfying.  Heavier-bodied with creamy carbonation on the palate.. alcohol was present, but well-balanced.. I’d gladly have another.

Poured from a 500ml bottle and served in a weizen glass.  This beer poured a cloudy golden orange with a decent sized head of soapy, off-white foam.  A small amount of lacing was left around the glass.  The aroma of the beer included strong bananas, oranges, flaked wheat, and just a touch of fresh cut grass.  The flavor was not quite as vibrant as the aroma.  It consisted of spicy yeast, ripened bananas, slightly astringent orange peel, hay, and a bit of alcohol.  The mouthfeel was full-bodied and had mild carbonation.  Not the best example of the style, but still worth a shot considering the price and easy accessibility.  Decent.

Pours a hazy yellow color with s thick white head. The aroma is very yeasty, there’s banana esters and bubble-gum, there’s also cloves and a soft candy sweetness. The flavor is very pleasant and balanced, there are bananas, bubble gum, cloves and sweetness reminiscent of soft fruity candies. After a while, I notice some hop presence and mild bitterness in the end. The body is medium to full with a creamy texture and medium to lively carbonation. This is a solid weizenbock, I’d say the best Weihenstephaner I’ve had so far.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2008 pours cloudy orange yellow with a fluffy white head. Banana clove and the dry plum bitter. Much more refreshing and light than other weizen bocks. Not nearly the strong plum flavors that you get from Schneidder Aventinus.  Great mouth feel - creamy,full, and sparkling. Simple start and very nice spicey finish. Bana na flavors really come out as it warms.  Very good

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2009 Sampled poured from the bottle into a pint glass.  The beer had a big foamy white head with great retention and decent cling atop a cloudy straw color with slight particles.  The aroma was a mix of banana and some other fruits, with barley, and some yeast and grainy hop tones too.  A sweet, somewhat fruity taste, with a touch of wheat and bitterness.  Pretty wet beer on the palate, somewhat creamy and maybe slightly on the thin side, with good carbonation.  A quality beer, not quite exceptional, but definitely enjoyed.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX. Pours a very nice looking cloudy straw yellow with nice lasting white head. Strong aroma of bannana, alcohol, clove, bubblegum. Flavor is semi-sweet,malty and very fruity, some bannana & clove, with nice alcohol spice. Mouthfeel has a soft medium body. Overall, I really like this one!

Only my second Weizenbock and what a superb brew.  Very good banana nose with nice unfiltered appearence.  The taste is outstanding and does taste like a hyper Hefeweizen.  Would definately buy again.
(bottle): Pours a cloudiesh/clearish yellow body, big foamy white head. Flowery clover aroma. Banana. Banana, flowery fruity taste, maybe citrus. Gooood.
Fresh beer. Hides the high amount of alcohol (for a Weizen) perfectly. Citrus/herb taste, really special. Very light colour. Had a 0.5l bottle in Rapallo, Italy at a nice grand café.

Pours a hazy saffron color into my Franziskaner weizen glass. Big 3 finger head is pure white, not much lacing. Good retention.
Aroma is lemon meringue, banana oil, flowers, clove, and a hint of copper.
Tastes like an imperialized version of a hefeweizen. Not a lot of dark, chewy, bready malt flavor at all. This beer is focused around banana, lemon, and clove. Also a touch of vanilla. Not bad, but certainly lacking the complexity a darker weizenbock (like Aventinus) would likely provide.
Highly carbonated, but not overly so. Medium body with a sticky banana pith finish. Classic Weihenstephaner drinkability.

pale slightly cloudy yellow with a well sized head the fizzes down to a constant one-finger size leaving little to no lace
wheaty aroma with light banana spices and a astringent floral current.
heavy on the banana spices with a trace of hops as well.
really smooth palate.
Bright cloudy yellow with tropical fruit aroma and a thick frothy head.  Slightly tart and a little spritzy on the palate.  I was expecting more from this beer than what was delivered.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2009 I hated this the first time I had it, but I am revising my rating upward.  I may have had a weak (or possibly mislabeled) bottle.  This one was much better.  Vitus has an intricate, antique label that makes me think of old books.  A sad-looking gentleman from a past century decorates the bottleneck.  Foggy, straw-colored pour.  Mediocre aroma with a fair amount of the slightly rancid yeasty smell that is featured in many macrobrews.  Tastes like a sweet hefeweizen, with plenty of wheat malt, and possibly some corn and sugar.  Some clove and tang too.  A rich brew that tasted better as it warmed a bit, which is surprising for a wheat beer.  Good stuff, but the aroma could be improved.

Hazy yellow in color.  Medium bodied with decent carbonation.  Sweet flavor starts off, then come the yeasty wheaty flavors combined with some citrus.  Couldn’t tell the alcohol content was so high.  Some spice flavor, though not all that strong.  Finished dry.
Sweet and wheaty, citrusy, estery and quite simple. Expected more complexity but this is very refreshing for such a high abv beer.

Bottle: Pours a hazy golden with a initially large white head, that eventually fades to a film. Aroma is sweet of ripe banana, dough, spicy esters like clove and more yeasty notes. The body is fairly creamy with an apparent peppery alcohol feel. The flavor is initially sweet with notes of honey sweet dough, and yeasty phenols of banana. There’s also a peppery alcohol note that leads to a dry yeasty finish. The drier yeast finish balances the early sweetness. A decent example of the style.
Pours a cloudy golden with a good sized head. Aroma is spicy, banana. Solid flavor, good mouthfeel.

Pours with a huge white head covering a hazy yellow body that I find too light in color for the style. Aroma is deep malts, banana, raisins, and clove. Taste is a bit metallic, very yeasty with dark fruits, clove and vanilla. Creamy with light bubbles.
Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with hints of amber. Thick, long lasting, white head. Spicy fruit aroma. Body is pleasingly full with spicy fruit tastes. No hint of the 7.7% abv. Great.

...bottle from Cloudwine.  On the nose, this tickles the sences with some vanilla, hay, wheat, and a hint of lemon.  Color is cloudy yellowish\orange, light for a weizenbock, with a decent white head.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied, lively carbonation, with tangy lemon, wheat malt, vanilla, bread and maybe a touch of clove, but not much.  Seemed to have less clove and orange than the original hefe, but was still a good brew.  Finished creamy, doughy with only a slight taste of alcohol.  I thought it would be better, but was still great, and worth trying.

On tap. Looks beautiful in its big glass, hazy yellow colour, creamy white head. Strong and sweet aroma of banana, some spices. Flavour is very soft, sweet banana, spices, cloves, wheat. Thick mouthfeel. Reminded me even of a banana milkshake. Great stuff.

Pours a clear straw gold with a fluffy white head.  An intriguing light color for a weizenbock.  Lots of spice, clove, banana and some booze in the nose. Really inviting and nice.  Flavor is similar with a great sweet wheat flavor with plenty of spice and clove.  The fizzy mouthfeel actually works really well with the flavor of this for me. Its a really enjoyable weizenbock but not quite on the level with Aventinus for me.

Pours dirty gold straw with a fluffy white head, eventually dissipating to a small layer of foam.  Aroma is very much like their wonderful hefe, with an emphasis on pungent grass, hay, clove, smoke, cheese, mushrooms, with a toasty and slight caramel quality.  Flavor has pretty sweet caramel, light toast, bread and white chocolate malt that mixes well with the pungent grass, cloves, hay and mushroom.  Good combo of malt and yeast.  High carbonation medium bodied, the beer feels good, but not heavy.  Only vaguely warming on the throat.  As enjoyable as this is, it’s just too similar to their regular wheat beer for me.  I’d prefer a weizenbock to be a bit MORE different, but nonetheless this is very good and emphasizes the things I like in a wheat beer.

literally sweet to perfection honey rum and vanilla entombed in a wonderful clove coriander spice and banana whirlpool of just good flavor(s). a great yeasty body that is totally complementary and good and full .  can you beleive i bought a 17 oz bottle for $2.99!? highly impressive this is a truly fine bock weizen.

Bottle from By The Bottle in Vancouver, WA--Poured a sparking golden body with a frothy carbonic head.  Yeasty banana bread presence with definitive tangy esters.  Stylistically, this is a one of a kind bock with a dynamic phenolic odor.  Perfect balance of flavor and attitude.  Great beer!

St. Petersburg, Fl. - Shep’s Deli - 500 ml bottle. Murky, light golden pour with a fluffy snow white head that sticks around quite a while - thought weizenbocks were supposed to be dark?. Strong banana and clove aroma. Flavor has the same elements, very full bodied and potent with some good ester notes. Flavor is very tangy - for lack of a better word. Thick, rich, sticky mouthfeel. Surprised I have not come across this before.
Boa cerveja. Coloração amarelo ouro, espuma de boa formação ambar. Cheiro frutado e intenso. Saborosa e aveludada.Muito frutada. Boa

Somewhat pleasing.  A nice cloudy straw color.  A mildly astringent aroma, some banana notes some bread notes too.  Flavor seemed to have a cloying sweetness to it.  Some bread like malts.  Good but not great.

(GERMAN) Pours a hazy orange color with a dissipating white head. Aroma is of funk, lemons, and spices. The taste is sweet like bread with some banana hints. You can taste some alcohol in the finish !!!  Not bad at all, if you can get past the smell.
Such a pleasure to drnk in the warm weather. Sweet yeast nose, bananas. Flavor is tart, banana, yeast, vanilla. Great wheat beer.
necco wafer and banana nose with wheat and yeast. Smooth with pin carb. Great ballance a little like hopfen weis. Lace stays after the head fades. twist of lemon.
Bottle. Thick foamy head. Taste has yeast, lemon, banana and earth. Body is balanced texture almost like water. Starts off sweet and finishes off tight and bitter.
Hazy amber with a large head. Sweet fruity aroma with banana and yeasty notes. Sweet yeasty flavor with caramelic and banana notes.

7-1-08 bottle 
Cloudy yellow orange with a nice thick fluffy white head and some lacing.  Smell is funky and appealing lemon, yeast, and more funk.  Flavor is yeasty and funky yet is sweet and somewhat balanced.  A medium body and decent mouthfeel - a hint watery .  Still not 100% used to the flavor but it seems balanced and decent overall.

Bottled. Pours golden honey with a white head. Aroma is spiced heavy, some malt and breads. Flavor is wheat, malt, spices, yeast, and bread. Possibly some banana working its way in. Body is perfect for the style.
Banana, wheat, spices, yeast and some alcohol in aroma. Flavor is banana, spices, yeast.

Bottle. Pours cloudy gold with a big white, large bubbled head. Aroma is banana, bit of citrus zest, hint of clove. Taste is sweet and fruity - banana and a bit of ripe apple and pear, and a spicy alcohol note that complements the yeast and clove notes on a lingering, slightly syrupy, bittersweet finish. Mouthfeel is full bodied, with a crisp carbonation.
Cloudy amber, big long lasting head, notes of rpe fruit, orange, yeast. Sweet and sweet finish, short bitter finish, very refreshing beer.

bought downtown after the ’beer meeting’ ... pours a hazy golden yellow ... big foam, lacing is all of A+ .. very smooth and drinkable .. is there such a thing as a session weizenbock ... decent flavour, not as refined or full as aventinus.. decent and all that sherpa stuff.. gunga guluga...
Sweet grain aroma. Cloudy golden color with a large white head. Moderate bitter beginning with a light sweet finish. Light palate for the amout of alcohol.

Pours a much lighter, cloudy gold in color than I was expecting.  I was expecting something more along the lines of a Korbinian.  This is more like a amped up Hefe.  Huge, pillowy head on the pour.  Plenty of the banana and clove in the nose and flavor.  Some hops show up in the taste to help out.  Decent beer, but it’s a Hefe!

A floral, grassy aroma and some similarities to a weiss. A beautiful, golden color with above normal carbonation and a bountiful head. This was suprisingly easy to drink, with plenty of fruit (apple, banana) and spice (cloves). A nice finish with a strong alcohol backbone that dimmed with consecutive sips. Reminded me slightly of the Kristal-Weizen style with a heavier alcohol taste.

Found at State Line Liquor. A great example of the style, this draws you in with a sweet wheat honey aroma. Mild chocolate brown with initially a large white head, that quickly dissipitates. Medium mouthfeel, and not very complex. But very drinkable.

Deep orange-yellow beer with a thick white head.  Very pillowy head and it keeps growing out of the glass.  Very thick, sticky and persistent.  Lovely aroma, loads of wheaty spice, clove, banana/apple and pears.  There’s a touch of nutmeg and spice and a fairly aromatic yeastiness.  Very well-balanced.  Sort of cleanly fruity (if that makes any sense).  A bit of warming on the finish.  Sort of like an imperial hefeweizen.

Pours cloudy yellowish gold with a huge white puffy head.  Smell is fruity, banana, wehaty and lightly spiced.  Taste is very strong, wheaty, banana, bitter, tart, and a very dense clovey spiced taste.  A bit of dark wheaty caramel flavor too.  Crisp mouthfeel and a full body.
From the tap poured a hazy straw color with a good amount of head.  Nice flavor malty/spicy with a quick finish.

50cl bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Tampa, FL). Pours a golden yellow with massive white head. Aroma is citrus, spicy with hints of yeast and bread. Flavor is bitter throughout with hints of coriander, yeast, bread, grain.

Inusutada bock clara. Creme branco muito denso e consistente, coloração dourada. No aroma, fermento de pão, banana e cravo. No doce paladar, que segue o aroma, a força do álcool surpreende muito bem e cai como uma luva no conjunto geral. Final levemente amargo e excelente drinkable.

50cl bottle @ VinensVerden, Odense. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy white lasting foam. Amazing appearance! Aroma is heavy of wheat & spices such as clove & coriander. Palate is smooth & filling. Some yeast, banana & citrus. Alcohol very well hidden. Top nice "Imperial hefeweissen"!

Bottle (500ml) shared with tupalev & jerc -- courtesy of GregClow. Pours a hazy yellow-gold with a large mostly-lasting frothy white head. Sweet and fruity (citrus and banana) aroma along with wheat, wood, light floral hops and a bit of alcohol. Flavour of yeast, fruit, wheat, a hint of smoke, alcohol and light spices. Dry, lightly bitter finish. Average to medium bodied. Three Weihenstephaner beers in a row and three winners in a row -- its a little boozier then necessary but still a damn fine beer.

Pours a surprisingly pale yellow and slightly cloudy color. I had to re-check the label to be sure this was indeed a Weizenbock since I have always found them to be quite darker in color. Pour creates a huge fluffy, pillowy white head with good retention. Some isolated streaks of lacing coat the sides of the glass as it drains. Nose is greeted with huge, assertive aromas of fresh, hot yeast rolls, lemon zest, ripe banana, spices and malted wheat backed by just a touch of alcohol. Palate was lively and refreshingly fizzy to style with just a hint of slickiness. Flavor profile seemed a bit lighter than the aromas but was still excellent. Seemed like an amped up hefeweiss with the 7.7% alcohol mixing in well with the flavors of the wheat, lemon, fresh yeast and various spices. A very respectable balanced beer with a bit of muscle, but still very crisp and refreshing.

Bottle shared with Greg Clow, Hogtown Harry, Blankboy, and Jerc, courtesy of Greg.  Strong wheat, some alcohol in aroma.  Dark hazy yellow, small white head.  Strong wheat taste, lots of alcohol, some clove in finish.  Good, but a little unbalanced and too strong really.
Aroma is of bready malt and banana. Flavor surprisingly light on the banana. Cloves. Lemon and a little sour. Sweet. Very nice finish and good mouthfeel that isnt too carbonated.

(Draught at MacKinlays Inn, Stockholm) Brownish orange colour, cloudy, with huge white head. Malty nose with citric notes of wheat and lemon, hints of plums and peaches. Malty, fruity taste with yellow plums, peaches, citrus, green apple and Anjou pears. Fairly sweet. Very fruity and rather nice.
Bottled. Thanx to rsmeds for this one. Hazy golden in color. Minor white head. The aroma is hoppy and yeasty, interesting. The flavour has a pre dominant yeasty and alcoholic mixture with herbs.
Pours bright gold into a Weizen.  Fluffy white head with good retention slowly recedes to skim surface.  Clove and banana.  Crisp upfront with flat clove finish.

A delicious and drinkable weizen bock. This was my 1400th beer and was worried that it wasnt going to be great. I love weizenbocks and this was a great one. Aroma of a hint of fruit, but mostly yeast, banana and grapes. Pour was a light gold with a nice 3 finger head that lasted the whole drink. Taste was nice and esthery. Banana, clove and light fruit dominate and a semi sweet dry finish. Love this style and am glad this was a milestone.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: UPDATED: NOV 15, 2012 2012-11-15. Hazy dark pastel yellow, good sized off-white head. 3+ Aroma is wheaty, lightly yeasty, grassy touches, muted floral and chalk/gypsum notes. Flavour is pleasant, sweetish wheaty core, moderate estery yeast character, mild fruit, mild bitterness. Light grassy accents and light alcohol in the background is fairly restrained for the abv. Smooth average plus to medium bodied palate suits it. Pleasant, dangerously drinkable while chilled, the alcohol comes out slightly more as it warms up. Pretty nice. 7/4/7/3/15 Bottle from the LCBO, Toronto2008-06-11. Pastel hazy yellow with a small white head. (3+) Alcohol over esters and yeast in the aroma. Flavour is similar with alcohol touched estery pale malt. (7+) Smooth average plus palate. (3+) Okay, but I was hoping for more weiss character to it. 7/3/7/3/15 Bottle shared by GregClow

Bottle.  Strongly wheaten aroma with plenty of yeast and grape, light citrus and clove with vanilla and banana cream pie.  Touch of caramel.  Hazy yellow-golden body with a large, creamy whitish head.  Taste is spicy, crisp and lastingly effervescent, only mildly bitter with a bit of dry, dark bread in and around the yeasty side.  Love the lemon and clove.  Lightly warming and boozy at the end, medium-full body.  A strong Hefeweizen with very toned-down Bock notes; well-made, as is to be expected from these guys, but needs more Bock.

16.9oz bottle-pours a big foamy to thin white head and slightly hazy yellow color.  Two surprises-the white head and the yellow color.  Aroma is bubble gum, yeast, floral/spicy-coriander/pepper hops, secondary husky light malt.  Not sure it will be one Ill like but a lot going on and interesting.  Taste is nice medium/light malt/wheat/husky/caramel, bubble gum, yeast, floral/spicy-coriander/pepper, grassy hops, secondary husky light malt.
