Smooth, medium body, which is a surprise from the appearance and aroma.  Good effervescence.

pours cloudy orange/yellow with a huge fluffy white head, the smell is very yeasty with wheat undertones. With the flavor is pick up bananas and spice, nicely carbonated. This is a well rounded ale, honestly when i bought this i was thinking a malty brew but this is no where near malty but it is very tasty and i really enjoy this!

Bottle. Clear, light colored, huge white head. Lighter than expected color. Yeast, grain like aroma. Flavor is okay,  improves with time; wheat notes softening up but is just average. Basically a decent hefeweizen.
Sweet hop malt aroma with floral hops. Murky yellow colour with great head and lacing. Malt hop flavour with citrus undertones. Fizzy yet smooth palate.

Expecting this to look different for some reason.  Pours nice slightly hazy golden with delicious and booming white head.  Yeasty fruity notes indicate the nose, banana plums and subtle clove spices, ...The body is a lot more spicey, than the nose ( a good thing in my book,) and a tad yeasty and leaves a lingering funky sourness, which is pleasing.  Nice mouthfeel and very drinkable. A good example of one of my favorite styles.
Pours a pillowy white head, yeasty wheat nose, a beautiful drinker, bananas and citrus - rich mouth feel.

Pours light straw/orange yellow with a large foamy white head. Aroma of sweet malted wheat, and citrus. Sweet and sour wheat, some banana and slightly metallic. Fluffy mouthful with some good carbonation. A nice drinking light Weizen bock.
Ok..my first rating.  Nice aroma of banana and thick, rich head.  Great banana flavor with hints of clove and possibly cinnamon.  Great beverage and cant wait to have more.
Bottle.  Pours a golden brown body with a moderate white head.  Aroma is fruity with banana, lemon, spices, and some sweet malt.  Flavor filled with a dry finish.

Bottle. Cloudy golden colour with a big white head. Aroma is big and warm, with banana and yeast and a nice hint of lemon. Full mouthfeel. Flavour of a really solid weiss on steroids - everything tastes great, and theres more of it. Finish is dry and warm, with some herbal hops and a bit of alcohol. Another Weihenstephan winner.

Golden and hazy with a large head. Banana ester aroma that could be more asertive. Flavour was quite like a hefe, fruity esters and a little spice, but with a restrained dryness and a stong malt character. Medium body. Pretty good.

This was from a 500ml bottle and poured to an orange-yellow color with a nice white head.Aromas were of spice wheat and banana.Those aromas were also in the flavor as well as some yeast and citrus.Very nice beer.
Dejlig øl til min Wok kylling! Syrlig og sød på samme tid. Lys gylden med flot skum.

Draught at the Rover, Göteborg, Sweden. Cloudy orange golden, medium white head. Spicy, peppery, slightly alcoholic and sourish, and estery taste, with clear notes of bananas. Medium bodied and smooth. Well balanced with some (alcohol?) bitterness. Not even close to Aventinus.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2015 First ratingDraught at The Rover, Göteborg.On May 19, 2008.Shady orange color, white head. Sweet banana scent. Sweet banana estery taste. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness. Warming alcohol.7/4/7/3/14=3.5RerateDraught at 3 små rum om November 12, 2015.Cloudy to murky yellow color, small white head. A floating humor looking particle, likely yeast, looking like a little tiny brain. Banana, ripe banana not the estery candy like banana, light spicy taste. Medium mouthfeel, low to very low bitterness. Sweet, ripe banana scent. Banana, spicy aftertaste.8/3/8/3/16=3.8

Orange/yellow colour, cloudy, large foamy head. Sweet smell, some fermented bananas. Rich, full bodied beer with creamy, mildly carbonated mouthfeel. Wheaty, malty aroma with notes of yeast, bananas, vanilla (especially aftertaste). Alcohol is very well hidden.
Draught. Hazy and quite dark yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is bitter orange, wheat and some herby yeast. Flavour is quite sweet with notes of herby yeast, wheat and bitter orange.

Bottle from Root Cellar. Poured cloudy yellow color with a large frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate banana, citrus & spice aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy yeasty banana sweet flavor with a medium sweet and small alcohol finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable brew more like a Hefe.

Dark urine-banana color with ultra poofy foam head. Very nice wheaty aroma with banana note. Relatively simple and straightforward, but enjoyable. Well-carbonated, spritely body with decent wheatiness and sour banana twang. Medium to full bodied with a prickly mouthfeel. Not so much a weizenbock as a mid-range German Hefe.

Golden yellow. Creamy, rocky stark-white head with superb density. Glowing clove-dusted lemon, melon, pineapple, green banana and floral hop aromas. Suggestion of bubblegum and vanilla. Expansive carbonation deposits a slightly fuzzy residue as it settles on the tongue. Vibrant and spicy with clove and an explosive medley of fruity esters ranging from pineapple, honeydew melon and dessert apples. Fluffy notes of bubblegum are beautifully composed and understated, and serve to soften the body while absorbing some of the slippery fruitiness. Wavering yet poignant clove flavors tickle the palate while augmenting the dryness. Tangy wheat lurks in the background, bolstering the body and gently caressing the yeast-driven fruitiness. Floral hops match the juiciness of the esters as an uplifting flash of acidity emerges. Quite uplifting despite its strength. Yeast pour  imparts a nutty quality which enhances the body and impressively brightens the nuances. Alcohol gently scratches the throat at the swallow while lightly warming the gullet. Finishes with a banana-pudding effect as the lengthy wheat tailing, which takes on a breadier, straw-like quality, fuses with the creamy banana esters. Bubblegum, pineapple, and clove linger on the palate for quite some time. Yet another clean and focused wheat beer from a brewery which excels at doing just that.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 I am eating nachos while I drink this beer,.I hope it holds up. The sweet malt fights the spice. The black bean tortillla says kiss my ass beer.My beer says Im a clear and clean brew..

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2008 (Draught) Pours hazy yellow to light orange with a medium white head. The aroma is of wheat, banana, clove, floral incense and some vanilla powder. Rather creamy on the nose. The flavour is very wheaty with tones of banana and clove. Hints of grain, salt and flowers. The mouthfeel is creamy and well carbonated. A wheat-ish graininess lingers in the aftertaste with a touch banana. Medium bodied. Nice.

Draught at The Rover, Gothenburg.
Hazy orange with a small, white head.
Spicy and fresh in both aroma and flavour; bananas and citrus.
Mild with a pretty low bitterness.
Bottled. A hazy orange beer with a huge white head. Aroma is wheaty and banana, notes of caramel. Taste is sweety and citrus, notes of cloves and acohohol. Some spices.
A nice Weizen bock. However, this is a bit straight-forward compared to i.e. Aventinus.

Poured a lightly hazy golden color with a medium sized white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of bananas, some clove, citrus fruits, toast, and a bit of toffee as well.  Taste was more banana and clove up front, lemony wheat, light honey, some more toffee, and a bit of alcohol in the finish.  Fizzy mouthfeel.

Thanks to weeare138.  Pours a hazy golden orange with a smaller bubbly white head.  Aroma banana, cloves, sweet wheat notes and some citrus notes.  Flavor of the same banana, clove and citrus notes.  Also getting a decent amount of malty sweet notes.  Some cereal grains as well.

Cloudy darker golden pour.  Medium fizzy white head that leaves some lacing.  Nice aromas of citrus, spice, banana and yeast.  Wheat, caramel, banana, and a hint of citrus in the flavor.  Surprisingly smooth and creamy in the mouth.  I thought it should be darker, but still a great all around wheat beer.

16.9 oz bottle, poured an light orange/golden color with a small dissipating head.  Aroma was nice, hint of apple, citrus, and spice.  Taste is sweet, citrusy, and a bit tart apple.  Medium bodied and smooth, slightly creamy, alcohol is evident but not overpowering.  A good refreshing beer!

(500 ml bottle from <A HREF=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/massachusetts/w target=blank>Julios Liquors) Pours cloudy pale yellow with some grayish tint. Tall off-white head. Actually looks more like a hefeweizen than a weizen bock. Aroma of banana, bubblegum and citrus. Mouthfeel smooth and medium-full. Flavor is good with quite a bit going on - notes of booze, citrus, wheat, caramel, banana and pepper. The booziness assured me it was not just a regular hefe! Not the richest weizen bock but still quite good.

On tap at Zenos Pub - State College, PA. Light fruit aroma. Mixed berry and passionfruit? A nip of bubblegum blows in. Pours a heavily clouded nectarine flesh. Soapy, lacing white bubbles above. Flavor bubbles some more light, indistinct fruit character. Subdued apple, rainier cherry and pecan pie syrup. Alcohol comes forth with bread-like yeast notes. Rather plain. Sugars are clean, too clean. Malt body really isnt interesting enough. Pale tasting. A touch sweet and sticky. Alcohols are mildly complex (in apple), but maybe a bit too forward for 7.7% and this much sugar. Hops? Meh.
Cloudy golden colored brew. Fruity aroma, banana. Wheaty, sweet, spicy flavor. Some banana. Nice.

Bottle. Aromas of banana and wheat. Hazy golden color with a multi-finger head. Seems medium bodied with creamy carbonation. Flavor is banana, wheat and a touch of clove. Very pleasant; fits the hefe style. The extra bock ABV does not really interfere, though the heat becomes noticeable in the finish.

Bottled.  Cloudy, straw colored.  Huge, frothy white head as is typical for this style.  Sweet aroma with prominent esters.  Classic banana-like taste from said esters, mildly spicy with clove-like phenols.  Über-classic example for a hefe-weizen (I dont get a lot of bock from it as it is rather pale)  A few notches below the best example of this style, i.e. Schneider Aventinus.   Rather pleasant.

Pours a hazy golden-straw color with a big white head.  Aroma is of spice, yeast, clove, and banana.  Flavor is wheat and banana with a little spice in there as well.

Bottle.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2008 Coloração âmbar turva, com creme bege mediano. Boa Weizenbock! O teor alcoólico de 7,7% caiu muito bem no conjunto, deixando-a bem atrativa. Sugestão de cravo, fermento, banana e algo mais que não discerni. Agradável, drinkable, ótimo conjunto.

Cloudy pale yellow pour with frothy white head. Spicy yeasty aroma with cloves and banana. Gorgeous bready taste with caramel, ripe fruit, and cloves. Very smooth, creamy mouthfeel; another excellent wheat beer from this brewer.

(Bottle) Pours a hazy light amber color with a good amount of off-white head. Aroma of spice, yeast and clove. Taste included dark wheat malts, caramel, bread, and light banana. Highly drinkable, with average mouthfeel and carbonation. Slightly oily consistency. This was a tasty beer, but I was surprised to find that it was basically a really good hefe.

Bottle poured a cloudy gold with a small lingering white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, banana, light bubblegum and a hint of spice. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of wheat, light banana and a hint of clove with a smooth fruity finish.  tastes a lot different than any Weizenbock Ive ever had, more of an Imperial Hefe to me.

Aroma of wheat, lemon? and yeast, hazy orange/yellow, small white head. Taste begins with a huge wheat profile, lots of lemony zing, which is odd but intriguing. Medium bodied, very well balanced, delightful mouth feel, gorgeous silky texture. Fantastic! Thanks mds.

Medium hazed gold, white fizzy head.  Nice aromas of toasted banana and caramel up front.  Warming brings out soft chocolate spice and bready pear tones.  Clove and caramel fruitiness balance on further notes of warm bread and pear.  Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation, crisp finish.   Very nice
Cloudy golden amber color, big white head as one would expect.  Taste is pretty much like an ordinary hefe, but maybe a bit sweeter.  Not as dark in flavor as I had expected.

bottle - Pours hazy yellow with a thin white head.  It looks unusually light for the style.  It smells of yeast and bananas.  The flavor is sweet and has obvious banana notes with the citrus esters.  Its medium bodied and theres a little noticeable alcohol.  Its alright, but I expected more.
500 ml. bottle, big banana taste, good golden color,  nice palate and good finish

Oct. 2007 - Straw yellow pour with decent head, no lacing. Aroma is sweet and wheaty. Flavor was just a delicious blend of heavy clove, banana and other fruits. Really sweet but not overbearing and still retaining the "lightness" of a hefe. Smooth mouthfeel. Another excellent brew from my favorite German brewer.

Hmmm, this doesnt seem like any Weizen Bock Ive ever seen but Im not gonna argue with the label. Much lighter than I expected. Taste like a std. hefe to me but still solid and enjoyable. Easy drinker too; so much so that the 7.7 really sneaks up on ya. Good banana flavor.
0,5l bottle. Light yellow color with nice creamy head. Aroma includes wheat and citrus. Surprisingly light and low bodied. Finish is somewhat bitter and alcohol filled.

Bottle purchased at Liquor Max in Loveland, CO and Coaltrain Wine and Spirits in Colorado Springs, CO - after my wife drank the first one.  Pours yellow with a small, fizzy, white head, lasting with fair lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (grain, hay, straw, meal), light hops (herbs), heavy yeast (horse blanket, barnyard, earth) with notes of banana.  Medium bodied, slick texture, lively carbonation, and a bitter finish.  Average duration, light sweetness and acidity, moderate bitterness.

From the bottle, pours cloudy orange with a soft small white head. Banana nose, yeasty and spicy. Very well done brew, wheat and the spicy yeast esters build a smooth, but bold flavor. I had this with a nice sandwich, and this brew made a "so-so" sandwich into a masterpiece. Doesnt hit the level of sweetness and malt depth of some of its counterparts, but is an all-around really enjoyable beer.

0.5 l bottle. Hazy straw color with fluffy head. Bready, clovey and slightly sour aroma with notes of apple and banana. Sweetish, tart, bready and clovey flavor with notes of apple, pear, banana and lemon. Alcohol is quite well hidden and somewhat surprisingly this is not much more complex than standard Weihenstephaner hefe.

Hazy golden yellow, big but disappearing pale head. Nose has alcohol, yeasty  wheat and even some pear, remids of a belgian tripel. Flavor pretty basic hefe, wheaty. Finishes dry with some banana and citric notes. Medium bodied with strong carbonation. Overall somehow hollow, a bit like basic Weihenstephan with a dash of vodka.

Pours bright cloudy pale yellow with copious foam head. Exhibits good bubbling (barbonation) after the pour. Thick tastey head. Excellents scattered lacing.  Strong bright, wheat flavor most dominated by refreshing banana. I thught this was going to be a dark because of the bottle, but its a light, full bodied, full flavored, delicious wheat brew, most enjoyable after mowing the lawn on this hot spring day. The palate has just the right amount of bite andrefreshment. Bright, flavorful finsih. Uncharacteristicly smooth for 7.7%, I thought it was 5%. Prost!

Bottle pours a light golden color with a gigantic foamy white head.  Very floral sweet aroma of citrus and wheat.  Lots of wheat in the flavor, but also some sweetness with a little bitterness in the aftertaste.  Surprisingly light and smooth for 7.7%

Bottle. Huge foamy, fizzy white head that mostly diminished, virtually no lacing, fast rising carbonation, transparent, and a pale yellow hue. The aroma was sweet, bananas, hint of citrus, spicy, clove, and lightly tart. Ditto for the flavor. Mildly tingly mouthfeel and light-medium in body. A most quaffable beer, easy drinking, ABV well masked, well balanced, extremely tasty, worthy of a try, and definitely a beer I would drink again if it comes my way. A beer that would be nice to have on hand a lot of the time. More please!

Bottle: Poured a golden color weizenbock (kinda light of the style) with a huge foamy white head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma consists of banana ester with some cloves and fresh fruits. Taste is also dominated by some nice wheat malt note with loads of fruity, banana and cloves ester. The yeast really works wonderfully in this beer. Full body with loads of lees and great carbonation. I wish I had access to quality stuff like that every day.

Pours surprisingly pale for a weizenbock, with a nice head that fades fast, A bit thin in the palate with a loose finish, strong notes of bubblegum throughout. A touch sweet, only a little wheaty, lacking complexity and more importantly body. Decent enough. Ive enjoyed drinking it but its not that good of a beer.

Thick frothy head on lemon yellow pour,aroma sweet toffee wheat,flavour,superb wheat taste,toffee sweetness,malt background,nice beer like this old brewery and their beers.Finish of  this is sweet and dry.

Nice weizenbock. Hazy yellow. Aromas of banana, citrus and cookie dough. Tastes very estery, lots of banana, cloves, sweet and doughie. Alcohol is well hidden. Very good weizenbock like their hefeweizen but with an extra kick and a layer of "deepness". A keeper and a favorite, especialy in the summer.

Poured from the bottle with a cloudy hazy darkish golden with a substantial head. Aroma is not overpowering with some fruits, taste is bananaish with some sweetness and caramel, not as overpowering as some weizbocks.  Incredibly and dangerously drinkable.

This is pretty well carbonated as a soft pour still yields a full three-finger thick, frothy, pale tan colored head.  The beer is a light gold color and shows a very lightly hazed, straw gold color when held up to the light.  The aroma is distinctly full of clove phenolics, even seeming a bit fruity in its clove character.  Wheat like grain notes provide a touch of bread aromatics, some light tartness and some cracker-malt notes.  Banana esters mix in with the clove notes, but are definitely noticed as well.  There are also some plum like notes as well as a touch of apple aromatics.

Well carbonated, yet still creamy like many a good Hefeweizen; this does have a touch more body than your standard Hefe, but so far if I was presented this blind I would be hard pressed to guess that this is something other than a normal Hefeweizen.  The strength of this brew shows up in the esters that are noticeable; this is a bit more fruity than your typical strength Hefe with flavors of plum, Macintosh apples and green raisins.  This fruitiness is backed by a spicy, phenolic finish reminiscent of the turpenes particular to cloves.  As the beer loses some of its zippy carbonation and warms up just a touch it begins to pick up a lightly concentrated banana note in the middle.  This has a light tartness to it than helps to accentuate the various fruit components a bit.

The last pour that has some yeast sediment to it, adds a bit more yeasted tartness to this brew, which is a nice added dimension.  I really like this take on the Weizenbock; it really is just a slightly amped up version of a well made Hefeweizen with the increased gravity producing more interesting esters and phenolics.

Purchased: <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Tucson AZ

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2008 Pours light straw/orange yellow with a large foamy white head.  Aroma of bacon, sweet malted wheat, clove, and citrus.   Sweet and sour wheat, soft banana, slightly metallic.  Fluffy mouthful with soft but sparkling carbonation.  A nice drinking light weizen bock.

500ml bottle. Murky gold with some orange highlights, big beige head. Lots of wheat and banana, a touch of citrus. Very wll carbonated. Banana leads the flavor, some light caramel and grass. Damn fine drinker.

Draught at Järnet Bar, Stockholm. Pours out in an almost opaque dark yellow colour with a rich sticky white foam. Surprisingly fresh citric aroma with dense undertones of cloves, banana and vanilla. medium to full-bodied with strong spicy and dryish notes of cloves and all-spice with sweet undertones of banana and Seville oranges. Long spicy and rather dry finish of oranges, green bananas and cloves. Not my typical dark and hearty weizenbock, more like an Imperial Weizen.
Smells go colves, bananas, and bubblegum.  Gloden in color and hazy with a big foamy head.  Taste stays with you for a while.  Some alcohol is appearant.

Pours a very hazy straw yellow with nice sticky white head.  Banana, spice, light fruit, lemon vest, clove, and sweet bread.  Definitely a wheat, pretty good mouth feel.  Very enjoyable brew from a good brewery.

I dont think Ive ever had a weizen bock before, wasnt sure what to expect.  Its light yellow and cloudy, thick head.  Got a banans and clove thing going on, basically tastes like a big heffe.  Has a slightly sour, dry finish.  Heffes arent really my thing, but I can drink it and appreciate it.  Really very little hint of alcohol, I wouldnt have guessed this was a big beer.

Bottle  500ml
Appearance:  Sunny side , bright amber-orange brew , medium creamy top.Nose : Slightly sour , some citric wheat with rich fruit aromas sparkled with vodka . Good , solid nose.7+Flavor/Palate : Clean , smooth yeast accented . Fruity malts followed. Full bodied with plenty of wheat malt character. Finish still full and big. 14+

Pour is bright golden yellow with a slight haze and a smallish tight bubbled soapy bright white head...smell is very light and fruity with lots of sweetness and tons of bubblegum...some floral notes and definitely light yeast and banana...so far, very uncharacteristic for a weizen bock...the mouth feel is slight with moderate carbonation and very thin...light citric sweetness and some smooth grassy flavors...very unimpressive thus far...finish is lightly tart and somehow dry...the interesting thing is that it does taste far from alcoholic, which is the only interesting thing...

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2012 Vitus is a very cloudy light yellow beer with a nice and white head. Aroma of wheat, bananas, sweetness and some spices. Taste of wheat, yeast, banas, and lots of spices. Medium bodied and surprisingly, slightly sticy to drink in a positive way. More bodied than normal weizen and otherway also refreshning, a high-quality beer.

.5L bottle. pours bright hazy yellow-gold with foamy white head. shouldnt this be dark? what do i know. nose is loaded with banana and some spice. flavor is mostly banana and sweet wheat and biscuit. kind of like a bumped up hefe but not like any weizen bock ive ever had.

500ml bottle, pours a pretty cloudy bright yellow gold with a white foamy head that hung around and left creamy lacing on the glass, aroma of aged bananas, wheat and 
intertwined with a sweet smoke fragrance (phenols?) on the nose, faint vanilla with sweet light fruits such as faint pineapple fragrances, flavors of malt sweetness with 
citrus wheat bread, slight banana sweetness fades quickly to citrus tart fruit flavor,  finishes with a citrus bitterness that leaves a lemony flavor on the tongue, has 
a creamy mouth feel, carbonation is medium or a touch more, a lighter version of a weizenbock compared to others I have had but still very good to drink.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2011 Bottle. Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly lasting. Body is hazy medium yellow, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (bread, cookie), lightly to moderately yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of banana, gum, lemon meringue pie, marshmallow, clove. Flavor is heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium to full body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly to moderately alcoholic.

Very nice, but the fatiguing sweetness keeps it from being a 4+ beer.

Hazy with the colour of peach flesh and a foamy, white head.  Dried heather and a gentle smoke lure the nose in, leading to a crisp fruitiness of apricots and white grapes.  Layered over that, spicy cloves and lemon zest.  Sappy, sprightly malts provide a solid base for the rest of the aroma.  Approaching room temperature a tangy, almost sour, citrus note pops up.  The flavour closely mimics the aroma with a bit more sweetness.   Smoke and heather come through, deliciously.  Tangy and citric-spicy towards the finish with a long sourdough aftertaste.  Chunky body, creamy, with lively, refreshing carbonation.  Slight tannic bitterness builds.  Simple, but cool; interesting yeast profile.  50cl bottle, bbe 07.04.09.

Dark yellow/heazy colour, compact creamy head. The flavor is in full balance. Sweet and smood with,  babana, nuts, raisin  some light bitterness. Becomes smoother and maltier as it warms. Better weizenbock.

Bottled (BB 12/2008)
Hazy yellow color, huge cloudy white head. Banana, coriander,  lemon and bubblegum in the nose, crispier aroma than in normal weizen. Fizzy carbonation, foamy palate. Banana, orange, coriander, bubblegum and candy flavors. Alcohol is evident in the finish, then some lemon and hops. Aftertaste has toasted banana. Very warming. Demanding beer.
Bottled. Hazy orange body, small white head. Taste alcohol and almonds. Aroma of alcohol and something which is hard to recognize. Yeast maybe? Fuit? Mediocre finish. Quite a disappointment actually.

Pint bottle poured into my trusty stein- poured a little murky golden yellow, enormus white head slowly whisped away to a half finger thick, light carbonation.  Aroma of mangos, cloves, coriander, and a note of yeast.  Hits the mouth with a medium body, can taste alot of banana intertwined with the malt, finish is solid.  Very easily drinkable, wouldnt mind a few of these for a session.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2010 500ml bottle. Shared by Tranquillity - thanks.
Pale  cloudy orange, brief large head. Wheat beer aroma - coriander and orange zest, some banana. Smooth carbonation. Covers the alcohol very well. Good malty body, well balanced. All the usual hefeweizen tastes. All-round solid brew. (5-3-6-3-14=3.1)
Rerate: (7-4-8-4-15=3.8)
Lovely banana and caramel aroma. Crisp carbonation. Big sweet caramelly taste - yum - caramel and banana. Some sauce - I cant work out what sauce though. Finish is green hops. So incredibly drinkable, covers the alcohol well. Smooth and sweet without being sticky. Stunningly tasty.
Great head, aroma and appearance. Perhaps a touch sweet, but great body and mouth feel. A very light Weizenbock, but it is excellent.

Bottle.  Pours a thin but interesting and lively yellow with a huge head of ivory.  Notes of clove, bubblegum, and pear are in the nose.  Flavor is a sweet and floral rush of clove and banana, with a tingly trickle all the way down the tongue.  VERY refreshing and light, and VERY enjoyable.  GREAT weizen; definite repeat.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: This is the lightest Weizenbock Ive seen. Looks like a hefeweizen. Smells like a hefe, big on the bubblegum with noticible spicy hops. Very nice yeasty, wheaty, banana and bubblegum flavor. Huge body with a nice effervecence. Really an exceptional ale and a new take on the style.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2009 Another bottle that was gracefully shared by Crosling.  Poured a semi-hazy, bright yellow color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma of wheat and some fruity esters (banana and apricot).  Initial strong grainy wheat flavor gives way to a strong, fruity banana esters and a decent yeastiness.  Easy to drink, and definitely didnt seem like a 7.7% beer.  Not a huge fan of the hefeweizen type beers, but this one wasnt too bad at all.
(Bottle)  Pours a hazy yellow body with a large white head.  Aroma of banana, clove, mustiness, and lemon zest.  Flavor of banana, wheat, clove, and bubble gum with a soft mouthfeel.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a head of all foam finely sized white colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a hazy softly carbonated yellow colored body and a poor lacing. The aroma was hoppy and wheat. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of malt hops dough and wheat. A decent one that I would consider buying again.  Very easy to drink.

Light gold, steady bubbles, foamy thick 3 finger head.  Lovely, but its the lightest weizen Ive ever seen.  Strong yeast aroma, some banana.  Same banana up front in the sip, gets dirty and yeasty quickly with a gritty texture to it.

Bottle. Rating 420, there should be a soundtreat but it doesnt play. Pours a hazy golden amber wtih big frothy white head. Aroma is wheaty and full of fresh banana. Flavor comes in with a yeasty doughiness and plenty of wheat and banana with hints of spice. Finish is short and clean. Moderate carbonation with a chewy but lighter mouthfeel. Well hidden alcohol. I will buy more for sure, very nice.

Draught at Bishops Arms SoFo, Stockholm.  Cloudy dark yellow, small head. Strong banana aroma with a touch of toffee. Sweet and malty, fruity and near full bodied with some caramel and lots of banana esters. Alcohol is there, but acts in the background. Low bitterness. A warming, fruity beer, feels just as a ramped up hefeweizen.

Pours a cloudy dark yellow color. Medium to large fizzy white head that quickly shrinks to a small cap. Nose is rubber, sour, and yeast. mouth feel is medium bodied and the finish is fizzy and a bit acidic. Taste is raquetballs, wheat, malt, lemon?, and some citrus. A great weizenbock in my opinion from a really great company.

1 pint 0.9oz bottle:  Pours a cloudy golden with a slight orange hue and a nice large head that lingers.  Aroma has got the definite wiezen characteristics.  A nice orange and lemon citrus spritz, banana, wheat overtones, spiced similar to a hefe.  Taste is  nicely robust and mouth filling.  I was basically expecting a Hefe but this is nicely complex.  A nice bite of citrus and wheat really make this a really luscious brew.  Overall,  Man this stuff is a good wiezen I really like this!

Bottle (500ml).  Cloudy yellow-amber with a huge fluffy-fizzy white lasting head.  Wow that smells great - lemony and sweet malt, like a dry hefe-weizen with woody overtones, bubblegum and light floral hops.  The taste follows, like a banana-grassy hefe with hints of peat and iodine, quite tasty and slightly  bitter in the finish.  Juicy, slick mouthfeel, quite fruity and lively, slightly medicinal aftertaste- like everything from this brewery, really classy and well-founded.
Excellent!!. a perfect example of what a Hefe should taste like, bubble gum and banana flavors. decent malts, low hops but everything else works very well. a must have.

The aroma is like a wheat beer! It has bananas, bubble gum, incense, and wheat. The appearance is hazy gold with a nice head. The flavor is like the aroma. The palate is what it should be. Overall its nice!

A very good heller Weizenbock. Its fruite with a very nice banana flavor. A Good golden, yellow collar. Its well balanced, with not much alcohol (7,7%). I think its as best to drink on a nice sunny day.

Ive tried this, and Ive tried Aventinus...I prefer the latter.  This beer looked okay, nice head, but the color wasnt quite as dark as I though it would be for its style.  The beer was little too bitter for its style, and my taste.  An okay beer, but there are better.

great to have a heller weizenbock around in case i dont feel like aventinus - i feel stupid not drinking aventinus most of the time because of how good it is and how available it is - but this is a good alternative. all the good stuff about a normal hefe amplified. in fact it doesnt get nearly as out of control as most lagers or ales at 7.7% - still swillable, only bigger. guess normal hefes have lots of fusels as they are. great head on this. vanilla/bread/aftershave aroma. tastes exactly like pavlova.

Bottiglia da 50cl comprata ad Alessandria, versa colore oro intenso (! inaspettato) con copiosa schiuma candida. Laroma è dolce e carezzevole, direi floreale mentre al sapore si mescolano toni "terrigni" (olio doliva?), frutta (mandarino) e dolcezze di miele.
Kind of like a heller weizenbock. Quite fruity with a somewhat tangy flavor. Had this on tap and found it agreeable, though perhaps a bit too sweet. Pleasant and uite drinkable, though.

This beer pours a cloudy dull yellow with a medium tan head.  First off the color of this beer does not lend itself to a weizenbock in my book. But...  That being said, this is an exceptional beer.  I do not typically rate within the style.  I rate how I like the beer.  and I really liked this one.  Lots of bananas and cloves.  It might have been a little light for a weizenbock, but it still had great flavor.  Maybe they misclassified this beer?  Cheers!

16.9 oz bottle from Beerworks of Largo. Hazy goldenin color.  Aroma of banana, citrus, clove, and very wheat forward. Taste is banana, clove, citrus, apple and tangy wheat.  Creamy medium body, extremely well balanced.  No alcohol detected in the aroma or flavor, not an easy task for a blonde weizen bock. This was excellent, glad I finally got to try this.
First thing that struck me was the color- lighter then any Weizen Bock I have ever seen. But very tasty, with a really nice mouthfeel.

Very cloudy, dark golden-yellow body with a lush, frothy white head.  The aroma is filled with honey and wheat - slightly sweet in the aroma, but quite spicy.  The spiciness comes out in the flavor. Its well-balanced: mild sweetness paired with just enough citrus acidity from orange peel.  Very good.

Cloudy glowing orange beer, with a substantial, frothy head - lively, zesty aroma of citrus rinds, bananas, yeast, bright wheat tartness, peppery spices - creamy body - tangy, nearly tart up front, with over-ripe apple and banana dominating - very mild clove, moderate sweetness, and some warming spiciness arrive later - yeast/wheat/bread character comes in near the finish, with veers back toward the tangy side of things, leaving lingering fruitiness behind - really well-balanced and delicious.

Pours hazy pale gold, with a typical big white rocky head one expects from a Bavarian wheat beer. Nose is traditional weizen, only more so. Lots of banana-like phenols, along with some green apple and clove. Not much in the way of hops, but a faint wheat character. Flavor is much sweeter than a regular weizen, again with lots of banana and some clove. Finish is fruity, with lots of green apple, and some dry, bready wheat character. Little bit full bodied for the flavor.
Very nice.  Wheaty and fruity and yeasty.  Honest and quite pleasant drinking.  Very rich mouthfeel.
The aroma was what stood out for me with this beer.  Bananas and clove, very sweet.  Not the most memorable beer, but definitely enjoyable.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2013 My Bottom Line:
This pale Weizenbock harbors a most complex fusion of sweet pears, bananas, spicy phenols and citrusy wheat in a nourishing and drinkable body. This brewery is as solid as they get.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the cloudy straw yellow.
-Effervescence is smooth and lively, increasing drinkability.
-The flavor profile is diverse yet balanced.
-The full mouthfeel is marvelous because it remains quaffable and its residual sugars are beautifully lifted by cuddly carbonation.
-Complex and elegant, this Weizenbock showcases this prolific yeasts (and brewers) many talents.

Bottles.

500 mL bottle.  Poured into a 500 mL Franziskaner wheat beer glass.  Hazy yellow pour with a tinge of orange as well.  Even with a slow pour, I had to pour half, then let it sit to allow the head to dissipate before I finished pouring.  Aroma matched that of most standard hefe-weizens: estery banana, spicy clove, maybe some coriander.  Flavor was similar, but with considerably more maltiness than a hefe and a thicker mouthfeel to it.  This almost seemed chewy to me and took away from the beer.  Probably due to the higher abv.  Im a huge fan of wheat beers, and even though this was good, its not one Ill seek out again.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2009 Ive had two of these within the last few weeks. The first one I had at the in laws house and poured in a semi-appropriate glass (a pilsner), The second was at the Lava Lounge in Waterloo, IA a few days ago and was served to me with a Trappist chalice?!?!?!?!? I will say this much, that this beer ought to be served in appropriate glassware, as it does affect the taste. 
This is (regardless of glassware) a very delicious beer. Pours a hazy golden color with a nice soft billowy head. The aroma is that old familiar weizen banana/clove scent. The taste of course compliments and to some degree matches this, however not as much so as in a hefe. The beer has a very good sweet/dry balance, and has a defined alcohol flavor that compliments the beer quite well. There is a faint hop presence.
Like most from this brewery. A very nice beer, I will buy again.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with an orange hue. The head is a couple fingers of creamy white that takes its time to fade and laces spots. Smells spicy, banana, pepper, coriander and clove. Taste begins with sweet malt followed by the wheat and spice. Medium in the mouth and a delightful twist on a wheat beer. So drinkable that it would be a delight to session.

Bottle. Pours yellow that borders upon orange. Big fluffy white head with good effervescence. Aromas of wheat, yeast, clove, white peppercorn, and banana. Flavor of a traditional German hefe, tied in with some clove, banana, and sweet lemon. A delicious sweetness mixed with some earthy and spicy notes. Hints of nuts, finishing more like a clove infused witbier. Refreshing.

Bottle at argo0s xmas party, thanks stine!  Pours golden, medium white head.  Typical german hefe nose--banana, clove, etc...  Flavor similar, and nothing really different from a standard german hefe, except for a little more alcohol.

500 ml. euro bottle, freshness date in the bottom center of the back label, sampled in a weizen glass.

Cloudy appearance and bright yellowish orange in color, robust white head of frothy, creamy foam that has good retentive powers with a fair amount of curtain-like sticky lace. You could say that this looks like a premium hefeweizen.

A delectable nose of banana, clove and lemons, hints of peppery spice and a backing of white wheat flour malts. The alcohol is quite estery smelling.

Creamy, lush medium feeling body buoyed by the active carbonation, this is very lively in the palate. Barley grains and malted wheat, bananas and lemons, earthy spices and clove, you get hit with a lot of flavors at once. The yeast becomes more nutty towards the end. Mellow hop spiciness that adds to the yeasty and cracker-like finish, a dry and clean finish that leaves you wanting more. The alcohol is noticeable through out the taste, low fruity warmth before turning spicy in the finale.

Well, I loved this weizenbock, the drinkability on this is way too dangerously easy, but then what else would you expect from one of the greatest breweries on the planet. Highly recommended.

Hazy golden (?) with a moderate to large head, good lacing and retention. Aroma is wheat, citrus, grass, banana. Medium to light bodied, very drinkable of course. Alcohol hidden well, somewhat sweet. Enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2008 Bottle from South Bay. Hazy golden straw color with a nice white foamy head. Slightly sweet yeasty aroma. Somewhat grainy with a little spice too. Flavor is somewhat grainy with some bitter spiciness. Some notes of yeast with a hint of alcohol. Full bodied. Pretty tasty.

Pours cloudy bright golden with a mostly maintained wispy off-white head. Aroma of bubble gum, banana, pepper, and apples. Tastes of pale malt, fruity esters: banana, bubble gum, phenolic spice and honey. Mouthfeel is full bodied, lightly sticky with lush carbonation. I was hoping this would be a dark beer like Aventinus. While I was a bit disappointed, it was still enjoyable.

Bottle courtesy of Stine. Pours cloudy, unfiltered yellow with a white head. Nice mixture of lemon, orange, banana and clove in the nose. Flavor has notes of wheat, lemon, clove, banana, herbal/grassy noble hops, light mint and a non-detracting alcohol presence. Full-bodied, smooth with moderate carbonation. Good stuff.

(50cl bottle, thanks Stine) Cloudy straw body topped by fluffy, medium white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, bubblegum, some orange, light lemon.  Taste is moderately sweet, orange, light alcohol, grassy.  Medium body, low carbonation.

Good looking pour, a cloudy whitened straw body with a tall rocky head.  It smells of fresh sliced bananas, clove, and fresh bread dough.  Soft and smooth to drink, the bananas, clove, and dough are joined by a light peppering from the alcohol.  It finishes on a light fruity note with traces of the alcohol showing though.  Quite nice.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Lakeview Liquors, Chicago, IL<font size=-1>

500mL bottle, courtesy of Stine.  Thanks, Eben!  Pours a cloudy, whitish-golden color; fluffy whitish head with decent lacing.  Plenty of chewy bananas and light clove and spices in the aroma.  Chewy Belgian sugars and caramelized banana pudding; dense, chewy hefe character amped up a bit; some cloves and spicing comes through mid-palate.  Lengthy, Belgian sugar and bananas in the finish.

Pours a nice blonde- deep golden with high carbonation- nice bead and sick shiny reflective head and some nice lace.  Aroma is spicy phenols- tons of doughy, sweet malts, some wheat and nice weihenstephan classic banana esters- traditional hefe just amped up on steriods.  Good smooth sweet thick wheaty malts, tons of doughy malts, spicy phenols and more apple and banana esters- real sweet and big.  Big mouthfeel and relatively smooth finish with a bit of a phenolic spicy kick to it.  Reminded me a lot of Ramstein Double Platiinum Weiss.  Like many others, I bought this thinking this would be a traditionaly fruity, dark weizenbock- but this was really cool and different.  Nice beer.
Thanks to Eben for this.  Cloudy yellow body.  Aroma of banana and ash.  Sweet banana, citrus, and bubblegum flavor.  A bit overly sweet and syrupy for me.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle.  Thick, soupy, dandelion hued pour; rocky white in abundance on the surface.  Fairly usual banana and clove aroma, richly suffused with brown sugar, strawberries, and sweet almond shavings.  Bits of grass and dry wheat husk.  Full bodied yeast and spice flavors; clove, bubblegum, tart red berries, dry pine, and bright peach.  Medium bodied, crisp, and lively.  Sweet  candies and taut white pepper in a quick, aggressive finish.  Solidly constructed, pristinely balanced, and softly rendered.  As expected, an exemplar.

This beer pours a golden yellow color with a thick head that fades right away and there is no laceing along the sides of the glass. The aroma is full of lemon zest,clove and hints of tangerine. As you drink it you can taste the clove and the lemon grass on the sides of your mouth. The initial taste is also very bitter but that fades out quick. The palate duration is moderate and has some orange tangerine flavors with mild hints of lemon along the sides of your mouth.

Pours a brilliant hazy, transluscent gold with a rocky white head with great retension, fading to a dense white cap. Enticing aroma of candied orange peel, lemon zest, wheat, corriander, banana and clove. Taste is sweet (malt-honey) and spicy (corriander, pepper) with estery notes like passion fruit. Nice wheat and banana-clove flavour mid-palate with a bubble-gum yeast finish. A lot going on here; definitely more than I expected. Tingly, sharp carbonation makes the beer seem less full and more refreshing. Good palate duration that finishes sticky.

500ml bottle in weizen glass.  Pale yellow-orange with beautiful dense white head that rises above the glass and some lace.  Strong banana-clove yeast aroma.  Vanilla-honey sweetness with banana and very mild citrus bitterness in finish.  Medium body and medium carbo.  Absolutely delicious.  Certainly one of the best hefe-weizens Ive ever had.

I guess for some reason I was so biased, I really expected this to be a dark beer, I am just so trained to think a Weizen Bock to be like Aventinus, dark.  I was highly surprised to see this pour a thick golden color with a thick head.  No clarity in the beer at all, just too thick.  The head fades rather quickly but leaves a surface covering lacing that is pretty sticky. Aroma first hits you with a sweet bubblegum and light banana and followed by other tropical fruits in light syrup.  Aroma is syrupy, sweet, strong, but yet it is very German.  Taste is not as sweet as the aroma suggested.  It turns into a sunshine-floral yeastiness with light sugar candy edges. The beer is well carbonated and a very spiky mouthfeel, which sets off the rather heavy body and the strong esters in the beer. The beer finishes fizzy with light lemon zinginess all over.  Basically, an American brewer would call this an Imperial Hefe but I see this as Weihenstephaners answer to the Schneider-Brooklyner collaboration without the American hoppiness. I love it when the Germans let there yeast to take over and work its magic, subdued can become so boring.  I like this and I will pick up more to age as well, just as an experiment.500mL bottle, cool cap, batch # 7327, St. Paul tulip/snifter glass.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: 500ml bottle, had during a poker game. pour is hazy beeswax color with massive head.  nose is yeast, syrup, and banana/citrus.  Mouth is clove, spice, with yeast.  Not too dry, nor syrupy.  very nice, well balanced.

The beer emerges from the 500ml bottle a beclouded golden yellow with an orange tint, the head behemothic in size, and a brilliant creamy white, as it fades slowly, the resultant lace is a fine veil to obscure the glass. Nose has an earthy aroma, spices also present, coriander and cloves come to mind, light and clean. Start has a sweet grain presence, with the top light to medium in feel. Finish as a benign acidity, the earthy, soapy sweetness continues to the dry aftertaste, a nice drinking beer, but did seem a little thin to me, with the hop presence very subdued, nonetheless, worthy of a sample.

Hefe-like, bubblegummy, sweet and a little bit of clove in the flavor. Pretty thick bodied but not syrupy. Smeels nice. Would like a little more spice and a little less sweetness. Not exactly hot in alcohol but it does hit you more than expected.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: UPDATED: MAY 21, 2008 500ml bottle: poured a cloudy lemon yellow color with a big white head. Typical hefeweizen aroma with yeast, banana, and a touch of lemon. On my first few sips, the weizen notes were present- banana, clove, yeast. Subsequent sips revealed the 7.7% alcohol which really ruined the beer for me. Sure I like bocks and I love hefes, but this was too alcoholic. Rerate: had another bottle and thought it was excellent. Same flavors. Sweetness was noted in the finish. Original rating 7-4-6-2-11. New rating 7-4-6-4-16

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense

Comments: Drank in Utrecht in a beautiful, very wide glass that never detracted its gorgeous head. A pale and lovely, very drinkable weizenbock with no alcohol notions, but delicate, yet almost chewy maltiness reinforced by exquisite, accurate yeastiness. Crunchy wheat extraction makes it refreshing despite being sweeter than dry.

hazy orange colour and with a little foam; aroma of orange peels and corn with hints of banana, yeast and alcohol; the high sweetness is well balanced by a tart acidity and a solid carbonation; effervescent finish with lot of fruity notes, atouch of alcohol and a load of residual sugars - solid and well-made

A pretty good beer, but maybe not a good Weizenbock.  The color is pale straw, it practically looks like orange drink.  The flavor and aroma are very citrusy and theres practically no hint of alcohol or bitterness.  There is a pronounced fruity aroma and flavor of hefeweizen yeast.  I prefer Aventinus.

Bottle: Very light, hazed orange-yellow with a monsterous pile of bright white foam, but it quickly gave in.  Spicy, citrusy aroma.  Musky, yeasty and quite mushy.  Keep expecting to pull some citrus pulp out of this, its so lemony and full-bodied.  Excellent.  (#3200, 11/10/2007)

Bottle: Dirty straw, very cloudy, large foamy white head, decent lacing. &nbsp Certainly looks decent, but not as dark as others. 

&nbsp Big wheaty and yeasty nose, very slight citrus aspect. &nbsp Sweet wheat malt on the tongue, slightly spicy, some bubblegum, clove, 

and very minor banana. &nbsp The spices are somewhat muted, maybe moreso citrus oriented. &nbsp Tiz a heavy Wheat beer, but not that 

Bockish. &nbsp Pale bock maybe? &nbsp I cant help compare to Aventinus, and this one isnt as spiced or bready. &nbsp Definitely light on 

the Bock, heavy on the Weizen. &nbsp Fairly full bodied. &nbsp Clean finish, very wheaty and thick. &nbsp Light example, but it works. &nbsp 

I enjoyed it quite a bit.

Draught pint at Deep Ellum on 10/17/07Hazy golden-beeswax with an immense, well-retained white head that laces fully.Tremendously fruity for a weizen bock.  Strong peachy-apricot sweetness, with even some succulent mango notes.  A very uniform, smooth malt sweetness takes on an aroma of vanilla-cream.  Quite sweet, as others mention, but its a German strong ale, would you expect it to not be richly malted?  Trailing nicely on the end is a dry, highly aromatic, rustic even, hay-like wheat character that takes some of the focus off the sweetness.  Alcohol was well enough concealed and no flaws noted.  Medium-high strength of aroma.Half way between chewy and sticky, is the malt body on this, with round, succulent ripe nectarine and apricot fruitiness and a rich honey-tinted vanilla cream sweetness from the wonderfully extracted (but perhaps somewhat underattenuated malts).  Im not going to say too much more about the sweetness, despite my preference for dry beers.  Sometimes the beer is just meant to be a sweet dessert sipper, as in this case.  Its not like Weihenstephaner yeast dosent ferment the beer well, if it needs to, and certainly the brewers know enough how to.  Obviously intentional is the sweetness, then, and soft and supportive it feels on the palate.  Even a little bit of wheat or yeast-like tartness on the finish....  Medium carbonation, with a touch of alcohol warmth and some slight bready dryness.  Pineapple-banana-clove lingers lightly.

Hazy pale golden, with a seriously retentive head.  Clovey-estery aroma, with some wheaty notes as well.  Smooth and balanced.  Good yeast signature in the flavor.  Big bodied, with some sticky wheat character along with a well-attenuated finish.  Nice.

500mL bottle, no date.  Hazy pale yellow with a two finger creamy white head that eventually fades to 1/4" and stays for the duration.  Lemon and ripe bananas dominate the aroma, followed by spicy cloves, yeast, and a hint of alcohol.  Flavor follows the aroma quite well with the exception of the alcohol coming through a little stronger.  There is also more wheat, and the finish is drier than what the aroma led me to believe.  Minimal bitterness.  Medium creamy body with moderate carbonation.  Very nice beer.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Another nice offering from the brewers at Weihen.  Pours a golden yellow - I actually expected it to be a tad darker.  Thick white head.  Beautiful malty flavor that was perfectly balanced with the strong clove notes.  This is really strong clove - not the usual subtle aromas you get with bavarian wheat yeasts.  The clove dominates so much that I didnt get the usual "other" wheat yeast aromas (bubblegum/banana) at all.  But this is a great beer.  The slightly higher alcohol content that is typical of weizen bocks is masked a bit in this one.  Watch out!!  And enjoy this one!

Bottle sampled. Pours a hazy golden with a nice fluffy off-white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, clove, and some spiceyness. Flavor was medium to full bodied and smooth with wheat, fruits, malt, banana, and a hint of smoke. A decent brew
Looks nice. Cloudy yellow. Very strong banana flavor, but in such a way that it isnt too bad. Not bad, and certainly doesnt seem that strong.

A bright gold hazy body with a large, bright white head. The aroma is clove and bubblegum (what others call banana, but I find it more appropriate for this one). There is also old leather or almost cellar type quality and it makes the beer seem very earthy. The taste has some light bananas and subtle cloves. There is also some strong spice character of cinnamon. There is a little bit of caramel that comes out as this warms. Soft and creamy mouthfeel. Nicely done.

Bottle. Hazy gold. Awfully light colored for a weizenbock. Aroma is DELICIOUS! Light banana, soft caramel, apple skins, spice, light grains, yeast and bubblegum. Taste is big bubblegum and wheat with yeast notes, candyish banana, and light lemon. Body is bubbly and effervescent. Medium to light-medium overall feel. Finishes with more bubblegum and banana, light caramel, wheat, yeast, spices and candy. Very nice despite its deceiving color.

[bottle] Really nice aroma-- apple, pear, clove and yeast. Some slight banana. Golden yellow color, hazy, with a very nice dense white head. Impressive. Wheat character composes most of the flavors, with some additional fruity complexity and spice. Finishes a bit tart, with some nice lively carbonation.
Tap Bokbierfestival, Amsterdam: Hazy yellow fruity sweet Weizenbock thats not bad at all.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2007 Pours a creamy, tawny yellow color w/ a full, semi creamy froth. Superb hangtime reducing slowly to a fine silky canopy. Strong aromas of meaty banana cream pie, lemony citrus, and spice. Very nice indeed! Medium full nectar w/ luscious, creamy residual effers. Thick and malty w/ strong flavors of creamy  bananas, fresh lemons, and spicey cloves. Theres a fruity, tropical character that shines through w/ nuances of pineapple,  kiwi, and wild apple. The malts are thick but the tropical acids cut through and balance perfectly. The finish  long and tastey w/ lingering fruity spice. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2008 (Bottled) Hazy yellow (opaque yellow-orange with yeast) with a medium, cloudy head and some lacing. Very strongly banana-estery, wheaty aroma with some Belgian Tripel-like, yeasty alcohol. Very banana-fruity, sweetish-malty, wheaty flavor with yeast, low bitterness and well-hidden alcohol. Yeast makes the flavor quite a bit smoother. Medium-bodied, smooth-carbonated palate. Slightly alcoholic without yeast - yet decently refreshing, in a sahti-like way. A drinkable and pleasant, although not that complex Weizenbock.

(Bottle, Vastarannan Kiiski, Helsinki). Initially I as surprised this was a heller weizen bock and not a dunkles. Looks like a hefe, pale yellow haziness. Nose has raw banana, yeasty dough and some waxiness. Flavor has a lot of wheat, yeast, alcohol, white chocolate, toffee, small bitterness which is a bit acidic somehow. There is some turn off here, but I cant quite figure out what it is. Stearin or paraffin..?

Pint size bottle purchased at South Bay Drugs. Appeared as a glowing yellow with a fat pillow of foam up top. The aroma was a delighting fruit essence that had Germany signature yeast all over this weizen bock. In the flavor, I find a perfect match to the aroma but even more chewy and spicy with just the right hint of banana. This weizen is perfect in aspect and Im in bliss drinking it.

Tap, Bokbierfestival Utrecht. Cloudy golden color, big white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, some vanilla, hint of smoke, malt. Taste of a hefeweizen, but with more power, more malt, some vanilla again, bit caramel. Good stuff.

Bottled. Hazy paler golden colour with mediumsized creamy head, some lacing. Aroma is bananas, spices and some wheat. Slight hints of alcohol, but not disturbing much. Flavour is a lot of wheat, spices, some yeast and also some grassyness. Wellbalanced, quite refreshing and alcohol is quite wellhidden.

Bottle, SL. The pour was golden hazy colored, hefe-like, head normal, yet not impressive, ok retention, very weak lacing in the Aventinus glass. The aroma was typical of an imperial hefe, lots of cloves and bananas, no alcohol. The flavor was strong full bodied hefe helles type character, finishing with a yeasty dry light grassiness. Definitely cant compete with the dunkel weizenbocks, but for a helles, pretty nice well-balanced flavor.

Bottle. Strong aroma of banana and toffee. Very strong aroma. Thin white head w/ decent lacing. Taste is similar to the aroma, though a little less fruity and with a bit of citrus far in the background. Nice beer.

Bottle: Pale golden, hazy, big stable, creamy white head, sweet wheaty nose with a distinctive lemony-fruity nose; robust sweet, but also tart flavour, medium to full bodied, smooth; very solid sweet-fruity, a bit almondy finish with a shy bitterness in the aftertaste. Great! Well balanced and moreish stuff with very well hidden alcohol.............

500 mL bottle purchased from Bauer Wines in Boston.  Pours a perfect cloudy straw.  I probably would have given a perfect score for appearance if this was a hefeweizen and not a weizenbock, as this is the lightest weizenbock I have ever seen.  Definitely not to style.  Nice wheaty and yeasty aroma.  It certainly does fit the weizenbock profile in its flavour though.  Strong flavours - wheat, yeast, banana.  The alcohol feels evident - or that could just be the aftereffects of the Indian dinner.  I am liking this significantly better than Weihenstephaners dunkelweizen, but then again, Im a big fan of this style.
Cloudy orange body with a large frothy off-white head. Sweet banana an clove aroma. Rich malty flavor with a banana and clove background.
Surprisingly, I didnt enjoy this beer as much as something like Aventinus...but I would try it again...perhaps I will re-rate this beer.

Dark yellow colored with big white head and good weizen cloudiness. Rich weizen-banana aroma with spices and yeast, only mild alcohol there. Medium bodied. Flavor is also rich, alcohol and full body makes difference to basic weiss-beers. Banana  and spices dominate also here, some sour fruits present too. Crispy palate. Aftertaste dries with banana and mild alcohol.

Bottle.  Yeasty banana aroma.  Really cloudy orange colored appearance.  Flavor is similar o a typical German Hefeweizen, but the alcohol is noticeable.    I expected a beer similar to Aventinus, but it is not.  But still really good.

Bottle. High white creamy and lasting head. Hazy light yellow body. Banana lemon aroma  with some spicyness as well. Pretty sweet flavor of banana and surprisingly a good deal of acidity as well. Low carbonation and a long aftertaste.

Pours very hazy gold with a large white head. Aroma of cloves, wheat, and sweet malts. Fruity--banana, mostly, and some darker fruits--flavor, with a great sweetness. Lightly alcoholic, but the spritzy mouthfeel keeps it from being too apparent. The bock is only present in that very light non-wheat sweetness; this is almost like a doppelweizen, which is fine with me.
Hazy golden colour with fluffy white head.Taste of wheat and hops more bitter then many others wheat beers.Aroma are fruity and spicey,less banana taste as many wheat beers.

Bottle @ Beer Circus, Croydon. Pours deep amber / brown colour. Aroma is of banana / spice / with a little yeastiness. Taste is citrusy tarte with some spice and a slightly metallic. Carbonation is good too.
UPDATED: OCT 4, 2007 Bottle @ Beer Circus, Croydon. Malty and wheat nose. Blonde/brown colour. Alcohol, plum and fruit on the tongue. Slight carbonation. Light body. A complex and rewarding bock.

Bottle: Hazy golden with medium frothy head and some lace. The aroma has notes of banana and clove esters, bubblegum, wheaty, smoky malts. The taste starts malty and fruity sweet supported by a notes of acidic twang with a hint of smoke and nut towards the finish. The mouth feel is slightly biting with sprite carbonation, a bit chalky. Solid but I was hoping for more, geek worthy never the less.

Bottle:  The aroma consists of banana, bubblegum, yeast, light smoke, and very faint lemon.  Pours a cloudy yellowish-orange with a moderate white head with decent retention.  The flavor starts with lots of banana and bubblegum and faint yeastiness.  There is some very faint smoke in the background.  The finish has some light clove and very faint lemon tartness and acidity.  There is a hint of metallic flavors in the finish which is just enough to downgrade the beer a tad.  Its medium bodied with very soft carbonation.
banana, bubble gum, candied sugar looks real good but tastses a little bland almost s a farmhouse or bland wheat beer, a little spice too. maybe good for summer nothing too exciting really

Cloudy, pale body with a large white head. The aroma is cotton candy, banana, clove, dough and light lemon. The flavor is moderately sweet, very fruity with apricot, banana, cloves, cotton candy and herbal hops. Medium body is very soft with moderate, gentle carbonation. Another excelent offering from an outstanding brewer.

Cloudy, dirty yellow in color. Huge white head, lasts quite awhile, nice lacing. Aroma dominated by chewy/yeasty bread, clove and faint smoke. Huge wheat sweetness up front, for some reason not as big a turnoff as usual. Has a strange tartness throuh the middle, almost sour mash like? Finishes with banana, spice and smoke. Great mouthfeel/palate. Very soft and smooth. Not what I expected in a weizenbock but tasty brew nonetheless. Maybe its because I havent drank in two weeks or I am getting old, but early morning buzz is quite nice.

Bottle: Pours a hazy golden pale bronze with a wispy, well-lacing white head.  Aroma of rich bready, doughy German yeast and lots of sweet malted wheat with some clove spice.  Body starts with good full wheaty sweetness and a smooth, bready yeasty balance and some mild banana fruity esters.  Not as complex as Aventinus, but still a very flavorful, enjoyable weizenbock.

On tap@ In De Wildeman. Cloudy yellowish dirty gold with a small head. Fruity and spicy aroma. Good fruity flavours with good banana and clove in big portions. Medium body, fluffy mouthfeel. Quite nice.

This is an awesome beer.  Thick,cloudy, golden and full of effervescence.  The strength is noticeable, but the flavor of the alcohol and the malt has a very full, robust, classic German feel to it.   All the malt character of any good bock beer and a nice fresh, light tartness that comes from the wheat.  Finishes caramel sweet.  A classic.

Draught in Pothuiske in Maastricht. Murky yellow, quickly diminishing head, (too fast even for a draught). Yeasty nose. Flavour is  yeasty with citrus and some candy. Alcohol comes through very dominantly in aftertaste

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 500ml bottle.  Date unknown.  Large billowy white head on a cloudy hefeweizen yellow colored body.  Nose of heavy clove, sweet creamed banana, faint alcohol, sweet gummi candy sugar, and lemony, zesty sweet hops.  Wow, very smooth and creamy, milky almost, on the palate.  Very mellow and soothing on the tongue.  Flavors of cream and spiced banana yogurt, some light smoked banana and smoked corn. Some rich and creamy wheat, lemon grass and sweet citrus, ending with a long, drawn-out tingle of alcohol.  Great stuff when in good shape.

Aroma/Malty-light,
Appearance Head/Initial-small, Head/Color white,
Body/Hue-medium,
Initial Flavor-bitter light
Finish Flavor-bitter light
Palate/Body-light

good beer

Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty, moderate hoppy powerfull yeasty aroma. Many ester-notes. Heavy bitter flavopr. Long powerfull bitter finish. Creamy palate. Really nice stuff.
Bottle. Nice big head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are wheat malt, yeast and some fruit.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a medium creamy head. Rich aroma and taste of wheat, fruits and yeast. Good beer.

Bottle.  Very nice, a jacked up wheat, pours slightly darker than most wheats, good CO2 and very nice arroma typical of a good german wheat beer.  Great bananna, clove, hefe flavor.  Dont even taste its 7.7%.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow with a big thick and sticky mostly diminishing white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus, banana, yeast and alcohol. The flavour is sweet with wheat, some yeast, malt, citrus and banana with a good alco touch. Dry finish with a slight bitter touch.
Cloudy yellow with a big, but disappearing white head. Banana, lime, clove and bubblegum aroma. Quite sweet flavour with much clove. The alcohol provides a rather dry finish.
Bottled. Nice aroma, citric, citrus, hint of banana, some hops. Hazy, yellow colored, white head, good lace. Sweet, citrus, banana, full and alcoholic. Clean and crisp, well balanced.

Hazy and golden with a huge, white head. The aroma has nice notes of banana, some alcohol and clove. The mouthfeel is rather flat and the flavour has notes of banana, alcohol, spice (mostly Clove) and a light sweetness. Its my first hell weiss bock, and its quite nice, mostly like a Hefe with a little more of everything. 2324

Bottle. Pours a hazy straw yellow with a small bubbly white head. Heavy aroma with lots of wheat and banana. Very full mouthfeel. Flavour is rounded, mild and sweet. Some oranges, banana, wheat, slightly vinious and a touch of a sour edge. Had there been a type called "Imperial Hefe", this would be the prime example. A pleasure to drink even on a very warm June evening.
(Bottle 50 cl) Slightly hazy golden with a white head. Sweetish banana aroma. Rather full in body with a high degree of sweetness, lots of banana and cloves. The finish is sweet. 120507

A mid yellow to orange coloured, cloudy beer with a thick and frothy white head. A spicy nose of cough candy, clove and pepper, plus a tropical fruit, banana aroma. Dry taste, wheaty and biscuity malt, then a potent spice flavour of clove, cinnamon and pepper, again, the sweet cough candy element is present, along with a typical tropical fruit flavour. There is a definate alcoholic backbone to the taste. The finish is dry and spicy. (Plantage, Freising, Germany).

(500ml, IBS, Perth)
Was not expecting such a delight. everything you like about a great Hefe, doubled. Reminds me of well aged Triple Karmeliet, cloves, bananas, and wheatly malty goodness that is divine.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a longlasting white head. Sweet wheat malty banana aroma. Sweet malty spicy banana flavor. Sweetish wheat finish whith some spicy hints.

A new drop from the lads at Weihenstephan Universitat/brauerei is always welcome, this one hit the spot nicely, I must say.The picture of good health on the pour. Inches and inches of solidly expansive, snow-white head adorned a hazy, dull, yellowy-gold body filled with rampant effervescence. The retention is phenomenal, the lacing a medley of fine white lines. Big banana smoothie nose with underpinning lemon and lime notes, a little strawberry in there too as some rough cloves and fresh cracked pepper. The palate compliments the nose, it is hefeweissbier-hell in perfect form only pressingly stronger. Big whack of cloves, some alcohol spice, in amongst so much ripe banana and sourish malts. A little vanilla and pine peaks in. It is clean, the body misleadingly light and fuelled by plenty of rushing carbonation. A little warmth on the swallow - the alcohol is held back well, very controlled - the finish has juicy, tangy, sourish fruit, cloves and strong woody, wheat-malt notes. I can say I also got notes of mocha on the nose and on the palate though this seems a little leftfield of a beer so pale. It is balanced very nicely and for a beer of such strength it is indeed a refreshing quaffer. It does however lack the complexity of most Dunkel Weizenbocks but you could say that is a plus - this bad-boy creeps up on you. A nice drop; not extraordinary but deserving of apt appreciation. Nicely done Weihenstephan!!! (50cl, 08/02/08, Intl Beer Shop, W. Leederville)
CBF07 sample from 50 cL bottle. Pours slight unclear yellow, little head. Aroma is wheat and slight citric and banana. Flavour is wheat and slight citric. Refreshing.

Warming mouthfeel with light banana and clove notes, medium body and soft texture. Initial full on aroma was fruity, banana, cloves and mandarin. Slightly cloudy yellow body with a mostly lasting white head, some lacing but not very much. I am not big on wheat beers though I bloody enjoyed this one, maybe it was the extra alcohol, dont think it was the sweetness.
Bottle. Blonde, hazy. Orange and wheat in the aroma. Pineapple, banana, slightly yeasty, alcoholic flavor. Pineapple in the aftertaste. Nice one, though rather sweet.

Hazy golden, yellow body, big white head; Great aroma, balanced pleasant and fresh, lots of clove and malty bock sweetness, great balance; Big a little to sharp carbonation, soft texture, bitter; Long finish with way to much clove.

Bottle @ Københavnske Øldage 2007 in Copenhagen. Hazy yellow orange color with a average frothy good lacing mostly lasting white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, moderate yeasty, banana, bubble gum, alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle, 7.7%. Banana aroma. Cloudy yellow colour, OK white head. Very powerful flavour, lots of ripe banana. Good sweetness and alcohol to balance. My kind of Weizenbock.
Bottle. Yellow/ orange colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, wheat,yeast. Flavour is fruit, yeast,wheat, spices. Nice beer.

Bottle. Unclear, yellow-orange beer with a nice off-white head. Wheat, banana and cloves in the aroma. Same goes for the flavor, but theres also some hops and alcohol there. Full, warming and a bit sweetish mouthfeel. A quite nice one. (070331)
Hazy yellow colour with a small white head. Malty, wheaty sweet aroma with banana fruity notes and some spicyness. Sweet, light citric flavor with notes of banana. Light dry and yeasty finish.
Hazy golden of color with n offwhite head. An aroma of banana, wheat and yeast. A flavor of bananam citrus and wheat.

Bottled. Light yellow coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Very wheaty aroma. Loads of banana and cloves. Has some yeastnotes. Flavour as well is full of banana and cloves. Sweetness and fruits are notable. Quite intriguing. Medium bodied. Has a light grapy and sweet end. Nice.
Bottled. Hazy yellowish in colour with a small white head. Very fruity with notes of banana, yeast, cloves and spices. Feels alcoholic and artificial.

Bottle.
Hazy yellow coloured with a white head.
Aroma of bananas, cloves and spices with notes of fruits.
Spicy flavour of bananas and cloves with notes of fruits.

Cloudy yellow, rocky offwhite head, nice challice.
Vanilla orange nose. Bread base, elegant peach banana marzipan, light metallic yeast. medium to light body, easy drinkable and fresh. Spicy fruity aftertaste.
Bottle. Hazy pale yellow colour with a big white head. Wheat, banana aroma and taste. Medium body with a sweet banana finish.

Bottled. An unclear light orange beer with a huge beige head. The aroma is very sweet and very wheaty, but also with quite strong notes of citrus, and some hay. The flavor is sweet and very wheaty combined with notes of citrus and banana. The mouthfeel is quite sparkling, but also with a thick alcoholic body. I think darker malts would make this better.
Pours a hazy dark yellow with a big foamy head. Smells sweet and of bananas and clover. Tastes sweet with lots of baked banana flavors. Lang banana finish... and then some banana.

Bottle.  [Thanks to Mads for sharing this one]  Average to large fizzy off-white head. Fair lacing. Cloudy looking body with a golden-orange hue. Aroma was for me recognizable as a Weihenstephaner with lots of wheat, yeast, citrus, banana, clove, coriander and orange. Nice smooth and soft wheat. Medium bodied with a lively carbonation. Flavor was light sweet with a light acidic finish with an average duration.

Fully hazy pale yellow/orange colour, obligatory greenish shine; collapsing whipped eggwhite head, just yellow tinted. Freshly cut oranges, wheat, yeast and very faintly clove. Citrus leaves (orange leaf, not kafir). Short sweet, nearly dry taste. Fruity notes, especially oranges, but keep floating more or less high above the dry wheat main flavour. Warming up, getting a bit of solvent. Well-bodied, wheat slickness, oily MF. Not really that spectacular, just decent. Actually that sums about up what Ive thought about the worlds oldest brewery products for a few decennia...
